review_content: Wet cardboard and boiled vegetables in the aroma. Some floral hops. Taste is quite similar, but above all quite sweetish and sticky. Looks nice in the glass though.

we zijn deadass na 3 uur onbeperkt bier drinken naar mijn moeder gefietst omdat de supermarkt al dicht was en we bier mee wouden naar de bioscoop, jordy en mijn stiefvader (jordi) hadden die kut naam grappies interactie en mijn stiefvader had allemaal random knowledge over zuidlaren??? anyways, vies biertje
A balanced beer. Smooth and easy drinking. Has a malt hint to it and isn’t too hoppy. Just a nice simple beer to enjoy. Cheers.

Canette. 
Robe dorée, limpide, scintillante, effervescence active. 
Fine mousse blanche homogène. Tenue de mousse éphémère. Arômes: linéaire, céréales, miel et légèrement houblonné. 
Saveurs: moyennement sucré et faible amertume en finale. 
Texture: corps mince/watery, carbonation faible-moyenne, buvabilité correcte.

Neerlands trots, op het gebied van pils, maar ook door de geur, coffeeshop geurtje, wat dan weer door de hop komt.
Een hoppig, mals wegtankbier wat door de gist een  fruitig aroma heeft. Prima pilske
Cerveja com malte diferenciado, com gosto diferenciado e altíssima drincabilidade

Poured from 650ml bottle at 5.0% abv. Aroma: Slight, subdued malt aroma, mildly bitter hop, very skunky seemingly regardless of how fresh it is. Appearance: Pours completely clear, pale yellow colour with large frothy white head and long lasting carbonation. Taste: Grassy, some malt, mild to moderate hop bitterness, somewhat skunky but less so than the aroma. Lingering aftertaste of lemon and mild bitterness. Mouthfeel: Light and smooth body, soft foam and lots of fizzy carbonation. Overall: It's a drinkable enough macro lager. More flavourful than most of those of the same price in the 4% abv range as you would expect, but loses points for it's consistently highly skunked aroma. Perfectly average for its style.

Famosissima lager olandese dal colore giallo paglierino limpido e la schiuma pannosa e abbondante. I profumo è caratterizzato dai malti ma non ha niente di particolare, così come il gusto che è comunque ben bilanciata tra malti e luppoli: leggermente amara ma delicata con un finale secco. Il corpo è leggero e frizzantino, ideale da bere in in compagnia quando si predilige la quantità anche se, considerando il costo al litro dovuto anche all’utilizzo di acqua demineralizzata, qualcuno preferirebbe un’altra bionda industriale. Una normale lager.

Poured from 650 ml bottle, golden yellow with dense large head. Immediate aroma of green-bottle skunk and hops. Maintains head while drinking.Taste- soft hops, slightly bitter cut grass, nothing intense or remarkable but satisfying especially when with a heavy meal in summer. Has no glucose syrup or corn, unlike Budweiser, Stella, Peroni, Fosters etc, this feels like a real beer.
They say they use a certain hop extract which makes this grassy than most other mainstream pale lagers. Compared to the competition, Heineken is a much better product and available everywhere.
Nice golden color with little foam, bitter and strong start and goes down well. Very satisfying beer that leaves you thirsting for another. Hardly any hangovers felt after an excessive binge

Yeah well. Fizzy piss water.
Pours clear golden colour with a decent lasting head. (positives ends here).
Aroma of nothing followed by dish cleaning liquid and something unpleasantly acidic.
Taste of water, bubbles and some bit of bitterness and hops.
Extremely poor, especially considering price point and name. Buy any euro lager for ~half the price or less in supermarket and it won't be worse (nor better most likely, but at least cheaper).

500ml can. Note this is NZ brewed version under license. Brewed in horizontal tanks to keep their happy A-Yeast going well. A bit strange that the can is full of notes about a passion for quality but it's in a bargain priced 500ml can. Lets crack on. Pours the usual pale straw of an international green bottle/can lager with a short white head. Not much aroma, maybe a bit of wet cardboard & generic beer there. Almost watery light body which at 5% is something. Flavour, uh quite sweet, bit of vegetable water, a hint of hop bitterness & yeah. Showing my age to say this tastes like beer used to. Better than at lot of US city water. Not quite up to Carlsberg, which I gave 2 point something.
Rating copied from Untappd. "Tastes like a fermented plastic bag". Had on 04 jun 2014
Sono molto affezionato a questa birra. Era la mia preferita da ragazzino. Ora ho un opinione completamente diversa e ci sta, ma le tantissime sere passate con lei non le dimenticherò mai.
Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. https://www.instagram.com/czgr_
Wet cardboard and boiled vegetables in the aroma. Some floral hops. Taste is quite similar, but above all quite sweetish and sticky. Looks nice in the glass though.

The first time I drank this, I was like wow! Now it's probably tastes just so bland. But it's widely available anywhere and it always tastes the same worldwide. Just a beer.
0.5 can from local store (made in Hungary). Satisfying taste, nice and balanced. Drinkable. Good classic world known beer. Sasvim korektno i lepo pivo.
Bonne bière importée avec un bon goût particulier. Peu de mousse et de bulle.
Barril Torp de 2 litros en Dispensador Sub de Krups. Color amarillo pálido, espuma blanca cremosa poco duradera. Aroma apenas perceptible a cereal. Sabor algo metálico, cereal, notas herbales. Floja.

Decent head, fruity aroma. Clear pale golden body.
Tastes like sparkling water. One of the most drinkable yet boring international pale lagers.
Una cerveza color amarillo oro, con una espuma media y fugaz, con notas un tanto salvajes, pero a malta. Con un amargor en el retrogusto.

Zaskakująco ładna, biała piana. Klarowne, złote. 
W aromacie nuty utlenienia, trawki, metaliczności. 
W smaku neutralne, wodniste i lekko goryczkowe. Zaskakująco pijalne.

From 12 oz can to glass.  Great color, lacing remains.  Good, quality beer that I avoided for 15 years as all the old ones I ever had were skunke. New packaging and in cans, and when fresh this is a very, very good beer!  Prosit!
By been a lager beer, or not by been a IPA! This os the best lager to drink diary
[Puszka 13.06.2021] Barwa jasno złota, klarowne. Piana średnia, średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko redukująca się. W aromacie i smaku typowo słodowe. Goryczka niska, nasycenie średnie.
Above average main stream lager. Served chilled, high carbonate content. Clean and crisp.
Can from Systembolaget. Clear golden with a small white head. A boring and insipid beer with almost no bitterness.
Golden color with nose of barley, very strong and bitter and hop water flavor with no head
een mooi en goede pils, smaak is licht hoppig en vol. mooie kraag en heldere kleur. goed pils!

Bottle in France; made in France. I rate this because I really doubt if this is the same brew as the regular Heineken that I know in NL. It is noticeably and unusually sweet in its taste. Pity. It already is a default fabric brew, but this French version really is the bad version of it.

This should be taken out of the beer category. 
Water nor beer. Bad balance, no flavor.

While this Beer is despised in the craft community as it essentially defines globalisation, it isn’t actually a bad Lager, and doesn’t deserve the god awful reviews it gets. It is perfectly balanced to the point where the flavour couldn’t really offend anyone, yet not blow anyone away; this gives it an incredible consistency. So, pleasant characteristics of banana, sweet malts, herbs and earthy hops along with a refreshing finish and smooth mouthfeel make it a good quality reliable option.

Read the full review here: www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2020/08/16/heineken

A 330ml limited edition 500 La Habana bottle brought back from that city by a friend. Pours a amber colour with a small white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of grain, bread, corn & sweet malt. Medium body & carbonation. Light bitter finish. More than passable for a mass produced beer
Gold pour, no real head.  Nose comes slightly skunky (which dissipates) with the smell of Euro hops.  Middle light kilned malt, slightly herbal hops.  That's all folks.  Finish dry.
Yellow beer with little head. grassy malty and some wet newspaper. Unpeasant bitterness from hops. I like pilsener and lager because of it's simplicity but not this one.
Pours like nephropathic piss, smells like lager in pubs when I was 14 (then; exotic, now; grim), tastes like standard lager, aftertaste of not a lot. Cheers.

Heineken lager beer, or simply Heineken is a pale lager beer with 5% alcohol by volume produced by the Dutch brewing company Heineken International. Heineken beer is sold in a green bottle with a red star and best poured and served in an ice cold glass.
This is a classic pilsner. Perfect to quench the thirst. No complex flavors or aromas... Simplicity is also beautiful!!

Pours a light gold with small white head; ok

Aroma of grain, light malts and a hint of sweetness; boring typical mass produced lager aroma

Moderate carbonation and fairly smooth body only a little watery; pretty good

Not much flavour but you get the malts and bread and quite sweet

Above average for an easy to drink mass produced lager

I like Heineken. There I’ve said it. It is uncomplicated. It doesn’t ask anything of you. It is a clean fresh crisp lager with a mild
hop that will very happily slake your thirst on a hot summers day. And at £7 for a box of 12 from tescos it’ll get you nicely toasted for minimal outlay.
Bomber. Pours a clear diluted urine color with a small white head. Aroma of bread malts, corn and yeast. Taste of bread malts and light yeast.
Kind of complex aroma and flavour in similar lager beer. An aroma of steamed rice is significant, which I didn't catch in other beer. A slightly bitter finish.

An okay lager, but definitely not my go to. The taste is a toasted malty smoothness. On the nose, maybe a hint honey. It's just a typical lager aroma to my nose. There's a slight hop bitterness on the back end. Don't get me wrong, this is drinkable, but there's others I'd purchase before this. I will say that for a mass produced beer, this is decent, and one that if I had no other option, this okay with me.
Tasted this beer. Drinkable to Pink Floyd, Elbow and other great bands. Remember to enjoy your beer in company with good friends.

[Blind pilsner tasting - Beder]

Aroma: Honey, hops and wheat

Appearance: Light yellow with a small slowly dissapearing white head

Taste: Mildly sweet and mild-moderatly bitter, honey, hops and wheat

Mouthfeel: Mouthfeel is soft with mild carbonation

Overall: Looks thin but tastes and smells fine :)

Mild aroma of malt
Nice appearance with good colour and small head
Taste of malts
Alright palate with mild carb
Better than i thought

Dose 0,33l: Golden, glasklar, sehr kräftiger & sehr stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; malzige + leicht fruchtige Nase, leichte malzige Süße, dezente Zitrusnoten, leichte fruchtige Säure, dezente Hopfenaromen, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Brotteig; frischer + malziger Körper, malzige Süße, leichte Fruchtigkeit, dezente Zitrusnoten, leichte trocken-fruchtige Säure, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, dezente Hopfennoten, spritzig, deutliche Kohlensäure, leichte Hefearomen, Brotteig; leichter malzig-trockener Nachgang
Not a terrible lager, just doesn't do a lot. One of the better of the huge mass produced ones though, does have some nice notes

Ar: Lightly grainy, some grass; a little toast; a bit of earthiness. Ap: Light gold and clear; medium slightly off-white head with good retention, receding into a firm cap of medium foam. T: Chalk and black licorice; herbs and more black licorice; medium-low bitterness, somewhat harsh; finish is bitters and tannins. M: Medium-light body with high carbonation, dry finish. O: Tannic flavor just makes this fairly unpleasant, overwhelming lager and malt characters.
Verdadeira  puro malte  e larger  no Brasil, porém a versão em lata não presta,  sabor totalmente  diferente  da garrafa e do barril

Pours clear yellow, with a foamy white head. Aroma of alloy. Initial Mouthfeel is that of a rusty watered down liquid followed by a rush of strong metallic bitter taste. Light taste of malts and hops mixed in the alloyed lager. Aftertaste doesn't let down expections, the bitter metal taste persists. Compared to other generic industrial beers it's not even the worst you can find...
SKÅL, CHEERS, SALUT, KIPPIS, YAMAS, L’CHAIM, PROOST,  SALUTE, KANPAI 🍻🙏😎
Bière passable. Elle ne présente aucun intérêt. Même le goût n'est pas là ! Une déception au plus haut point !
Heerlijk biertje gedronken in de schorning en schouten show op rtv krimpenerwaard
Taste of the beer refreshing, with hints of malt, bread, herbs, long finish with subtle herbal notes and hop

1000 mal getrunken in jedem CL-Spiel eine Werbung man kommt nicht dran vorbei. Aus der grünen 0,33k Dose mit rotem Heineken-Stern fließt es goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone ins Glas. Es riecht getreidig. Es schmeckt mild würzig, eine feine Süße in der Mitte,  mit langem Abgang. Ein typisches TV-Bier das keinem wehtut und jedem schmeckt. 6 Öffner. 16.02.20
Another lame macro lager. Boring and watery. I don't know why people bother to import this into Australia when there are a billion beers like it already available.
HG came baking the biscuits. HG came breaking the barriers. HG broke down the walls and stole all the bread from the bakery.

Tap@Roast, Tampere, Finland. Light/medium, slightly bitter nuances of bitter grains, a hint of German hops and plastic side-note. Narrow taste spectrum and medium/short aftertaste with some grains. Light body with high/medium carbonation. Overall, bulk in all aspects although 5% gives a hint of more structure. 3 2 3 2 5
Nessa faixa de preço é a melhor lager que encontro no Brasil, tem um amargor unico

Can from supermarket in Copenhagen 

Crystal clear, straw-yellow. Medium white, lasting head. The quintessential macro pils.

Nose is a bit sweaty, grainy and malty.
Light-tasting; metals and a subtle acidity.

Light bodied (obviously), medium carbonation,
watery, and lacking any noteworthy finish.

Beats water.

Quite good, never complained about this one. Sometimes, in random places when I don't see options I know, I might occasionally try totally new beers, but very often when I'm not convinced, I just go for Heineken, and it's all right. Taste - there is flavour, after a first sip you know it's lager, and it doesn't taste like pure alcohol like many horrible beers. It's a classic one and I never  felt like it was a bad choice in contrary to many others. It's a good beer.

Watching North Harbour rugby and drinking heineken with my Mate Dazza. I am currently celebrating getting a successful extension on the mortgage to buy my son Tristan a jet ski for his Birthday. My lease is almost up on my Ford Ranger and Rodger just brought a Jeep Cherokee I think I’ll finance one of those next. Fantastic drop.
the aroma is malty and herbal with shades of grain, straw and some grasses... the taste is malty and floral with notes of grain, hay and some herbs... the aftertaste is dry and bitter...

Time for review this beer because just got this one :)

I got this beer production on 06 April 2021 this one is so fresh from production line (IMO) it's still different from my last tasting it from draught beer version.

The body of Heineken is so medium to light, little sweet a taste from malts and bread taste is not so long, little bit watery body, floral from hops, low bitter, easy to drink

Not dry finished after taste, still some thing on the mouth. It's ok

This one production from Thai Asia Pacific Brewery. I think taste is change a lots such as no more sweet body, medium floral hops but more easy to drink.

Ok
Light yellow pour, white head. Sweet at first, mild bitterness, dry finish.
Pite jakiś czas temu, stąd brak szczegółów tylko ocena przeniesiona z notatek...
Not my first choice of beer but if it’s there I will happily drink it. Has a nice refreshing taste with little to no bad aftertastes. Makes me wanna get with a broad from Europe.
Can at KLM-flight. Orange color, middle foam size. Common lager beer. Drinkable and fits into style.
Cerveja levemente amarga, mas suave. Não beber muito gelada para poder perceber o verdadeiro sabor.
From tap in the Netherlands. Clear golden, small head. Light grain, citrus, a bit metal. Average bitterness. Light bodied, oily watery texture, dry finish. Inoffensive and drinkable.
A great classic. Nothing surprising but a solid blond beer to enjoy in all occasions
classica birra industriale, sentori di lattina, mais cotto e verdura cotta.
Aromat słodowy, nawet przyjemny, ani śladu skunksa mimo zielonej butelki. W smaku słaby słód, lekki diacetyl, niezbyt pełne, a nawet trochę wodniste. Wysycenie powyżej średniego. Goryczki brak.
аромат - почти никакъв, бързо чезнеща пяна, леко газирана, леко сладникав вкус, хмел - много слабо.

Fresh draft in Amsterdam. This is not the export version. This local NL version tastes much better. I wouldn’t call this a Pilsner. It is more like a lager with barely any hops. Not as sweet as Amstel. Clean. No bad aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pression de 50 CL. Robe dorée limpide avec une légère mousse blanche. Arômes de malts. Texture aqueuse, carbonatation faible, légère, sucrée. Notes maltées, citron. Finale courte et maltée. A fuir même quand il n'y a que ça à boire.
hoppy on the nose, malty and fruity taste, nice golden color, overall a well rounded masterpiece..!

Market  "Elf" 21.7 lei - 0.5 l
E greu de găsit ceva specific în Heineken, un euro lager standard care nu e lipsit de populatitate în toate ţările
# 271; 3/2016. Very watery international lager without character. Taste is worty, slightly bitter. 0,4 l bottle, market, Pilsen (CZ).

Ah Heineken, one of the great posers of the beer world. “But it’s European, so it must be good”. I’m Australian so I’m must be able to surf, (right?!?) Yet if you gave me a board and sent me out into the waves I’d end up with a mouthful of fishy tasting water, not unlike my experience drinking this beer
Light yellow with a skunky lager aroma.  Flavor is crisp, bitter hops with a little sweet malt underneath.  Typical European hops taste with lasting bitter aftertaste.

Pentru cea mai promovată bere din lume un gust destul de dezamăgitor. Este adevărat, prețul nu este unul mare. Am remarcat în același timp diferența dintre gustul berii fabricate în Olanda, respectiv cea fabricată în România.
The ultimate mainstream lager I am drinking at World Cup rugby. Lots of adjuncts, nothing appealing but drinkable enough

Blind test - 25 koncerniaków. 
Wygląd: Barwa jasnozłota, klarowna z niską, drobnopęcherzykową białą pianą, która opada do małego krążka, pozostawiając lekki lacing. 
Aromat: Pusty, głównie estry jabłkowe, diacetyl oraz akcent słodowości chlebowej i kwiatowego chmielu.     
Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie. W ustach półsłodkie, treściwość średnia, wysycenie średnoniskie. Goryczki brak. Finisz wytrawny, lekko ziołowy.

From one of the most popular beers in the world, I was kind of disappointed. There is very little taste, but I still somehow manage to get something of a skunky aftertaste to it, especially as I reach the end of the bottle. Its fine, no better or worse than American macros tend to be. Dos Equis is very similar but is far better.

50 cl can bought from supermarket. Pours clear golden color with medium white head. Aroma of malts, cereals, light citrus & alcohol. Taste of malt, light cereals, medium sweet. Light body, medium carbonation, light bitter finish. Overall a decent beer, but I would expect more from it.

Can’t believe not rated previously. Lovely lively look. Creamy fizzy.  Biscuit palate with richness in there. Not like many either weak or cloying macros. It has nice thick lager taste so you know you’re drinking. Thumbs up . Tried bottled 660 ml and cans from Loco.
Most overrated beer taste like water and its one of the most expensive beer. This is not beer.

Zlatnozute boje, tanka bijela pjena, kratkotrajna. Uglavnom slabe citrusno-travne arome. Srednje gorčine, malo duzi gorak finiš. Vodene teksture, srednje prema jakoj gorčini. Isto u moru drugih lagera.
Well known lager in 400ml bottle. It is ok beer considering in what quantities they are making it.
Hungarian version: Light yellow color, neutral aroma, taste is watery and little signs of fruitiness and malt in tastes. Drinkable beer, but average, not good. It has too much hype.

Shit literally smells like a used condom and taste like fucking asshole. Germans like this shit cause they’re weird af. I’m in the US military and I saw two German paratroopers that I was training with drink their buddies piss.. guess there favorite beer. You fucking guessed it Heineken. I’ll go buy dos equis next time. If you like eating burnt butthole then drink this shit you nasty fucks. I literally made an account on this website to tell you how shitty this beer is, if that doesn’t tell you anything idk what will. Save yourself and never buy this beer.
Bottle from bordershopen, puttgarten. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Malty and sweet with notes of grass. Dry finish.

A little bit watery but not corona/Budweiser watery but still it's a pretty good beer.

But buy the bottle version tastes a little bit better.

Watery, clear, golden, without foam, medium carbonation. In general, aroma of malt, cereals, a bit of citrus and spicies. The taste is sweetish, so and so refreshing, could be a bit more carbonation; malt and traces of citrus, and nothing else. Almost no aftertaste.

No aftertaste, basically tastes like water, if you want to have a good night with some buds hanging out, sipping some beer and you don't like beer in general, but wouldnt like to stick out of the group, then there are much less overpriced alternatives for this beer but it'll do

Had an Extra Cold Heineken at Schipol airport in Amsterdam. My god this beer tastes so much better in The Netherlands, I’m from Norway and bottled here it just doesnt taste the same. Was one of the best experiences I’ve had at an airport i was tired of traveling and a nice cold beer was the perfect thing. Was the best lager I’ve had on tap to date.
Clear golden colour with thin white head. Good taste, very refreshening. Not the best beer but decent.
0,33l bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma of skunk, grainy, citrus. Taste is skunk, some hops, grainy, citrus. Not even refreshing, terrible.
Almindelig lys pilsner, med meget lidt bitterhed. Lidt og groft skum. Er meget tynd i smagen og har meget lidt eftersmag.
I am not surprised that it has taken a while for me to review this. It pours golden and has thin lace. Some malt aroma. Taste is medium sweet to bitter with a crisp finish. Utterly forgettable.
Very pleasant with foamy and fizzy mouthfeel. Slightly warms the stomach. Crisp. Fair amount of bitter hop flavor upon the moment it passes your lips with a slightly stronger bitter hop after taste.
Clear golden appearance with a thin head. A little bitter and in general rather watery, but very drinkable and refreshing.
Cerveza de estilo pilsner industrial de sabor casi neutro olor difuso a cereal y amargor medio
Flaska från mack i Baskien. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Brödig och söt med inslag av citrus.

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS BEER AND THIS EXPERIENCE THAT I HAD IN THE HEINEKEN MUSEUM. Stephen was so nice (he’s one of the workers there) really helpful and made my experience even better, had a great laugh. Learned so much. Got some pictures got some beer what isn’t it to love about this

One of the worst beers available when you buy outside The Netherlands but by god somehow this becomes one of the best beers available on a hot Amsterdam day, wish I could relive that moment in the hot Aussie sun
So little to note. Very gassy. Little malt or hops to note. Nothing bad particularly, just bland.
Backlog. Clear gold with a small white head.  Crisp lager with nice hop bitterness

Good ol’ Heine has nothing new to offer but as far as mega massive produced beers go you could definitely do worse. The lack of sweetness and slight skunkiness throw up red flags when you’re in some American suburb, but in tropical heat on a Caribbean island, the skunkiness comes off smoother and drier and is a welcome sight under certain circumstances.

Nothing special point but I understand why this beer is popular all over the world.
Clear, less bitter, refreshing ,medium body and easy to drink.

I´m sure that there are not a lot of people that haven´t had a couple of these, or atleast, had a taste.
Out of the mainstream beers, this one never disappoints me.
can. smell is faint sweetness corn. taste is malty, on sweet side, light grassiness. some metallic.

Tons of bottles and drafts over the years. Mostly drink the ice cold in Amsterdam when I'm desperate or at a coffeeshop type facility. At least the Dutch don't allow any GMO corn syrup in this one. Notes are macro lager but better than most other american crap. lemons, biscuit, spice, and grain. Prefer amstel light but can drink this in a pinch

Bottle brewed in Holland. Grassy aroma that makes itself known without being overpowering. Fairly large plain head that in turn doesn't last long. Light, clear amber colour. Very mild carbonation textures the mouthfeel without being fizzy. Refreshing grassy taste melds into malty finish. Quite laid-back flavour-wise all-round while staying firmly on the right side of watery. Very pleasant to drink, but suited for leisurely drinking outdoors on a hot summer's day, not going on a taste adventure. Two-dimensional at best, but does what it sets out to do well. Great beer if you're thirsty, while also well-crafted enough to reward being savoured. No complexity or wild flavours here however. A sedate beer.
Has a interesting aroma produced by the A-yeast and is refreshing when ice-cold. But that's about it. People rating this higher than a 2 or a 3 are just a spit in the face of beer culture.
ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w celu uzupełnienia profilu

Metallic, grainy aroma. Stable white head, lots of fast CO2 bubbles. Sweet and smooth malty taste. Sweet yeast in aftertaste, just like if you've ate a bun. Nothing special, but enjoyable on a hot sunny day.

Grainy and malty aroma, pours light golden with decent white head, malty, grainy taste with smooth finish. Not bad for a world famous lager that are usually dull. Good to drink when watch CL final with mates. Bought from local Grossi pood, Tallinn.

From a bottle to a glass. Pours a clear amber color with a medium frothy head. Some particulates floating around in the beer. Aroma is Sweet grainy malts, bakers yeast, slight pairs, grassy Earthy hops. Taste follows the aroma well with a watery light medium mouthfeel. Not too bad for a Lager.

The aroma is weak hop. The taste is weak a little malt, light hop bitterness.
Standard euro lager

Licht zoetige smaak, met weinig bitter hop.
Vreemde nasmaak en erg vlak.
Echt een industrie pils.
Er zijn in Nederland veel betere pilseners te koop.
Snap ook die hoog punten niet van veel bezoekers.
Van de tap is het nog wel te doen.
It depends where you drink it how good it will taste. It's not a bad lager but not the best
prima oara cand am baut,mi s a parut buna, dar dupa ce am baut mai mult,gretoasa
Premium beer of choice for me. I can’t fault this beer in anyway. Defines European beer that have taste body flavour. Beautifully crafted and the best European lager by some distance
Типичный нейтральный евролагер с типичной хмельной горчинкой на послевкусии

Had this as my first official drink. Not too good. Taste just like crap, but not the worst I’ve ever had. It’s just mediocre. The initial taste isn’t that bad, it’s more of the after taste that kills the whole vibe. There’s a lot better beers to try than Heineken.

I wanted “a beer” to go with my dinner, and had to get one from a corner mart. This was the only single beer I was willing to buy that they offered, the rest were malt liquors and michelada beers...
This one came in a 24oz can. The beer is slightly flat. 
In hindsight, I should have gone with the 40oz of Colt 45. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Одно из худшего пива, что доводилось пробовать. Нечто среднее между "вылить сразу" и "давиться". Популярность и мировой ажиотаж непонятен. Не конкурент большинству дешёвых белорусских позиций.
Nekem nem jön be,semmi habja,nagyon keserű íz.Iható de abszolút alsó kategóriás sör.
Bottle Heineken Extra Vers. Smooth with sweetish hints. Quite bitter, moderate sweetish sessionable with grainy parts.
Opinia to opinia, każdy ma swoją. Mnie wcale płytkość nie zraża, jak na koncernowe ma swój niepowtarzalny smak i świetny, jedyny w swoim rodzaju zapach.

Heineken Lager Beer sau pur și simplu Heineken este o bere palidă lager cu 5% alcool în volume produsă de compania olandeză de fabricare a berii Heineken International. Heineken este bine cunoscut pentru semnătura sa de sticlă verde și stea roșie.

Ich glaube es gibt keinen Biertrinker, der noch nie ein "Heini" getrunken hat. Da die Brauerei alle möglichen Brauereien überall auf der Welt aufgekauft hat und dort auch das Heineken-Bier produziert (in Österreich in Wieselburg), ist es quasi omnipräsent.
Bei solch bekannten Biere gebe ich gerne ein paar andere Informationen, wie dass die "e" in Heineken um ein paar Grad gedreht wurden, damit sie als lächelnd wahrgenommen werden oder dass der rote Stern im Logo in den 60ern weiß eingefärbt wurde um nicht mit den Kommunisten in Verbindung gebracht zu werden.
Ich trinke mein Fläschchen, das leider nicht mehr in Pfandflaschen abgefüllt wird, im Speisewagen Wien-Innsbruck. Es ist stark gekühlt und dadurch recht leicht und angenehm zu trinken. Es ist ein bisschen leer im Mittelteil, hat aber einen netten Abgang. Klassisches Industriebier.
Lager gold with a white head - Casual lager beer no big expectations here - so mainstream like Coca Cola
Birra commerciale bevibile, mediocre intensità olfattiva, bella bionda, senza troppe pretese, adatta per accompagnare una grigliata tra amici.
piwo jasne, klarowne, w Holandii smakuje lepiej  ;) Irlandzka wersja trochę słabsza
complex taste compare to other macrobeer lager factory garbage. If I have to buy a lager I would choose hophouse13 and heineken
My favourite of the big brands, Friday afternoon refreshment and hot summer drink.
Una de las cervezas más vendidas del mundo. De la cerveza baja final. Nada realmente notable.

Jasno złote, super klarowne. Piana na 3 palce. Biała, pęcherzyki drobne. Nawet trwała. Dodrze trzyma się szkła. 
W aromacie słód, śladowe ilości chmielu i niemały DMS.
Wysycenie spore. Wodnistość.  
Prawie bez smaku. Coś tam majaczy słodowego. Jakieś podrygi goryczkowe. Mizerne to to . Lekko osłodzona woda gazowana z mierną ilością akcentów piwnych.
Flavoured water. Very clear. Slightly malty but not complex flavour overall. Does well as a hydration aid.
Buena. Aroma metálico. Cristalina dorada, poca espuma. Sabor ligeramente dulce, muy poco amargo, corto final en boca. Muy carbonatada. Ligera.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear pale gold with a nice white quickly disappearing head. Very light scents of grass and hay. Bland malt flavors with a slightly skunky vegetal after taste. A bit of a sour finish that doesn’t marry well with the malt core flavor. High carbonation. Not good at all.

Parfaitement insipide, et, exploit dans le genre, tellement pauvre en goût qu'en dépit d'un titre plutôt faible de 5° le goût de l'alcool se trouve bien trop perceptible à en devenir désagréable ..... Beurk ! Dans le genre pils sans saveur, même une triste "Kro" reste plus satisfaisante.
Leicht pappig, leicht Getreide, leicht herb und vor allem viel Wasser. Eiskalt genießbar.
Once upon a time favorite one. But not significant aroma. It’s good but not deep.
Lager industrial Holandesa de lo más normal. Cristalina, muy carbonatada y sabor escaso. Fácil de beber y pasable si está bien fría.
It is what it is, another Mac Lager.  it is refreshing on a hot day, good to drink as a session lager but nothing to savior.  Goes well with seafood.
Had at airport in St Maarten, was the Dutch version which made it better than in the states, but still nothing remarkable

Heineken is het grootste merk bier in Nederland en ook in mijn vroege jeugd was er bij ons in het dorp bijna alleen Heineken Pils te koop.
Mijn vader dronk het ook altijd. Als er een verjaardag was dan dronken de ouderen meestal Jonge Jenever, Heineken Pils of oud bruin.
Zelf ben ik geen liefhebber van Heineken uit het flesje, maar van de tap is het best wel goed te drinken. Gelukkig is er tegenwoordig veel keuze in veel betere en ook betaalbare bieren. Het is wel zo, dat als je er een paar glazen van drinkt, je niet veel verschil zal merken met een ander pilsener.

440ml can. Pours light straw with a dissipating white head. Aroma is sweet, yeasty, cereal, banana and a touch herbal. Very yeasty on the taste, with some cereal and light bitterness. Almost light licorice in the bitterness and a touch metallic. Ok, pretty much a macro lager, but has a little bit in the taste department. Had a lot worse, but then again had a lot better!
Can. Light malts, tart. Metallic. Cardboard. No notable taste. Watery. Medium carbonation.
Bottle. Super clear, clean and crisp but left me with a pretty dull finish.
Cerveza muy simple, sin cuerpo, sin espuma ni sabor. Gran popularidad pero nada más
Kokusu belirgin olmayan Asitli ama köpüksüz Hollanda lager'ı malt tadı gelmiyor.
Bottle from tesco. Clear yellow appearance with medium white head. Aroma is sweet and slightly hopper. Flavour is crisp and refreshing. Hoppy and sweet for a lager, hints of banana.
Net uilenzeik.                                                               .
Cerveza fácil de beber, típica cerveza para todos los gustos. Suave, muy suave.

Had in pretty much every form, can bottle, Longneck bottle, draught, imported and locally made.
Classic European pale lager, just the right blend of medium bitterness and smooth finish, the way a lager should be. Slight metallic taste.
Smell is pretty light typical of lagers
Body is light typical of lagers
May be a bit biased with my Dutch heritage but one of my favourite drops of all time

Moda em São Paulo. É uma cerveja perfeita, com gosto de malte acentuado, apesar de ter corpo bem mais leve que outras brejas. Tem de estar trincando para ser justamente apreciada. Não é meu estilo de cerveja: gosto de mais encorpadas.
Rather tiny and bland, not a terrible amount of hops or other beer flavor, but not a bad option.

Famosa lager holandesa, nave bandera de la grande multinacional de cervezas. No merece en absoluto la fama que tiene pues no pasa de ser una lager de fábrica mediocre. El poder de la publicidad es grande. Color amarillento, poca espuma, carbonatación media-alta con burbujas medio-grandes. Sabor ligeramente amargo, aguado. Retrogusto refrescante ligeramente amargo. Poco cuerpo. Es bebible pero no vale gran cosa.
Birra conosciutissima, molto venduta.. Ma nulla di che. Gasata e dal gusto praticamente imbevibile

Slabo, vodeno, bezukusno i bljutavo. 
Jedno od najgorih piva probanih. 
Vrlo slabo.
Birretta commerciale.....ma nel formato da 150 cl carino il packaging..... 5% vol. Si fa bere!
Typisch Großbrauerei, einfach nicht gut, langweiliger Geschmack nach Karton
A melhor cerveja popular do Brasil, ótimo custo x benefício e se levar uma caixa paga de boneco e é bem visto no churrasco !

Zasadniczo jest to zabarwiona na stosunkowo ładny kolor woda. Trudno mówić o doznaniach płynących z picia tego „piwa” tak samo jak trudno mówić o szczególnych przeżyciach podczas picia wody z kranu. Z drugiej jednak strony Heineken jest świetna opcją dla kogoś kto nie lubi piwa, ponieważ zasadniczo nie ma smaku, zapachu lub goryczki, a także całościowo nie odpycha nieprzyjemnym zapachem albo dziwnym smakiem. Podsumowując do bólu nudna, ale jednak alkoholowa alternatywa dla fanów wody prosto z sieci miejskiej.
Can. Pours bubbily gold with white head. Metal, corn, grass aroma. Taste is mildly bitter, a mix of metal and fruity berries. Thirst quenching, but not so tasty. Not the worst macro lager.
Ultra basique. Une des bière les plus vendus au monde. De la lager bas de gamme. Vraiment rien de marquant.
Color amarillo, cristalina. Un dedo de espuma con retención media. Aroma discreto a cereal. Gusto dulce, algo de cereal y paja, nada más. Cuerpo acuoso. Dulce, simple y sin alma, muy floja.
I've tried this in their Amsterdam factory, which tastes different than what you get from a local store.
One of my go to lawnmowers. A little bit sweet like so many euro lagers are. Also had a crisp finish. For those times when you just want an easy drinking beer.
Easy to drink, nothing very excited. At times poor aromas. The coolest factor of this beer is that James Bond drinks it so it has that going for it.
Heineken sucks! Used to taste good about 40 years ago. I wouldn’t drink it unless somebody offered me one. Pay for it, please.

Bue Au Cheval Noir 25cl (Villedieu-les-Poêles)
Robe jaune translucide.
Mousse légère et éphémère.
Saveurs d'orge et aucun ressenti de houblon.

Bière passable uniquement quand elle est la seule alternative disponible.
Color amarillo con una cabeza que desaparece en segundos. Tanto en aroma como en sabor destaca la malta y poco más. Una lager industrial muy standard con poco que ofrecer.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Cerveja gostosa! Provavelmente a mais famosa entre as puro malte. Odor agradável e forte retrogosto de lúpulo. Bom custo benefício.

0.5 l can. Pours clear golden with minimal head. A: malty T: higher saturation, lower body, malty, slightly bitter, only bit harsh.

On tap. Pours clear golden with smaller head. A: T: crisp, medium body, more bitter somewhat harsh, bready, malty

Une bière sans âme ni intérêt, la pire bière industrielle sur le marché.  Même certaine marque distributeur ont beaucoup plus de caractère, surtout vendue à ceux prix la, certaine bière à moin de 1 euro vos mieux que cette bière.
From bottle. Skunky, sour and watery. A towering mediocrity. Could possibly tie with American Budweiser as worst overconsumed beer on Earth.
Cerveza Lager sin ningún matiz definido con cuerpo ligero con buen paso de boca. Anteriormente diva ahora simplemente buena, mejor bien fría. Se acabó su supremacía, lo mejor, su marketing.
Clear, golden color, thin texture, rich foam, malt aroma, perfect refreshment on warm summer days and nights.

12 oz can. Smells of sweet malt, also a bit of egg smell is detectable. Golden and crystal clear in the glass. Taste is ok, sweet malts with a hint of sour. Finish leaves a lingering off-sour note. Drinkable, better than most mass produced american lagers, but that doesn't set the bar too high.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Sehr gutes holländisches Bier, kann mit westdeutschen bieren (Becks ect,) mithalten, Respekt an die Müllabfuhr
Fragrant Bouquet. Flamboyantly non-desript. Subtle yet annoying, with a morose attitude.

Its a regular open wide lager among all the other shelfwarmers. 
Carbonated, open, nice lager
Always enjoy a Heineken! Nice taste and enjoyable on an evening, especially when hot.
It is a good beer to enjoy with your friends if you don't want to spend a lot of money, it goes pretty well with a pizza,but overall nothing spectacular.
A classic, it might now be the most tasty ever, but it is an ok beer to go and drink with friends
Claro ejemplo de como un producto puede ser número uno de ventas única y exclusivamente por marketing

På fat Hooters Pattaya Thailand. Ljust guldfärgad med relativt liten skumutveckling. Maltig doft med inslag av frukt. Smak av malt, bröd, apelsin och citrus. Mycket kolsyra. Tycker att den Heineken som bryggs i Thailand smakar bättre än den från Holland.

Overpriced rubbish, I've tasted better beer out of a bottle I found from a night before which had a cigarette butt in it. Bottle looks nice but the taste is quite the contrary. Run away, just do it. Run!
Toch wel Nederlands bekendste bier. Smaakvol pils met veel hop en mout smaken. -backlog de BierApp-
When people ask why I drink so much non-alchoholic beer, I should cite this one as an example of a 'real' brew that offers nothing by comparison... except for drug content.
Bottle 330 ml. Similar to many other standard lagers. Probably a good terrace beer when extremely cold.
Kein Geruch, kein Geschmack, es löscht den Durst und ist nicht das schlimmste Industrielager.

Earlier Rating: 9/28/2018 Total Score: 5
Earlier Rating: 9/28/2018 Total Score: 4.9

Robe blond clair, limpide, mousse assez faible, carbo faible. Nez malté léger, un peu de grain. Bouche légère, maltée (grain), une pointe de houblon herbacé, léger. Bière de soif classique, rien à dire.
Bottle. Pours golden with white head. Aroma of pale malts - little sweetness. Thin texture and body.
Too many bad reviews by guys wil have antipathy against Heineken. Tasted from tap and bottle (prefer tap). But a Good and Nice pilsener. A light bitter and very drinkable. Good lager
Not much nose, mainly light malt with a touch of lemon. Faint lager nuttiness, moderately bitter, weak finish. No off-flavors, nicely balanced and a bit better than most light lagers.

On tap at Piccadilly restaurant, Ruse. Probably a version brewed by Zagorka at Stara Zagora, Bulgaria. Pours clear with a well retained pillow of fluffy white foam, plenty of lacing and brief rising carbonation. Very pale straw in colour. On the nose, more malty than hoppy. In the mouth, too bitter and tasteless, thin and basically unpleasant. Overall, so pathetic it will be hard to remember I have finally rated it. Please up your game, Heineken!

Przelicznik spejsona jest tragiczny. Kupilem za 3.50 w lidlu wiec dla tych ktorzy chca kupic cokolwiek zeby tylko zachlac to odpada. Przechodzac do ocen to wodniste, goryczka zerowa, zapach nie jest tak uciazliwy jak w perle. Termin przydatnosci jeszcze dlugi wiec skunksem nie zdazylo zajsc. Typowy koncerniak, za wiecej niz piwo jest warte otrzymujemy wode z procentami. Jesli chodzi o wyglad to rowniez typowy koncerniak, jasno zlote z drobnopecherzykowa piana, ktora szybko znika.

Tried it in all forms, can, bottle and draught. It’s a great all rounder as far as lagers go but still with enough bite that let’s you know your drinking a good weighted beer.
Yes it’s commercial, but so what!! I’m pretty sure there is a reason for that.
For me a real all rounder, good ABV, clean and crisp taste and available everywhere.

This Beer Is Life. The taste when drinking it cold it makes you want more of it, very smooth, here in Sa even the Ladies adore this Beer. It gets you drunk when you consume too much of it, classy beer for any occasion.
Čim se otvori, ubije me miris svježe pokošene trave i livade. Okus nije jača strana.
33cl from bottle at Neverland (Valladolid). Plain, tasteless beer, slightly metallic even. Just a bad beer
I love Heineken - mostly because everyone on here hates commercial lager. You know where I can get Heineken? Everywhere.

The scent is very strong and hoppy. Kind of smells like weeds which was off putting. The appearance had a medium head and yellow body.  The taste is quite hoppy and bitter. I could not see myself drinking more then a couple, as I’m already feeling a bit bloated. It also leaves somewhat of a gassy aftertaste which bothers me. Certainly would not go out of my way to drink it, but it isn’t too bad.

Importowany z Amsterdamu przez Heineken USA. 3.2% obj alk. Barwa jasno słomkowa, piana slaba szybko opadająca, mocne wysycenie lekko gryzące w język,  szybko wypełnia żołądek, aromat lekko słodowy, mocno kukurydziany ( siarczek dimetylu DMS), nie wyczuwam specjalnie skunksa ( 3-metylo-2-buten-1-tiol, merkaptan prenylowy MBT) mimo zielonej butli, puste, minimalna goryczka przy przełykaniu bez aromatu chmielu.

This is the best beer you can buy all other the world what tastes the same where ever you are, I prefer to drink mine between 2/4c as that’s when I really enjoy the beer srinkeling on my tong. It’s a very clear beer as well for the people who like to wake up with a clear head the next day.

Lata de @Supermercado, Oviedo 25/08/2018 

Color amarillo corona de espuma blanca, aroams metalicos, sabor malo, mala cerveza industrial.

Quelqu’un a pisse dans un extincteur, il en a sorti une heineken. Une belle réussite, la bière conserve le caractère métallique et ferreux de l’extincteur et tous les arômes de l’urine animale! Chapeau!
Als Extra-Cold ganz genießbar, aber recht wässrig. Aussehen ok, auch wenn sie Schaumkrone etwas stabiler sein könnte.
Found from bottle from Binnys in Plainfield, Illinois. The aroma as is the taste are completely off. Leaves a bad aftertaste as well.
Bière industrielle fade, sans saveur et goût. A boire quand on n'a pas d'autres choix.
Tzv." Europivo" které nemá s pivem moc společného. Bez chuti, řízu, hořkosti.

Recommended. I really like this beer especially when it's cool. Not so much foam and the color is light. I was surprised by the smooth feeling when drink. The tast is really freshing and kind of sweet. Didn't get drunk while drinking but got really drunk afterward.

Thin off white kept a cover on an active straw coloured body.
Wheat, grass & floral aroma.
Medium bodied, sharp on the tongue with a sharp finish.
Floral tasting with grass, mild citrus & a hoppy bitter finish.

Tasted this in Hyderabad, first time was a bottle and i was utterly disappointed with the bitterness. I could taste nothing but hops there. Never dared to get one again, however, once brought a can along with fosters and to my surprise the can tasted way better than bottle. It was smooth, fine aroma and tasted better even at a room temperature. Would only recommend can for heineken.

W aromacie prawie nic sie nie dzieje, jesli sie doszukiwac to lekko stęchły i alkoholowy. Barwa zlota, idealnie klarowne, piana drobna, ladna. W smaku wodniste, owocowe. Goryczka niska, wysycenie wysokie. Kwaskowe na finiszu. Kiepski eurolager, polskie w przewazajacej wiekszosci lepsze.
Całkowicie słodowe, zero chmielu. W aromacie dodatkowo karton, szmata, skunks. Niesmaczne
Ocena wydana na podstawie notatek sprzed założenia konta na Ratebeerze. Wartość archiwalna.

50-cl can purchased from a snack bar vendor in Luxembourg Gardens in Paris, France (note that the label states it was contract brewed in France). Pours clear pale yellow with large fluffy white head and lacing. Aroma: Corn Flakes, Rice Krispies, honey. Flavor: corn syrup, marshmallow rice cereal squares, honey. Mouthfeel: light-bodied. A really shitty beer that I shamefully used to think was OK -- 35 years ago!

0,33 l bottle. Thanks to Jörn. I would never have had the courage to buy it myself. Clear golden in the glass, one finger off white foamy short living head. Light grainy smell. Taste? Not a lot. Low grainy, nearly like rice or corn, no bitterness. Hints of chewing gum. Cardboard aftertaste. Boring stuff but tbh it doesn´t hurt.
Sólo si está muy fría o no hay otra cosa. No es que esté mala, tan solo es que no está. Muuuy plana en boca, totalmente ausente en nariz y bebestibilidad afectada por una textura algo cargante.

Niet slecht, deze autoriteit op biergebied. Stevige bittere afdronk. Betere smaak sinds nieuwe fles.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From backlog. 0,5 litre Can from Rema 1000 Bispehaugen. Clear Golden with white head. Pilsner, malts and hops, some sweetness.
Keg at AFAS, Amsterdam. The only thing available at the venue. The thing one forgets about Heineken is it’s weird, corn-like sweetness, as opposed to total blandness. It really is quite unpleasant.

Uiterlijk: Goudblond bier met een echte pilskraag.
Geur: Gist, granig, banaan.
Smaak: Hoppig, gist, mout.
Mond: Veel koolzuur en moutig, tikkeltje zuur. je kan er als bierliefhebber gewoon niet omheen,de groene opvallende verpakking is niet meer weg te denken in de huidige bierwereld, gewoon een prima geslaagd bier/pils.
Ha gyorsan kell döntenem mit vegyek rá szavazok. Kellemes könnyed. A habja átlagos, finom,
Que d'eau, que d'eau, que d'eau! Pour faire de la bière, il faut de l'eau mais tout de même, il ne faut pas exagérer !
Plastic bottle. Clear golden with brief head. Cardboard, malt, grass. Standard shitty macro lager.
Bardzo źle ale do wypicia. Kiepski zapach, karton, smrodek skuna, mało chmielu, nijakość. Źle źle źle.
Hellgelb, klar, gering karbonisiert, minimale Krone. Minimal malzig, frisch, süffig, wässrig, charakterarm.

Ein leichtes und erfrischendes Bier. Die Farbe ist gold und die Schaumkrone ist klein. Der Geruch ist minimal hopfig. Der Geschmack ist eher wässrig, zum Ende hin aber etwas hopfig und spritziger Nachgeschmack.

What can I say...
Worked in their factory in my hometown 
It is piss poor beer but we grew up on it

Can, 0.5 L. For sure it's a trustworthy lager, it contains lots of stuffs inside. For me, this is the origo, this is a corraleting point in the Universe of lagers. Golden appearence with an average white head. I can feel a huge amount of sweet malt, very pleasent smell, some melted brown sugar i feel. Good carbonization and great mouthfully aromas on the palate with a "sweet bitterness" on the end. Absolutely fair lager, despite the fact that Heineken is ruiling the world (i believe in Heineken ruiling anyway), they make constant quality. It's a great choice every time.

Cata de un Envase 355 (mexicana), servida en una flauta pilsner. 
Apariencia: Espuma inestable blanca, color rubio cristalino 
Aroma: a campo, semillas
Cuerpo: ligero, con carbonatación vivaz y balance adecuado
Sabor: refrescante, con un ligero amargor limpio.
Fles 33cl. Wat zoetige smaak. Ergens een bittertje. (8-2010).--------------.
I love this beer and i thing it taste is very good. Cause i dont like bitter beers and Its sweet .
Dit is een lager zoals een lager moet zijn. Een referentie punt als het gaat om bier. Alle lager bieren kunnen beoordeeld worden met Heineken als het perfecte voorbeeld.

Heineken ist Kult, weils eben jedem schmeckt. 
Dem Biertrinker ist es aber zu flach, zu wässrig, zu süß...
Nichts für mich... kann den Hype nicht verstehen. 
Dazu oder grad deswegen, ist der Preis auch noch sehr (zu) hoch.
Entre l'entrée et la sortie du corps il n'y pas de différence que ce soit en gout ou en aspect
Se trouve en soirée entre amis fauchés. De l'eau pétillante colorée, rien de plus.

12 ounce can into lager glass; canned on 6/19/2017, best before 6/2018. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense white head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malt and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness of pale malt and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a nice pale lager. All around good robustness of pale malt and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mildly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful with a nice body for the ABV. Clean pils malts and mild earthy hop balance. A nicely enjoyable offering. Very well made and spot on stuff for the style.

Heineken used to be my free beer of choice while gambling in casinos. To be fair, it was the 90s, and it went well with the persistent sensation of losing money. A light bulb moment!



Bottled Heineken is almost always skunky-tasting, because too much of the branding is based on the green glass, preventing them from doing the smart thing and switching to brown glass that better blocks the UV light that kills beer.



And canned and draft versions are almost as bad, suggesting that the skunkiness has become part of the intended flavor profile. I've heard that Heineken adds some esters and intentionally light-shock its beers before canning and kegging in order to meet its  customers' expectations of shittiness and deliver the "desired" off-flavor, but I can't confirm this.



If you can avoid the skunk, you're still left with a thin, watery, too-sweet, over-carbonated beer. A Bud Light, if you will. 



Hey.. wait a second.. I took a tour of the Heineken brewery in Amsterdam and the beer served there somehow tasted better (granted this was a few years ago and alcohol was not the only mind-altering substance consumed) ... Weirdo.

Het moest er eens van komen en wat is het mooier naar een dag fysiek hard buiten werken. Dit met een Heineken af te ronden. Alleen het lipje van het blik los maken geeft al dat fantastische tjssss geluid. Waardoor je al in het feestje verheugd. Het heeft een lichte neutrale bier geur. Maar een perfecte doorzichtig licht geel kleurtje waar je de CO2 belletjes om hoog ziet gaan waar het vervolgens een witte schuimkraag vormt. Smaakt naar lager maar wel van het soort in perfecte balans. Niet te zoet, je proeft de malt, je proeft de hop maar niet te specifiek van smaak, je proeft dat deze iets bitterde als een standaard lager is maar ook weer niet te bitter. Deze groene reus is dorstlessend en je wilt er altijd nog één meer. Kortom het biertje wat het altijd goed doet. Ook zonder de reclame’s staat het biertje in zijn klasse als een huis. Proost

I remember back in the day, FuzeTV was cool; it had this music video program called "Red Star Sounds", sponsored by, of course, Heineken.

Heineken is one of those beers that you usually find to be skunky in the bottle, but the cans don’t usually have that problem.

Back in the day, I actually used to think of Heineken as a "Classy Beer"; I had remembered to old ads back in magazines in the 80s, with the tagline, "Come to think of it, I’ll have a Heineken".

The classic early 70s Jack Nicholson film The Last Detail has a scene where Nicholson tells Randy Quaid’s character that they’re going to have a Heineken; in Jack’s own words, "It’s the best beer in the world, kid - President Kennedy drank it!"

I will admit that it was a step up from Miller High Life, and it did look good in a frosty cold bottle - although sadly Heineken has changed their bottles from the slick, short "fattie" bottle that the had sold in the U.S. for decades, to the same-old, same-old longneck style that every other damn beer has; what’s wrong with being unique?

I also remember around early 2007, I was in the process of being hired for a Payroll job, and it was looking quite good; unfortunately, it would be almost a month before I would start the job, and I was running out of money.

Thankfully, about seven years earlier, I had ignored my sister-in-law when she was telling me a specific Cold Steel knife (the Recon Tanto) would be a "waste of money".
Well, I was determined not to be bossed around, so I bought that Recon Tanto then and there - bragging to her how cool it was (and it WAS cool!); flash-forward seven years, and I’m at a pawn shop, pawning it for $80.00 (I had bought it for about $100.00, so it had retained very good value!) - now I had grocery (and Heineken!) money!
I dropped by my local Bruno’s (a now-defunct high-end grocery store in my area - they really were great!), got some groceries and a 12-pack of Heineken; I got home, changed my clothes, sat down all bundled up at my computer with my space heater under the desk, keeping me nice in toasty on that cold February afternoon, and I started chugging back those frosty bottles of Heineken while surfing the Internet; I think back then I had gone to sites like Digg.com, Rense.com, and a few others; this was the early days of YouTube, so I checked out some music videos there, but also Google still had Google Video up (back then they had only very recently purchased YouTube), and some kind soul had posted a long video (back then YouTube had time limits on videos!) called, "MTV in 1983" - which included the videos, the VJ’s, commercials, everything!


Also shortly thereafter, I they marketed a keg-shaped can, that was quite sturdy (although the pop-top would sometimes malfunction; it required a lot of force to open, but if you miscalculated and applied too MUCH force, it would break and cut your finger!).
I remember that can specifically because of a Sopranos episode where Tony and Bobby Baccalla were on vacation with their wives in the Catskill mountains, and were on a speedboat, drinking Heineys out of those same style cans.

These days it’s rare that I’ll partake of that Dutch brew in the green bottle, as there are so many better choices available - usually around the same price, too!

But I will always remember my days of naivete, when I used to hold up a frosty bottle of Heineken, and say out loud to myself, "Classssyyyy......"

De la macro cervecera Femsa-Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma (Heineken México) su ya muy conocida Euro Pale Lager “ Heineken” con 5% ABV, anteriormente esta cerveza era considerada Premium y era importada, lo que la hacia mas cara, pero a partir de que la marca holandesa compro la totalidad de la nacional Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, si no me equivoco ya se maquila en suelo nacional y su precio se homologo a sus demás productos(Tecate, Sol, Corona, XX Lager, etc.), volviéndola mas accesible.
A simple vista muestra una corona de espuma mediana de ínfima retención, perlas pequeñas y cristalinas con una carbonatación considerable, el color es el típico paja encontrado en la mayoría de las cervezas de este tipo, muy cristalina por el tipo de fermentación y seguramente es filtrada, se puede observar un cuerpo acuoso en las paredes del cristal.
El aroma no tiene mucho en particular comparte una nota a pan por las maltas empleadas, dulzor igual por el grano y quizá el punto a favor es que no tiene carácter a maíz o dulzor de maíz ya que es muy común se utilice una cantidad considerable de maltas de maíz para abaratar precios en la producción debido a que es mas rendidora.
El sabor es de inicio dulce, sabores a pan blanco se mezclan, quisiera decir mas pero esto es lo único que aporta, al final hay algo de amargor, pero en su conjunto todo es pasajero, en general un clon de cualquier otra Generic Pale Lager con el punto de que no tiene aroma ni sabor a maíz, la recomiendo de lata o barril ya que la embotellada se oxida mas fácilmente por el color verde del vidrio, este ofrece menos protección contra los rayos UV que foto oxidan los componentes de la cerveza ocasionando olores similares a orina de gato, sabores agrios y ligera astringencia.
Muy buen cerveza. En los últimos años ha bajado su calidad, pero se mantiene como una muy buena cerveza.

Aroma: Skunk, sweet malts, corn. Appearance: Very weak head, short-lasting, body colour is light gold. Taste: Sweet, watery, skunk, some grass, corn, bitterness none. Palate: Finish is semi-sweet, body low, carbonation high.

The beer has a normal pilsener look. It is not very different from normal Heineken. The color of the beer is golden yellow. The shade of yellow might be a bit different from that of normal Heineken. The beer pours a thick layer of rough crispy white foam. The bulk of the foam remains rather quick. The smell is nice. It is definitely better than that of plain Heineken. It has something sweet to it. It also has a little alcohol in it. The remaining aromas are those of barley and some hop and yeasts. It is the smell of pilsener, with a bit more depth to it. It reminds me more of German pilsners. The same goes for the taste. This has also more of sophisticated flavor. It had some nice fresh hops in it, which are accountable for some nice bittersweet fresh flavors. It also had a normal Pilsner taste to it. The mouth sensation is that of regular pilsner. All in all, a nice pilsner but it looks way more special than it truly is.

Dégustation, pardon absorption, sur demande d’un ami du nord de la France qui souhaitait mon avis sur la question. J’ai mis trois mois pour l’acheter !!! 

Début du commentaire :je n’ai jamais regardé de film d’horreur , sauf un qui s’appelait l’Exorciste.

La bouteille verte ici me rappelle l’Exorciste pour le visage de la petite fille. 
Le liquide lui, me rappelle l’horreur, mais heureusement sa couleur n’est quand même pas verte, comme par ailleurs ces bières vertes de la St Patrick, une pure idiotie et un barbarisme sans nom, ou cette Berliner Weisse Kindl Waldmeister, une chose infâme et une vraie horreur, nous y voici à nouveau …

Ce liquide légèrement malté a toute l’apparence de la bière, mais c’est comme le Canada Dry, ce n’en est pas … 
Et il faut dire que le management a bien travaillé la chose, puisqu’il va même jusqu’à y mettre un peu de houblon, semant ainsi le trouble parmi la population, surtout les jeunes qui n’ont jamais bu de vraie bière et qui n’en peuvent mais ….
Alors quel est le fautif ?? la bouteille ou le liquide ?? C’est comme l’oeuf et la poule … 

Par ailleurs, il faut dire que l’on n’est pas volé, puisqu’il y a 65 cl dans la bouteille pour le prix de 33 … mais c’est normal puisque c’est de l’eau... 

Ce que ne dit pas l’étiquette, puisqu’on peut lire « bière de prestige », « premium quality », médaille à Paris en 1875 et 1889 (c’est récent !!! ), 
diplôme (????) à Amsterdam en 1883 (il y a donc 3 siècles !!!),
et « hors concours » en 1900, je ne vous le fais pas dire !!!

Mon problème est justement que j’aurais voulu moi, la mettre hors concours, et n’avoir que 25 cl dans la bouteille, mais j’en trouve donc 40 en plus !!!! 
Que faire ? Où vais-je les mettre ? 
Je le propose à mon chat, qui me regarde en chien de faïence … offusqué que j’aie pu penser à lui !!! 
Je regarde mon chien, qui d’un air dédaigneux, s’en va grogner dans le coin, en pensant que je le prends pour le dindon de la farce …
Désespéré, je propose à mon épouse de faire un plat à la bière demain .. elle regarde la bouteille, et me réponds qu’elle n’a pas envie de gâcher tout son plat !!! 
Il me reste l’évier ... qui se met à gémir de tous ses boyaux … 
Non, je ne peux pas lui faire ça, puisqu’il me le signale si poliment.... 

Que faire ? J’attendrai demain, et s’il pleut en même temps, j’aurai l’impression de boire à la source … Oh désespoir, de l’eau dans une bouteille verte, une horreur !!
Et ratebeer, qui n’en manque pas une, parle dans le commentaire de 
« pure water » qui donne à « this brew » une « unsurpassed clarity » … 
là je me roule par terre !!! C’est à se tordre l’estomac (au sens propre..).

CONCLUSION : zéro pur, comme l’eau pure, 
mais le puritanisme (sans jeu de mots) américain de ratebeer 
empêche de mettre un zéro à une bière, alors que des profs 
en auraient collé jadis à des élèves pour beaucoup moins que cela !!!

Bref, même sur ratebeer, on ne peut pas mettre ce liquide à l’évier … 

Donc, je souligne qu’il s’agit non pas d’un 0,5, car c’est 65 fois trop !!!, 
mais d’un 0,00000000000000. 

Et puis maintenant, je sais enfin pourquoi la petite fille 
a le visage vert dans l’Exorciste … 
Il m’a fallu 40 ans pour cela, mais je sais maintenant ce qu’elle avait bu …
Une horreur …

Heineken has proved that they do not care about people and traditions; they just want a high profit. They want to destroy a small beer manufacturer in an area of Romania where a large Hungarian minority lives because a very small brewery is able to beat them with a beer that supports traditions and local heritage. Heineken has started a lawsuit in order to stop the production of Igazi Csíki Sör (the new local beer). They claim that the name of their beer called CIUC PREMIUM has been stolen and used unduly by IGAZI CSÍKI SÖR. Can you see the similarity? Oh, of course not. Even if they claim that CSÍKI is the translated version of CIUC, which is completely wrong. Local people have a sense of justice, pride and persistence, so they have started a boycott against Heineken. The point of this action is to avoid everything that is a Heineken product. Many people have felt that they have to join this action, even from Hungary. I believe Heineken has been experiencing a large decrease in sales, especially in this Hungarian area (Szeklerland), as a result of their lawsuit. As a result, they have been putting even more pressure on the manufacturer and are pushing the court to make a decision favourable to them. I encourage everyone who feels that this is an injustice NOT TO BUY, DRINK OR PROMOTE HEINEKEN PRODUCTS! Long live integrity, fairness and justice!

One of the most famous beer in the world. Classic lager beer. Bitter respect to other lager beer

Can, 33cl. What to say thats not already been said a million times? Pours clear yellow, pale character. Malty, hay and straw aroma aroma, a little skunky. Light, weak sweet flavour with hidden bitterness. Yet another worldwide mass produced lager, nothing wrong, but just nothing to say.
Piany prawie nie ma. Piwo w zapachu wodniste. W smaku wyczuwalna lekka goryczka.

Clear golden color with a white head. Light grain, skunky and herbal aroma. Medium body and a fine carbonation. Grainy, malty and herbal flavor. Ugh.
[Bottle my son dragged into The House]

There is nothing to hate, but there is also nothing to love about this beer. It is a typical example of unified mass produced "world" pale lager. I actually like it, not for its taste, but for warm summer evenings. It is very good as a "beer soda", to refresh and to quench thirst. There are no errors or unpleasant things, however, when you start looking for some deepness and taste, you just won’t find it. It is just thin malt body with a hint of hidden bitterness. Nothing more, nothing less.

Bottle. Clear gold/yellow with a decent white head. Aroma of grains, hay and grass. Taste follows aroma plus a hint of lemons. Medium to strong carbonation. Refreshing when served ice-cold at the beach. Bland and inoffensive but really  not as bad as expected.

Quite weak beer that is overrated. I can not understand how this beer can be the most sold lager worldwide? They must have succeded with their marketing. However this beer is very light and do not have the thing that i wants in a beer like a malty flavor. But ive had worse beers.

Bottle @home tasting General Election 2015 (rating backlog) Pours golden quite a big white head. Nose is caramel, slight floral and mineral. Taste is ok, caramel and with a reasonably bitter after taste.
(2) Not worth trying. There is nothing too exciting about this beer. Although the brewery tour was fine - (do not take the one in Amsterdam - do the one outside the city)

Can, 33 cl. Clear pale yellow body with a frothy white head. Light aroma with a bit of malt sweetness and some citrus notes. Weak and rather dry taste with a light malt base. Light bitterness with some hoppy notes and a bit of acidity. Watery body with average carbonation. The finish is very dry. This beer is nothing but generic, and lacks any distinctive character. I am sure that is exactly what the brewery wants, as this provides them with the largest possible target customer group. I would probably prefer a glass of water over this.

On tap. L’intensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma è a sbrigativa dispersione, lasciando poi una velatura. La frizzantezza del liquido è a bollicine fini e dalla carbonazione vivace. Il colore è giallo dorato. L’amaro è moderato. Il corpo è rotondo. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è pulito, dissetante, semplice. Bene l’equilibrio tra il malto dolce e il luppolo amaro.

Tja... vergeleken met Belgisch speciaalbier is dit natuurlijk niets. Ik kan geen onderling verschil ontdekken in het enorme aanbod aan Nederlandse pilseners. Is voor mij allemaal bier dat tijdens een voetbalwedstrijd of met carnaval goed te drinken is, maar thuis zou ik er zo een nooit opentrekken.

Ideal para o brasileiro, acostumado a brejas "fraquinhas", começar a sentir as delícias do lúpulo.

Rated to correct a deficiency identified by BlackHaddock, thank you sir! I once worked at a small charity hospital in Saint Lucia, near the southern tip of the island. There was a Heineken brewery on the island, but no one had been able to score a tour. Then one day a guy came into my clinic with a deep gash in his knee. As I was stitching him up, I asked him how it happened, and he said he tripped and fell in the brewery. Do you work in the brewery? I asked. He said, "Oh mon, I dee brewmaster!" Needless to say, we got a tour for the whole hospital staff. At the end of the tour he left us in his office, equipped with a giant walk-in cooler, and said, help yourself, I’m going home for the day. So that was my most memorable taste of Heineken, which seemed less bitter and astringent than other versions. He explained that he tinkered with the hops recipe, and was constantly getting into trouble with headquarters because of it. We also sampled quite a few brews from around the Caribbean, since much on the various islands is contract brewed. They all went down good that day.
Its bitter taste is little less but its aroma and sourness is good but not strong as a pilsener beer

Appearance: Pale/golden, of course with a small quickly disappearing head.

Aroma: Corn, cereal, a bit of sugar, a bit of wheat, your general lager, but much less watery, no alcohol or barely

Palate: Think, very drinkable but semi-bland, doesn’t taste like much.

Overall: Less offensive than other similar Macro-brews as it doesn’t have that weird metallic tinge, but then again, you’ll pay a whole lot more for this stuff, since it’s "imported." I’d prefer to get something more session-able. More flavor for the same price. Thanks but no thanks.

I’m only going to say that I wish in the USA you could find and get Amstel bier (not Amstel Light). I had it in Aruba many years ago and it is better than Heineken: more thirst quenching, satisfying, and less astringent aftertastes. Heineken is much in the same class as a Bud/Miller/Coors/Molson product even if it is a non-adjunct beer (supposedly). It’s not bad and certainly not the best. It depends on what you want for a beer.

330ml can poured into a lager glass. Appearance is clear pale golden with a large frothy off-white head that reduced quickly, leaving a lacing on the glass. Aroma of canned corn and cereal. Flavours of wheat bread, canned corn and a hint of alcohol and processed sugar. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Palate is light bodied, thin texture and average carbonation. Heineken is a standard plain lager, there are better and cheaper lagers available.

Hey, judge me as you want, but I liked it. Yes, it is not the best beer in the whole wide world, but it does its job as it should. Refreshing in the summer, quite bitter aftertaste, it just needs to be really well chilled.
Sub par taste and an unpleasant metallic aftertaste make this famous brand an experience best had online, and not actually tasting it. The Dutch Coors.

So famous, but so average. Not much to say about it. Eu lager. light and drinkable. I think they produced this type of beer because of people who could drink more than 5 litres in one evening. I am not one of them. Anyway, very nice crisp white top, I must say one of the best among lager beers.
Boa. Niver similar as populares d Brasil. Sabor um pouco mais amargos que demais aguas de batata

Cerveza muy aburrida y demasiado cara aqui en España para lo que es. Deberian venderla a precio de cruzcampo.2nd take: 6th Nov 2015. Watching Worst Week 1x12. In Ikea?s pilsner glass. Spectre special edition. A bit better than the typical industrial lager but not much more14 Apr 2016: Reading CSHTP6 Ch7 & Playing South Park Stick of Truth. In shaker glass. Champions League edition. Soft, more smooth and sweet than the typical macro lager
Probably the best beer in the world! :D HAha, but really, this one works for everything. Great in summertimes!
Bue à la pression lors de la mi temps d’un match de foot. Autant dire que le contexte à fait la biere... Comme parfois sur ce genre de bières...

Drank multiple times (draft, cans and bottles), but never thought about a rating actually. And to be honest, I wish that would be like that forever, since Heinekens are far from tasty and appealing at all. The aroma is clear stale bread and overly grainy. Tastes truly disgusting if served above 4 degrees centigrade. Complete taste bud-killing bitterness and sweetness which will let you lose all your taste for the coming four days. Watery texture, color like piss and extremely carbonated. Overrated to the max. Credits for their marketing divisions, since they still trick a lot of people all over the world. +2 Overall for that.

Well, I drank this beer out of a bottle many times and I didn’t experience much skunkiness, even though the bottles have been sitting in the basement for months and the date expired by a few months. This is a good beer, when compared to most of the AAL out there. It’s a little too carbonated, though, also, it’s overpriced here in the US.
This is a good Holland beer that you can take down 10 to a time. Light looking and good to the taste.
From a bottle. A very ordinary beer in my opinion. A distinct, strong but not overly nice flavour.
Sem a menor sombra de dúvidas, a Heineken é a melhor cerveja popular! Dispensa qualquer comentário.

Pours a light golden/yellow colour with a good size bubbly head. Good lacing and carbonation. Aroma very light on the hops and not much else really. Taste is also light hops,along with corn and wheats, with some bitterness in the finish. Average beer but worth buying by the 24 (in quebec of course) for parties and fridge stock.
Tan simple como una cervezas para refrescar y quitar la sed.... Nada mas que eso.
