Taste like a skunk that drowned in a mass pool of water that someone urinated in within the last week.
Not much to say about it. Watery but good marketing makes it available everywhere. I wish other beers could be as much available...
The one and only Dutch classic. How can anyone not like this amazing lager?

The obvious choice for the poser at the disco or bar."Look at me I’m drinking foreign beer." Can impress anyone who doesn’t have an idea about beer. Medium carbo ,watery finish and unmistakable metal flavor and above all OVERPRICED.

Golden colour with white head. without aroma, you can notice a little presence of hops. flavours are also empty, exaggerated carbonation, low bitterness, watery finish. Unbealivable for a such high price.
Not a good beer. Only drinkable if served really cold. Poor aroma and plain watery taste.

My kind of beer, bitter. Very well balanced. A bier to be tasted every day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I really can’t say anything bad about this beer. Been drinking it forever (since the start of my drinking days), and I never get tired of it. Been going a while without buying it, as I prefer the microbrews instead, but given a choice between Heiny or Bud, I am trained to not even think about it. Heiny or Corona, I’ll still probably pick the Heiny every time unless I am vacationing on a tropical island or in Mexico, and even then I’ll pick Heiny at least 3 out of 4 times. Basically a smooth lager. On the sweet end, sort of like a mix between lager and pilsner. A little skunky but not too bad, I prefer to drink it super-cold then it’s hardly noticable. Pours a pale yellow-golden color. Medium-light carbonation, but not too much head.
Golden clear pour with minimal white head. Mostly malt aroma. Medium carbonation. Not overly bitter with a short bitter aftertaste.
Can. Clear golden, white head. Some floral notes in aroma. Dry grainyness too. Similar taste, but with some metallic vibes.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Plastic Pint Cup. Supplier: Aviva Stadium (Dublin). Highly carbonated and watery with quickly dissipating sweetness.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Color: La Heineken es una cerveza de color amarillo pálido. 
- Sabor: Cremoso, notas de cebada y malta. Cuerpo ligero con toque amargo fresco.

Dry crisp toasted hop taste, slightly bitter but not over powering. Sweet "corny" taste and subtle barley. Very well rounded beer seemingly ’flat and to the point’ there is a distinct difference from Heineken brewed in Holland than Australia.

From 12oz bottle, poured into tulip glass, leftover bottle from BJCP study group



Aroma: Spicy saaz hops, slight corny-sweetness



Appearance: pale yellow, crystal clear, nice big white head with low retention



Taste: light sweet, light bitter



Palate: light body, creamy texture, average carbonation, bitter finish



Overall: Not a bad beer. I’m a fan of Saaz, so I thought I recognized the aroma right away. Not a lot of hops, but the spicy saaz is a nice touch. A tad corny and sweet taste, which I’m not a fan of. Had this numerous times over the last twenty years, but not in the last 5-6 years. Years ago, the spicy hop and bitterness wasn’t something I enjoyed, now I actually like the subtle hop profile. I just wish it didn’t have that corn/cream ale taste.

Draught pint at Empire at Singapore Land Tower on 19/03/15. Pale straw yellow in colour, clear and with a medium level of carbonation. Aroma of malt and grain. Smooth and medium body. Sweet and light bitterness. Nice cold refreshing lager - perfect to deal with the tropical climate in Singapore.

Pours a slight straw yellow. Has a pretty nice light creamy head....Aroma is grassy and biscuity, and some toasted malt....Taste is much of the same. The maltiness has a stronger taste than you would expect. I also taste some honey and corn, as the beer is a little sweetness...Mouthfeel is a little alcohol astringency, but it’s very clean. Finishes very clean, and it’s smooth. Dry, medium body. Lip smacking refreshing...Overall, it’s a good beer. I think of this as more what beer probably should taste like.

13.11.2013. Peruslagerille varsin mukava tuoksu, hieman banaania ja raikasta kevyttä hedelmää, myös hieman makeutta. Maku on varsin pehmeä, kukkainen? Melko mieto ja kevyt, peruslagerien paremmasta päästä.
Lubię wygląd butelki. A tak poza tym to nie mam nic do powiedzenia, poza tym: nie piję tego więcej.

On veut vendre cette bière, à coup de millions, investit dans la publicité. Tout cela pour vendre un truc qui est à mon goût horrible et qui veut manger le marché, à grands coups de dents. Il n’y a aucune innovation dans la qualité, c’est déplorable. Sa robe est typique de la lager, jaune, or. La mousse n’est pas très persistante. Le goût est classique avec du malt, sûrement du maïs et le houblon n’est présent que en petite quantité. Le goût en bouche part vite. I
drank this wonderful beer again during my transit in
Amsterdam, going to Lima, on the 24th of december. I drank it in can, pilsener version. I don't know, if I am totally wrong but this version of can is a bit better than the bottle that you find in Switzerland. The taste is more dry and malty and a bit more bitter, even though it is standard beer without any surprise and in Schipool, this beer is present everywhere.

Piana: biała, średnio i drobno pęcherzykowa, dość wysoka, szybko zanikająca.
Kolor: złoty, klarowne.
Aromat: słód, lekki chmiel, trawa.
Smak: słodowy, goryczki brak, wodniste.
Unter den ausländischen Fernsehbieren eines meiner liebsten. Angenehm herbe Frische und als Alternative zu oft miesen lokalen Bieren in Asien durchaus empfehlenswert.

Golden, a wee bit of white head. Aroma of malt and grains. Same goes for taste with some biscuits added. A very low amount of grassy hops and bitterness can be detected. Light bodied and thin. Boring macro lager.
That was not a good idea to go to supermarket and buy such a stuff. I think it develops worse and worse ...
Drucken på flaska. Gul färgad, med vitaktig skumkrona. Helt ok lager, dricker gärna flera stycken. Passar till det mesta, men kanske bäst till grillat.

Typowy, masowy lager. Wyglada dobrze, odczucie w ustach jak na styl ok. Aromat słodki, nieprzyjemnie slodowy. W smaku słodki, goryczki brak.

Flaska på satin örebro. Klar gulaktig vätska. Brödig doft med lite honungstoner. Smak av knäckebröd, blött gräs och lite äpplesötma. Viss beska.

Fľaša 40 cl v akcii z Tesca. Kyslastá vôňa, svetlá farba, pekná pena. V chuti cítiť slad a jemne alkohol, pivo má dosť CO2. Chuťovo zaujímavé europivo.

Copenhagen 22/8 2014. 33 cl can. Pours light yellow with small white head which subsides instantly. Anonymous slightly malty and salty aroma. Prickly mouthfeel. Taste like it smells - not much. Bitter aftertaste. Not much else. Rather boring.

Heineken pours pale yellow with no real head to speak of. The nose is weak and consists mainly of earthy and slightly grassy hop notes. The taste is watery, but grain notes followed by grass notes is perceivable in the almost hollow mid-palate. The texture is watery as well and the carbonation is moderate. There’s nothing much to say about this beer, really.
Another one of my first foreign beer experiences. Typical mass-produced/marketed pale lager. Not much taste, hops or malt. Astringent on the palate. Undrinkable at this point.
It´s like drink water. Easy to drink, but it doesn´t have any taste at all.

Draft in Amsterdam. I’ve had this plenty before but before I started rating. Pours straw coloured witg a thick, foamy head. Aroma of sweet hay and a hint of acetone. A smooth lager, not much fizz which is good. Some pears initially and then a stale acohol kind of bitterness. I’m not a lager man but this is quite pleasant
Czasem kupuję w małej puszce 330ml bo można nim popić posiłek, zielona butelka to zło.
Beer without any interest, just made for people who wants to drink something fresh or for parties

Very pale gold, clear. 
Subdued but pleasant yeasty nose, undoubtly skunked. 
Very light body and flavor but mouthfeel not watery. Good balance and length. 
More sweetness than bitterness, less acidity but not without it. 
Predominantly yeasty but also malty. 
Good quenching drink, I don't mind the skunkiness in a beer or coffee but the animal is a different thing.

Yellow. With foam with cleanser aspect. Discretely fruity aroma. Taste rather sweet. Mild body, not very persistent. In despite of being in the roughly every macro beers, this in particular is clean and reasonably equilibrated.
Signature aroma and bitter taste. Beer full of personality in its balance of taste and freshness.
One of the better big brewery offerings. It has a light bitterness, light body and a subtle background biscuit sweetness.
Essa nunca falha, para a correria do dia a dia, fácil de encontrar e de suave apreciação. Um leve amargor para completar.

2/3 - Work Event. Drank a lot while I was younger. Decent beer. Overall 3.0.

I think this is a very proper beer. Coming from the Netherlands I know a lot of other Dutchs people don’t like Heineken that much, calling it ’ditch water’. To me Heineken is one of those beers that really tastes like beer, not extra softened and sweetened but the real deal. Heineken is one of those rare beers that stayed true to its authenitic recipe. As a true beer lover I like this beer. Because I like the taste of beer.
Aromat słodowy, kukurydziany. Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana drobna, krótka. W smaku słodowe, gładkie, pijalne, bez wad. Spore nagazowanie. Niska goryczka.

Pours golden and clear, with minimal white head. In aroma mostly malts. In taste light sweet. Thin, light body, average carbonation, low bitter.
33 cl systembolaget. Water... Water.. Drack denna i sälen till maten. Aldrig mer tack.
Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is very sweet, caramel, and grain. The taste is very similar with a little bit of hop bitterness as well.

Pours a yellow/gold with very little head. Aromas of toasted malts, corn syrup and a little honey. Light flavors of cooked apples, honey, sweet malts and paper. Much more enjoyable than the bottled product - a little fuller and sweeter, and without the typical skunky nose.

Pours with moderate head, that diminishes quickly. Smellbof spoiled eggs, clear yellow colour. Very moderate carbonation, that endulges any taste, that may be or may not be hidden somewhere... A cheap lager, what can I say...

industrielle très limitée, légère et simpliste, m’écœure même un peu avec une arrière bouche désagréable sur la longueur. Se trouve partout, même dans toutes sortes de concerts/représentations/festivals, malheureusement.

On tap. Pours a yellow/gold with very little head. Aromas of toasted malts, corn syrup and a little honey. Light flavors of cooked apples, honey, sweet malts and paper. Much more enjoyable than the bottled product - a little fuller and sweeter, and without the typical skunky nose.
Boa cerveja. Encorpada e boa graduação alcoólica. Uma das preferidas . 👍👍👍👍👍
Its poor at aroma, appearance and taste. It seems to be good to drink with the heat of the summer if its very cold.
Bier ist klar und golden. Durchschnittliche, weiße Schaumkorne. Zuerst fad, dann sehr herb im Nachgeschmack.

250ml bottle from a ferry between Tallinn and Helsinki, clear light yellow colour, small mostly vanishing fizzy white head, some lacing. Moderately malty aroma of grain and hay with light grassy hops. Taste is initially mildly bittersweet and acidic, turning into a lightly bitter finish that has an odd sweet twist for half a second. Light to medium body, slick mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Not the most unpleasant of the bulk lagers but utterly uninteresting none the less.
33 cl bottle at home. Drank on January 5th 2015 as Heineken (5,0%). One of the lesser lagers.

Arômes de malt pâle. Robe blonde. Très légères saveurs de houblon européen.
Mousse peu. Pas très longue en bouche.
Une bière industrielle buvable mais sans plus.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of oranges, sweet bread and yeast. Tastes of fruit, year and dry hops. Semi-sweet/bitter aftertaste.

Guess I never got around to reviewing this gem. Had it out of the mini keg I bought at a grocery store. Skunky and weird, just what I expect out of Heineken. It is what it is. It’s a mass produced lager. But it’s not by any means the worst one you’ll drink. It’s probably one of the easiest beers to drink all night. Just don’t let it get warm no matter what you do.
How : can Appearance : clear light golden with a large white head. Aroma : not much, some hints of grass and boiled vegetables. Also some metalic scent. Palate : thin body, high carbonation.
Rien de bien particulier. Une mauvaise lager . Probablement passable en été quand on est assoiffés mais rien de plus .
In Billy’s honor in PSL at his favorite local pizza place. Skunky. A touch of fruit. Some floral. Better than Miller Lite. Still missing you ...
33 cl can @ home. Pours pale yellow with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are grains, flowers, and malt - with an ever so slightly bitter finish.
Somehow I have apparently never rated Heineken. Looked this up on a whim after drinking a few recently. We all know Heineken. It’s not awful if it’s not skunked, but it’s nothing great.

Piwo koloru złotego, piana o średnich bombelkach, trochę zostaje na kuflu podczas picia. Piana cały czas pokrywa piwo podczas picia. Zapach słabo wyczuwalny. W ustach nic specjalnego. Nie ma odrzucenia jak przy tanich piwach ale niczym specjalnym się nie wyróżnia. Finisz krótki i mdły. 

Moim zdaniem nie warto kupować tego piwa dla smaku, do meczu, na jakieś większe imprezy to owszem, niemniej relacja cena do smaku pozostawia wiele do życzenia.

330ml can (not the skunky green bottle) served in a tulip. Aroma is light citric and bread, with some herbal and earthy notes. Taste is light pale malt with some good hoppy bitterness. Light bitter aftertaste. Cheap and refreshing, is a good beer to drink in any ocasion and it?s a great beer in its Pale Lager style!
Has almost no taste. Light body. Nice weed and gressy smell. Overall it just has no taste.
0,5l Light golden yellow lager color. Thin white head. Aroma is waterly, grassy, weed. Light body. Taste is grassy. Notes from malty sweetness and soap. Medium carbonisation.

Bottle at a friends; rectifying RB most rated beers that I haven’t had, an easy scoop, clear straw yellow pour with a bright white bubbly white head, corn aroma, taste has corn, grass and skunk, pretty terrible.

330ml can into glass. Brewed in Spain(?). Sweet metallic nose. Pale yellow, small foamy head. Taste is average macro lager but the aftertaste is bad. All metal and vegetable. The kind of beer you drink at the football because that’s all there is.
Never liked it but when it’s free I’ll drink it to be respectful. Super dry, no malt or hop profile. Skunky, nothing good really.
Draught. Little to no aroma. Looks great though. Taste of watery beer, slightly better than budweiser.

Smells of hay, bread, leaves - in short of cheap hops. Very little bitterness, short bitter aftertaste. Medium body. It’s a beer you can buy about anywhere, it’s not expensive, it’s been around for ages. A true classic, even if it doesn’t taste so good.
330ml bottle from the only cafe. Transparent straw body with very thin white head. Bready cereal aromas, nice carbonation for the style. Very sessionable and light bodied.

Slight green apple like nose, otherwise not too much. Looks like a standard pale lager in the glass. I will give Heineken credit for not using adjuncts in the beer. Taste isn’t as offensive in the aftertaste as a Stella Artois. Fun to try this beer after many years but unless it’s a hot sunny day and this is your best option there are many better beers. Not terrible almost all beers are decent but meh compared to others.

La Heineken, tu la bois pas pour ses qualités gustatives. Parce que ce n’est pas une grande bière. Elle est bien pâle, ça sent, parfois la mouffette, parfois le maïs, parfois le malt et parfois les herbes. Un goût semblable à bien d’autre bière du genre. Disons que ça fait plus distingué que de boire une M***** ou bien une B** (1348-141214)
Pils, niet bijzonder, wel fris wanneer koud geschonken in de zomer, drinkt lekker weg tijdens een avondje uit met je maten.
another run of the mill larger that i didn’t like alot of people do like it but don’t know why
Bottle 500 ml. Skunky aroma, slight malts. Clear golden colour, medium-weak head. No bitterness, extremely carbonated. Considering the relatively high price, it is not even worth thinking about.
Drank many since being introduced to Heineken during high school by SN exchange student from the Netherlands 40 years ago. Good when compared to basic BMC’s, it is just another so-so pale lager.
Clear yellow collor beer wih a small white head, medium carbonation. Taste is watery, a small bitter and a little sweet. Not a nice beer
A standard Euro lager. Very clean, more bitterness than American lagers with a hint of citrus, and a very dry finish.
Pours like a pale lager. Little aroma to speak of. Tastes of butter, banana and nail polish remover: much better than expected thoug, in the scheme of things, nothing special.
Superb design work, the bottle is appealing, the e is jus tilted enough but the taste is really not there. Also I prefer if I have to too to drink it from the bottle.
500ml can the ultimate euro lager is a mild blend of malt & hops bit bland but always goes down well

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 1C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L4192724T14. AROMA: medium-low grainy aroma with some sweetness. faint herbal hop aromas. APPEARANCE: gold color with a thin white moussy head with below average retention. TASTE: watery grainy flavour with residual sweetness. low bitterness with an almost dry finish. PALATE: light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: yet another bulk pale lager a bit watery...
Bottle 0,4l. Brewed by Soprony brewery, Hungaria. Low intensity aroma, insipid malty flavor, watery, some unpleasant salty and plastic tones. On the other hand, it could be worse.

Bottle 0,4l, brewed in Hungary. Clear gold body, small white head. Aroma of malt, hop, yeast. Light sweet taste, nothing distinct in it. Note of bitterness and some strange behind dominate "taste of sweet nothing". Without aftertaste. Light and watery body, medium carbonation. 
Well, it’s not good, but I awaited something terrible, so... nice surprise? Drinkable, refreshing, without bad chemical bitterness.

The only beer that you can find at Fiumicino airport of Rome. So trying to get brave for the upcoming flight is not a pleasant experience :P Clear pale yellow color with white head. Malty grainy aroma. Light sweet and light bitter, metallic taste. Light tin body with average carbonation.
Piana 3/6 Barwa 2/3 Aromat 4/12 Smak 9/17 Odczucie w ustach 2/6 Goryczka 4/6 Razem: 24/50
L’impero colpisce ancora, il lato oscuro della birra avanza inesorabile col suo piattume e la sua obbrobbriosa acquosità. Riusciranno i nostri eroi a fermarlo?
Cerveza muy comercial, sin gusto (aquoso) sin presencia de lúpulo... demasiasdo light.
Bottle. Pale yellow pour, few bubbles. Faint aroma that’s off-putting if anything. watery body with a weak grain taste and a metallic finish. Macro through and through.
Bière industrielle qu’on est parfois content de trouver, mais par ce qu’il n’y a rien d’autre en pression ou en canette. Toujours mieux qu’un soda.
Poured straw with a small white head. Aroma of sweet grains, muted by being served around freezing point. Light body, not too carbonated, very little flavour of any description, gassy.
Se parliamo di quella importata in Italia, parliamo di una birra amarissima e troppo gasata per lo stile. In olanda un po’ meglio, in greci anche

Bottle. If there ever was needed a template for industrially produced lager with a slight metallic taste, this comes high up on the list. Hardly any aroma, hard and bitter hints of malts, no yest, no significant hops. Drinkable but that is it.
As far as pale lager goes Heineken isn’t too bad. Better from a can than a bottle due to the skunkiness. The taste is medium sweet and medium bitter, rather smooth too.

Bland grain flavor. Not horrid but good mouthfeel. In general bland. Good head as expected.

what a boring beer !! i don’t understand how this beer got this popularised internationally !
Bottle, pour light yellow clear uuhhh. Light filmy head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of lightly dissipated lemon water and grass. Sweet palate. Ughhh

0.33L bottle. Pours clear pale with a rocky white head. Aromas are herby and resiny hops, some iron. Flavor is mild sweet, with some decent cereal grain flavors, but most herby and resiny hops. Finishes with a mild, herby hop bitterness, along with some metalic flavors. Light body with a thin mouthfeel and active carbonation. Overall, despite it’s macro-brew status, actually pretty tasty for a continental lager. Nice clean hop character, and decent malt to make a fairly well-balanced beer.
0.5 boks. Gyllen og veldig klar med litt hvitt skum. Aroma av litt malt. Smak av litt malt. Verken smaker eller lukter noe særlig. Helt grei tystedrikk hvis en ikke har annet øl.

Strong distinct aroma of floral hops. Pours a clear yellow with a frothy white head that fades. Crisp dry flavour of hops. Quite high carbonation and a little thin. This is clearly not everyone’s favourite but as a day to day lager it’s definately one of the better ones.

Tasted on 10/17/14 from a 16oz can purchased at the gas station. Pours clear pale golden with an average white head that slowly recedes to average, uneven lace. The nose is very light and hard to get much, but there is some dusty, corny hay malt, and just a bit of an herbal undertone. The flavor is a bit more cony sweet with the same dusty herbal note underlying, and a bit of "skunk". The body is light with average carbonation, and a short, sweet corny finish.
skunk anyone? better from a can, but still not drinkable. and for $7 a six-pack. REally? why would you pay a premium for ths swill with what’s out there? stop it. just STOP."
Pours clear golden, aroma is sweet, slight dms. Taste is neutral, sweet. Not much of anything.
Insípida, falta de sabor. No la considero ni cerveza, prefiero pedir un agua que esto sinceramente. De las peores que he probado.

0.5l can served in an ordinary glass.
A: Pours a pale golden yellow color forming a big fluffy aired white head. Medium retention and some lacings left
S: Very characteristic Heineken smell of sweet malts and grassy/skunky hops
T: As the nose, the characteristic taste of sweet malts, skunky hops and Lager yeasts. End is reasonably bitter
M: Very light body and high carbonated level. A refreshing session beer. Aftertaste is citrus hoppy bitterness
O: good drinkability. Heineken has somehow, personality. Its smell and taste are a trademark
[ BA Review @ 2/26/2010 ]
Heineken is probably the best known beer of the world, I don?t know why... The taste is watery with a small bitter.
Contrabande provided by MiP. Clear yellow, fluffy white head. Grainy aroma, light hops. Flavour has sweetish cereal, light bitterness. Soft carb and mouthfeel.

It has a stronger aroma that I can not place or put directly into words. Heineken tastes lightly bitter to the tongue with a crisp finish. It is definitely more on the fizzy side of carbonation but its overall texture is quite simplistic and thin.
250ml can at FL330 on KLM. It’s not a bad beer but nothing really exciting about it.  It’s a plain Ducth Lager.

Holland’s national standard lager, tasted from tap, bottle and 50 cl can. Sticky, snow white, dense and medium thick head, stable for the whole duration of the tasting; colour pale blonde, cristal clear with calm sparkling. Aroma of sweetish pale malts, grainy, weak impressions of young cheese, floral hops, soap, some wet dog but not disturbing. Sweetish grainy onset, medium carbonation, minerals, thin body, spicy and grassy, medium long hop bitterness in the finish, in which some bready maltiness also lingers and a kind of chemical acerbity appears in the background, which disturbs me after a while. Has a very bad reputation in Belgium, where it is usually stereotypically described as one of the worst beers one could possibly encounter, but this is nothing but chauvinism: objectively tasted, this is a perfectly acceptable standard lager. I’d even prefer this over Jupiler - but I’d hesitate to state this in Belgian company. But it remains a mass-marketed, soulless, very industrial ’pilsje’, of course.

La Heineken a la réputation (méritée!) de goûter la mouffette. Cela serait dû à la dégradation du houblon causé par une surexposition de la bière à la lumière. Le transport et l’entreposage en bouteille verte n’aidant certainement pas sur ce dernier point, j’ai décidé d’essayer la Heineken en cannette pour voir… ///// Bière jaune pâle tirant un peu sur le vert, incroyablement limpide, belle effervescence bonne et uniforme, et surmontée d’un col blanc immaculé, pas tellement large, mais bien dense, mousseux et persistant. Arômes de pain frais, pâtisserie, bonbon, avec un peu de grain et de foin, léger houblon herbacé et salé en arrière-plan. Certains effluves de petits fruits rouge bien sucrés (ou de réglisse rouge) sont également perceptibles, et non, aucune mouffette à l’horizon (vive la cannette de métal, à bas la bouteille verte!). Nez bien agréable, complexité intéressante, intensité un peu faible cependant. En bouche, pétillement moyen-faible sur la langue, belle onctuosité au palais, c’est rond, moelleux et velouté. Au goût, tout de même assez sucré, pain frais, pâtisserie, bonbon aux petits fruits rouge, réglisse rouge, avec un peu de grain, et un houblon subtil qui semble à la fois herbacé et floral, avec une toute petite note salée. Amertume à peine perceptible, complexité intéressante (surtout pour le style), et très bonne intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles. Ça reste tout de même peu intense comme bière, mais, franchement, une Heineken qui ne goûte pas la mouffette, c’est vraiment bon. Essayez-la en cannette!

We did a proper blind test in Tampere Finland 26.7. with numbered glasses and notes, no commentary allowed, the whole works, with 11 common supermarket beers available in Finland. Of the 5 testers 3 were women and 2 guys, medium age some 50 years. 

Heineken lost by a clear margin (22 points vs. second worst 25 points, winner 41 points). Very big surprise to everybody considering the brand. 4 people commented on the very weak taste. Good Lord it tastes like water! So if you think you like this beer I strongly recommend a blind test.

And the winner? You are all going to laugh at us but it was Lidl’s “Gourmet”. 4 testers rated it as the best and one as 2nd best.

Tja, von Deutschen zu erwarten Heineken neutral zu berwerten ist schwierig. Heineken ist das Bier welches ich wohl in den meisten Ländern der Welt getrunken habe. Dies ist immer beständig gleich egal wo es man trinkt. Man kann dieses Bier wohl erst schätzten wenn man es im Kontrast zu Anderen getrunken hat. Lager ist ein unterbewerte Biertypus und hier ist Heineken ein beständiges gutes Bier. Vergessen wir alle Bewertungskriterien ausser Süffigkeit und etwas Bitterkeit und Geschmack. Das hat Heineken und ist gut: im Flugzeug, in Amsterdam als Abschlussbier, in den Bahamas oder Teneriffa am Strand, im Japan vollkommen überteuert im Nachtklub, in London in der Lounge, in Dubai in der Minibar,...

Transfer from BA review on 3-15-12 - 
Poured into a pint glass from bottle

Appearance – A lighter golden to straw color with a big white head formed upon pouring. The head faded fast giving wasy to only a little bit of lacing.

Smell –Some rice and a good hit of skunkiness mixed with some very light, but hard to identify sweeter aromas.

Taste – In the beginning there is actually a nice smooth malt flavor. It is slightly dry and then sweetens more in the middle. Up to this point it is actually quite pleasant, but then it all sorta goes down hill. There is sorta a more papery taste that then works its way into the flaovor and at the very end, the beer leaves a rather bitter and skunky taste (sorta like what you would expect the smell to taste like) in the mouth. Not a pleasant aftertaste.

Mouthfeel – A tad above average in body with a higher level of carbonation. Not bad, but not great either.

Overall - Not a beer I really enjoy all that much. Its prevalence makes it easy to get, but if the choice for something else is around, I would likely take something else.

I poured a 24oz can into a large mug. It was canned on 11/8/13 and cost $2.69 ($0.11 per ounce).



Appearance: Clear dark gold hue with calm effervescence visible. Pours to a rather small, white, foamy head which retains and laces poorly.



Smell: Pretty standard pale lager aroma, though cleaner than most due to lack of adjuncts.



Taste: I used to hate Heineken with a passion. The green bottles they’re usually served in are skunky and taste sour. However, I’ve started to come around on this brew, at least a little. I met the "International Brewmaster" last year and learned a lot about the brewing and pouring process. I also learned this beer is all-malt, unlike so many North American macro lagers. Additionally, this placed 2nd overall in a blind macro lager showdown I held with friends last year (and scored the highest of the pale lagers). I haven’t had it since, so drinking it with this newfound respect has definitely swayed me… a little.



Let’s be honest, Heineken is still as much a macro lager as the BMC brands. It does offer slight differences in character, but they are quite subtle. There does seem to be some genuine malt flavor here. A touch of caramel or honey is noticeable and creates for minor sweetness. There also seems to be some faint, dry, spicy hop character to this brew. While nowhere near that of a pale ale, it’s definitely stronger than most pale lagers. Unfortunately, even the can still seems to have a tang or astringent off-flavor on the finish. And the palate certainly isn’t all that complex, either. Regardless, it’s genuinely not bad-tasting from the can or tap; just avoid the green bottles since the lightstrike makes them drink like a completely different beer.



Drinkability: Weighing in at only 5% ABV, Heineken should be a borderline light beer. But the mouthfeel is actually not all that light - it’s a little heavier than most of the genre, but still has the crispness you want in a lager. It finishes clean, though it’s not especially refreshing. It does have the most flavor for its weight compared to other macro lagers.

Can labeled as ’Sensation’. Pale yellow with small white foamy head, light yeast aroma, high carbonation, grassy taste with a bit of a sting at the end, abrupt finish. Another highly commercialized generic beer.

It did have something of a bitter finish that was refreshing, but then left behind an unpleasant straw aftertaste. I usually am more open to European macros over American macros, but there isn’t much that makes drinking this beer worthwhile. But if you’re relying on brand name instead of taste - as the late Freddie Heineken once said "life is all about advertising" - what can you expect from such a beer?

Appearance: Currently having it straight out of the can, so I can’t speak for it. No doubt it just looks like a pale yellow with a mediocre head and no lacing, like I’ve seen in pictures... I do like the can itself though. It’s bumpy. Fancy. I do have to laugh at the label though. "Brewed with passion for quality." Ha! Good one.

Smell: Corn. Grain. Cheap. What else is new.

Taste: Not bad on the start with some of that corn sweetness, but then it’s just... bad. An odd sort of bitterness aftertaste... like an "if-i-were-to-suck-on-a-penny" bitterness. Lingers and lingers. It’s gonna be a bitch trying to finish this can, I think.

The aftertaste kills me. That WEIRD bitterness ruins this. It almost tastes like a chemical. Has to be my least favorite adjunct lager -- definitely one you want to pound and be done with, because it certainly doesn’t taste good... maybe after a buzz I wouldn’t notice the aftertaste, but sober? Yikes. No thanks. Better off having yourself a Budweiser -- it’d be cheaper, and be less offensive... this wouldn’t be awful if it didn’t taste metallic.

Blonde, clear and fizzy, slightly sweet when tastes and slightly bitter afterwards, that’s how I would describe my current can of Heineken. This beer brewed in so many places now that it seems to taste a little bit different depending where you get it.

Jaune et limpide avec un mince collet de mousse qui s’évanouit en quelques secondes. Nez de céréales fraîches avec une touche très subtile de mouffette. En bouche, on goûte un peu d’acidité et de sucre avec une faible amertume en finale. J’en ai bu trois de suite sans broncher. Une bière de soif dans la moyenne.
Not so bad hoppy aroma. Light golden colour with small head. Medium to high carbonation. Little bitterness in taste with too much sweetness.
one of the best beers in the worlds, definetally the best choice when outdoors :)

330 ml can; Pale golden yellow colour; Half-finger head and white foam which last for 1 minute; Small lacing and fizzy carbonation; Pungent and lasting smell of malt, with bread and corn; Very light sweet taste of malt, with light green apple, soda water, faint hint of cold tablet, extremely light citrus, and light grass; Light body, watery palate; Hoppiness is typically light weight but more evident than most macros , slightly bitter as a finish. Pretty dry after taste, very easy to mouth.



Comments: as much as I hate to say it, this is perhaps the most decent and consistent among macro pale lagers, with very few faults to pick on, quite well attenuated, sweetness is very low, and actually have hoppiness. One of my friends, a wine person first and foremost, always stressed that this is the best macros out there. Well, he may have a point.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Taste and aroma is malt, grass and a hint of grain.
It poured a clear yellow color with a white head. The aroma was skunky and bready. The taste was similar, skunky with a bitter (notes only) aftertaste.

Pint can into pint glass.

Aroma: malty. almost a sour smell? smells like mass-produced lager.

Appearance: Absolutely transparent and yellow.

Taste: Bread-y. the slightest hint of grassy hops, but it’s barely there. nothing outstanding, no complexity, no depth. on the other hand, not horrible.

Palate: Watery, very fizzy, almost soda-like. It’s there and it’s gone.

Overall: Decent lager. I don’t hate Heineken. If the selection of available beers is limited, I’ll pick Heineken over Bud Light or Corona, but somewhere where there’s more choices, I wouldn’t even consider it.

25cl from TAP.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, unstable white foam.
Nose: malts and some lemon
Taste: malts, bit fruity bitter aftertaste. Reminded me a lot of alcohol free beer for some reason.
Drank at S&G big pilsener tasting, blindly comparing 24 pilseners. Taste for most pilseners was the same, some grains, bit hoppy, quite malty and mostly bit metallic.

Draught. Pale yellow, fizzy white head. Traces of grain, corn, cat piss on the nose. Refreshing enough, but too fizzy. Thin palate disappears without a trace. Drinkable in a pinch with some food, but by itself as dull as dishwater.
Bottled & canned ; Devon ; UK ; Malty and grass aroma ; Golden color with average head ; Medium sweet taste and medium bitter finish ; Lively carbon ; Not bad.
Boring beer. Nothing interesting, little nose, little taste and watery. The only good point is that it is a very thirst-quenching "beer". Very, very, very poor beer.

A nice pilsener. Also noting special about it. 
A light bitterness and a very light sweetness tasted.
Lekkere, degelijke pils. Niet heel speciaal, maar gewoon lekker en drinkt goed weg.
Not the best, had on numerous occasions.  Forced to drink it at certain Heineken Cup matches, but would prefer a different lager if possible.
12oz bottle. Pours a light yellow color with small fizzy white head. Aromas of light malt, slightly skunky, with some corn. Flavor is the same.

330ml bottle, poured into Leffe Chalice. Golden colour, clear, medium head that didn’t hang around long. Aroma was fairly faint malt, detected more hop content towards the end. Tasted a slight hoppy bitterness that was balanced out by a malty sweetness, had hints of wheat and minimal yeast. Finish was slighty sour dough like. Texture was smooth but had an initial coarse edge from the carbonation although this faded. Slightly thick body. Overall this is better than quite a few Euro Pale Lagers out there. Not that interesting but well made and not offensive in any way.

Poor. I have been off booze for Lent. Received momentous good news this evening. Heino in the fridge, very poor after 30 day abstention from booze. Better than Carlsberg, Bud but still not nice. Much rather Budvar, Staropramen, Stella, Superbock.

Decent & slightly different from the rest in its class.  The taste is often skunky, but there is a classic German malt character that separates it from the standard 6-row & corn syrup beers.  Overall ok but there are better options in available pale lagers.

0.33 can. Small white head, vanishes straightaway, clear, golden color. Very faint aroma, mostly hops with a tiny bit of malty scents. Mostly tasteless, delicately hop and malty, simplistic, disappointing. Uneventful palate, light body, smooth texture, lively carbonation. Finish is short and relatively crude; lightly bitter, no particular taste, delicate yeasts. All in all this beer is as vastly dull as it is known, typical mass produced lager.

12 Fl. Oz. Can. Tried this one a bunch of times before but never tough about reviewing it but anyway. poured a clear yellow with a nice white head and lots of lacing. Aroma of yeast (bread) as is the standard for most Pale Lagers. Taste sweet with a bit of bitter finish. It is not right to compare it with a crafted beer as is a mass produced brew, that said it is drinkable and definitively better that most American equivalent beers.

Serving: from tap at Doyle’s Public House.

Aroma: couldn’t detect anything.

Appearance: small, frothy, white, initial head with good lacing and mostly diminishing longevity.  Clear, light-yellow body.

Taste: lightly soapy initial flavor and lightly bitter finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: okay.

As many of you had said that this is a commercial beer, but it tastes in past and now and it does not change. remained the same pleasantly mild flavor. Not to want something to feel special This beer after all, it’s not dark or strong a flavor i think as lager beer this one is one of best
New 65cl bottle. ABV: 4,6%. Clear golden with white soon-fading head. Almost no taste. Drinkable.

Good marketing, bad beer. Of course, this beer is part of a certain style beer that I don’t like. It’s a commercial beer, so appearance gets a lot of attention, yet, that doesn’t make a beer a good beer
0,33l can. Aroma is malt, taste is the same, overall there is nothing too good or very interesting about it.

Effervescence importante et durable ; plutôt pâle et agitée, col de mousse neigeux qui enroule le breuvage. Mince, dorée, et quelques reflets argentés. Houblons et maïs à l’odeur. Fort côté "Perrier" avec une mince amertume. Très désaltérante, assez pétillante, le goût fuit rapidement. Pas originale du tout, la Heineken est une bonne bière de soif, qui supporte tout simplement mal d’être examinée de près. Ordinaire, mais plaisante en certaines occasions ; malheureusement, sa plus belle qualité est son généreux col de mousse.
Long neck bottle from Mane Liquor. Standard mass produced pale lager. Nothing interesting to note on nose or taste. If I was at a party and had to choose between this and Budweiser, I’d go for this.

One of those highly commercialized euro macro lagers, which is why it’s obviously popular. Pours light yellow. Nothing spectacular on the aroma, bland. Tastes...skunked perhaps, probably because of the green glass on the bottles.  Besides a harsh taste overall, the brew redeems itself by some sweet malt, which makes it easier to drink. Overall, this isn’t a beer I’m ever going to buy, but if it’s free at a gathering, I would have no problem drinking this beer, but it’s definitely a low end beer, especially by European standards, but compared to most American macro lagers, such as Bud, Miller, or Coors it’s much better.
A nice clean, sweet smell from the start. A clear amber in colours. Very sweet to taste with slight citrus notes. A clean crisp finish. A decent beer if on tap.
650ml bottle. Pale golden colour, slightly sweet aroma, not overly carbonated. One of my preferred lagers when it comes to the mass produced market but pretty average in the grander scheme of things.

330ml can. Pours clear golden with large bubbles and a thin head that disappears quite quickly with no lacing. Looks almost like a cider. Mild generic lager aroma. Light citrus flavour, some mild honeyed sweetness and perhaps a touch more bitterness than many macro European lagers, but still very mild and generic. A relatively decent example of its class, though that doesn’t really say much.
Okay...i have to use the amount of characters that Ratebeer says so...YEKYEKYEKYEKYEKYEK...enough?
Unfortunately is Hawaii’s beer of choice. Oddly metallic with otherwise not much flavor at all. On the watery side. Punchy but there’s no real reason to drink it.

25 cl bottle. One of the most famous beers around the world. A pity that it is just marketing. Straw colour and almost no head just after pouring. Not enticing at this respect. Mediocre aroma, almost odourless, and taste, a little on the bitter side. Light body, thin texture, too much carbonation and very short finish. A poor beer, although there are worse ones. At least this one is not unpleasant. Recommended just ice cold, if you feel like gulping down some unchallenging beer.

33cl. Can. 
Poors clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma bread, hay. 
Taste little bitter, little bad sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
So bad!.
always a skunky smell, and a pretty terrible taste... nothing redeeming about this beer...

Aroma is malty, no hops at all. There is a lot of malty taste with some kinde of strange flavor (i am used to this kind of flavor in special beers, so i think there is a little bit of a color malt, of somethink which gives extra tip of taste t it, but i dont like it..) well i didnt expect much from a heineken, i got it as a gift in stylish 1 litre bottle, pretty nice,

Pours with a huge billowy head. Head sticks around. Tons of bubbles. Slight hops in the aroma. Tastes like pocket change and light malts mixed with a bunch of carbonation and extra water. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Ciao Presso for 450 yen in Miyakomichi. It pours your typical yellow with a head of white foam. Served ice cold & the flavor is bland, just a boring lager. As it gets warm the taste goes downhill. Nothing special but drinkable  in a pinch.

grass, spruce, dough, bread, pale, clear, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, bitter
Holland’s mass produced effort. Not much in the way of aroma/flavour but decent when ice cold from the bottle. Better (not by much) than Molson/Coors offerings in N. America, still not great in my opinion.

I don’t understand why this beer is so popular. It is awful and will give me a headache the morning after (even when I just drink 2 of them).  O am from Holland, but I am not proud that this is the main beer we export.

A bottle is a little bit better then a draft one. The draft ones have no taste at all.
Not sure "clarity" is as much of a positive as Heineken would like you to think.  Decent choice for those venues with limited selection.

I just realised I’ve never reviewed this one, although is one of my favorites when I want to drink quite a few beers in just one afternoon. I am going to assume that everyone (almost) is familiar with this one, since it’s so highly advertised. Bottle of 300 ml, in a brown bottle(yes, Heineken returnable bottles are brown in the Netherlands). Golden yellow colour, with a two finger head, average retention. Smell is not that good, as a matter of fact smells a bit skunky. Taste is better, quite close to the average pilsener. Medium thin on the body, average carbonation, some dryness left behind on the palate. Overall an average beer, praised by many mainly because of the advertising and loathed by many others because of how mainstream it is. I see 20 something guys writing on the internet "Oh, Heineken, this sucks, you should try the -enter name of a shitty beer-, it’s great, but lacks the advertising that’s why not many people know it". Yeah, right. Anyway. Oh, I also had Heineken many times in Greece where its made locally and it’s not imported, and I consider it to be far better than the original!
A little too bitter for me and with low carbonation. Only drink it if I have no choice, but at least is drinkable.

Kan det vara världens mest kända öl?
Snackar vi aroma och smak, är detta en av de sämre ölen jag smak......
On draft at the Mal Maison, pours clear golden and one and a half finger white head, aroma is cereals with small hints of sweet oak. Taste is fairly uneventful, but it is refreshing & sessional.
Hey, it’s better than bud light when bowling.  Nothing special, but nothing severely off putting either.

Proper Heineken drank from a dark bottle not a green bottle in the Netherlands. Medium gold with a foamy, lacy, lasting white head. Smells fruity like peach, honey and toasted malt. No musk or staleness. Medium frothy oily body with soft carbonation. Tastes of cereal with a sweet honey, centre with a grassy dirty finish. Much better than others versions of Heineken I’ve had. The finish is dry and slightly metallic.
Bière gazeuse sans goût particulier. Se boit au mieux en rafraichissement. Avec un lamelle de citron
The beer I love, 15 years ago I tasted for the very first time, and it was love at first sight, my review is totally biased of course, but.. what can I do... I love heineken.
330ml can. Golden body, white head. Fairly well done for a typical mass produced lager.

Clear golden with a non-lasting head. Aroma of straw and pale biscuity toffee...which is my closest description for "mass produced lager". Flavor is bland, albeit crisp and sweet with low-mild hop bitterness. Actually tastes more ’craft’ than I expected, and certainly more so than BMC. Earthy toffee biscuitiness with a semi spicy grassy hop note.
Smells like corn water. Has a taste that reminds me of old watered down apple juice mixed with beer. Can be somewhat refreshing when had at the right time. A classic.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with average, fizzy white head. Aroma and flavor are heavy corn and straw as you would expect with the macro lagers with some grassy hops and light fruit esters; dry throughout. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.
I’m not a Heineken fan. It’s really skunky to me in both taste and aroma and not appealing at all. Prefer to avoid it.
Ordinary and boring lager. Not bad, just a common lager. High carbonation. Ok, but nothing to remember.

Pours a clear straw colour, almost like apple juice. The smell is of saw dust, and a faint whisp of apple. The taste is crisp and refreshing, but lacks any real substance. Perhaps some faint notes of malt, apple and pear..the hops has very little presence. The finish is extremely unspectacular. This is your run of the mill macro beer, still better than most macro’s.

Can. Light golden, small and fully diminishing head. Light, malty - some corn and sweetish aroma. Body is light, malty - some corn and sweetish flavor. Finish is short, malty - some corn and lightly sweetish, light metal and faint hoppyness. Really watery lager - no good.
Ordinary dull pale lager. Nothing disturbing, nothing to remember. Quite fresh.

Heineken is good beer.  Pours a clear straw color.  Solid malt nose with some grassy hops.  Nothing to find in the way of phenolic complexity. No fruity esters.  The taste is clean, dry and even optimistic.  It’s one of the few beers whose taste quality is the same whether in the bottle, can or on tap.  It’s everywhere because it’s reliable like an old friend.
Bouteille de 341ml, robe blonde limpide et claire, arôme d’herbes, goût de malt houblonné!!!!

Nice golden color with a frothy withe head. A straight forward lager that delivers on its premise. Nice drink-ability and quite refreshing. Noteworthy is the difference of the license brewed version and the one brewed at Heiniken Nederlands. A clean and refreshing lager.

I’ve enjoyed other comments suggesting that this is more marketing ploy than actual beer, and certainly few brewers know how to market like Heineken.  The aroma is much as you’d expect - straw, hay and a silo full of grain.  It’s very bland in the mouth, with a little citrus concentrated at the back of the throat.  It’s not a great beer, but like most macros it won’t do you any harm.
Some bitterness. Amber in colour with a white head. Good beer after long day.
Succesvol marketingproduct. geen idee waarom ze dit in sommige markten als premium product ervaren. Het ziet er netjes uit voor een pils meer valt er niet over te zeggen.
Nothing special really. Some bitter aftertaste, but in general quite watery taste. A simple lager.
Skunky and very carbonated, no real redeeming value in this beer other than an iconic label.
Bottle @Hungary- Clear yellow pour with a white head. Skunky, bready aroma. Skunky taste with a bitter (notes only) aftertaste.
C’est aqueux et très pale. Il y a un peu d’amertume et un goût faible. C’est bon pour un lager pale mais je n’achèterais pas.
It’s a good beer has the aroma of weed. Enjoyable for a European lager. Good brew nice aroma but just a regular lager.
Draught at bar. Golden color, white head. Malty taste with citrus, toast, grass and a bit of floral hops. Dry malty finish with citrus. Ok, drinkable brew.
Very low but not as bad as the bud light series so this is my go to cheap beer in the us
Would take this beer in a bottle over tap anyday. Love the slim classic green feel. Initial tastes are sweet, neat and nutty. A true classic. You can’t go wrong !

Once poured from a can, the aroma of this beer is quite strong with hints of dough yeast and sweet bread malts, and the appearance is clear yellow with a medium white head that fades quickly to the thinnest layer of foam, which stays for quite a while. The taste is slightly sweet and sour (The exact level of sourness is hard to distinguish, but I think the beer is about as sour as it could be without having any fruity sourness to it.), and the palate combines a medium body, soft carbonation that builds in your mouth, slick texture, and a long sour finish. However, I will note that, from a bottle, this beer is much more skunky and much less flavorful, which makes me advise shying away from those horrid green glass bottles.

First off, you need to get this out of a can or on tap, because the green bottles will most likely be skunked.

With that out of the way, pours a pale yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is a bit sweet and malty with a little bit of straw. Flavorwise, a mild sweetness with mild hops mixed in at the end. 

The flavor is stronger than your average American macro-brew and has a  fairly thin, but not too thin, body with a moderate amount of carbonation. Not a terrible brew, but not all that exciting.

(500ml can) Genuine not BUL.
Slightly metallic aroma, no hop presence.  Lightly carbed, golden colour.
Sweet but not cloying.  No bitterness.  Would have preferred a drier finish, disappointing but not bad.

Not as bad as some of the other mainstream beers. If you can get ya hands on the real stuff from Europe it's actually not too bad 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Maybe my favorite mass produced lager. Pours straw yellow. Flavor is slightly sweet, slightly hoppy. Nothing terribly complex or exciting, but nothing offensive either. A refreshing, simple beer.

Tasted from a can left over in my fridge by a friend who stayed recently. It needed to be disposed of as it was ruining my street cred! Poured a clear light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is malty but not strong. The flavour is bitter, malty and with a rather weird aftertaste. Hey it's ok...but I probably wouldn't drink it if there was anything else on offer.
Seems to think its better than it is, premium lager? The only difference between this and carlsberg is the percentage. Awful. And expensive. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its a shame that this beer is the face of Dutch brewing as it’s one of my least favorite (though far from the worst).  In the states, it has the stale, pasteurized aroma and flavor.  Corn sweetness with some breadiness.

skunky aroma, pale in color and very clear, produces minimal head, and possesses a medium bitterness, with medium body, fizzy carbonation that kinda bugs your throat as it goes down, and a lingering bitter finish,

Not sure how I went this long without tasting the fabled Heineken. Despite all its bad rep, this isn’t really all that bad. Pours a deep golden yellow with a big white head that leaves no lacing. Aroma is skunky malts, wet hay, and bread dough. Taste is the same and a little watery. This is in the same boat as Stella Artois: decent, but just too darn expensive for what they are.
Tall Boy. Pours a clear yellow with white foamy head.  Aroma of citrus and sweet malts.  Taste is sickly sweet. Watered down.  Lots of water. Very light. Metallic taste.
Light gold, thin white head.  Skunky corn taste with metallic aftertaste.  Not good.
dentre as premiuns populares é a melhor. leve, saborosa, ótima para beber no friozinho!

500 ml beer on tap @ Beer Palace,Oslo,November 28,2012
Light yellow color.A slightly hoppy aroma.A light bitter finish.Very little to say aboat this macro lager apart from easy to drink.
Skunky aroma.  The clear golden color is probably the best thing about it.  Alot of hype around this beer, and I’m not sure why.
Bottle. Super light with the skunky lager taste the cheap macro lagers have. Very little to like about it.
Great to drink after you’ve been drinking liquor all night and you want to slow down, otherwise, not worth your time buying alcohol water.

Bomber bottle. The aroma is Skunked malt. The appearance is golden with a white head with lots of carbonation. The taste is barely any malt, that is quickly swallowed up by skunkidy skunkeness. I hope it is better in holland, cause over here, this beer blows. Would rather drink cheap malt liquor than this bs.

Watered down, totally skunky.  Really not a fan of this beer, but I will say that I prefer it in the can versus a bottle!

NOTE: Extremely subjective scoring! (objectively, this beer is around 2.6-2.8 - for me :) )
In fact, this beer was my first favourite many-many years ago, so it is very hard for me to assess this objectively...however after tasting plenty of really great beers, I would say It is still quite good...or at least drinkable ;-)  - well, with some cardboard, metallic notes and maybe diacetil  - but still better than an average lager...or I’m just simply a bit subjective :-)

Not bad for a lighter-tasting beer.  It has that slight Holland skunk taste, which is why I like it better than the popular American pale lagers.  This is good if you want to kick back a few beers and want something better than a Budweiser.

Smells like regular beer, tastes like piss mixed with water. Well it tastes like beer diluted with water. The aftertaste is a little off. The sad thing is that the beer I buy and drink now is a bottle of 1 liter Limited Edition made ​​in the context of the film Skyfall. Yikes!
30 cl. bottle @ Rick. Pale yellow with a whtie heas. Grainy sweetish aroma and taste. Nothing offensive to be found which explains a big part of the succes of Heineken. Boring but decent

Bottle from imtimrhodes. Aroma is rice, saaz hops, white bread, and a little metal. The flavor is sweet and very lightly bitter. Light body with a crisp, clean palate. Eminently drinkable. Overall, this is a good pale lager, meaning that it doesn’t taste like anything, and drinks like water.

0.33 bottle. Good and pleasant yeast aroma and aroma is like a good beer should be. Taste is sweet and mild hops flavor should be noted. Aftertaste is waterly and not so exciting. Very little bitter. I was thirsty and i like this beer :)

Poured a yellow-gold color with a thin head and lacing.  Aroma was the highlight with a malt sniff and a slight fruitiness present.  Taste was typical of a pale lager - malts followed by grains followed by a slightly off hop finish.  It tasted slightly like PBR.  Palate was decent for the category.  Overall, it came in as expected.  Probably will not revisit after my sixer is gone, since I can get PBR for less plus - both price and carbon footprint-wise.
Esto sólo sirve para quitar la sed en caso de que esté muy fria y no haya agua cerca.
bonne biere gouteuse qui sa prends tres bien entre amis c est ma biere de tout les jour une un bon gout qui est pas trop prenonce
A straight forward beer with no surprises. Some bitterness. Amber in color with a white head.

Bottle. Typical grassy aroma, some sharp hop notes. Standard pale straw color. Big hay with citrus fruit initial; mid palate brings an attack of carbonation; final is very mild and sweetish. Thin-mdeium body. A decent macro. The fizz is a bit too much. Still, it’s better than just about any US macro lager.

Bottle. Pours clear with airy white head. Light golden colour. Light aroma of hop. Richly carbonated. Watery, just slightly hoppy, barely discernible taste. Dry aftertaste. Not bad as such, but I can’t see a reason for its huge popularity.
Plainly middle of the road lager with no real distinguishing flavors or qualities. Very carbonated and all in all just your regular old beer
25cl can. No aromas and dull watery mass market lager with medium head and pale golden color.

Not a fan of this one. Pale golfen pours, medium head. Stale aroma and taste. Watered down. Would prefer a Bud Light, honestly.

#710
 Goldgelbes Bier mit schnell verflogenem Schaum; keine Blumenbildung. Im Aroma eher verhaltene grasige Hopfigkeit, die in seiner Art an Becks erinnert. Im Antrunk dann sehr dünn geraten. Geschmacklich erst nichts, dann eine nicht nur gerstenmalzige Süße und im Abgang kommt dann der langersehnte Hopfen durch. Ich kann verstehen, dass mit diesem Bier nicht jeder klar kommt. Die ersten zwei-drei Schluck sind doch gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber dann ist es ein akzeptables Lager. Nicht die Krone der Braukunst, aber auch nicht wirklich schlecht!
	
Test vom 7.1.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,8,9,9,12,9 - 9,00
Great beer with malty taste. Very refreshing. Too sad it’s kinda expensive here in Norway, but definitely worth it compared to somewhat cheaper beer that sucks.
This beer surprised me as it actually had a very small malt profile albeit thin it is there if you let it be. Very over filtered and just plain and bland, likely the product of mass production.
Pours average white head, aroma of some malt and hay, taste is slightly bitter and sweet some hops, crisp.

I am not a fan of this sour/bitter beer. When I see people purchasing it in a liquor store I cringe at the thought of them drinking it. I can’t imagine that this beer tastes the same way if you were to drink it fresh at the brewery. In fact, I’ve been told that the US recipe is completely different than the recipe they use for European distribution.
Pale malt and corn/yeast smell. The taste makes this beer tolerable. Good pale lager flavor
Well above the usual, high volume brews. But generally not worth it either, given its competition of piss-poor lagers and pale ales.
This is one of my favourite. Perfect mainstream beer with perfect marketing.

Era da tempo che non non assaggiavo una Heineken ma ieri sera, durante una serata tra amici, è saltato fuori un bariolotto da 5 lt ... per cui mi sono riempito il bicchiere... Purtroppo l’impressione non è cambiata. Premetto che l’aspetto migliore rimane la schiuma, densa, alta soffice e persistente. E basta. la birra finisce qui. Niente aroma o profumo, niente corpo, niente piacevolezza al palato, niente finale. A parziale attenuante posso aggiungere che il barilotto non era fraddissimo e questo influisce sul giudizio, dato che molti sottolineano la piacevolezza e la freschezza di questa birra una volta che venga servita veramente gelata....
Small white head that disappears in an instant, orange-yellow colour. Unpleasantly bitter aroma. Medium bitter taste and bitter finish. Nothing special, but apart from the aroma it is nice.
Nice golden color but i smell bad aroma and the taste is drinkable and inexistent. Bad beer
Pours clear and very light gold and little head from the bottle.  Aroma has some mainstream corn and after a sip it has a slight taste that hits but not much else going on.

Looks bad - too light and not enough head. Aroma is honeyish, sickly sweet. The flavour has its own bitterness, but not particularly pleasant. Very metallic - and not iron-pleasant, but some other alloy...No finish at all. Must be freezing cold not to be offensive.
Light straw colouring. Minimal scent of grain. Crisp and light body. Slightly bitter finish. Overall, not very flavourful or redeeming

Light straw color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, & some grain; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, and some caramel; Fairly light and bland; Overall, inconsistent at times - but still one of the better macro lagers out there.

I dont get why people buy Heineken.  It is expensive, I have had multiple skunked bottles, and overall it tastes like almost every other generic american beer out there.  boring, clear appearance, normal head, boring taste, boring beer.

Tap, bottle. Studied abroad in Holland and this was my first beer while there. Cheap, light, not overly offensive. Great for the place and time. Tried it when I got back home and it just wasn’t the same. Skunky and stale out of the bottle. Not the greatest beer ever, but certainly not the worst. And worth some points from me for nostalgia’s sake.
Shared 0,5 l can kindly shared by my pal Espen. Clear pale golden body with a small white head. Light malts and boiled carrots on the nose. Sweet and papery bitter. Watery texture and a light body.

Light yellow color almost no head. 
Close to aroma, so malt. 
Watery taste with malty aftertaste and notes of bitterness...
Not even a lawnmover beer i my opion...




Bolton Brew Rocks !!

A classic beer. But you have to drink it cold otherwise it’s like any other beer, bidder and hard to swallow. But cold its one of the best beers! Nice Taste and smell! Getreidig, karamellig, grasig, grasig, holzig

(bottle) pours a very pale yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of bittering hops, earth, pale malts and straw, with a hint of pepper. flavour is mostly cooked vegetables, herbal hops and straw, slightly sweet with an inappropriately bitter finish. light-bodied with average carbonation.

12 oz. Bottle. Not offensive. Just weak. Astringent bitter scent, grain. Godlen clear bubbly pour with a thin head. Light and crisp feel, moderately dry finish. Touch of tartness to the taste with toasted grain and a bitter finish. Overall, weak.
Clear yellow pour with a white head. Skunky, bready aroma. Skunky taste with a bitter aftertaste. Big rep for a bad beer, but just not my style.

330ml green bottle. Pours light amber with thin white head. Fair carbonation. Can’t smell anything much apart from skunkiness and maybe bread - really not pleasant. The taste is marginally better than the smell - malt, maybe some burnt sugar - can’t really place it. Overall pretty foul - Brewed under licence locally - does the genuine stuff taste like this?
Tsja, nooit een liefhebber van heineken geweest, goede marketing, matig bier.  Ruikt wat raar, smaakt lichtmoutig, weinig body en weinig  smaak in de afdronk.
Yellow in colour and a tiny white fading head. Smells a bit of straw and hops. Thin body, light bitter and hints of sweetness to it. Finish is flat. Thirst quencher ever now and then.
Simply one of the most disgusting beers in the market. Water with some gas and alcohol.

Aroma: can’t tell, maybe a little bread, slightly skunky; pale golden, very clear, white short-lived small foam; medium sweetness, lightly bitter; light body, thin feel, average carbonation, short slightly bitter finish;
Overall: if it’s cold and you thirsty, drink it fast...
I like to fall asleep watching the television. This helps when drunk in sufficient quantities.
500 ml can. Probably one of the most disappointing beer experiences I’ve ever had. Metallic after-taste, lack of hops, total lack of identity, and the livelyness is gone instantly.

Can on BA flight from LHR to Belfast City - 24/08/12.
Wouldn’t have paid for this one but as they are included in your fare on BA so did something to kill time and provide a review on the 60 minute flight!
Pours clear pale blonde with a frothy white head that soon thins. Fizzy carbonation evident by way of visuals.
Nose doesn’t provide much other than grain, wheat, subdued malt and a faint whiff of bananas!
Taste is of sweet malt, caramalised banana (faint!), slightly buttery and with a citrus backnote.
On the palate not as carbonated as the appearance suggested. Still fairly high on the carbonation front but ok in this respect leading to a slightly sweet finish.
Overall a more flavoursome beer than I had anticipated, not having drunk the stuff for some 15 or more years. The flavours dropped and it became blander as I drank.
Can. Clear yellow with a medium white head. Skunky and malty aroma. Taste of metal, sour hops. Weak body and a short dry aftertaste.

Bottle from weis supermarket to insure the proper amount of skunk on the nose. Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Has a slight bitter thing on the finish. Convincing the American public that skunky drainpour from Holland was a premium product is one of the great con jobs of the 20th century.

I’ve had this both on tap and from the bottle and in most cases it’s skunky in the bottle. Tap is alittle better but still isn’t an aroma to this beer or much taste. If it’s not skunky I’d take this over most mainstream lagers like bud, coors, etc. It’s not bad.
Very available and pretty cheap, a fairly regular beer for me. The taste is ok after you get used it, I wouldn’t say no to one but there are much better beers!
Bottle: Found while diving in the ocean. Tasted a bit skunky. Wasn’t much different than a bottle bought from the local store.

One of those beers that you can unfortunately find almost anywhere you go. Pours a clear pale yellow color with an average head. I was pretty fierce in pouring this into the glass to actually get a head. Smells like stale wheat with some citrus. Taste is cheap, thin and grassy. Basically what I call beer flavored water. A simple and overpriced beer that mass advertises in the Asian markets to gain popularity. Why anyone would buy this more than once is beyond me. Thankfully I got my 12pk free after a rebate.

Poured into a frosted mug (say what you will about the frosted mug, but this needs it!)

A: Pours a clear straw color with a three finger white head with crappy retention and lacing.

S: Good news, everyone! The aroma is pure skunked maltiness and sulfur that reminds me of Corona. Wait a minute, that’s not good news at all...

T: This is 100% skunked, meaning it plainly sucks. BUUUUT, there is a slight breadth of grassy hops on the finish along with a slightly crisp malt note, meaning this might have been tolerable without the skunk.

M: Drinks like seltzer water.

O: No. It might be semi-acceptable if imbibed in a format that doesn’t allow it to be skunked, but out of the bottle, never again.
Jag hittar lite citrus i smaken. Det är nog det mest positiva som kan sägas om den här ölen. Så standard att det inte behöver skrivas mer.

Aroma: Nothing. Apperance: Look refreshing. Taste: not much. Palte: Nothing
Overall: Only in the desert with nothing else
Bottle. Golden clear. Crisp lagery flavour. Slightly grassy. A serviceable pale lager.
33 cl can, smells a bit sweet hay like, refreshing, a bit nutty like taste with some bitter after taste

Ahhh, the old green demon, the king of beers. His lordship is brewed with a proverbial whos who of the worlds finest hops and yeasts. Coming in a beautiful precipus green bottle, this cleansing elixer pours a mesmerising shade of golden yellow, with an exquisite, air-thin head, and majestic carbonation. On the nose there is a veritable bouqet of delicately fragrant citrusy hop and yeast smells. In the mouth this beer not only has a beautiful velvety texture but also follows through with a variety of beautiful tastes, oriental jasmines and intricately interweived lemon yeasts. It is sad that the whole life changing experience is over after only 330mls, but luckily the experience can be had over and over again.

From bottle. Served in a 25cl Pilsner Glass. Crystal clear.
Aromatic notes: bready and Salz hop.
Disappointingly basic !
For summer only and if you made sport before, otherwise it’s not worthwhile drinking such a p...
Tastes like piss, only good thing is that they sponsor the world cup. Pierce off Jack.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Sweetish lager with a slightly bitter ending. Surprisingly done with a lot of love for an industrial made beer.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Expected a bitter, citrus style beer but got a quite sweetish beer with low carbonation. Flavours of peach and nectarines.
Cerveja básica para o fim de semana. Sabor Um pouco mais forte que as concorrentes. A melhor escolha para um encontro de amigos
Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Smells stale malty. Tastes bitter malty, abit sweet with a similar finish.

This was left in the fridge by a friend.  Hard to believe this use to be a favorite.  aroma: reminds me of that classic beer smell / taste from the 70’s ie Pabst or Hamm’s / but skunkier.  Appearance: light gold, lots of carbonation.  Taste: skunky, not much malt or hop flavor, acidic flavor, a beer that needs to be drank quickly.

Heineken is a lager I can only drink when it’s very cold. Once this lager gets anyway warm it is impossible to drink. 
The after taste to Heineken is not very nice and it’s a very gassy drink so prepare to be burping constantly. 
It’s one of the nicest lagers. It’s not too strong and it’s not too weak.

golden yellow color. Lots of sweet bread malt, lemon grass, and other citrus. 
Clean, crisp and dull.

Very light aroma has just bit fruits, corn..not much more. Pale golden with ok but short head. Taste has bit grass. Light body and thin feel, medium finish one-sided. Not much happening here, feels diluted, plain and flat.

It is what it is. I had this on a flight in a nice plastic cup. It had a nice urine color with a very sustainable head. There was a slight skunkiness at the beginning followed by a mix of malt and hops. This tastes best real cold and gets worse as you finish the can because it gets warmer. Not much here but better than most American mega-lagers.

My favorite from any of the mega brewers.  Another case of nothing fancy winning the contest.  The initial aroma is of grass, hay, and grain with a crisp bite on the finish.  Extra filtering keeps this lager very clear with a refreshingly drinkable attitude.  Not to be overlooked.

Aroma prácticamente nulo con ligeros matices a lupulo.

En cuanto a la vista, es una cerveza de color amarillo pálido y transpariencia importante. Corona de espuma casi nula, con una ligera capa en los bordes. Carbonatación importante.

En boca se deja sentir la carbonatación, así como el lupulo y un ligero amargor.

Al paladar, esta laguer cumple su función ya que es refrescante, ligeramente amarga, con un final ligero.

En resumen, una cerveza agradable para el calor, aun que no de tomarse en serio a la hora de una degustación.
Tap. Very basic lager from a very big brewery. No character to speak of, very easygoing.
Not much to say about this beer, mass produced and "Popular". had cold out of a bottle after work, Pretty Bitter in the mouth and the way down.

Drunk straight out of the bottle.

Aroma was unfortunately pretty skunky as to be expected with the green bottle. There was a little bit of bread and hay, though, and it was similar to other Euro lagers.

The flavor started out ok but quickly became incrediby bad. A little bit of skunk , grassy hops and bready grain at first but it was overtaken by an unusually harsh bitterness. Add to that, way too much sweetness and you have a bad combination. It was really all I could do to finish the bottle.

While I normally really like Euro lagers, I have to make an exception for this one. Really it is an unbalanced mess. Not something I will have again.
The best of the populars, perfect in all. A melhor de todas as cervejas populares. Beba.
probably my favourite of the mass produced lager beer types. still got a funky veg aroma smell but somehow carries it off better than its contemporaries. a last resort beer
Very good and solid lager if ghats what you are in the mood for. Would take this over a bud any day..
Great taste and available for everyone to drink a very special lager. Drink it up and make it cool!
Grew up in that just because the company that represents it here in Greece dominates the market. Other than that it is as bad as Bud Light for me
My most favorite beer no matter what it’s a little expensive but to me there is no beer worth the money more than heineken :)

I honestly consider this worse than Budweiser. Tastes like skunk and that sickly sweet flavor that is the earmark of European macro swill (St. Pauli Girl, Becks, Stella Artois, etc). Just because it costs more than American pisswater doesn’t make it better.
Golden yellow in color. Recognizable hops and sparkling. Refreshing on hot summer days, but too watered down for special ocasions.
Can pour. Much better than your typical mass produced premium lager. You can taste the hops and it isn’t overpowered by adjuncts.

33 cl can @ Delta Airlines, BBE 06/2013. Rated on 11.07.2012

Aroma is sweetish with some honey, malt, grain, pear esthers(!) and hints of hay. Flavtour is surprisingly malty with grain, some honey and hints of hay. Somewhat sticky and foamy palate. Surprisingly good, but still bulky and starchy feeling here.
Very mild when cold,refreshing. Strong brand name but not a special beer. But I like it.
Strong taste for a pilsen beer, bad to drink more than 3 pints, but is easier to find and one of the best in his price category.

Can.  Hey it was free.  Pours a pale yellow color with a minimal white head.  Aroma is citrus, metal, and some sort of funk.  The good news is it has a nice hop finish but the start is flat, sweet and cardboard.  I’m not a fan but will drink it when its free.

I tried very hard to smell something from this beer and after that i caught a slight malt aroma. Pours clear yellow with small white head which disappears fast. Taste is a a bit sweet and acidic which is interrupted by high CO2. Finish is abrupt and a bit bitter and you can’t feel much in your mouth after some seconds. Overall an easy to drink beer but certainly not world’s most enjoyed beer!

Can in Eindhoven. Pours clear yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt and hints of meadow. Taste is light bitter and light acidic. Body is watery with soft carbonation. Finish is short, flat and light bitter. Even in its home country, this beer is rather boring.
Cerveza muy comercial con todo lo que ello implica. Tristemente, servida como la mejor del bar en muchos sitios de España.
Cette biere est bonne mais je crois quelle ne merite pas toute la popularite quelle a car cest plutot une lager de base

Nice pale lager yellow colour, fizzy, white foam which quicky dissolves. Mild alcohol smell. Taste differs from bitter and sweet but it still has strong taste of something similiar to alcohol (not a good thing). Leaves a mild taste of caramel in mouth. Below average beer and I’m not drinking this any time soon, people who think that this is the best beer in the world obviously did not taste anything else in their lives.

Along with Carlsberg and Budweiser, this is one of the worlds most famous and sold pilsner/lagers. It’s the best out of the three, and the most clean tasting, reminiscent of northern german pilsener. I’d probably still go for Tuborg Green instead, but it’s a decent drink and a good thirsquencher on a summer day. Draught version preferable.

Fun note: When me and my friends started drinking beer at age 14 (yeah, that IS the norm in Denmark) or so, we all thought this was the greatest drink in the world, and thought it was all exotic. Turned out we were just ignorant
Bière de couleur pâle. Une des premières bières "importées" que j’ai bu. Bière rafraîchissante avec une pointe d’amertume. Étrangement la version en canette est meilleure que celle en bouteille.
Tasted bottle. Nothing special here its a  Heinie. Crisp beer not much flavor.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent and memorable. Rated from the bottle.
My goto "fancy" beer. Actually the first beer i bought when i turned 21. A staple in my beer diet.
Hay, grass, alcohol, woody. classic, a beer for everyone. For the lovers if modesty and a touch of community.
(bottle) Light yellow coloured with a thin head. Watery, with a slight hoppy end.
One of my favorite skunky beers. Very light on color. Thin head. The carbonation is light. When poured properly seems less skunky then drinking from the bottle.

Pours clear golden yellow colour with a moderately thick white bubbly head that dissipates quickly and leaves little lacing. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of faint malt and hay. Taste slight malt with sweet crisp mouthfeel, nothing to strong. Light body, watery and crisp palate. Slight skunk aftertaste, nothing strange or strong.
Perennial favourite. Classic all rounder that you can always rely upon. Have even been to the brewery
Caramel, bread, hay, nuts, roasty, coffee, nuts, toast, chocolate, floral, grass, spruce
Looks like piss and usually tastes like piss.  Exception is when you can grab a fresh bottle.  Then it has a nice sweetness and is very drinkable.

Pours a clear yellow with an off-white head which rapidly become a ring. The nose is strong has a grainy/hay smell. The taste is similar to fragrance with just a hint of skunkiness. The mouthfeel is light-medium. Not my favorite beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Heineken Extra Cold tasted 24/4/2013 "Heineken Lounge" Dubai International Airport. Poured a clear golden yellow with a one-finger white foamy head that collapsed reasonably quickly and laced poorly. Moderate to high carbonation as seen by large bubbles forming trails. Aroma faintly of sweet malt (the ’normal’ Heineken had a better malt profile). Taste sweetish then bland as the cold serving temperature masked the taste. When warmed the malt profile increased. Light body. Smooth, light, soft lager. Bland finish. 
Tasted 13/4/2013 draught at Cafe Kalkhoven, Amsterdam. Poured a clear gold with a two-finger white foamy head that diminished quickly and laced OK. No carbonation, not a bubble. Aroma of malt. Taste of sweet malts and slight hops bitterness. Light body. Crisp and with a very faint bitter finish.
