20/6/2012 Poured a clear pale golden yellow colour with a moderately thick white foamy head that dissappeared quickly leaving very slight lacing. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of faint malt and hops - nothing to impress. Taste slight malt with some mild bitterness, again nothing to impress. Light body bordering on watery.
Buen cuerpo... No da resaca y es un buen digestivo.. Tomarla.bien fria.. Recomendada en botella de vidrio
One of the better commercial lagers and what I would go for if theres no decent choices available. Not a huge amount of any flavour. I agree it can be a little skunky.

Cannette de 33cl. Une blonde assez pale, mousse honnète de tenue moyenne. Malgrès sa notoriété, elle ne se distingue pas de la concurrence , ni par son goût, insipide, ni par sa faible amertume avec en sus, une pointe métallique (contenant en métal). Distibuée à McDonalds - Hénin Beaumont

Bottle. Golden yellow with next to no head. Cereal and amonia aroma. Tastes sour, skunky and generally bad. Heavily carbonated, but thin and light. It’s been years since my last; hopefully it’ll be longer before my next.
Nothing more than an average beer.. no special or strong taste, available everywhere. "0815-Beer"
One of my favorites :-) Not really a beer expert, but am very particular when it comes to taste, appearance and the after effects. This beer is a winner in all categories!

The nose is grainy like a hot cereal with something of an appleish note. The beer is a medium straw color with a very quickly disspating fizzy white head. The taste is bland grain with some mild skunkiness and a dry semibitter finish. Smooth and crisp in a very light bodied package. Nothing to celebrate, but it is a slightly better alternative to American adjunct lagers and light beers.
Tastes great, something light not really strong enough to get you High..something nice.
Pils smaakt prima vooral bij feesten, heeft een goede smaak blijft lang in de mond ...
1st try was a 40oz. many years ago and nothing has changed since that horrible experience.

Melhor cerveja de todo dia na minha opnião...
Fan n1, toda bebedeira tem que terminar com ela kkkk

Light gold/yellow pour with a thin head. Light fruit aroma, grapes (wine-like). Smooth, light-bodied, some fruit. 
It’s not bad if nothing else is available, but there’s so much better than this.
The most popular beer in the world is... You guessed it, a tasteless lager.
bread, hay, cereal, citrus, herbs, pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,
decent aroma, nice appearance with a good head. balanced flavors with a slight bite
I always have thought that Heine has a weird bite...like a skunky Stella...

(Flasche) Es hat eine goldgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer schneeweißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist eher schwer, riecht stark wie nasses, älteres Heu und etwas würzig. Der Geschmack ist zuerst wässrig, dann kommt eine breite, leicht ölige Bittere zusammen mit der Heunote. Es gibt einen späten Nachgeschmack, der sehr leicht aber störend ist. die Karbonisierung passt. Zusammengefasst: "Heineken, Fuck that Shit..."

Nah I’ve never been a fan of ’ol heiney. Maybe it’s made from 100% malt but the aroma has always seemed off to me, always a little skunkiness. That doesn’t whet my appetite. It’s often available in Asia but given the choice I always pick the local brew. My fiancee prefers this though so I usually have to finish off the second half of her glass. Can’t let the nectar go to waste, no matter how off-putting it may be. I’m cheap like that.
This must be the golden mean of how a lager are supposed to taste. Not too bitter, not too foamy, not too sour. Works equally well in Tromso, Norway as in Kinshasa, Congo.

Well, it is drinkable. That is about the best you can say. Just a little bit above your mainstream lagers because it has that  little bit of skunkiness that sets it apart. It will do in a pinch, I guess.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a quick dissipating 2 finger white head that leaves a few spots of lacing.  Aroma is grassy with light malts.  Taste is much like the aroma with a bit of skunkiness.  Light to medium body with adequate carbonation.  A small step above the typical macro lager.

Tap @ Pub, Microkeg @ Home and Bottle @ Home

There is really nothing terrible nor great one can say about Heineken. It is inoffensive, simple and goes down easily; which is exactly the point. If you’re after a choice lager, this definitely isn’t what you want.

Leagues better than most macro lager, though.

I can’t believe I actually rate this beer lower than Bud, but I did.  I always thought I just got some old beer, but I found out that that skunky taste was the hops they use.  I find little to no malt taste and this is just not my style of beer.

Geschmacklich ist es hopfig, süß und leicht zitrusähnlich. Im Nachgeschmack süß-hopfig und vorallem süß-malzig, am Schluss leicht bitter. Fazit: naja
	
Test vom 26.9.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,7,8,7,11,7 - 7,65
Bottle from a shop, probably Tesco. Out of the mainstream lagers probably one of the best.

Heine "road soda" courtesy of Wegman’s East Syracuse. Enjoyed out the can in my hotel room. Mostly malt centric with caramel and very faint biscuit. Bitterness cleanses on the finish.  Not much of a nose. Light to medium bodied, this actually hit the spot on this slightly warm evening. Not skunky like the other times I’ve tried, GO BIG CANS!
There’s some pretty bad variations if it isn’t brewed in Holland, but the export version is very good lager.
Che dire... É una Heineken!  Bevibile se accompagnata con un bel panino... Schiuma non eccessiva, ben carbonata ma odore e sapore un pó piatti anche se non c’é niente che stoni.

Clear yellow color with one finger white head. Skunky and malty smell.
At first this beer is sweet then bitter. It’s easy to drink. Solid european lager.

fles 30cl
kleur: lichtgeel met een witte schuimkraag
geur: mout en hop.
Smaak: lichtbitter, licht zurig.
Regular pilsener, niet bijzonder

Draft 

Appearance: Clear pale yellow color with an average, frothy, ok lacing, white head. 

Aroma: -light- malts, corn, hops 

Taste:light sweet with a light bitter, dry, soury finish 

Palate:Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is average.
Pours and smells like every other piss yellow, mass produced, pale lager. Taste is a little different, a bit maltier. Eh.

I was never a Heineken fan even in the days when it was the "Imported" beer. This version has a pale yellow and a fizzy head. The aroma is corn and I don’t know what else. The flavor is watery gruel. Give me a Coors. On second thought don’t give me a Coors.
Pale golden colour. No distinctive smell. Aroma of malts, a faint of hop and fruits. Quite fresh, mild carbonation. Does not end up rubbery or metallic.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale yellow with about a finger of white head. Aroma of corn, hay and skunk. Taste is very lightly bitter. Corn and skunk. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, not my favorite. Made to be drank pretty quickly.
Pours a light gold colour. The aroma is corn, and grains. Taste is a balance of hops and malt, very watery though, and a thin mouthfeel. Not a great beer.
Bottle to pint. Looks fine. Smells and tastes funky, but not in a bad way. Mouthfeel is average. Decent.
Just for fun, I’d like to rate this water. The favorite beer of most of my fellows, how can I put it ? Yeah, it’s like a bit of wheat water. Avoid if possible.
This is the first beer I had with my father. It is a beer made for anyone and everyone. There is nothing special about it and nothing truly bad or disgusting about it. I like it.

Bottle. Pours pale yellow with a medium white head that dissipates fast with no lacing. Aroma is of grains, perhaps some grass. Taste is typical lager, grainy, a minor hop presence gives some initial bitterness. Clean finish, with perhaps a bit of sweetness. Not  bad.... for a pale lager.

King of skunks - is there honestly a stinkier beer than Heineken?  Whenever I’ve had this, I’ve had to hold my nose.  Honestly, if you get past the smell, it’s a bit more crisp and flavorful than your typical pale lager, but that SMELL!  My gosh.  I’d give 0 if I could in aroma.  AUGUST 2015 RERATE: Had this in a can.  Actually not that bad.  I can understand why this is a go-to macro for some now.  Reminds me a bit of Harp Lager when it doesn’t have the green bottle skunk.

Drank from pint glass from a 1PT 8 Oz Bottle. As a commercial beer this lives up to the standards of a pale lager; being an almost character free simple beer. Light and Musty sour aroma that only appears when first poured. Bready with a trace of hops and a dry finish after the first sip. The palate was light with medium carbonation. Finishes watery and bland.

500 ml can. Light golden with small foamy white head. Weak flora. aroma with some grassy hops. Taste is hard to describe since there is little. Refreshing watery mothfeel. A bit sweet with notes of banana in aftertaste.

Politeness beer, drank so as to not appear to be the pretentious beer snob I know I am.  Smells funky and green, like someone left some pilsner hops out in the sun for waaay too long.  Bubbly, yes, and it does look better than a lot of BMC stuff, but god it tastes awful.  Tastes corny and  spoiled and watery and bitter and of all-around horribleness.  The fact that Bond will be drinking this in a new film is killing all those cool points earned by Casino Royale.

Originally reviewed: 5/7/10. I’ve had this beer a few times, but have never reviewed it. Grabbed a bottle at the grocery last night for this purpose. Poured into a pilsner glass. 

Pours a crystal clear pale yellow. There’s a very thick wispy white head on top. Retention is decent; leaves some light lace. Scents of corn mash, hay, and slight gym socks. 

The body, like most pale lagers, is extremely thin and wet. This is made to be drunk quickly. Spot on for the style, but I don’t care for it. Very light, weak flavors make this one up. Some buttered corn and a bit of a lemon-y twang on the finish. This is a drinkable beer because it’s light, wet, and quasi-refreshing, but I’m gonna pass.

330ml bottle. Light yellow color. Small light head, disappears quickly. Aroma is hay, fizzy. Taste is somewhat sweet, light hops, fizzy ending. Not a bad beer, but nothing special.

I also tasted can version of this beer. And its simply awful.

Pours a clear yellow with a short lasting white head. Aroma is faint malt with some hops. Taste is pretty much the same with slight hoppy bitter finish. Pretty inoffensive. I’d take it over a lot of mass produced pale lagers.

Aroma: Fresh cut grass mixed with a sour smell, with also a hint of a gasoline type smell.

Appearance: Amber.

Taste: Bitter, what you would expect an average beer to taste like.

Palate: I have a decent appreciation for it.

Overall: Never used to like this beer as a younger person. Over the years it has grown on me. Although I like my crafts and it is about the same price as some of them, there is really nothing to hate about Heineken. Just an average to pretty good tasting beer.
12 oz bottle.  Pours a clear yellow.  Aroma of skunk.  Flavor is corn, grape, herb.  Tastes far better than it smells.
Weak in every way, I don’t even feel comfortable saying that I detect anything in this liquid other than a hint of malt. Watery, piss colored, awful.

being in hawaii this beer is the beer of choice for the locals I dont know what it is but here on the islands this beer taste so much better pours yellow with a small head has a great taste its one of those beers thats not a beer to go play beer pong with and its not one of those beers where you sip on its just a beer to go down to the beach hang out with your buddies and drink some heinekens

Pours very clear yellow and with a slight foam that is surprisingly persistent for a lager. Quite refreshing beer, and with floral notes in aroma. Tastes watery and slightly malty, finishing hoppy and a little sweet. A good dairy beer.

330 ml can. Pours yellowish golden with minimal foamy white head. Weak aroma is floral with some grassy hops. Nice in a way that it lacks skunkyness. Quite refreshing taste has some light notes of malt. Watery mouthfeel and stingy carbonation. Sweet but not oversweet aftertaste. Quite tasteless but a suprisingly good macrolager.
Can. Pale yellow golden with huge foamy dissipating head. Smells lightly of biscotti and lemon. Tastes watery and sweet. Lots of carbonation with a sweet aftertaste.
Watered down lager. You get what you pay for on this one. Better than bud because its not skunky but still on that level of garbage.
Quite often skunked but if you can find one that is not it is okay and it is readily available at most places

De color dorado pálido y mucha espuma blanca poco duradera. Se siente una leve mezcla de aromas a malta y lúpulo. El sabor es algo seco, con buen balance entre el sabor a malta y el amargor. Suave y refrescante.
Bottle at de Spijker, Amsterdam on 16th March 2012. Quenching, refreshing, mildly hoppy. Short hoppy end and a fizzy, foamy texture.
Pours a straw yellow with very little head. Aromas of grain and corn. Taste is typical macrobrew with metallic off flavors. Watery body.
Many a good night out on the Heineken because it is clean, crisp and refreshing.  Good beer for a session.
I really do not understand why this apparently is THE brand in the world, nothing special about this beer. I drink it just when I am very thursty and need some cooling down.
There are worse things to drink, but not a great lager. Slightly bitter, very light malts, very thin.

A: Straw gold (piss) yellow, clear. Quickly forming two finger head of tight white bubbles that are well retained. Some glass lacing and no alcohol legs.

S: Corn, some hops, sweet, metallic, cold and since it is from a can there is NO SKUNK. Avoid the nasty green bottles.

T: Sweet, some hop taste with a bready, grass finish.

M: Watery thin, well carbonated. Crisp, refreshing dry finish. 

O: It is what it is, a Pale Lager. This said, it is leaps and bounds better than Bud, Miller, Coors and other american lagers. Just buy this in the can and your experience will not be that bad.

Mini keg can from mini kegerator, freshly opened.  Damn, I’m not going through all the details, just submitting my score because my details are likely not going to be read... and if they are, well.... it’s Heineken!
Bottle into a Lager glass. Light yellow pour next to no head. Sharp co2 with low malt taste. Finish is weak. Over rated from the get!!!

12 oz can. Crystal clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of light cracker malt, and spicy/herbal hops. Flavor is light malt with a nice hop bitterness. Light body with average carbonation and a crisp, refreshing finish. I think the can helps preserve the freshness and keeps this from getting skunked like so many I’ve had in bottles. I like this beer.
Bread, cereal, woody, woody. Nice beer with a good price. Not the best one, but always an option.

Rockin’ it.  I can’t believe I’m reviewing this beer.  The mainstay of douchbags and wannabes, I actually like this beer in some perverse sick way.  What is wrong with me?  I know I should hate it, but it tastes too good to truly repulse me.  Try it every once in a while: you might hate (or love) it.

Bottle.  Oh dear.  Pours yellow, almost clear with a slight haze to it.  Head had disappeared almost as soon as I’d finished pouring.  No aroma.  No taste.  No point.  This is water - albeit water that prevents you from driving - and is only saved from a sub-1 score because, being water, there is nothing unpleasant about it.  I hear it is better on tap in its native Netherlands so I will re-rate it if I ever try it over there.

Bottled, 0.473l. Pours clear golden color with creamy mid-sized white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of malt, grassy hops, citrus and some wine marc hints. Sweet malty taste with fruity notes. Light bitter and dry finish. Medium bodied, thin texture and soft carbonation in palate.

I give Heineken middle range marks all the way through. I did like it, but it does have a different distinctive taste. I would drink it again if offered by someone else or if nothing else is available, that I like on tap.

A színe ok. A hab pedig meglepően sűrű és tartós. Illata hozza a nagyüzemi lager tipikus fémes eggyenkomlós vonalat csak itt kicsit több benne a jobb minőségű alapanyag. Inkább édes. Karbonátos keserédes közép, kesernyés lecsengés. Tűrhető mainstream...
One of the best Pale Lager in the world... even its famousness, i still drink it!
Choice hops? My choice is to stay clear from this crap. It always tastes like styrofoam and cheap lager yeast. They love this in Puerto Rico; third most popular beer to Medalla and Heineken Light.

can   light yellow pour with big white head . aroma is mown grass , boiled vegetables . taste is sweeter than most commercial lager - this trick makes it seem a little better than most commercial lagers  . A hint of bitterness at the end  . It’s just a commercial pale lager - nothing to get excited about
Den fyller ain funktion, knappt, men den är inte direkt god. Men det är trots allt en Heineken.

Light in colour. Smells realy bad. White head. Don't like the taste. I used to like this beer. I did not know better!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle left at my place following a party.Clear pale yellow with a fluffy white head.  Skunky barley aroma and an earthy barley and cereal grain taste.  Not as bad as I expected, but certainly not good.

Bottle @ party. Unknown origin. Pours deep yellow with a big fizzy and frothy white head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, slightly floral and tiny metallic with bread, butterscotch and hints of dandelion. Taste is sweet, tiny skunky and slightly stale with an artificial quality to it with hints of bread and toffee. Mouthfeel is thin bodied with heavy carbonation. Finish is sweet, tiny bitter and tiny floral with some fudge.

Can. Yup it's still a Heineken. Better than a miller lite but beggars can't be choosers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
spruce, hay, cooked vegetables, pale, clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, bitter,

Great floral and earthly tones. Very hoppy. Pours smooth with a thick white head, rich golden color. This beer become a different beer out of the bottle and into a glass and is even better in draught. Something about the air hitting it and opening up all the rich hop aromas and flavors. I would recommend always pouring it or ordering it draught as opposed to bottle or can.

Draft at Mogwai. Helsingborg, December 2011. 


Bready aroma of rusk-bread and skunky malt. Light bodied with cereal notes, grains and sweet malt. Watery.
Straw yellow color with a thin head.  Medium sweet taste with a smooth finish.

Imported version to AU. Pours clear pale gold with ok white head. Decent retention and a touch of lace. Noble hop, grassy aroma, touch of caramel malt and a touch of vegetable.  Light body, nice malty character, a little vegetal, but noble hop flavours apparent, with a light bitterness. Bitterness lingers along with a nice noble hop flavour and a light sweetness. For a mass produced beer its not so bad.

Golden straw color with an instantly-flattening head. After a minute, there was no head to be found at all and it looked like I could be drinking a pint of apple juice. Smell and taste are strangly metallic, with a hint of sweetness.
Can. Pours a straw yellow with small white head. Smells a bit of hay but very feint. Taste is light with some light bitterness. Its ok

Just a commercial pilsener. Blond, pale, thin but stable foam, bitter and sweet, but not too bitter nor too sweet. There is nothing wrong with it, just that it is commercial and boring. The funny thing is that Heineken is bashed by Belgians, as part of their "We’re not like the Dutch"-act, while it is still a better lager than most Belgian lagers.
This is really bad beer. How is it possible that this is one of the world most popular beers??? The only taste is the taste of cardboard

Can at home. Pours clear straw-coloured with a big frothy white head that fades fast. High Carbonation. Aromas of sweet corn, hay and grass. More wet hay in the flavour with a dry and grassy ending. Pronounced medium bitterness. Thin and watery mouthfeel. Just a boring and easy-drinking lager with no uniqueness.
Has a light golden color. Smell is on the skunky side. Taste is grains, some malts, light hops. Overall a middle of the road beer.

Clear golden color with a small fizzy head that faded as quickly as it came. The smell was of grain, more grain, and a faint hint of malt. The taste was about the same with a dominatnt grain flavor and a hint of malt and hops.
In het aroma komt na een beetje hop de fruitigheid naar boven, het snoepje (de peredrup) overheerst.
Yellow bubbly liquid with a small white head. The aroma and flavor is that of skunk and body odor. Heineken is canned corn quality.
A beer that you can get anywhere and everywhere does not make it great.  It is crisp in the mouth though and leaves the tongue quickly.

New fancy textured 500 ml can. Bright lager yellow, white head fades quickly. Light skunky aroma. Signature skunky malt taste, not much else. Watery and low hopped, average carbonation. This used to be better. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Exaggerated cloying flavour. Sorry, but  this is almost not beer. I really dislike.

This use to be one of my fav commercial beer, I still can enjoy it once in a blue but to this day I prefer becks beer over this, but other then that is decent beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not bad for a light lager. Crisp and refreshing. Not a ton of flavor but it does have a slight tanginess. Pale golden color with a full head.

bottle rock on 80s....... awesome this beer was consider the top notch beer, my dad would buy it like a treasure, aroma, tootise roll type maltness, color, nice light amber hue, white head, taste, more of that smooth tootise roll maltness!, overall a classic straight up forever!

5 liter keg. Definitively way better than 12oz bottle, it has more carbonation and a thick creamy head, also less bitterness and more malty character. For a industrial beer is a good one, and the best one to get here in Ecuador, even if it is expensive.
A light aroma, golden, clear, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish,

0,5 l. can, 4,6 % abv. Leftovers from a party, so its "free". Brewed by Royal Unibrew, Denmark. Clear golden colour with a small, white head that faded fast. Light aroma with bread, grasses and cooked vegetables. Light bitter taste. Thin body with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation with a short, sweet finish. I like the Carlsberg Lager more than this, as far as macro lagers go. Would not buy this one.

A poor discotheque water beer for people who want to signal that they know something about beer to people who do not know anything. A thin beer that almost do not taste of anything. an indifferent beer which is only marginally better than the cheapest Harboe discount beer.

Bottle. Pours a golden body, with a low white head that diminishes fairly quickly, leaving almost no lacing. Artificial-like malty aroma, not good, no taste at all in the first minutes, but, as the beer warms up, taste becomes light bitter, but nothing special. Very thin bodied, very watery, medium carbonation. Really not good.   ( Old rating : Can. Pours a yellow-golden body, with an average white head that diminishes quickly. No lacing. Aroma is grainy and sweet. Taste is light bitter and a little sweet. Light to medium body, and the texture is too watery for me. Refreshing, if you’re drinking this on summer, but a very watery beer. 5/2/3/2/8 )

50 cl, canned. 4.6 % alc. vol. Pours clear yellow with a disapp. white head. Aroma: Sweet malts, hops. Taste: Sweet malts, herbal hoppy background. Cardboard. Palate: Light body, a bit thin. Subaverage carbonation. Texture feels a bit odd. Nothing to remember.

Cerveja bem equilibrada e apreciável. Com certeza a melhor alternativa na opção custo-benefício, qunado procura-se "aquela" cerveja para ser comprada em massa para uma ocasião com várias pessoas. Por isso ela merece o devido respeito!
Cannette 500 ml. Bouteille. Fût. Baril. Couleur jaune paille. Arôme de céréale. En bouche légèrement sucrée. Finale sans histoire. Se boit bien l’été bien frette.
slight sweet hop smell, pale straw color, pretty much no lacing, water and a little hops, sub-par overall but not bad for the price and availability
A typical pale yellow pils/ helles. Some vague herbs in the aroma. Palate mild watery with semisweet maltiness. Aftertaste hints of hops, short watery finish.
Comercial beer, cheap, and, nothing much more. Not really tasty, but more enjoyable than similar beers
Bottle - A green bottle. Not much to report here. Light in color and fizzy with a somewhat metallic taste.

- net water
- geen smaak
- onprettige geur
- na 2 a 3 biertjes begint het te schuimen in me mond, probeer ik dit weg te spoelen met een biertje word het nog erger.

Helaas kan ik niet meer noteren als deze rating. Dit komt doordat ik dit biertje te slecht vond om er meer over te kunnen noteren.
Bottle. Clear, golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of cereal malt, corn, off taste and metal. Taste is dry, light sweet and light bitter. Light bodied with high carbonation. Boring eurolager.
5.0% yellow with a quickly disappearing head, faint sweet hop aroma, slight malt taste, the archetypical British lager, not for me.
Pours a golden colour with almost no head. light hops in the aroma flavour is crisp smooth little sweet and very mild bitterness

25cl bouteille. Cette lager reste probablement l’une des meilleures bières pour ce qui est de se désaltérer, mais ne m’a jamais impressionnée par ses saveurs : au-delà de sa sympathique et légère amertume, et de ses malts à peine touraillés, pas de gros caractère. Appréciable pour la conso de tous les jours.

When 2pac wrote "heineken is a top fucken beer." he expressed in profane excitement his complete and utter satisfaction with and strong preference for the beer. 

My Heineken sampling is from a 24oz can, a can with a lot of odd raised texture on it. I don’t know about this can, back in my day Heineken came in a can that looked like a keg, that was a righteous design right there, and better than this odd textured can. 

The Heineken pours a very fucken pale yellow color with an enormous tight white head that leaves some lacing on the glass. 



The aroma is lots of perfume and sweet grainyness. It really is quite a pungent beer, but it’s pungent in a brash and unappetizing way. 



The flavor is clean & sweet. The beer is lightly fruity and has some raw graininess. I think it might just be the sweetness and the maltiness playing a trick on me but something about this seems sort of chocolaty in a faint and odd way.  Generally the beer is very sort of perfumy tasting as well. 



I don’t think that this is one of my top fucken beers.
This beee is a work of art. A beautiful lager best enjoyed cold and fizzy. Slight hop bite. Excellent. Everything a beer should be.

Draft pint. Straw yellow, thin white head. Almost no smell. Somewhat herbal taste, slight bitterness. Very strong carbonation, I remembered Heineken to be way tastier than that, I was highly disappointed...
piss.  i only drink it when offered to not be rude.  i’d rather have a Bud Light.  skunky smell, off flavors.  watered down.  the worst beer from Europe.

Pours a clear gold with a thin white head mostly dissipating. Nose is mostly hops. Not real creamy on the palate - fairly thin viscosity.  Flavor is of pilsner lager - fairly well balanced but no real distinguishing taste. Surprised this one is as popular as it is.

12oz bottle and take home keg from my father in law.
Pale yellow with very little head.  Aromas of burnt grain, skunk, and corn.  Flavor is extremely corny and skunky.  Some metallic off flavors.  Perfect example of why I don’t like Pale Lagers.

Little tiny can some pilot left at the hotel I work at. Limited edition can, nice! Pours light golde yellow with small white head. Sweet grainy malt aroma with some honey and straw note. Flavor much the same, much less skunky than the Heineken in used to. Sweet honey grain note some bits bread with a lightly bitter crisp finish. Light to medium body and sharp carbonation
Bottle - small foamy head, pale straw color, thick mouth feel, malty flavor with mild hops - kind of weird texture/taste combination
Una de las lagers más famosas del mundo, suave al paladar y refrescante, no es una cervezapara degustar pero si para disfrutar con ella en compañia.

Pours a pale straw yellow with a short lived white foam. Aroma is grass, skunk, and sweet malt. Flavor is your typical euro-lager. Hop flavors are greatly diminished and tend toward the grassy side, but more flavorful than a typical American macro. Ever present is the slight skunk flavor. Not an abomination, but not my thing.
This was my first "go to " beer. It’s not bad, but a tad boring.  Can or draft is the way to go, the bottles are just too unreliable for me to risk.

Recently had this in a can, and for the first time, it was drinkable. Every time I have tasted this from a bottle, it has been consistently skunky. I avoid this at all costs unless I can get it in a can. If they used dark glass, the skunkiness would probably be less a problem.

On tap, two pints. Clear straw yellow with small white head that recedes quickly, exactly what you’d expect from from a macro beer. Aroma is moslty cereal, honey malts with and "choice hops". Nothing interesting but I didn’t get the overly skunked notes from the bottle version. Taste is very refreshing, some citrus and light hop presence. The malt is a little akward but still a nice thirst quencher in a restaurant with exclusive macro selection, way more drinkable than the bottle version.
Overall a good beer, what I like to call ole reliable.  Goes down well, nice and smooth.
Great marketing, not so great beer. Taste is different in every country. Like the brand tho

My "go to" beer at work related "parties." Seems like the choices are always between this, Bud Light, Miller Lite, and maybe Corona. I don’t consider Bud and Miller to be drinkable, so if it wasn’t for Heine - I would be ordering iced tea or water. Thank you Heineken for being servicable...
Not a spectacular beer, but good for a pale lager. Better than Labatt or Molson, that’s for sure.

there is not that much aroma to be detected, a faint malty aroma is followed but some lagerish hops. looks very standard. the taste is very flat and minimal with not much flavour, works well for mass consumption if that is what you want. the easy drinkability and minimal aroma and taste works well for "getting drunk", much better than most of the others standard lagers out there.
not much to write about here....pale yellow color...slightly skunky in smell.

Ne jamais prendre en bouteille verte!  Le goût de moufettes y est un des plus fort que vous pouvez trouver.  En canette, c’est une bière quelconque, très surévalué.  Une molson dry un peu plus houblonné.
Bottle.  Medium carbonation.  Strong hoppy nose, although more muted hoppy taste on the palate, with mildly bitter finish.  Classic, unmistakable flavor; you either like it or you don’t.
Heinekken tap @ Bordeaux airport. Light Golden clear. One finger foam. Faint cereal an hoppy aromas. Quite bitter.
Decent mainstream beer, bitter floral tones, not much flavor really. A good thirstquencher on a hot day.
Bland; functional; don’t particularly like the taste - esp. the finish; marketing may be excellent; the beer is average at best.

Heineken out of a can. I firmly believe a can effects the taste of beer, I think it makes beer more sour tasting and slightly metallic. Anyway on to the rapport.
Aroma: Not much in this beer. Heineken is watery above all and it has very little hop taste. Their’s practically no bitterness compared to other beers. 
Appearance: Pale, blonde beer, leaves a white head which dissipated quickly. 


Palate:  Small tiny bubbles fizzling on the tongue. I like these tiny bubbles.


Taste: Slightly watery, feint sourness from the bubbles, not sweet. The bitterness off the hops is only in the aftertaste. The aftertaste is bitter but short lasting, it has no ZANG to it like other beers do.


Overall: lol, I dislike Heineken, it’s a pale watery boring beer. The lack of a distinct hop taste make this one of the worst pilsners. It’s a shame this is such a big brand. 

It might be better then budweiser or something but I disagree that this is one of the better "party beers".
bottle from everywhere. Thin head and texture. Golden appearance. Corn/cereal aroma. Low bitterness and medium carbonation.

Can.  Pours pale golden with a smallish white head.  Aroma and flavor are grainy, some pilsner-style hops, a bit of sourness -- always has that characteristic Heineken tang.  I’d call it skunkiness...
A mass marketed pale lager that is actually leagues above some of its competition.
This beer is the choice of the masses in NZ, and for the life of me I have no idea why.  Wet cardboard on the nose, this beer is very easy to drink as there is not much to it.
better then most out there like bud and carslberg etc low alcohol vol tho leads me to drink several cases at a time
the better of the so called "party beers’ if you ask me. i’ll always enjoy this over a bud or coors.
sono stato generoso..l’ultima volta che l’ho bevuta sono stato male !!!!!!!

Decent aroma for a "party beer", though the effect was ruined for me by the slight hint of skunk odor. The head was tiny but retained decently. The taste was so wildly unbalanced that it was almost funny trying to figure out where it would go next (it was as if sweet and bitter were waging an epic war for control of my taste buds). Very thin texture.
Descent lager that you can find almost EVERYWHERE in the world. Not bad for parties, concerts, football matches etc. But you can find many many more lagers that are a lot better.

Not sure if this is even worth my time. Aroma is decent, has that skunk-appeal which I like. Can’t really taste any distinctive notes in this beer. I always seem to find a Heineken at a party or sporting event, and compaired to Miller Lite or Bud Light, it truely is the better alternative.

12oz bottle.  I used to drink this when I turned 21 and wasn’t involved in craft beer.  It’s a pale, dank lager that offers little flavor and a palate that is filled with bitter shat.  Really nothing good about this beer simply put, you either love or hate this beer.

Twelve ounce bottle from six pack that was a Valentine’s Day 2011 gift from Mrs. Drjohnrock.  Pale yellow color with good clarity, small white head that mostly lasted and left some lacing, sweet, malty but skunky aroma--that green bottle syndrome, you know--bitter, sour, astringent flavor.  This might have been old--I don’t remember Heineken being quite so bad in the past.  But trying it again to give it a second chance is close to dead last on my beer priorities list.
olor leve a malta y al paladar bastante neutra,a veces cuando me estoy muriendo de la sed saco una del refrigerador y me refresca el paladar
Golden, clear lager. Lasting white head. Malty sweet aroma. Thin malty sweet flavour (maize?). Short bitterness. Not impressive.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mrMM__vK6_8



Appearance: Transparent gold, ½-finger head, average lacing



Smell: Light skunk from pour, dog food, stale lemon, breadiness, grassiness, biscuit notes



Taste: Medium body, fresh tennis ball, bready malts, butter biscuit, lemon rind, earthiness, hint of stainless steal sweetness + grapefruit, crisp, medium carbonation



Pairings: Bratwurst
You can find this one in a typical warehouse between the waters - The dutch answer to sparkling water - taste of piss in the evening

A flavorless lager. This beer always seems to be skunked everytime I try it whether at the bar or a friends house, but I finally tried it on tap (the alternative was Tiger) in China where Heineken seems pretty big. It poured very clear with quite a bit of carbonation and little head. It tasted very slightly of malt and had a bitter hop finish. My palate was not able to discern much else.
A so so pale ale. Pours a watery gold with a fizzy white head. The nose and taste are of light mellow hops, hay and pale malts.

Heineken is pretty boring.  Malty and crisp on the nose.  Clean flavor.  There is a slight corn flavor in there.  Nice palate.  Heineken is what you drink when the rest of the options are Bud Light or Miller Light.  A step above those, but still not great.

Heineken is ok, but I only drink it when it’s on special or is the only beer available.  Its color is pale.  Its liquidity is clear and it carries a minimal head.  The flavor is medium sour with a light bitter kick.  Very carbonated.  There are plenty of beers I’d otherwise choose before this one.  I do think the keg can is creative, though.
Weak pine aroma. Weak grassy-lemon flavor. Not much happening here, but there are limited opportunities at 36,000 feet.

I went to the factory in Amsterdam - was awesome

Got a free base ball cap.

Top stuff
Bottled here in Australia. Terrible. there’s little to nothing to savour.  The colour looks strange and carbonation is fake. I  wouldn’t ever drink another.

Poured from bottle into nucleated pint glass. Pretty average pale lager fare, but I do appreciate Heineken’s 100% barley malt recipe. Most macro-breweries cheat with corn, rice, or other adjunct sugars. Heineken also claims to use a proprietary yeast strain distinct from the one used by almost every other lager brewery, and I’m pretty sure I can taste that. I can sometimes detect a minor "skunkiness" that other reviewers observe, but not always. People say it’s because the hops go bad in the light green bottle. Maybe, but I suspect it has less to do with ingredients and more to do with an industrial-scale brewing process and lengthy, non-climate-controlled import process. It’s still better than many pale lagers made here. I love Holland. I love the bottle design. I love the grocery store mini-keg concept. I want to love the beer more than I do. Their dark lager is better.
It’s just like the other big brands lager Bud...Miller.....and all the other macro’s.. Nothing special.

Draught @ JC Sjiwa, Baarlo.

Clear pale golden colour with small head. Aroma of grass and malts, flavour is the same. Light-bodied, medium carbonation and easy to drink.

2413

Bottle.  Pours clear, fizzy yellow/gold, with a small white head.  Aromas of stale malt and skunk.  Similar flavor, unfortunately with skunk notes as well.  I used to be able to drink this, but it’s just bad.  I’d rather not have a beer at all than have this.  [825]

In my younger beer snob days I used to hate this. And the old watered down version for the UK market was certainly grim. But, I have to say, these days I don’t mind a Heineken (fresh on tap, or canned, that is). Obviously looks ok, rich golden lager. Taste is strong, sweet boozy malty, with enough hops to give bitterness and a hint of flavour. It is quite satisfying. Maybe I have started appreciating ’premium lager’ more, but unlike say Stella or 1664 this is actually an ok pint. So there!
Light golden. Pale nonforthcoming taste. Disappointing stuff all the way. Just what you expect.
Bottle, pours clear straw w/ semi -dense white head, aroma of fermented rice and light skunk, light and clean w/ lightly nutty fermented adjunc on finish, finishes clean, could be worse
Pretty bitter lager. Really only as popular as it is because it is so easy to drink (a lot) of it and because it is refreshing (e.g. in warm weather). Both of course because of the bitterness.

Golden with small white head. Aroma is subdued light malts and faint grassy hops. Flavor is sweet, very streamlined, with a light non-distinct bitter hop finish. Drinkable, but no real charachter. To avoid.

Of the macro brews, Heineken is one of those at the top of the list for me.  It pours up a vibrant pale amber body and a nice foamy head that dissipates quickly and then tends to leave good lacing on the sides of the glass.  The aroma is just as I remember from over the years, very clean and possesses a slight hoppy hit.  Flavors of hops and just a tad of sweet malt; there’s also somewhat of a lemon grass flavor floating around here and there.  Very easy to drink and makes for a suitable session brew from a macro-brewery.

From a twelve ounce green bottle that was, luckily, noy skunky - Alright, I can hardly believe that I haven’t rated this heavy, bitter, most common example of Eurolager before! Alright, it poured a fizzy, golden brew into my cup with a tall white head of foam and a hoppy, breadlike aroma. Tastewise, it is bitter, but not as terrible as some others have rated it. Better than BMC crap, anyway!

355ml bottle from the Olive Garden, Bangor, Maine, poured into a glass. Aroma was sweet malts and a little skunk. Poured a medium yellow with a kind of orange or brown hue, one finger of fizzy head that vanished quickly. Taste was sweet grainy malts, a little skunk and I think I might have found some hops on the finish. Body was light to medium. Not watery, just kind of crisp. Overall, it is a pretty standard lager (like anyone didn’t know that), nothing brilliant but nothing offensive. Good enough to clear the palate at a meal.

Pours golden, urine appearance, very clear. Not much of an aroma, a tad malty and grassy. Taste is grass and water,lots of carbonation.makes me remember why I hate most macros,no body,no depth,no flavor. Avoid.
Not much to this beer.  Grassy hay like stale flavor.  Bitter finish.  Highly carbonated.
too light a beer and too sweet...taste more like a ladys drink. suitable for casual seeping if have time to spare
Served in a glass. Another beer which is very difficult to write something new. Large white head, golden colour with malty aroma. No more..., almost she is fresh.
Tap @ The Beach, RAI, Amsterdam 11/09/11. Pours clear, golden with a large, white head. Aroma is grain with a slight malt character. Taste is a bit of straw, grain, hint of malt. Palate is watery.

Serving glass: Poured from can into clear plastic cup.

Appearance: Pale yellow with stark white head that quickly disappears.

Aroma: Very grainy, corn syrupy sweet, light spiciness. Most of the smell dissipates, leaving sweet grains behind.

Taste: Sweet and grainy - seems as if there are adjuncts but I know there are not. Light spiciness at the end.

Palate: High carbonation, light body that seems very thin, even for a Pale Lager.

Overall: Okay ice cold but becomes borderline undrinkable as it warms, even to 40 degrees.
Gele heldere kleur, proeft bijna geen hop en is een bitter biertje. Wel hebben ze een leuke reclame.

I had what I deemed to be a "fresh" bottle.  I poured it into a pint glass.  The bottle came straight from a cardboard case where light damage would have been minimized.  It didn’t have that skunky taste I always associate with Heineken.  It was actually fine with a slight caramel flavor at the end.  Still not very complex, still not a beer I’d be running to as a daily drink, but much better than I remember or would expect.

tall can@outside: almost agreeable if it is ice-cold but that is only because you can only taste the cold, watery, slight hop bitterness in the end, otherwise it has a very slight malt sweetness to it, rather bland & lot less worse than I expected it to be, drinkable actually, mostly because it doesn’t have all that much going on, still better than most of others of its ilk
Helder goudkleurig pils met witte kraag. Zit erg weinig smaak aan en is erg waterig. Maar op sommige momenten kan dat juist wel lekker zijn, vooral op feestjes waar je lekker door drinkt.
Can 33 cl from white plastic glass. Much head, golden. nose with fruity hay. Medium body and short. ´Taste is dryish with a little unpleasant artificial sugary tone.

I’m old enough to remember when people in the US considered Heineken and Michelob to be "premium beers"  (a.k.a, the Dark Times).  I don’t think I’ve ever had a bottle that wasn’t skunked beyond recognition.  I’ll take a Bud Light any day--at least I’m cutting down on the empty calories.   I can only assume they stay in business due to reputation and advertising.

had one of the suckers at the wedding this weekend. its funny because i always grew up thinking heineken was this awesome beer made in the netherlands and that cool people drank it.  stupid tv commercials, occasionally they work.  anyway, i drank a bunch of this swill when i was 20 and 21 and thought it was cool.  then i had my first hop rod rye and the rest is history.  Drinkable at a wedding and when given limited options.

pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, thin feel, fizzy, 
Bottled. Nothing too say. No taste, at least she’s fresh.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.

Bottle. Pours a very light golden with a medium head quickly dissipating almost no head. Fairly decent aroma of bread, dough, earthy. Taste is carbonated water with a few hops and a tablespoon of sugar. It would be a fine session beer if someone else was buying. Thin body, medium-high carbonation, abrupt finish. Not the worst, not good either.
Along with stella one of the most overrated beers on the planet. Overall profile very bland. Not worst patio sipper out there, but nothing to get worked up about either.
Part of what puts this above Bud for me is a distinct memory tied to the aroma. It is distinct enough to take me back to New Orleans before Katrina
On tap at Boston Pizza Steinbach, served ice cold. Slight bready sweet aroma. Taste is touch of bread and hops, but very little. Watery.
Not great lager by any means. Doesn’t mean I don’t like sipping on it every once in a while. Well over rated and priced.
Draft in a pint glass. Pours pale yellow in color and has little white head. Aroma and taste are weak. Goes down smooth and leaves a slightly filmy feel. As basic as it gets.
despite this being readily available everywhere in the world it is nice and refreshing when you get a nice cold pint. Saying that I wouldnt go out of my way to get one.

Date: August 4, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Miller Brew House, Milwaukee, WI Airport.  Got it free at the club louge so why not.  Very pale golden, light watery, carbonated, not much aroma or taste, but better than most macros.

November 16, 2017 - on tap at the KLM lounge in Amsterdam, interesting as last time I had this was also in an airport lounge.  Aroma was grainy and sweet malt.  Taste was the same with a very mild bitterness.  Bumped up my rating from 1.2 to 1.9.
hay, citrus, basement aromas, earthy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel,
earthy, barnyard, pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter,

Long Island, NY @ Tiki Hookah Lounge - As usual when it comes to commercial import beers I prefer Heineken. My 12 oz. was extremely cold the way a Heineken should be.  Aroma had a bit of hops and mild sweetness. Taste was of hops and ended with a sweet note.  In my opinion still the best option when it comes to commercial imports.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very basic lager from a very big brewery but this one has some bitter flavour to it which I like.

very good brand name, nice bottles and logo
but a very big group brand beer, I have enjoyed it several time.
Grattis är gott? Fick denna på ett KLM-flyg. Ljust klassiskt pilsnergul med vitt skum. Söt doft med lite hö och majs. Ganska tunn med inte så mycket smak. Lätt metallisk på slutet.
Taste from bottle. Clear blond coloured beer with small white head and no carbonaiton. Herby aroma. Wattery slightly sparkling palate. Finish is sweet bit herby. Not good.
dont understand the low scores from other but this is bar far the lager of choice on a hot bbq afternoon or watch the football

Terrible.  I still think that it’s funny when people tell me that this is a dark or strong beer.  Pours light golden.  Aroma is of skunk, malts, and corn.  Flavor is the same.  Watered down and overly carbonated.  Nothing at all special about this.  The only good thing about this is that those who like it will stay away from the real beers.  And that means more of them for me.

I put this brew in the same class as Bud...Miller.....and all the other macro’s. Not worth my time or effort. Never did understand this one’s allure and it always has one note I taste if I have to imbibe one....skunky.

Lightly golden, clear body with white head. Fizzy body. Metallic, grainy, hay and cornflakes. Light bitter body and a generic review for a generic beer, although there’s much worse out there. (33cl bottle)

The horror... the horror... has very often been the worst enemy of a good evening out. It’s bitter taste is not as heavy as the dutch comptetitor Grolsch but the add of the incredible watery taste makes it a horrible experience.

Alright, really.  The problem with Heineken isn’t that the taste is necessarily bad, just that it costs more than its worth in most places as  an import.  Generally unoffensive however and a touch better than many macro breweries.
Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma and flavor are just malts. Not that much character. Boring.

had this out of a can on the airplane due to no better options.  It had actually been a long time since I had had one.  Aroma is of corn, and lightly starchy.  There is a slight inner tube aspect, but not as off-putting as I remembered - maybe the can keeps it fresher than the bottles I used to drink.  Body is light and watery but has more body than an american light lager.  Flavor was very bland, but I surprisingly found it unoffensive.  For the price there are much better domestic options, but its really not terrible.

Pours a pale yellow with a white fizzy head, not terrible but not good. I took a whiff of this and it was like sticking my nose in the rear end of a skunk, just awful. The taste was even worse, if I may quote the Angry Video Game Nerd it’s like eating the rotten asshole of a roadkill skunk then downing it with beer. The palate is bad too, it’s thin and overcarbonated, quite bad. Overall this is the unholy grail of beer IMO, it tastes like skunk, it attracts douches and that damn song is still stuck in my head!
500ml can. Pale yellow pour. Aroma of sour grains and a little skun. Taste is thin astringent grains and bready malts. Not very good.

Bottle- Pours a pale yellow with a small head that fades quickly and minimal lacing. Light aroma of grain. No skunk detected. Tastes sort of like bread and some malt sweetness. slightly bitter finish. Light body crisp clean and quite smooth. Nice balance. This used to be my go to beer when traveling thru Dakar and Kampala in Africa as well the numerous places is S.E.Asia. This was always good for a few and still is.

In the South of The Netherlands we drink Bavaria, and Heineken being the main brewer from the North, these two are harsh rivals. Therefore a lot of Dutch raters from the South might not be entirely objective about this beer:P Although I read some pretty ’destroying’ comments from raters from other countries, I’ve tried to stay objective. But honestly, it’s just another massproduced pilsener. Nothing special, nothing you’ve missed if you haven’t tasted it before. Ending my comment like a worthy Dutchman from the South I have to say: Bavaria tastes better;)

330ml bottle.  Awful.  Words cannot describe how ashamed I am to be European after drinking this piss.  Unpleasant skunk aroma, unpleasant skunk taste, unpleasantly thin body and those are the good points.

Can, poured at 36000 ft and traveling at 493 km/h. Unfortunately neither speed nor height could make this beer good. Pale yellow with a generous white head. Sweet corn macro smell, thin, sweet, mild carbonation, bit dry on the finish but that’s about it.

I always find it funny when people at a bar/restaurant insist on paying more for this import. Just becuase it’s from another country doesn’t mean it’s better,and this stuff is pretty terrible. Almost everytime I’ve had one of these it has been skunked: smelled skunky, tasted skunky and sour...makes me nauseous just thinking about it.
Just a cheap and nasty tasting beer tried once would never buy it ever again.
I hate this beer. It’s the budlight of beer from Holland. If this is the only thing in the store, then find a new store.

can - pours a clear orange tinged gold with 2 fingers of head. Aroma is light but I’m getting some floral notes. Taste is a little bitter, but it is so watery and then that it’s hard to even count that. It just so bland that I would rather drink ice water. And that’s my Holland beer tick.

Schnell verflüchtigt sich die Schaumkrone auf dem blass-gelben Heineken. 
Die Nase versucht im schwachen Geruch noch etwas Ungewöhnliches zu erahnen, was aber fehlschlägt. 
Der Antrunk ist genauso nichtssagend. Mitte und Abgang sind gekennzeichnet durch leichten Hopfen. 
Heineken ist ein dünnes Massenprodukt mit ausnivelliertem Geschmack im negativen Sinne. 
Schnell austrinken und auf ein Bier mit Charakter wechseln.Test vom 8.10.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche
500ml can.  Pours light gold with a small frothy head.  Aroma is sweet grass and corn.  Taste is faint, grassy, touches of corn.
Bottle. Pour clear straw yellow with a soapy white head. Aroma sweet slinky funky malt and grass. Taste more the same with a thin watery dry finish. Blah...
Light body and texture, hopy taste. An easy to drink beer but far from being exciting,
Straw yellow,  a bit of white head. Nose of metal, fruits - pineapple, corn. Watery feel. No taste at first. Then some aroma of apple and metal. Drinkable, but not much taste in it.

As far as pale lagers go, you could do worse.  You could do better...I mean, A LOT better...but you could also do worse.  Pours straw, head is small but present, and will go away as soon as you divert your attention elsewhere.  Aroma is hay and bread, a hint of grass hops is barely perceptible.  Flavor suits nose, if not somewhat more watery.  Carbonation is a bit too much, and the light body somehow manages to be overly filling.

In my dark past, i.e. my pale-lager-from-macro-breweries drinking days, I didn’t really like Heineken. I thought it was too bitter and not easy enough to drink… I haven’t had a Heineken for many years, and the past months I have given my palate some serious exercise, so here we go again! It pours a pretty standard pale lager body, with a small white head and all. Fair lacing. The aroma is once again pretty standard, but in addition to faint sweet malts and even fainter hops, I also get some unpleasant sour notes? The taste is light sweet and light bitter, not that bad, actually. No off-flavours. Lively carbonation. This is actually not a very bad beer. For a pale lager, that is.  


[33 cl bottle, 4.6%, from Kiwi, Valle, Oslo]
Surprisingly, it’s not one of my favorite beers.  I think that for beers at this price level, there are many more that are of better quality.  Yet overall, not a bad beer.
Draft, Den Haag.  Usual lager appearance and lack of aroma.  Flavour is equally bland.  It doesn’t taste bad, it’s just bland.

The first beer I ever paid $9 for (damn Vegas clubs).  I’ve never actually enjoyed drinking Heineken, but I always enjoy that first whiff.  Much like Amstel Light, the first aroma out of a freshly cracked bottle is all pine and another (an unmentionable) kind of plant.  Taste, appearance and palate are all underwhelming.  Might be good if you’re somewhere without a real beer in the house, otherwise no, no, no.
Mild herber Antrunk, frisch, wenig aromatisch. Hopfen ist kaum erkennbar, dafür wird die Herbe noch etwas intensiver. Zum Ende trocken, wenig bitterer und kurzer Nachgeschmack. 6/8/9/7/7/7

It’s almost a burden for me to drink an entire bottle of it, which I’d only do if I were really, really thirsty and this were the only drink around me (and it were really cold). This is far from offensive, but far from good as well.

12oz can on delta airplane en route to paris, rated from notes. Highly carbonated, quick finish. Yeasty, but mostly watery aroma. decent complement to in flight meal, but got hard to finish half way through.  Not very pleasant
With little aroma or taste Heineken has to count on the perfect pour up to the star and the water socked cut of the froth of head to finish her off.

Can while camping. Light yellow with a foamy white head. Light grain, slight floral hop, and a bit of sweetness. Taste is much sweeter, with honey, tons of grain, a little skunkiness, and next to no hop presence. Very forgettable.
alcohol, golden, sparkling, white foam, medium bitterness, average carbonation, It’s a mistery how this beer is so popular, this is one of the worst light golden beers.
Clear yellow almost without head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and light hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Watery and light bodied. 141009

Pours a clear and faint hazy green. The head is bubbly with sloppy lacing. Aromas are dry and bitter, of hops and sort of metallic (botte AND can). The taste is refreshing and simultaneously bland. Tis of bitter hops and light malts that provide an unbalanced lager, very bitter and nothing to revive it. Not a great example of a pale lager.

Draught at Modos. Pours golden yellow with lots of bubbles and virtually no head. The nose is of nut much but there is sweetcorn and a tiny bit of pale malt. The taste is of more sweetcorn and some faint grassiness on the end. The palate is thin in structure, thin in texture and not actually that refreshing! Overall, won’t be hurrying back!
Not bad... Not good. Really its in between those two just like every other mainstream pale lager
Bit sweet, not too bitter pils beer. Golden with a white head. About the standard for pils when you go to party.
One of the worst industrial lagers I´ve ever taste. Absolutely nothing remarquable
Pours clear yellow with a white head.  It looks like water, tastes like a mellow lager, and a few hops.  Somewhat malty with a lingering lager finish.
Don’t really understand why so many people like it. Even as a lager it’s nothing special (of course, it’s not bad - just not very good...).
La Heineken que todos conocemos. La "rubia" por excelencia (más por marketing que por otra cosa). Una cerveza holandesa de gran consumo sin más.

Tu viens de terminer ta partie de hockey et tu t’en vas en prendre une avec les boys.  T’as le gout d’une couple de p’tites frettes mais t’as pas le goût que les gens s’en prenne à ton manque de finesse.  Ça fait que tu te call une Heineken.  Ses principales qualités: être froide, désaltérante et être plus cher qu’une Coors...
Un gars averti en vaut deux.

At one time this used to be the most popular import in the country.  It’s still in the top 10 beers sold in the country.  It definitely has the name, but now that I tasted many other imports and craft beers, I have to re think this beer.  It’s an ok beer at best.  Little color, more of a corn aroma and a metallic finish.  Not one that I am seeking in the future.

Bière parfaitement limpide, coiffée d’une mousse blanche assez peu durable.  Des arômes houblonés d’herbes et de musk, la signature Heineken.  Légèrement amère.  Bière légère, à la texture lisse et à la vive effervescence.  En bouche, elle offre une fin arômatique assez rapide.
On tap at the airportt. Poured a clean yellow and looked just like a beer. Taste like dry corn and was fizzy. A refreshing beer that just laked much flavor. Hope I’m never forced to drink it again.
Straw golden yellow white head. Aroma adjunct corn cereal grain light grassy note. Taste adjunct cereal quite sweet overall grassy. Thin weak body meh carb. Avg at best drinkable if no other options.

Can 500ml @ Otra

Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, corn and grain. Taste is light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Pale yellow color with a thin white head.  Smell and tastes of sweet metal.  Also, kind of tastes like skunky weed but the beer is new.
I remember thinking this was high class stuff when I was a kid.  It is downright awful.  Little color, corn aroma and a metallic finish for taste.

Pale yellow, firm white head. Aroma of malts, grass and hops. Taste is fresh, crisp, some sweetness, some hop bitterness. Rather thin, not lasting long, but refreshing. Sweetness is the predominant lingering taste.
Not very flavourful. It’s main virtue seems to be that it’s drinkable if you dislike all other options. Not my kind of beer, but as a sales strategy it seems to be working well. (rating from tap, at ’s Hertogenbosch factory -NLs)

Kinda has a nasty aroma to it, I’d recommend it to people that have no sense of smell, its a yellow straw colored lager with small amounts of palate, lacks carbonation to me and the taste isn’t really worth the money, this beer doesn’t have much going for it to me.

My beer of choice, next to Palm, when I want to get a sixpack of relatively good swill. Slightly sweeter than for example Grolsch, but it’s a guilty pleasure that I actually like this. Might also be because I live 2 blocks from the Heineken Experience.

Can. Pours yellow with a pillowy, white head. Smells metallic with overtones of toast, grain, and funky citrus/vinegar. Taste is nothing special, but it’s not overly offensive, either -- there is actually some bitterness, and it’s drinking pretty decent after a day of house and yard work. It’ll work in a pinch.

On tap everywhere in the UK. Pours pale straw coloured, Clear in the glass. Lots of carbonation and lacing. Nose is very subtle. Bit of sweetness, but mainly sour citrous. Taste is overwhelmed by the carbonation. Then it’s sours coming through and not enough hops or malt to give it enough character. Hmmm. I remember even when I was an uneducated Euro lager drinker I used to avoid this for exactly these reasons. Not enough flavour and dominated by sours and carbonation.
Never put beer in a green bottle. Home brewing 101. Skunky taste. Skunky smell. Not even one burp. Icky!

Reviewed from notes.

Served in a pint glass. Pours is a clear golden color with plenty of visible carbonation and a white head. The nose is quite a bit of skunked hops plus some grain. The hops are definitely skunked and a bit grassy. Some very light grain. Skunky hops somehow fit this brew like they don’t with any other; maybe I’m just used to it. Really not all the great. Crisp and light. I really don’t like this and can’t suffer through it any longer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

Heineken is one mass produced beer which is so average that you cannot like it or dislike it. Although the new released Ellipse glass serie makes it look irrestible. Like a guest at the bar once said to me; Heineken is like sex on a boat... it’s f....ng close to water.
Bottle.  Pale yellow pour, white head.  Nose and taste have a strange detergent character that turns me off every time I try one of these.  Really not enjoyable.

On-Tap (Pint): Light straw in appearance with a finger sized, white head that lasts fairly well with some bubbles rising to the surface. Standard in taste & smell for a pale lager & slightly skunky. It is watery & light bodied. Nothing more than your standard session beer.

More at:
/
Golden color with small white head. Almost no aroma, maybe some grain. Taste, bittersweet, maybe again grain.
33cl can left over after a party.Pale golden lager.  Decent head.  Crap mass market bland lager
No head or lace, slightly darker than expected, pleasant lager flavor (comparable to Yuengling), yeasty aroma

Very plain. Sometimes the only choice in some restaurants aside from BMC family. Looks, tastes, and feels like your average mass produced pale lager except the taste is extra skunky and a little metalic for me. Nothing impressive.
Not much taste and a rather similar scent to most beers. Has a light and crisp mouth feel, enjoyed it out in the sun.
The standard of mediocracy. It has many clones throughout the world. Drink it once, move on.
Pale average lager. It does a decent job as a beer, but don’t expect any taste sensation.
This is no longer the beer I remember from my youth.I drink it now and there really isnt anything interesting going on.I think I’ll stay away from this

This beer is good for someone whos just getting into the beer world.  The flavor isn’t too overpowering and there isn’t a bitter after taste. Overall its a decent beer, but for the price there are better options out there.
Light brew, a little malty, usually skunky, but really not that bad of a beer, just a little uninteresting.

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a clear light golden colour with modest-sized white head.  Aroma is sweet, stale cereal grains and not much else.  Taste has a fruity hint but also dominated by sweet, stale grains.  A touch metallic.  Nothing remotely special.

New Zealand brewed. Was given a bottle at the party and was too polite to reject. Aroma of cereals, faint green hops, carboard, sulfur. Taste of cereals grain, quite prominent hoppiness, grassy and metallic. Bad artificial aftertaste, like after chewing on a piece of phenolic plastic.
LEt’s face it, it is a macro beer, if you find it in the can, on tap, or in the minikeg you’’ notice it is a decent, but not spectacular beer.
This is probably because I’m just not a fan of the pale lager but this beer mostly tastes like water, smells like water and looks like brown water.
500ml can. Normal foam but watery body. This beer is sweet with a hoppy aftertaste and beside these a papery aroma has the hungarian version for me. Not good but quite expensive. :)

This beer taste like a dead skunk
How can people really drink this beer
sad sad sad beer
A good lager. It isn’t for nothing that it is the worlds most sold bottled beer. There is nothing remarkable to find. But there are neither any flaws that are obvious. It’s a beer.
Tastes like weed.  I can drink like fifteen of these sumbitches.  They’re great when I’m too drunk and stoned to enjoy a real beer.

From a 330ml bottle on 28/1/2011 (from a mini bar at the Windsor Hotel, Melbourne). Brewed under licence in Australia. Minor aroma of malt and a touch of pear. In the mouth, it’s clean with some mild citrus tang, with a decent hop presence. I actually enjoyed this a little more than I thought I would.

Can courtesy of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines. Aroma of hops, grass & vegetable. Clear light golden yellow colour. Vegetable, hop & resin flavour. Unpleasant aftertaste. Probably not the best lager in the world.
Not much to say that hasn’t been said already. Better than other beer choices for the train home after work, but other than that, you won’t find me picking up any six packs.
Ugh. Not a good beer. I think this tastes more likes a yeasty carbonated beer with some hoppiness that gives it its ’bitterness.’
A good lager. It isn’t for nothing that it is the worlds most sold bottled beer. There is nothing remarkable to find. But there are neither any flaws that are obvious. It’s a beer.

This isn’t a beer that I would normally buy myself, but I wouldn’t mind it if someone sent one my way, if I was feeling particularly upbeat that day. Today, however, I felt like a beer and this was the best stuff at the corner store, so here goes a review.

The taste is pretty standard for this type of drink. The best thing I can say about it is that it has less flavor than Miller, Coors, Bud, etc, and therefore has less about it to dislike. 

For the same or lesser price, there are a lot of better drinks.
Pale gold with a decent head. Straw-like nose. Smooth intro with a soft palate and a lightly bitter finish. Not quite as good as having it in Amsterdam.
served in twelve ounce green glass bottle, not the best taste for any type of beer, may cause health problems

Bottle.  Clearish yellow with medium head.  Aroma hay and skunk.  Light body with oily texture, small carbonation.  I’d try to describe some other flavors but whenever I’ve had this beer it’s been dominated by skunkiness.  No good.
pours clear pale yellow with a small head, no retention. grainy, slightly fruity, but above all skunky. it’s just not good.

bottle poured a light golden in color with a thin covering of white head that fell away quickly. aroma has light malt, grains, and a bit of skunk hops.mouth feel is light and there is plenty of carbonation. flavor is typical for a lager, light bitterness, some skunk, and an overall crispness. better than past memories and flavorful for the style.

33 cl bottle from a local supermarket. It pours a clear golden liquid with medium white froth. The aroma is very hoppy when poured, gaining a little maltiness then. The taste is a light balanced mix of hops and malt, very much like the aroma. It feels watery and a little too fizzy. It ends lightly bitter. Drinkable lager, and a good one for parties either on tap or bottled, as it has a very standard taste. It tastes almost the same if you drink it directly from the bottle. Nice bottle and crowncap, and occasional special editions.
a very common pilsen taste, nothing special, low carbonation, doesn’t make a nice head and its slightly sweet taste and aroma are not an invitation for more. Pale color.
Lascio decisamente bere questa birra a chi guarda la champion’s league... almeno li disseta...
Golden beer with small white head.Grass,sweet malt,citrus,bitter.Ok beer nothing bad nothing good.Refreshing beer for the hot summers.

This rating is based in an overall experience with Heineken (Brazilian, Argentinian and Dutch versions), but specially the Dutch one. A very simple but not offensive lager. Some bitterness, malts and a distinct estery flavour. The Argentinian version is more similar to the Dutch than the Brazilian one, and both are still a lot better then the  average industrial pale lagers available in these countries.

Can 500ml, 4.7% alc version by Hansa Borg Breweries for the Norwegian market. Pours clear light yellow with white head. Aroma is grassy, hint of citrus. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Watery, soft carbonation.
Flaske 33 cl.  Farve strå gul hælde, med et medium hvidt hovede.  Aroma af humle med noter af græs. Smagen er mild og virker sprød,. Alt i alt  en forfriskende nem drikkelig øl

My wife bought me a can because she saw me drink it recently at a party. Aroma is slight hay with a hint of alcohol. Pours clear, pale golden, white head that quickly attenuates. Taste is a bit sour. Body is light, texture is thin. Overall...I didn’t bother finishing this beer. The finish became unbearably tart, or....well, ungood.
Clear golden beer with a fine diminutive head. Bitter aroma with yeast, alcohol and hay. Sour hay in the flavor. I am not impressed.
0.33l bottle. Pours a golden fizzy body with a tiny white head. Typically massproduced lager, light bodied, quite lively carbonated and a clue of some faint hops in the background. Boring.

12oz can, cleaning out the fridge,  brought back from Costa Rica by my wife 

Appearance: Clear yellow with a medium sized white head and some lacing 

Aroma: Wheat, honey and citrus 

Taste: Pale malts, honey, citrus and grainy 

Ok
Can at Schiphol. Aroma: Metallic, malt, corn. Nice head, clear and pale. Flat, plain taste. Oily and astringent palate. No off flavours besides corn and the astringency.

Who hasn’t had this? I remember the first couple of times having this and thinking, did this go bad? Hahaha. I’m not even going to describe it. If it’s ice cold, then it tastes fine. You will get the occasional batch of classic Heineken skunk though. I can’t hate on it like everyone else.
Pours clear with a yellow tint.  Aroma of sweet malts.  Flavor of the same with some hops, very watery , & sweet in the finish.
Transparent golden color.  Cereal grain malt aroma.  Medium body.  More cereal grains on the palate.  At least out of a can it isn’t skunked.

Had this one on a cruise a while back, a refreshing pale lager  -AROMA-  faint aroma of grass and hops, but as I said... faint  -APPEARANCE-  looks like piss, clear yellow piss  -TASTE-  Delicious... when cold.  Finish this fast, if it starts to warm up just let the sink have the rest.  mainly cheap malts.  refreshing.  -PALATE-  watery  -BOTTOM LINE-  refreshing beer, but drink it fast
Golden colour. Weak head. Aroma of grains and fireworks (?). Quite heavily carbonated.

Pours clear yellow, light white lacing, good effervescence. Medium-strong metallic aroma with light yeast notes. Clean and crisp on palate with a slight metallic flavor and a bit of creaminess in the finish. Not great, but certainly not terrible. I think this is getting terrible ratings on here more because it is "mass produced" than for a lack of quality.

12 oz. bottle from In-Laws’ fridge.

Ar: Oh boy.  This ain’t good.  Fermented sweet corn, just plain offensive.
Ap: Pours a urine-yellow straw with a 1" head that surprisingly sticks around for quite a while and leaves decent lace.  This looks about as good as urine can look.
T: Pretty nasty.  Corn/adjunct sweetness.  I don’t know if they brewed this thing pure barley or what, but it sure doesn’t taste like it.  Almost no hop bitterness.
P: Fizzy, light body.  What else is there to say?

O: Well, this one is exactly as offensive as I thought it would be.

Tasted on tap at the sports exchane in Fort Collins.  Honestly, this is the second time that I’ve had it on tap in America.  Slightly darker than your typical Pale Lager.  Pale malty head.  Actually a good Pale malty, lager flavor.  One of my favorite Pale Lagers.

12oz can into a flute(?).  Sampled at a wedding reception last night.  Clear, straw colored body topped with a fizzy, quickly receding head.  Aroma is lightly sweet, skunky and grainy.  Flavor is fairly sweet and some floral hop in the end.

I first tried Heineken in the mini-keg and didn’t think it was bad. I bought a 12-pack 12oz. bottles because of this and boy was I disappointed. I felt it had a skunky aroma and a bitter taste that stays with you the whole time. This doesn’t inspire me to have another. In fact many time I force myself to finish the bottle. It has a very pale amber color with little visible carbonation though it was noticeable when I drank it. I may drink it again from a mini-keg but I’ll pass buying it from the bottle again. In nearly two months I still haven’t finished my original 12-pack.

Obviously this is far from a great beer. I’m even hesitant to call it a good beer. Still, the sharp bite has its endearing qualities. For its price, almost any beer would be a better choice, unless you’re having pizza rolls. This beer should be the official beer of pizza rolls. That’s the only time I drink it is when I’m eating those little mini microwave nuggets of faux meat and crack. So, in that context I quite enjoy it, but I never think of it on it’s own

Bottle pours yellow with a white head.  Aroma of grass, grain, and the tendency to be skunked.  Flavor shows the same.  Overall body is moderate with moderate bitterness.  If I have a choice, I prefer the can.

Fucking awesome beer, not expensive at all
..............................................
(can) clear yellow colour with tall white head; grassy aroma, balanced flavour with long light bitter finish, still one of the better mass produced lagers
Nice foamy head, some lacing on the glass. Grassy, malty aroma. The taste is mildly hoppy, thin and watery. It has some body, but not much. Pretty standard mass-production brew.

Another in my series of "hey, let’s try that one again now that I appreciate good beer".  From the 24oz can.  Is this skunky aroma and taste something to do with German-style lagers?  Not much aroma to speak of other than "skunk".  Taste is the skunky taste that in this one seems to be from very, very, very stale hops.  Extremely subtle malt lurking barely.  Hey, it’s marginally better than the Beck’s I re-tried yesterday, but that’s not saying much.

Clear and light yellow, good head, tons of carbonation.  Aroma is of light-struck hops.  Taste is a light bread malt with somewhat skunked hops.  It’s a shame they sell this in green bottles.  It’s a different beer on draft and out of their mini-kegs.
Just another one of those cheap watered down lagers, nothing special at all.
Fra dåse, fremstår flot lys gylden som en pils :) smager ok ! lidt mere fylde end alm tuborg / carlsberg ! fylde som en pils ! i alt en ok pilsner smager sikkert super skønt på en varm sommer dag !
In bottle; one of my least favorite beers ... I drank it recently only because it was the only beer the restaurant in paris had ...
another one of these overhyped frat boy brews a "meh " beer at best in other words AVERAGE!
Not bad for a "corporate meeting" or "Back 9 beer cart girl" beer, chuggable at least.
The taste is bitter with a slight hop taste, Aroma is nice. Full bodied and highly drinkable. This beer is definitely another beer i keep in my fridge.

330 bottle. Rated @ 12.4.2009.

Pours a pale yellow colour with high carbonation. Strong grainy aroma and flavour. Low hoppiness and a malty finish. Basic.

Not a bad beer for a mass produced import.  When I have to go for a mass producde beer for a party or bbq, I will go for this or a Stella rather than Miller bud or Coors.  Once you can get past the aroma (hint don’t drink it out of a pint - the bottle is the best way to take this stuff) it foots the bill.

Aroma was mild. Appearance was standard yellow lager. Nice but nothing special. Taste was a disaster. This is a seriously skunked beer. Not drinkable. Tastes like skunk and dirt. I have had heineken that I have really enjoyed..... but this one was awful. Had to pour it out.

For the eyes: very pale yellow; small (almost inexistent) white head; crystal body. For the nose: some grain malts; nothing more. For the mouth: very thin body; waterish. For the tongue: not much, water, water and a slightly bitter aftertaste. For me: sells a lot because it’s easy to drink, not because it’s any good. (p.s. I still think it’s better then the commercial brazilian lagers).

Bottle. Pale yellow with a no head and even less taste. very popular.. I would attribute this to a lack of taste. its crisp and clean, but there is very little body, mouth or nose. Its near empty experiance.

Canned version.  Pours yellow with a short-lived fizzy head.  No skunkiness in the can. Bold aroma of roasted biscuit and pale malts.  Clean crisp hop nose.  Body is medium. Interesting biscuit taste.  This was worth re-doing three years later for a new perspective.  

(Sept 2010 rating = 2.2)From the US 24 fl. oz. green bottle no. 0167528D1540.  The pour is a highly-carbonated pale yellow with a real puffy, soapy looking white head some two inches thick.  The aroma is skunked but deep within you pick up bits of grass, grain, and thin hops. The barley malts tend to jump out in the taste with a sour hoppiness at the end.  To think that 25-30 years ago I thought it was cool to drink this one.  Oh, how I have evolved.

Pours a clear, golden color with a small, quick fading white head. Aroma has a strong grainy note, low spiced hops with only a very small touch of skunk and sourness (which is a first for me from this beer).
