Flavor has a low toasted malt touch, lots of graininess, low skunk and a low amount of hops. Light body, slightly fizzy.  Overall a palatable brew. This one must of been a bit fresher as the skunkiness normally associated with Heineken was very subdued.
Awful standard, sour base with ok bittering. boring and oppressive ubiquity.

Not too bad, a common beer in USA.  I don’t hate it but the skunkiness always makes my nose cringe.  I would say this isn’t a bad beer by any stretch, but not great. I much rather drink the Brown bottle heinys I get in holland or straight from the tap there in a bar, no preservatives, less skunky yet hard to find, so I say ehh, not bad, try it.
(Bottle) The quintessential corporate beer served at cocktail parties.  Always with a hint of skunk. Unpleasant palate and tart flavor.  Why is this considered a high end selection?

Bottle. Pours like a regular lager.
Aroma is standard malty. Sweet taste with bitter aftertaste.
Pretty good beer.
Pours great head and keeps up well. It is a great dutch beer. I do recommend you grab your self one of these.
Jævla grei øl detta, men ikkje meir. Unødvendig grøn farge. Mykje skom. Sit greit nok i handa. Litt dyr i forhold til sine konkurentar. har hatt mine fulle på denne ja. =)

12 oz bottle.  I had to order this one because the place was out of Brooklyn lager.  Pours golden with a white, lacy, strange head.  Nose is some grass.  Taste is sweet grain, dough and some earthy hops.  At least it was not disgusting.
Two words: horrible aftertaste.  Tastes OK at first, but finishes horribly.
Can. Golden colour, small white head. Malty aroma with notes of grain and citrus. The flavour is malty with some citrus and sweetness. Slightly bitter finish, quite smooth mouthfeel.
12. oz can.  skunky smell and taste. Drinkable, but if you put a budweiser in the sun and the put it in the fridge this is the taste I imagine.
IMO, A nice Euro lager for casual drinking. Good aroma, smooth lager taste, nice balance, easy to drink.
Most bland tasting beer I’ve had, slight candy apple. Funky aroma. Not worth having (well, most beers aren’t).

This poured a boring yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of hay, skunk and a bit of sewage. The taste is a bit pleasing compared to the aroma. Mainly lighter corn and some european noble hop skunk taste. Not bad for the style.
Smells like wet dog and tastes like a typical dirty tap line sadly though, this is form a bottle.

This is an alright beer. I would have no problems drinking another one of these, however, I know that for the money I can get something exponentially better. The aroma of this beer is consistent with the genre of lagers in that it has an almost skunky smell. The taste has a bit of lemon to it with that wet hay type taste mixed in. Nothing too special here but the lemon is a nice touch. Good beer if you like lagers.

(12oz bottle) pale lager, minimal bubbles on the edges. Nose of corn, mild skunk (fresh one maybe??), animal fur, burns my nose for no apparent reason. Taste of skunk, weird lemony tartness, earthy, nasty lager hop bite, very obviously force carbonated, terrible linger.
Looks like pee pee in a glass.  Smells like grass, hay, and skunky hops.  Tastes watery, bitter and metallic.
Can. The aroma is grassy, taste is slightly bitter and metallic with notes of hay. Passable macro lager.
Very skunky aroma. Spilled a bottle on the counter before drinking and the whole room smelled like skunk.Beyond the aroma it’s just a macro with an import price-tag.
300 ml bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts hop and water taste water bread malts and some bitter

12oz. Bottle:  I have had this one a million times, but never rated it.  Aroma of noble hops, lager yeast, and corn.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a large, white head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear.  Sparkling.  Flavor is light to medium sweet and medium bitter.  Tastes of noble hops, lager yeast, corn, and some water.  Light body.  Thin, watery texture.  Average carbonation.  Noble hops, lager yeast, and corn finish.

This must be one of the most average industrial lagers in the world. It is strange irony that Heineken has put only one star on label, where two stars would have been more accurate. Yes, the beer is so average that I find this slightly boring, thou I certainly can drink this stuff quite a bit.
Tasted blind. Pours golden. Aroma of bread, sulfur. Flavor contains little flavor and a hint of metallic aftertaste.

It’s Heineken, what can you say? It is a perfectly acceptable but not great Euro lager than more sweeter rather than more bitter that we have all ordered when everything else offered at the bar is rubbish.  The missus and I argue rather MGD or Heineken is better. Serving: Bottle, tap and can.

I drank this sample poured from a 12 oz. can.  Heineken has a thick, white head and a very clear golden appearance.  Carbonation is high.  The aroma is of barley, with a decent hop spice.  I enjoy this flavor, and it has the right hop balance for this style of beer, not too bitter nor too bland.  Mouth-feel is light and watery.  Heineken finishes crisp and refreshing.  Overall, I think it is a very good beer.  A NOTE:  I recommend only drinking this from a can or on draft as the green bottle may allow the beer to spoil.

RJT

Bottle:
small white foamy head disappears quick.
Clear golden yellow color.
Smell is malty hoppy and bit watery.
Taste is malty and bit bitter. Towards aftertaste more bitter and dry but not well balanced.
Bière houblonné...pas méchante...me rappel voyage en hollande et à Amsterdam!
Not the worst, and better than many pale lagers, but often skunky and boring
Yuck.  Grassy, typical trash skunky swilsner taste.  The green bottle suck is carried on by this one.
worse than amstel why do i bother this suckssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss

Had one of these on the ferry between Fortune, Newfoundland & St. Pierre and Miquelon.  Always remember these better than they are. Often skunky. Mediocre taste. Not offensive, but not delicious either.
Bottled. Typical pale yellow lager colour with some white head. Sweet malty aroma. Tastes has some malts with some hops and thats’s all. Watery and drinkable typically boring lager.

Pretty poor stuff.  Yellow piss water color, fizzy head.  Don’t even know what i would call what little aroma there is.  Taste like metal.  I guess it goes down easy when cold... Left me with a headache...
Sorry, but why bother? Extreme skunk + Extreme metallic = a very bad recipe.  Worst than most NA macros. Marketing isn’t always a positive thing, and Heineken is exhibit 1 of this.
Pours up light with a tiny bit of head. Not too much aroma or taste. Cold beer is crisp, though, and it isn’t bad.

Heineken. This is an example of a meh beer where marketing made it what it is today. There isn’t much flavor here and whatever flavor there is an odd bitter with a sort of metallic lacing. I think it’s just really awkward. The smell is pretty skunky and isn’t the most appetizing smell for a brew. I guess this is a decent brew for the average joe who hasn’t tasted the craft/specialty brews but I seem to have a tough time getting it down nowadays. The medium to high carbonation is also a slight shock to the system. I can’t say I can recommended this beer to anyone but to each his own I guess.

Although I?ve had my fair share of Heinekens over the years, I never really thought much about rating it.   It?s actually a fairly good looking beer pouring a light golden yellow with an initially billowing white head that dies away quickly.  There?s a light toasted malt aroma with a little sourness mixed in.  The taste is clean with a very light corn flavor.  The strong carbonation makes it taste and feel a little creamy.  There?s some light and undistiguished hop in the background.   Overall it?s really not a bad light lager. ***Just tried a bottle versus a can of this to see if there was any difference between the two.  The bottle seem to have a lighter taste and the hops were a bit muted. but the can had a fuller, sweeter taste that didn’t seem to fit the style.  Verdict: the bottle wins!
12 oz. can on boat ride to Mets game.  Perfect place for a simple unimpressive but light and crisp beer.

Poured into a pint glass. From the 16 oz keg can.

Pours a very thin fizzy head that doesn’t last very long. No lacing. Color is a clear straw yellow. Nothing exciting.

Aroma: It had a really bad smell, very skunky and grainy.

Taste was very bland and uninviting. Didn’t really want more of this skunky flavored beer.

Mouthfeel was very dry. Light bodied. High carbonation.

Most people (non BAs) fame this to be an amazing beer but I thought that it was the exact opposite. I definitely will not be drinking this one again.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 08-12-2008 06:11:20

Pours a pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma and Taste is grassy, some sweet fruity notes, with some light hops and malt with a light funky flavor. Palate is light to medium body, with a crisp mouth feel and moderate carbonation. Finish is light malt some fruitiness with some funky flavor and some light bitter hops. Overall a descent pale lager.

Clear golden colour with a thick white head. Funky wheat smell to it. Bitter, not totally unpleasant wheat flavour. Leaves a cloying, bitter after taste. Look its not as terrible as some would have you believe, but its far from a classic.

Draft at a bar in Rotterdam. This is the worst pilsener type of lager I have ever had. It has a very funky smell to it, it’s very thin and seems to be watered down (same goes for the bottled version). This is just carbonated water with a weird unlikeable taste to it. Despite all the hype and marketing, this is a beer that should be avoided by any serious beer drinker. It’s definitely not a premium pilsener. I rather have a coke for refreshment than this. Avoid drinking this by all means.

aroma isnt much to speak of  but you can distinguish between malts and hops...looks good nice yellow color with tinges of amber lasting head with lacing no less taste has a malty underbelly,maybe a bit of a corn flavor and a surprising bitterness for the type..as i said in the aroma comments you CAN distinguish between malt and hops in the flavor too..plenty drinkable..always been a good session beer
Bottle 33cl. One of the worst beer I ever tested, no aroma, no body, no hops, a poor lager with some acidity notes.
everyone knows heineken, and most likely everyone thought it was great at some point. until they found the multitudes that are better.

A - Fruity and grassy
A - Light gold with little to no head
T - Slightly sweet with a bitter, dry and tinny finish
P - Watery and fizzy
O - Its Heineken...nothing special

First time to try this beer. Out of the drought mini keg. Not great at all, but something that I would consider very "drinkable" (mostly because of the lack of complexity of flavors). Straw colored, clear with a skunky, slightly hoppy finish.
Bottle.  Pours very light yellow.  Thin head.  Faint aroma of malt.  Tastes skunky and a little bitter.  Don’t get it at all.

From a friend’s 5l keg. Poured a clear golden yellow with a lasting, slowly disappearing white head leaving a scattered lacing. An odd nutty, grainy malt aroma. Dusty malts, very light bitterness and some fruity sweetness on the tongue. Light body, soft palate texture - especially for a lager - and a short finish.
Bottle.  In the USA.  Pale lager all the way.  Heineken has this roasty/smoky flavor that a lot of them don’t have though.  If I had to, I could drink it.

Bottle. Metal, perfume hop, not much else. A little caramel. Pours a thick white head, Dutch style. Clear pale gold. OK lacing. Head quickly disappears. Heineken branded tulip glass. Slight bitterness. Crisp and refreshing with a dry finish. Decent Eurofizz. 2 2 3 2 3 Rerate. Draught, The Lowther, York. Branded glassware. Gold body; Medium white head. Corn, hops, lager malts. Sweetish. Dry finish. Refreshing. 4 3 5 3 8. Second review seems fairer.
Clear pale yellow, white head, some lacing.  Notes of skunk with a hint of muskrat.  Tastes like weak deer urine.  Not among my favorite animal themes.
Well,it’s far better than it’s Amstel Lager competitor in Greece,a pretty decent beer,with light taste and a slightly weak aroma.
Bevuta in bottiglia: versa color giallo pipì trasparente, schiuma evanescente, sapore appena cerealoso che sparisce immediatamente in una miriade di bollicine.
50cl can. Poured clear golden color with a white head that quickly disappeared. Weak grainy aroma. Flavor is malty, cardboard. Ends bit dry and sour?. Quite refreshing on a warm day.

Enjoyed while waiting to watch the England vs. US World Cup match.  It’s an average lager, lighter than most and crisp.  Standard average, not bad but not good.  I also enjoyed this after taking it from a crappy band who kicked my band out of our practice space for some stupid stuff.  Bumping up my rating just because spiting them felt good.
Another macro pale lager. Watery, grainy and bland. Slightly sweet finish. Not much to see here. Triumph of advertising over taste.
Very little flavour and only nasty, skunky aromas. One of the worst "Premium imported" beers in Australia.

Can.  Clear light yellow gold with a white head that barely stuck around at all to see it.  Faint maltiness, mineral hop bitterness, and some grainy sweetness.  Tastes basically this same, and the finish is too sweet for my tastes.  Thin and watery. Just bland crap, and we all know this.  Upside is that a canned version in Europe is a whole lot better than the green bottle delivery in the US.  At least this isn’t light struck and that disgusting.  There are worse out there.
When a beer describes itself as having "unsurpassed clarity", I guess one shouldn’t be disappointed when it barely has a taste or a smell. Good for hot days.

Served from bottle into an imperial pint.  Poured a pale yellow with minimal white head.  There was no apparent lacing present.  The aroma consisted of a musty and sour note.  The flavor was of wheat, sour, and nutty hints.  It was light on the palate with low carbonation.  Overall this brew is very bland.  Definitely needs more flavorings to be competitive with others in its style.  Aroma would help as well as it is not appealing.  Not horrible if you are in a pinch but if you have a choice of something else, choose it.
This beer smells very skunky, but it tastes great. Very light and crisp. Highly recommended.
Pours light with a quick white head. Nose and flavor are weak and skunk-lager dominated. Not much else to say...lame skunky pale lager. If you want to drink swill, get some Miller.
330 ml bottle, some time ago now, possibly mid-2008. Typical pale lager really, boring flavour, flat consistency and no small degree of mass-marketing. Dull and worthless stuff.
Bottle. Yellow golden colour. Quicly dissappearing medium head. Sour- spiced smell, some fruity. Earthy sour taste. Good marketing can do so much stuff, this "beer" proves it.
Lots of times, most recently on vacation in Indonesia.  Pour is clear straw color with white head.  Aroma is skunky hop, light malt.  Flavor is also skunky hop and light malt.  Always a bad hangover.
Green bottle but not too shabby. The flavor is decent, and it has a nice, crisp finish. Better than most macro swill.
Heineken has a very unoffensive taste that combines a slightly sweet flavor with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Refreshing and somewhat cleansing if served cold.

bottle at a convention poured into a tall boy.  med golden with a med white head tgat stuck around a bit.  smell balanced with malt and slight hops.  taste is sweet and malty with a slight metallic and adjunct aftertaste.
Very general beer. Has a very strong bitter after taste. Nice golden collar. The beer has no special taste and its just another beer like every other pale lager

Since this is one of the famous macrolagers people tend to slag off every once in a while in here, I had really low expectations. Moreover, it’s been ages since I actually had a Heineken. Turns out, it’s not really that bad. I mean, it ain’t good - that’s for sure - but as far as pale lagers go, the taste is pretty balanced between light, sweet malts and bitter, dry hops. Palate is also drinkable and relatively pleasant. No obvious faults and bad hints of this or that, either. Thus, I got no choice but to give Heineken a mediocre rating, which is more that I expected. After all, ya gotta give credit where credit is due.
This should rate much lower. I need to re rate it. Pours pale. Nose and taste is very peppery. Rated 1/15/2000

over here in the states its considered more than decent by the uninformed, its aroma is quite pungent but not complex, it tastes almost exactly like it smells, and is watery. reminds me of freshly mowed grass.

Very pale yellow with a short-lived white head. Dry grassy aroma, a bit sour, skunky. More grassy hops in the flavor than I might have expected, grainy flavor turning sweeter on the finish to actually overpower the hops, but otherwise good not great.
33 cl bottle. Definetely a bad beer, I didn’t like it. One of the worst beers ever tried.
Nasty mass produced dutch lager with an over fizzy fakeness about it dull and leafy taste with weedy roots from the garden one to be avoided
Bottle, brewed in Sopron Hungary,neutraly aroma, pale, clear, white foam, lightly bitter, light sweetness, medium body, nevyýrazný pivo, shit
Pretty Standard macro brew. Light yellow, fizzy, and watery. Some grassy notes, faint hops, and some sweet flavors. Quite basic and watered down. Fortunately, the one I tried was not skunky.

Bottle. I haven’t had this for some time now and I think it will be another long time between drinks. Better then some light lagers but that’s not saying much. Mild grassy aroma. Very watery and light hoppy flavour. Finishes dry with a dose of boredom.
Decent beer.  Bottled in a dark grren bottle.  nothing special.  Would drink again.
On draught. Pale colour with a nice fluffy white head that sadly didn’t last. Another pretty mainstream mass market beer that is alright and no more
Pretty bog standard lager, not too offensive, good on a session where you just want to get drunk, nothing distinctive about this beer, could be mistaken for so many others

Pours a golden yellow with a distinct skunky corn smell.  This beer has been around for ages and is not bad if its the only thing lying around.  A decent pale lager that is slightly complex than you’re normal commercial pale lagers.  Its not my favorite but is decent.
You either love it or hate it...me personally I grew up on this stuff so I really like it. Great skunky smell &  bitter taste, but it’s oh so good when drank ice cold!

Call me crazy, but I think Heineken is an incredibly underrated beer. Yes it has the legendary skunky flavor that is it’s hallmark, but it’s also a beer with a flavor that it can call it’s own, and really, how many beers can say that? Heineken isn’t my "go to" beer, but it’s light, memorable taste is much better than American domestic stand by’s based on it’s superior flavor.

There is no easy way to put this...this beer looks like urine, with slightly less froth. Definite earthy aromas, corn, leaves, etc. The taste is water with a tablespoon of sugar. The procceedings are equal parts yucky and crisp.

Pours pale golden color with small head. Typical lager. Nothing to exited about the aroma, no character at all. Artificial sweet flavor with some hints of hoppyness, yaicks. Nothing on the palate and definately nothing in the aftertaste except the artificial sweetener.

Can, Malaysia version. Not a bad color for the beer, a nice bright gold with a few rising bubbles and a scant head. The aroma is corn nuts at first along with green apple and light phenols like scented non-acetone nail polish remover. The mouthfeel is prickly but not too fizzy. The first thing I notice in the flavors is the intense cloying sweetness. It lingers on the tongue leaving an artificial strawberry candy and green apple candy finish. As it warms a little, the flavors become more offensive and intensely bad. This beer is much worse than I remember, very disappointing.

Okay for a pale lager. The aroma is straw and skunk. Taste? well it’s your typical "whatever" taste. Kind of refreshing but plain and boring. A bit skunky and very watery. Palate? Well the palate has a kind of clean crisp lager thing going on. Oh well I wouldn’t drink it anymore unless it was free
33 cl can. Pale golden body with white head. Flavour is malt, watery and a little bitter.

Heineken Brouwerijen B.V.--Heineken Lager Beer

1996 12 oz. Bottle.  5.50% (3.5 / 5.0)  Pale Lager		

1999 24 oz. Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Pale Lager--Clear light straw golden color.  Rich hoppy front with light malty note.  Body is smooth and flavorful with delicate crisp maltiness and light sweet fruitiness.  Balanced dry refreshing finish.  Sampled 12/14/1999.

2003 11.2 oz. Chinese Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (3.25 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear thin light golden color.  Mild floral Saaz front.  Crisp mild light butter citrus adjunct body.  Hint of tang in mild hop end.  Light but refreshing.  Sampled 7/30/2003.

Heineken Service Consommateurs France--Heineken Biere De Prestige--French Version--2006 8.45 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV--18 IBU’s.?  (3.75 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Clear bright light golden color.  Mild head.  Light hop front.Refreshing smooth mild lager body.  Clean quenching mild hop end.  Smooth easy Macro.  OK flavor.  Sampled 1/12/2006.

2007 12 oz. Green Bottle.  5.00% ABV--20 IBU’s.?  (3.75 / 5.0)  Pale Lager.  Mild lace creamy white head.  Clear bright rich yellow gold color.  No stank mild hop front.  Crisp refreshing all malt mild butter caramel body.  Balanced mild hop spice clean refreshing end.  Nice Macro.  Sampled 4/17/2007.

2007 24 oz. Green Bottle.  5.00% ABV--20 IBU’s.?  (3.75 / 5.0)  Pale Lager.  Green bottle stank hint.  Foamy off white mild lace head.  Clear bright yellow gold color.  Mild hop front.  Crisp mild tangy light butter mild caramel dry sweet body.  Clean mild tangy hop spice quenching end.	Sampled 3/28/2007.

Heineken Nederland B.V. 2011 Heineken Draft.  12 oz. Draft @ Fremont, Seattle Hop Scotch Beer & Scotch Festival on 4/01/2011.  5.00% ABV.  25 IBU’s?  Thin white light lace head.  Clear bright very thin gold color.  Crisp Saazish hop pilsner front.  CO2 zesty sligtly herbal pils pale lager body.  Refreshing light herbal hop adjunct hint end.  (3.75 / 5.0)
Can and draft. Draft is more better than canned drink. Golden color, herbal aroma, flavor of common lager. Nothing to say, but ...

Can.

A - Light straw color with an average sized foamy white head. Disappears pretty fast. Minimal lacing left.

S - Lager, corn smell. Slight skunky smell and faint grassy and floral hop.

T - Similar to the smell. Pretty typical Euro-lager beer. Grain and corn sweetness upfront with some skunkiness. Decent amount of grassy/floral hops for beers that are similar to it.

M - Light and highly carbonated. Crisp.

D - Decent. The flavor isn’t great, but compared to other Euro-lagers it isn’t bad. Easy to drink.

Notes: Decent for a Euro-lager type beer. Not good, but decent for what it is.
Pours gold with white head, aroma is bread and cereal.  Taste is slightly dry with some cereal and hay finishing dry.  Ok for a mass produced lager, would get this over many of the others.

Bottle: Pale golden to golden, sweetish papery-cardboardy nose with some greenish hops underneath; light bodied, mucous MF, light sweetish-bitter flavour; wet cardboard and vegetables in the sweetish-bitter finish. Quality sells.......
12oz. bottle, very light golden in color, medium carbonation,skunky, hay, clear, minimal head, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel,
Overrated but easy to drink, Lets face it: Heineken is a Wedding reception beer.
Skunky smell with a small white head. Beautiful color with light carbonation. Tastes a bit hoppy with a small hint of herbs. Overall, not a horrible beer.
In a can on a flight from Columbus to Charlotte then on to Las Vegas. Great aroma, but wasn’t so "extra cold"
Bitter, skunky and watery.  The fact that this is mildy expensive and still popular boggles my mind.
Pale yellow with a white head. Taste is grainy, mild hops, water... thinnish body.
Clear pale golden yellow, thin, skunky, grainy, little grassy, slightly metalic.  I hate this beer!

can. Poured pale straw coloured with a white receeding head. The aroma is sweet with a light hop note. The palate is smooth and a little dry, a light to medium mouthfeel. Flavour isn’t spectacular, typical pale lager, not far off of an american macro. Sweet grainy taste, finishes clean and crisp. Slight dry hop aftertaste.

A: The pour is a clear pale golden color with a fluffy white head that actually leaves a bit of lacing.

S: Having had Heineken many times before and having experienced plenty of skunky bottles, I was pleasantly surprised at the absence of the skunk. The nose was all sweet grain, no hops, and perhaps a touch of malt.

T: Like the nose, this beer is incredibly sweet. The malt is a bit more noticeable in the flavor than the nose, with the grain not too far behind.

M: The body is light with a moderate level of carbonation.

D: Certainly not a great beer like so many people seem to think it is, but it’s not the worst pale/adjunct lager out there. It’s tolerable when it’s not skunky, but still not my first choice.

12 oz. pour from bottle.  Big, fluffy head and skunky as hell.  Light notes of hops, malt and last call wrung out bar rag into your glass.  Not the best beer in the world, but certainly an institution.  Show some respect bitches!!

Holds a sentimental value for me, this was my first beer. Not a bad way to start either. Decent as far as macros go, a tiny hoppy smell, light golden color. Usually drink it out of the bottle, never really on tap. The taste is slightly bitter, bland, but not offensive. I would drink it again, but there are better macros out there.

330 ml bottle.  Pours light colden in colour, big white bubbly head.  Aroma is euro lager, with euro hops.  Taste is of slightly sweet lager malt.  A pretty decent euro lager, a go to beer when micros are not available.
It has a pretty weak taste, but is definitely better than the mass marketed beers and is very drinkable.

Look, Heineken is not a bad beverage for everyday consumption.  I have enjoyed this beer so many times that there is no reason to isolate one experience.  However, You MUST drink this from their 12 oz or 24 oz keg cans.  This beer should never be consumed on tap or in bottle.  Why would you even want to?  Enjoy the keg can and above average macro experience.  By far not the worst blend of hops and malts out there.

Bottle.  Pours a light yellow.  Big white frothy head.  Weak grassy aroma.  Extremely smooth, however almost no flavor.  I’ve enjoyed this back in the day when our beer choices were limited to the Macros, but now it just seems so weak.  Much better then US Macros, but priced high considering it is practically water.
Burk. Själva definitionen av lättdrucken, ljus lager. Urmodern till alla massproducerade lager. Absolut inte sämst i klassen, men nästan anonym intill självutplåning. Väldigt schablonartad i smaken.

I cannot believe I have been missing this rating.  Tap, TacoMac, John’s Creek.  (keep the glass night)  Yellow pour, no head.  Aroma of honey and very sweet malt.  Flavor of pale lager.  Bread, straw, some grassy hops.  Overall, this was a really hard beer to get down.  i had to take big gulps just to finish it.  Made for the (wealthier) masses.
Heineken is one of favourite tap beers. It´s crisp and light-tasted with a great colour.

Bottle. A long time since the last time I tasted this one. Golden colour with white head. Aroma grassy hopp notes and a little malt. Taste mainly malty and a little bite from the hopps. A quite average pale lager.

A pretty average beer.
Nothing bad, nothing good. It’s just beer.
Good to drink if you have nothing else.
Notorious light beer. Not so much taste to enjoy but a fast drinker. Can’t say there is much bitterness in the aftertaste. Rather soft and smooth I would say.

I used to drink this regularly but only on tap, and I remember it being MUCH better on tap... smells weakly of malt and alcohal. Looks a bit yellow, but it is ABSOLUTELY see through. Tastes of light malt, a bit of hops and bitter/dryness at the end, Bitter aftertaste, not nice. Out of the bottle, this really sux.

Pours a thin, pale light yellow with a big white head.  Light dirty vegetable aroma. No hops. Lightly sweet with a ghost of hop bitterness in the finish. Thin and watery. No real character. For a macro brew, you could do worse than this one.

Nothing too exceptional here. Nothing too frightening, though. A pale lager that’s slightly different from the American macros.
 Slight metallic and citrus flavor, then bland sweetness.

Pale yellow color; unpleasantly sweet malty aroma with faint hop presence, luckily it´s even mild; mouthfeel is thin and watery; sweet malty flavor, even slight bitterness to my surprise, though unfortunately the hops are bit metallic and not fruity. It´s got surprisingly lot of taste for a mass-market product like it, but then again the taste is not very good.

Why bother?  It’s more expensive than the generic American macro swill and tastes just as bad or worse.  Cloying corn sweetness, blah nose (and I bought a can rather than a dumb green bottle), looks pale as a ghost, not even really good for the college kid scene because it has something resembling flavor and bitterness.  Yuck.

Bottle.  Smells of green apple.  The taste is crisp but lacks any real distinguishing characteristics.  There is a slight metallic tint to the flavor.  If given the choice between this and a bud light, I would go sober.
Refrigerated Bottle. Beautiful!!! Drinkable, refreshing, with a great after taste... Will drink it again!!!!

Bottle.  Pours a super clear, golden color with minimal, frothy white head.  Aromas of citrus, floral, and malts although all except the citrus are light.  Moderately lively palate with a crisp finish and little aftertaste.  Flavors of citrus and sours.  If you are going to drink a mass-produced beer, there are MANY worse ones out there.
Refrigerated bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with small white head, no lacing, and low carbonation.  Taste is mostly corn malt with some skunk.  Really smooth with light crisp bitter dry aftertaste.

Comment copy "Pale golden with small white head. Bitter aroma. Pretty waterish beer with hoppy bitter taste. Bitter aftertaste which smoothens out in a soft way. Pretty standard "boring beer"."

 Krakow
Believe the hype, this is one fine beer. A perfect chugging beer, completely refreshing and easy to swallow. Another personal favorite of mine.

This is what is. A perfectly average lager. Better than american macros (what isn’t?), but that’s the only reason I see to have this over something else. I guess if you are in the mood for it, then...

0.5 l can.
Pale golden colour, nice creamy-liked foam, soft carbonation.
Sweet and grainy smell, the taste is sweet, too.
Sweetish aroma of malt, grain and hops, medium bodied. Sweetbitter finish.
Good drinkable, but nothing really special.
Pale yellow. Thin head. Aroma had traces of piney hops and sweetness. Taste was more of the same with a corniness resonating. Overall, pretty weak.

Very pale yellow with a short-lived white head. Dry grassy aroma, a bit sour, grainy. More grassy hops in the flavor than I might have expected, grainy flavor turning sweeter on the finish to actually overpower the hops, but otherwise passable. Slightly over carbonated.

had to rate it sometime.. so here is goes. Drank this one several times yesterday. Not my type of lager. Im also not a big fan of this big multinational brewer. Nothing to say about the aroma etc. Taste is typical for a lager but i prefer other lagers to drink on an evening.
Pale golden color, small white head. Slightly grainy aroma, watery and slightly malty taste. No hop presence, no finish, nothing interesting.

Heineken is quite literally the only macro that I won’t touch to my lips. I am a snob, but I am also the kind of guy who can happily drink any plonk that is set in front of me as long as it means being part of the crowd and having a good time. Not with Heineken. Much like how some people have a rare aversion to cilantro, I am genetically predisposed to hate Heineken. Smells and tastes repulsive and it’s so fizzy that I can’t even choke it down and say it’s overwith. The aftertaste lasts for hours and every nasty belch reminds me never to touch the stuff again. Anything but Heineken!

(16 ounce can - pint glass)  Pours a clear golden yellow color that produces no head and leads to little lacing.  Very little aroma but for the nose that is there is grainey malt.  Taste is dry, grain cereal malt and skunky.  Thin body, little carbonation and dry finish.

gold-lct, simple, clean, very bland, good co2, §hop-bitterness, might be good with seafood.

usually pretty skunked unless carefully selected and protected.
Served at a holiday party. One of those beers you hold in your hand and drink on and off without really noticing.
It’s Heineken, what can you say. My wife’s Portuguese and all the old European men in her family seem to love it so I drink it a lot. It’s pro the standard for generic euro lager flavor.

Brewed under licence by Lion Nathan Australia. "It’s Heineken Jim, but not as we know it." Pale straw colour, little to no head, rather dull nose and although it tastes similar to the real thing this beer has a distinct pear note to it that kind of stands out. Its not as good as the real thing

Bottle. What can I say? It’s Heineken. Actually it’s not all that bad (the one brewed in Holland, not brewed under license), if not particularly exciting. Grainy, malty aroma with a hint of grassy, herbal hops. Flavour has some mild sweetness but is otherwise the same. Inoffensive and very easy to drink but that’s about it.

Poured from a 355 ml bottle. Drank it very cold, paired with bread and cheese. Pale yellow color, with a quickly evanescent head. Smells really good, with herbal, vegetable notes. Mild to moderate bitterness, with a hoppy, short-lived aftertaste. Very easy to drink. Doesn’t require much attention.

33cl bottle. The aroma was bland, nothing stood out for me. The appearance was pale golden, with a thin head that quickly disappeared. No lacing and very meek taste. To add insult to injury it was way over priced. Why buy it you ask, well, a meal is a poor thing with out a beer…even a bad beer.
Tap. 5L keg. Yellow color with tight white head. Aroma is earthy with grass and grain. Taste is grainy with straw and cardboard. Slightly metallic. Watery. Bland and boring.

12 oz. can- Pours pale golden with a weak head, and little lacing. The aroma is almost nonexistent, but I was expecting a skunky aroma so it gets a better score because I did not have to smell skunk, probably because of the aluminum can. The falvor has a mellow European flavor to it, not bad but please explain to me why this is one of the best selling beers in the world?  I just did a search for the top 10 best selling beers in the world and I was disgusted but not suprised by what I read, all of them were watered down mass produced crap. I at least thought Guinness would be on the list, but no.

Clean yellow color, medium head and carbonation. Aroma: hoppy, malt, some skunk. Flavor: slighty acid, bread, metallic. Normal not really remanent bitterness. Body is ok (maybe in the limit of being watery) Standart mass production pilsen. Drinkable if really cold. 330 ml bottel, supermarkt in Utrecht, in bars, etc...

33cL bottle.
Clean, crisp pale lager. Decent balance between malt flavour and hops. Standard issue these days really, but it’s good to get the real stuff in Europe in comparison to the BUL stuff that seems common place down under.

12 oz keg-shaped can.  Smells of cardboard, cheap adjuncts (my last three reviews have all used those same words, I know; that’s what happens when you’re reviewing mass-produced pale lagers), hay. Pours yellow--not too pale--with a medium head and surprisingly decent lacing. Tastes like a bad European lager--not unexpected--which is to say, lots of hay, a little skunk, straw. I’ve always thought of this beer as the Budweiser of Europe and my opinion still hasn’t changed.

Pours a brilliant light yellow with very frothy, creamy white head. Nice grain, straw, fresh hay smell with some floral spicy hops evident. Palate is quite soft, even soap like with plenty of floral hop flavour. Finishes quite smooth.

Pours pale yellow into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention quickly recedes to hug rim leaving spot lacing. Sour fruit candy aromas. Dry with sweet malts and a lasting sour finish. Tastes much better in Holland.

330ml bottle poured into a pint glass. Poured a very clear yellow with a 1" head. The foam was gone real quick and there’s pretty much no lacing. Aroma has some sweetness, some grass and plenty of sour. Not skunky, just sour. Makes me think of lemons but in an unpleasant way. When I used to drink these out of bottles I never realized how awful the sour aroma is. Taste is of mild sweetness, lemon sourness and mild hop bitterness. Not too impressive but after a few it doesn’t bug me as much. Average macro feel. A few years ago I’d tell you these were really awesome but I just can’t drink too many of these nowadays. I still have a Heineken when there’s little else available but there’s plenty better beers then this. And it’s Not worth it’s premium import price.
Nasty pale lager from Holland. Skunky and really tastes cardboardy and chewy.
watery. really pretty sweet.  wasn’t expecting hops but did not notice any matl either. was sadly the best thing in the fridge at a party.
Can/bottle, 2009-05-25 - possible to drink when it’s free (as it was tonight) - fissy international lager with some hopy caracter!
Thin, bland, unremarkable. Smidge of sweetness at the finish Struggled to detect any semblance of flavour. It was at least thirst quenching, so we should all be grateful for small mercies.
Bottle.  Skunky taste, good carbonation, nice head.  For a commerical beer, it’s not so bad.  Much better than a beer with preservatives.  Not my favorite but would drink if stuck!

The  best beer in the world.  Perfectly smooth and sweet taste with just a perfect sharpness to it.  Delicious.  Best served moderately cold.  "Skunked" Heinekens are not representative of all Heinekens.  It is the exception, not the rule.  In the Keg cans  you will not get skunked Heineken.

In the 80’s, it was the yuppy beer and I shunned it.  It was overpriced.  It had an  image I hated.  Then when a bar ran a $2 Heineken special, I drank it because it was cheap, image be damned.  And I quickly realized this is one of the absolute best beers in the world.  Yes, they have had problems with skunkiness.  Some years back, it seems they made a concerted effort to eliminate skunked beers from being sold.  For a while, every Heineken I had was fresh.  They seem to have let this go in the past few years, but still most of them that I get are fresh, although I get a few skunky ones.  It’s worth the risk.  A non-skunked Heineken is perfect.  Easy drinking and tasty with just perfect bit of bitter finish.  Crisp, cool, smooth yet  sharp.  I’m having one right now.

Skunky aroma,instant headache,  Great marketing though . 

For the best review please see crisp500, he’s right on.
330ml bottle. Before I knew what real beer was, I used to think highly of this. Extremely overrated, generic taste, with nothing interesting about it.

330ml bottle.   I used to think it was OK as it was one of the better mainstream lagers available in NZ.  It did taste better at the brewery in Amsterdam. Drinkable - would drink it if nothing else on offer.

probably the most overrated "mainstream" beer. horrible taste and an even worse aftertaste, but somehow better than the big three. maybe it’s because since it even has a taste at all, it’s more interesting. wait, is that saying much? drink a few if you’re trying to catch a trashy buzz and make sure you brush your teeth before you do pass out, so you don’t wake up in the morning wondering if someone took a crap in your mouth.

the last time i had this (at my in laws) it wasn’t to bad so I tried my best to give some good points...must of been a fresh batch cause I’ve tasted many heine’s and this was the best bunch by far...ok light light hop swallow,little skunkiness that i kind of like, that’s really it...wouldn’t buy it with a food stamp but not bad for a no choice party beer...

12oz bottle.  clear yellow pour with very little head to speak of.  pale apple malt nose.  grain and citrus rind in the taste.  bready hop finish.  I’ve had this on tap several times while traveling in europe and could swear it tastes far better.  never cared for it out of the bottle though.
On tap.Pours light pale with a decent white head. Weak malty aroma. Crisp taste, maty with a bitter dry end.

Not at all my favorite but better then the US mass producers.  Pale, yes!  bitter, a bit!  bad to good but far from great.  Pours yellow with white head. No lacing.  Not good aroma of corn, not a great taste.
I’m not sure how to rate my pet peeve of beers. Tastes like a dirty sock that a dead rotten carcass of a skunk ate before he died and then threw up during autopsy.

Bottle: I understand that the difference between fresh, on tap, and bottled is extreme for Heineken. I hope so. Bottled,
it was bland, bubbly, and a bit skunky.
The fact that macro drinkers think of this as "the good stuff" is a textbook exanple of successfully marketing an image, not a product. BUY AGAIN? No reason to

Bottle 330ml. Nothing special. Aroma is lightly hoppy, with floral tones. Tastes sweet, with some bitterness at the end. Looks bad, light yellow with no head. The body is thin and bubbly; carbonated, although not as bad as other pale lagers.

~ 12 oz bottle. God, what a boring lager this is. Typically found in mass quantities at local teenage house parties all across the US. I really want to give this beer a fighting chance, but I just can’t. As scary as this sounds, I’ve actually had worse! :-0 ~
Very light easy to drink beer that goes very well with spicy chicken wings. Kinda sad that it rated so low on here.
Pale yellow pour with a skunky smell and flavor.  Maybe it’s the green bottle, maybe it’s just a bad beer.  I have no idea.  Either way it tastes pretty bad.
Draught. Faint malt aroma, a bit fruity. Pale yellow color. Ok malt flavor, with decent balance. Drinkable stuff with enough flavor to know it’s beer. Better than most of its ilk.

Most recent notes off a 12oz bottle from minibar, but overall review is heavily influenced by hundreds and hundreds of drafts consumed not too many miles from the brewery whilst doing a work ’tour’ for 6 months in Holland last year. Pour is pale yellow, nice head &#40on draft, it’s fairly impressive looking after the whole dutch ’spatula treatment’&#41. Aroma &#40fresh&#41 is crisp malt and pilsener bite. Taste &#40fresh&#41 is crisp, clean and prickly with a nice buttery malt and a pleasant dry finish. Of course - some points deducted for the fact that the green bottle on anything but dutch shores leads to a high skunk factor and turns this from a pleasant brew to a pretty lame one. Short - in Holland  = 3.0, anywhere else = 1.8. I have had more in Holland than outside of it, so my review skews upwards.
Decent pale lager. Not my favorite, but it’s light and easy to drink which make it an ok party beer.

12 oz. bottle.  I guess I had to rate this one sooner or later, and had this one the other day so here goes.  Pours clear gold with big foamy white head, looks like any macro lager but maybe a slightly deeper gold.  Very active carbonation.  Aroma is malt, grain, skunk.  Flavor is bitter, metallic, and grainy.  Prototypical European lager, albeit not as offensive as some of the crap German ones.  The Heineken Experience was closed last summer when I was in Amsterdam, but if I ever get a chance to visit again, I’ll re-rate with the freshest one possible.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
Appearance: Pale yellow with a foamy white head that is gone pretty quickly.  Poor head retention and lacing.
Aroma: This beer defines skunky euro lager.
Taste: Light malt and metallic notes paired with an off bitterness.  Ugh.
Palate: Medium-high carbonation with a light mouthfeel and a medium &#40which is too long in this case&#41, bitter finish.
Overall: Not my favorite for sure.
Rebuy: Negative.

Big advertising does not a good beer make.

Over the years I have been handed many Heineken’s and can honestly say I never enjoyed one.

Skunky, bitter, bland why does anyone buy this?

Any american mass market lager tastes great compared to Heineken, and for much less. Not to mention all the other europen imports that are in the same price range.

Dont like it... its taste is really bitter. I am talking about the exported heineken ax from what i heard from people who visited holland heineken is awesome there, may be i’ll go to holland and try it some time!!

Experienced on several occasions via tap, bottle, and can.  Depending on the serving and storage vessel, the beer can take on drastically different characteristics.  Most often, Heineken from the bottle is terribly light-struck, and gives very heavy skunky notes, pretty much ruining what good qualities the beer does possess.  At its best from a can or draft, it is a pretty decent example of a premium lager.  The nose gives hints of pilsner malt sweetness.  Also, there is a hint of diacetyl from time to time.  The palate is reasonably refreshing, if very straightforward, combining a light and almost buttery malt sweetness with a touch of hop bitterness, and a neutral, almost insipid finish.  A vastly overpriced and overhyped beer.

Keg Can. 12 oz. Pours clear honey gold with a thick, fizzy, quickly fading white hade. Aroma of sweet malts, hops, lemon, brown sugar, and slight caramel. Light bodied with a loose, smooth palate. Finishes with a dry, bitter bite. Very decent macro pale lager.
12 oz bottle. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head.  It has a skunky taste and also tastes of hay and pine. This is a refreshing and pretty good beer in my opinion.
If you get this, you must get it on tap.  From the bottle it’s skunky, overrated, and overpriced crap.

Not much to say. Pale color, yeasty aroma/taste. Bitter. Palate rough. Tastes better over in the Netherlands. I would rather save my $7.50 and drink water next time im out at a bar. Possibly the most overrated beer ever.

OK, I’ll finally rate this after having this often in my first few years of drinking.  Pours pale yellow with an aroma of metal, grain, and faint herbal hops.  Palate always surprises me with how un-crisp it feels -- almost oily --, other than that it goes down fairly easily.  Flavor is hay, grain, metal and nothing much.  I’m just not a heineken fan, and I’m proud to say I never was.  Doesn’t mean I didn’t once TRY to be though &#40read: high school&#41.
Draft and bottle, too many. Pours pale gold, minimal head. Slight hop aroma, slight hop bitter to the tongue. Decent sessioning beer if well cared for &#40a rarity&#41. Favourite of JFK
On draft @ happy hour. Pours yellow. Adjuncty, skunky nose. Some hops. Slight bitter skunked flavor, corn, grain, bread and slight residual sweetness.

Draught
It is a decent standard lager. When served extra cold it is just dull...

12oz bottle.  Pale, this golden-yellow color.  Quick-fading head.  Sugary noble hop aroma.  Sraightforward, drinkable stuff.  Pretty balanced, with an earthy cheap malt bill balancing out the minimal hops.  A decent beer, but certainly loses points in my book just for being such a commercial entity.  A certain dirty macro feel pervades, but doesn’t dominate.  Middle of the road stuff, underrated here, and overrated out there.
Slightly sweet and dense, no acidity, no significant bitter- nor graininess.  A noticeable aroma of alcohol.

My first "real" beer ever drunk (in 1966!), so I have a bit of a soft spot for this.  The head is fair,the colour is a bit pale, aroma so-so, and the familiar bitterness in the taste.  A tad over-priced, maybe? There are better Dutch beers.

Like most pale lagers, this one is best served ice cold to kill as many of the bad flavors as possible. Its very light and fizzy with a bad skunky aroma. The taste is the same, but somehow its not as offensive as other mass produced beers of the same style. I could put up with if I had too, with emphasis on ’had to".

At first I feel this is just another over fizzy and rubbish lager but after a while the taste actually holds up without becoming too boring and it is ok to put up with the skunk for a while. Better than Carling.

UPDATE: I could not finish this skunk which is no real surprise.. this has a lot of chemical and fizz and not much else.

Best served cold, tends to get skunky. Nice frothy white head, golden appearance. Light hoppiness, slight malt, easy to drink.. but it’s a bit watered down. Still one of my faves compared to other mass produced pale lagers.
The only positive thing I can say about this "beer": at least it contains some alcohol...
Drank out of a bottle.  Smells a bit skunky, with light hops and some cereal malt.  Not much flavor, just crisp and watery with slight hops/barley and rice.  Meh.
Bottled. A light piss colored brew with no head. light malt aroma. Tastes like water. No good flavor. Starts a little bitter and ends abruptly with less bitterness. Not a good lager
i would have to agree with iabeerguy... good for a quick drink when really cold. skunky and hoppy. looks is pretty good.
I only like this nice and cold when I’m really thirsty for a quick beer. Light colored beer with minimal head. Aroma is skunky. Flavor is watered down.
Looks and smells OK, but this beer always seems a little astringent to me.  There are so many better large-brewery choices out there.
A smelly lame wanna be grolsch. Need I say more? Ok, the bud of Europe.... .

Bottle.  Pours a nice gold with a nie white head.  Aroma is skunky with a bit of malt.  On the palate it is light and rather refreshing.  The taste is watered down and skunky, but it does not leave much of an aftertaste.  Overall, I am not a big fan.  I would drink this any day over a Budwiezer or an MGD, but still just Macro brewed water.

12oz bottle.  Pours gold with a long lasting fizzy head.  Smells very skunky and some maltiness.  Even after having  many of these throughout the years, they always seem skunky.  Tastes about the same.  Some skunkiness, balanced out by a decent malt and hop finish.  Very nice drikability and very refreshing.
Rather poor and insipidus brevage which couild at least be a good substitute to water during summer excesses.

Poured from a bottle; golden yellow color with a thin white head.  Smells okay, nothing special or too distinct.  Disgusting metallic bitter taste, somewhat skunky.  Bitter aftertaste lingers too longer for its own good.  I would never buy this for myself.
Bottle. 5%. Smell is horrifying. Very skunky. Clear pale yellow lager, taste is like any other high distribution pl. Highly carbonated. Nothing to get excited about, especially for the price.

Bottle Poured. Golden yellow, small white head which doesn’t last. Very skunky taste, partially due to the green bottle i’m sure. If you’re in the mood for a skunky lager Heineken’s for you, if not then look elsewhere.

Tap, 25 cl served in a typical non-beer glass, with a beautiful Heineken-logo on it. Too many bubbles, golden clear colour, no head at all (bad served?). Positive was that is was served extra cold. The aroma is sweet, a bit hopy, but also the smell of shampoo, sigarettes, tobacco and a bit stinky overall. The taste starts sweet, then becomes light grainy (here we come to the ony positive thing in the taste), directly followed by an unpleasant bitter taste breaking down he whole taste. No aftertaste at all, but it is a rather yeasty bear. No beauttiful transitions in the tasts. Also carbonation in the end, which made me belch. I don’t like this beer.

bottle@’heineken café’ Brussels, soft yellow colour and almost no head served in their strange ’limonade glasses’, stinking hops and artificial smell (shampoo?). Taste: a bit grainy, some bitterness, rotten hops and too much sweetness. Much bubbles!  Would you believe it? I don’t like it!

Bottle, Honolulu. Skunk aroma. This beer always tastes sweet to me. I really am looking forward to tasting this beer in the Netherlands to see what it really tastes like. I drink this beer often, and now I don’t know why?

Poured a typical lager light gold, yawn. Aroma is 100% uber skunk, quite repellent. Flavour is hops and utter crispiness, leaving you with a slightly bitter swallow and a dry grainy wheat finish, not too bad. Average and fairly competent, but totally soulless and an utter wallet rape for what it is. Don’t bother with it on tap either, it’s garbage in that setting.
ellow gold in colour with a strong acidic aroma. Bland taste compared to other European beer, but one of the better cheap European beers on the North American market...it is what it is...

Bottle. Poured a pale to medium yellow with a small white fizzy head that was fully diminishing and had poor lacing. The aroma was that of light grain malts, a flowery hop and a horse blanket yeast. It  tasted a little bitter at first and finished with a mild bitter hoppy flavor that was quite crisp. Mouthfeel was light in body and dry in texture with a lively carbonation. Overall a nice crisp refreshing brew, just right for the style.

Better than water ,Miller and Budweiser, but not much else.
Not bad, but not good either

Green bottle pours a calm carbonation and mixed fine/bubbly head that is small.  It smells of slight skunk, crisp malt and light dry noble hop. Taste is sweet pale malt and has a palate-smacking crispness at first. I becomes soon too sweet. The late feel is increasingly drying and soapy. I think I just felt something weird in my left upper salivary gland. This beer is kind of aggressive in feel. and every sip is like having my nose in a skunk’s ass. Maybe a very young pretty skunk. But whatever. I ditch more than half the bottle.

Bottled.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malt and straw. Flavor weak of malt.

Poured a clear pale gold small bubbly head which fades quickly. Light hops in the aroma. Slightly sweet, quite a watery beer. A little malt and a slightly metallic finish. Not that bad for a macro-brew, much better when drank in Holland.
Bottle at DT 2009. Pale golden color with a large but fluffy white head which disappears fast. Light malty aroma. Flavor is malty with a touch of sweetness.

This beer is horrible in the US and in Amsterdam its more than tolerable.

Never drink anywhere but around the real brewery and you’re set.

Best of the bad beers.  Get it if nothing but Miller’s and Coors is available.  Pours clear, pale gold with a large white head; smell of straight malt, not really anything else.  Taste is slightly sweet, a bit of malt, somewhat weak, tiny hint of hops.  Meh.  Soulless, but not terrible.
Pale yellow color with a distinct taste. Very bitter in my opinion. Not something I care to have again.
19.01.2010 on tap at the "News Cafe" in Groningen. Pale yellow colour with white head. Aroma is malty with some nice flower-like hops. Not bad at all, but not the best. (24.06.2009, 0,5l Can)
Drank a pint once and pretty much wish I had not bothered. Instantly forgettable and a truely bad beer in every sense of the word bad.

Compared to the Bavaria I just had, this is beer heaven. Well, more like a heaven you could buy at a pawnshop.
Dumped out a light weak gold and produced little head that died quickly. The aroma is ok but lacks any defining qualities. Grain, light grass, some alcohol or something else ...maybe chemicals? dunno. Nothing appealing here at all. Some apple. The flavour revolves around a bitter hop / solid but faceless malt content. Bready indeed. Slight fruit. Annoying hops. Come on, you know this beer is sub-par. Seems a bit heavy for the style but this isn’t really a bad thing. Poor swish./..maybe this is too thick now... don’t want anymore (wrong day for a lame beer me thinks). I guess the carbonation is not bad afterall. The finish is decent with a short lived hop end along with a noticable malty ending. Dude, it’s a Heineken....Look like a rock star around the norms.

On draught at a café somewhere. No real aroma to speak of, no head, colour is off-yellow and more appetizing than your cheapest beers but still nothing special. Taste is all grains and a slightly bitter finish. Not bad. Should probably cheaper for what it is.

Crisp and refreshing with light bitterness and a hint of citrus. Feels light and fizzy with a somewhat metallic/skunky aftertaste. I feel like a Jersey Broseph drinking this.  Not terrible, but definitely not worth the money.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow, with a thin white head that quickly reduces to a ring, acceptable lacing. Mild saaz character, apples, pale malt on the nose. Slight hops, rice and grain, more apples, skunk and melon rind on the palate. Overly carbonated, too clean, simple basic, grassy and bland. I was at a golf course and it was actually the least of all available evils. meh.

I have never, ever in my life understood why anyone would pay so much for this stuff. The aroma is heavy, definitely a scent that correlates more with a malt-heavy beer, in my opinion. The color is a rich gold, which does do justice for the overall character of the beer. The flavor is heavy for its category, with a distict aftertaste that can be overwhelming. I recommend heavy duty teeth brushing and gargling after a Heineken-the aftertaste will literally last for as long as you go without sanitizing the effected area. The carbonation is unusually low for a pale lager (or perhaps more accurately, it just seems to settle much faster), which kind of gives it a stagnant pond vibe if you are used to most others. Just not very good. Try another -dam beer and you will be better off.
I found this old rating in my notes- must have been a desperate night. Can. Golden colour with a rich white head. Mild hop aroma. Medium bitterness. Good carbonation. Refreshing alternative to water.
Amber color with decent taste.  Definitely has a bready, heavy aftertaste.  Has been marketed the right way and is expensive even though its the same as any other pale American Lager
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is mostly skunk.  Not too much else.  Flavor is, not surprisingly, skunky.  Just nasty.

this is not a good beer and not a cheap one either! has the price of good craft brews but none of the flavor. if you drink  this then you are probably the dork with tapout t-shirt that smells like he bathed in axe deodorant. hops are present but they cant hide that pervasive skunk tinge. avoid like the swine flu.
One of the most overrated beers.  I keep going back to try it based on its acclaim, every tasting is the same, poor.  What little flavor it does have is not very pleasing.

Ah yes I have finally arrived at Heineken the beer that difines Euro trash. The beer looks not so bad golden body with a one inch of bubbly head that vanished pretty quick, just your average looking lager really. But after you look at this beer every thing ells goes down hill fast. This was the first time I’v ever had a Heineken that didn’t smell like I was sucking on a skunk, instead my nose was treated a different fowl stench it was if I just walked into a public toilet where a some one just dropped the biggest azz bomb possible after a night of Taco Bell, combined with musty apple juice, this beer is very strong smelling. I don’t find the taste as bad as the smell but it’s still very sub par, cheap malts, moldy apples and a slightly metallic taste are what I notice, once again very surprised in this particular bottle no skunk was present. The beer also felt thin and watery and left a very sweet bready after taste. I truly do not understand the popularity of this beer, it’s crappy European beer with a multi million dollar add campaign ( however the keg cans are kind of cool ) stop falling for it and drink almost anything else, but if you must drink it please be wearing the appropriate attire, tight black leather pants, a shinny silk shirt unbuttoned past your chest with hair slicked back and you must be listening to techno this entire look is best described as Euro trash.

BBBBBBBBBBBAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF!!!!!  Only drink if there is nothing left too drink!!!  Please ensure total annhiliation is present before drinking... not even suitable for beer pong.
Decent flavor with a bit of bitterness, but the heavy smell of skunk throws me off too much to enjoy. Plenty of beer in the same price range that are more enjoyable.
Aroma and flavor of skunk, some hops and a basic lager flavor. Not worth the time.
Pale, dry, watered-down, the typical boring cheap lager. I guess it’s ok for what it is.

12fl oz bottle poured into a dimpled mug.  Pours straw color with one finger white head that quickly disappears.  Smells faintly of hops but kind of skunky.  Flavor is kind of bland, with subtle notes of citrus, hops, and socks.  Palate is watery.  With all that said, it is actually drinkable.  This is not a "good beer" but a cheap session beer that I could throw back a six-pack of with the guys.

pours crystal clear pale straw yellow with white head.  The aroma is skunky and slightly malty.  The flavor is almost non existent, and is of water and maybe some malt and hops.  Mouthfeel is like soda water.  Overall this sucks.

A shame that Heineken is now brewed in New Zealand by Dominion Breweries.  A real turn-off, original taste has been tarnished by DB’s one-zone, traditional blandness brewing techniques. That is, squirt a bit of our rank flavour into all our products.  Result, all the beers taste like juicy fruit gum.

What is there to add? It is sold everywhere and very popular. This one is a 330ml bottle brewed under license in Australia (which doesn’t stop it being listed under the "imported" beer section of most drinks menus Down Under). Pours clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of grainy sweet malts and subtle grassy hops. The taste is mainly sweet malt but there is just a touch of grassy-hay hop character in the finish to give it that slight air of sophistication when compared to usual mainstream lagers. Rather thin bodied with a flat carbonation. It is a good thirst quencher for sure but that’s about all really.

Nearly flavorless, nearly clear - not so bad over ice. 

that is,  if  you have no other beer choice available!
Pale golden yellow with a soft white foam.  Grainy adjunct laden malt aroma.  Taste is very sweet, malt, corn, overwhelming.  Feels like a malt liquor.
Green bottle.  Pours gold with a white ead.  Smells and tastes like a crappy, skunky pale lager.  No discernable nose, some fruity appley hints on the finish.

Been drinking this since i was too young to legally drink. It’s got a straw taste with a slight hop finish that is not too bad. Not world class beer but this is my fall back beer if there is no quality beer around.
Bottle. Sweeter than a pilsner should be. Some barley when tasting. Short finish. A bit carbonatede. Very flat.

Can:

Pale gold with a long lasting puffy white head.

Banana yeasts with some orange notes and light airy cereals.

No real sign of hops except maybe the tiniest inkling of something at the back of the throat.  It is very sweet all round with tropical passionfruit and banana.

Quite thick but a little too fizzy. Belch inducing.

Bland but better than many.

100% Barley malt, choice hops and pure water give this brew unsurpassed clarity. So why does it give a bad hangover? I don’t trust this nothing taking lager whatsoever. The Netherlands are lagging behind the dutch in the beer department.

Pale amber pour with a small head that faded quickly.
Aroma is a mix of light skunk, floral hops and sweet malt.
Flavour really fails, with sweet malt and a short-lived, weak, dirty bitterness. Incredibly watery.
Not a really offensive beer, but just plain boring.

Can at home.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of malts with notes of fruits and hops.
Flavour of malts with notes of fruits and hops.
Hoppy finish.

Slight skunky aroma, nice light amber hue with thick, frothy head. Crips flavor is reminiscent of hay and malt. Lasting palate with thick (but not too much so) taste. Overall, the number one American import for many years (until Corona took over a year or two ago) has good reason to be. While being a little bit on the high side price wise, this brew is not too expensive to enjoy on a regular basis.
LIght skunky hop aroma. Flavor is sweet malt and a little hop bitterness. Not too bad not that good.
A light yellow beer, white head. Poor, boring beer. Easily drinkable but nothing more.
One word. Meh. As popular as this beer is, it sure is disappointing. It wasn’t awful but it wasn’t great. Smell was alright but kind of had a skunky aftertaste.
Can. Aroma and taste seems a bit soapy and metallic. Head disappears rapidly. Pretty crap really.
Too expensive for what it delivers. I can enjoy it, but I would much rather have a Rolling Rock or a Coors.(Both of which ar tastier and cheaper in my opinion)
Bottle.  Mild malty aroma.  Very pale golden body, large white head.  Flavor is sweet and malty, with a bit of hay and grass.  For a macro pale lager, this is one of the best.

Medium white head. Pale yellow body with carbonation. Dry papery apple malts taste with straw notes. Mid-bodied. Dry papery corn and rubber aftertaste with grassy malty notes. Sort of bland and mildly unpleasant, but could be a lot worse. (0.5l can from Joker Gamlebyen.)
(bottle). Pours a clear yellow color. Small white head. Alcohol aroma. Light malt and alcohol taste. Smooth/watery finish, with alcohol taste that lasts. Soft carbonation.

Decent lager, I don’t like the bitter taste that is associated with the after taste. I usually drink lots of beer, and after drinking 3 or 4 heineken the after taste and bitterness becomes more and more apparent. This therefore makes it not a stand-alone easy drinking beer, although it is quite delicious when accompanying a hearty meal. Decent brew.
A glass or three from a 5 litre Can. Apperance; Light golden, clear with a minimal head. Aroma; Light hoppy and grass with a light bitter flavor. A bit sour aftertaste.

12oz bottle. Pours diluted urine yellow, white head that is gone like-that. No lacing. Smells like cheap beer, tastes like cheap beer. Not sure why anybody would buy this if it costs more than Keystone Light or PBR?
Too skunky, kind of smooth, but would rather have most domestic lights for half the price.
Clear and yellow...foamy head. Aromas of skunk, grain, corn and sileage.....Taste is a cloying sweetness. Yay.
Clear gold foamy white head. Skunky grainy fruity aroma. Doesn’t taste quite as skunky as it smelled but maybe my senses were just dulled by it. Earthy and spicy taste. Crisp and clean finish.
very bitter, golden, sparkling, white foam, medium body, slick feel, bitter, average carbonation,
Yellow color. Thin white head that disappears quickly. Sweet, bready aroma. Flavor is much the same. Skunky finish with a lot of corn adjunct flavors.
330 liter bottle Doha, Qatar Well not much to say other than it is pretty nasty stuff. Not a lot of beers in Qatar. This stuff seems to be getting worse everytime I am dumb enough to drink it again.
Ha, why not? Looks like urine. Not much coming through on the nose. Flavor is bland, not very complex, but refreshing to say the least.

q macro brew it is not offensive but neither is it good. i really will not say much more about this brew other than that it has a certain flavor that i find common with regard to brews of this region. i also prefer amstel.
Probably the most common beer in greece. Personally I don’t like it at all. I’ve tasted worse though. I think the taste is just awful...I prefer amstel.
Never liked two grab that heine tases like a dead skunk and way two bitter..
More flavor than the popular lagers, and still avoids a dry, bitter finish.  This is one of the better mainstream brews I’ve had.

Had it from tap, cans, bottles and even the 3,5% version available in Sweden. As almost everyone knows this is a watery lager with little smell or taste. Usually served too cold, but allowing it to get warmer only brings out a taste of chemicals. So why then have I had so many Heinekens? It’s usually the only beer available in strange places, Carpathian mountains, Moroccan deserts you name it. Heineken is the Coca cola of beers and that´s it´s main quality.
This is a average beer.  It isn’t a good lager, but it is easy to drink and certainly offers more flavor that the other popular alternatives.

Presentation: It was poured from a green 12oz bottle into a pilsener glass. There was no freshness date on the bottle.

Appearance: Its color was a bright straw yellow with very good clarity and some nice visible carbonation. The head was bright white in color, average in size but fades out fast leaving not much in the way of lace.

Smell: The aroma had a fairly clean light grain and light floral hops with just the slightest funk.

Taste/Mouth feel: Its flavor is clean and crisp. Malt flavor is light with a dry biscuit like grain mixed with some very light floral hops. The body is light with a thin easy drinking texture. Its carbonation is balanced and the finish is fairly dry, clean and crisp.

Notes: This is your very simple, basic Euro lager for trendy people to say hey look at me I’m drinking an import. Still it’s not bad.
Normal beer color with a head that disappears quite fast. Great drinkability.... Damn solid overall beer however.

Unfortunately the most common beer in and of the Netherlands, boring taste, or rathermore, lacking taste, even for a pilsener.
It will get you partying without a headache though.
From stubby can. typical lager appearance and aroma. Seemed a bit oily. The beer had a weird after taste. Completely different to on tap.

Overall Impression: 
Want to know the easiest way to tell if someone had decent taste in beer?:


Ask them what they think of Heiney, if they think its good then they don’t know beer.  If they call it shit beer, they’ve got my respect.  For me this is to Euro Beers as Magic Hat # 9 is to American Craft Beers.

I have before me a moment of both anticipation and trepidation because, for me, Heineken was one of those early exploratory beers which I drank because it wasn’t those nasty watered-down American lager swill. When I had a beer in my younger years an order of Heineken was a point of pride, of joy, and of maturity. Oh, how the times have changed and how the clouds have cleared to show in full shining beauty the clarity of my ignorance. Ignorance is only bliss when it is still ignorance, but when ignorance steps aside to make way for enlightenment, only then can we, and I, appreciate the true folly of my views. With that in mind, I approach my Heineken lager, in a bottle, poured into an, unfortunately, cold frosted glass.




Bubbles practically explode as I pour my pale straw-hued Heineken Lager into my glass, a thin excuse for a head forming for a brief moment before disappearing. A few scattered bubbles float on top of her brew below, and after a few moments to try and give my over-chilled Heineken a chance to warm, I partake of grassy hops, hay, lemon and dank, almost rotten grains and malts. She is still bubbling away as I take my first quaff and wonder what delusion of youth I was under when I thought I enjoyed this back in the day. The brain-washing mass marketing of an inferior product maybe? Sweet and lemony hay make their presence known first while very quickly some bland and soggy malts and grains make up the middle of her palate. The finish is unfortunately rather rotten and kind of funked. Dank, wet, swampy, and none to pleasant, especially as it lingers long after the quaff and into the next. The crisp lemon, lager yeasts, and grass struggle to fight the good fight, but end up failing as I painfully finish my glass.




I was truly hoping for better and have heard rumors that the can is better, but if the product inside is the same, I can hardly see why. Maybe Heineken Lager was better in the years of my youth, but maybe it wasn’t. I don’t have the option to compare one from then to now, but years from now, I really have no desire to try another to compare to my notes from now.
Call me crazy but i think heineken is a decent all around beer. Not great but above average. I espescially like it out of the mini-kegs.

I got five of these for 7 bucks at a crappy bar.  I’ve got to say that I’ve always hated Heineken, even before I became enlightened to the world of real beer.  However, this time I thought it was little better than expected.  It’s not even worth going into details about the aromas or flavors because most of us know that they don’t really exist. The only positive thing I can really say about this beer is that I pounded ’em pretty quickly and that it’s not as watery as the American giants.
Translation: Skunk.  Did not like this one bit, and I’ve tried it several times, and each time, no.

A yellow colored beer with a large frothy head. Aroma is slightly malty with some grassy hoppiness. Flavor is rahter malty but nothing sticks out. Slightly dry. Pretty ok in its category nothing else.
Bottle. Clear golden, some head retention. Aroma is light grains and bread, a vague hint of hops.

Average pale clear yellow lager with a little too much carbonation. Grainy grassy aroma. Mild malty flavour with a odd bitter to it. Light body without much character. It’s on the dry side with an off-metal note that I both find unattractive. Easy on the palate relatively speaking, it’s easy to gulp down.

One of the worst beers in the world. No taste, no guts, nothing at all. If I had a choice between Heineken and Pepsi, i still rather drink the bloody pepsi. I admit Belgians are a bit spoiled having all those great beers around. I even can’t think of a village not having it’s own beer. But come on, Heineken? that’s just a poor effort.

golden with lots or carbonation. Mild malty aroma with hints of some fruit. Flavour is little sweet. Short finish thank god. Watery and no complelxity. After rating it, i put a slice of lemon in to give it some taste....

710 mL bottle. Pours a clear yellow-gold with a two-finger fizzy white head that quickly dissipates. Some lace was left on the sides of the glass as it was sipped. The aroma is malt, hops, steamed rice, a hint of skunk and grass, and a faint innuendo of honey. The taste is a pungent mix of sweet malt and rice followed by grassy hops and a mild aftertaste of skunk with a touch of honey. This beer is very overrated and overpriced for what it really is. I’m not buying it again.

Pours a pale yellow with average carbonation and a decent white head. Aroma is skunky... what do you expect from a European lager? Other notes are grass, apple, earth and bread. Tastes skunky too. It’s very grassy, apples, bread, grain, slight metallic finish. Palate is very mainstream. It is what it is.
Eh. It’s OK, Nice hoppy aroma & golden yellow apperance. First few sips go down smooth, but soon leaves a metallic aftertaste that just screams headache. Not impressed.

oohhhh that smell, cant you smell that smell... Pungent... And i definitely agree with the unsurpassed clarity, i dont even think Evian could top this clarity... We used to put a lemon wedge in our pints on $2 Heineken draft nights after soccer games...
Not my first choice but still superior to many of the other common swill being consumed out there.
Bottle. We all know what heineken is and what it is all about. No need to go all onto it.

Bottle poured into a pint glass.

Pours a clear golden yellow with a short lived white head that left no lacing on the way down.  The aroma is textbook Euro lager with lots of grains, especially corn, and light malts.

The taste is sweeter than the aroma would indicate with some sweet malts and grains.  There is a fairly abrasive bitterness in the finish though not extremely off-putting.

The mouthfeel is a tad thin but not terrible for the style with lots of carbonation.

This is certainly not a beer I would drink frequently but it’s better than many other options out there, especially within the style.

Drank out of a can at 15,000ft on my way to Phoenix
A- Light orange/yellow hue, dense layer of soapy foam that sustains, moderate lacing on the plastic cup
S- Mostly light corn malts, clean and crisp with grassy hops, not much going on
T- Mass produced import lager that is lacking in flavor, mild malts and grassy hops are present in small amounts, finishes with slight dryness
M- Light-bodied, watered down texture, high carbonation
D- Better than most domestic lagers, Heineken has some subtle flavors and is very easy-to-drink, I would pass on this for just about any other style of craft beer but my options are severely limited while flying Southwest
I actually don’t mind Heineken.  If I am going out for a night of drinking, I’d rather this than most other "high volume" stuff.
Not much to it, taste skunky with an even worse aftertaste. Not worth the extra $$ over all the other crappy "general service" beers.
12 oz bottle from the grocery store.  Poured a clear yellow color with a one finger white head.  Aroma and flavor are both grainy and bitter.  Not very good.

Why would you use a green bottle?  I guess it’s just a marketing ploy for people who don’t care about taste anyway.  The fact that people consider this a "premium" beer in the US is laughable.  Yellow color, fizzy white head.  Pilsnerish hops and grain on the aroma.  Flavor is skunky and metallic with a little malt and bitter low-quality hoppiness, not much better than Bud/Miller/Coors. If this was the MTV show "Next," I would say "Next" (and hope the next beer off the truck was a Westvleteren Abt 12).  Oh yeah and John Turturro is a sellout with no clue about beer.  Those ads are awful.

UPDATE 5/26/09: actually tried a non-skunked bottle and it wasn’t all that bad!  Flavor was pilsner-like with grassy hops and sweet pale malt.
Yellow in color with a small white head. Aroma is of light hops and grain. Taste is grainy with some corn and light hops.
Draught. Clear light yellow with white head. Slightly sweet. Betted than canned or bottled. Weak aroma. welcoming after a long days walk.

Still makes me think of drunker nights on the island of St. Martin. In essence... the Bud of the Netherlands. Sure there are better, but in many bars this is the best you can get. A bit odd in taste (and aftertaste) Heinies can still provide a decent beer experience when faced with the options of PBR, Bud, MGD, etc. Not my fav, but definitely the goto beer for the lower end destination where drinking an import will not get you punched...

This beer has everything I hate about European pale lagers.  Green bottle, skunky smell and taste and really nothing much else.  It isn’t as bad as Grohlsh, but it isn’t good.  The canned version isn’t as bad, but I’m rating a bottle.

330ml Bottle
