A real disappointment. A real pissy yellow color, with a skunky taste. Nothing special at all, would NEVER buy it again.
5 litre keg. Poured with a small white sudsy head. Good lively carbonation with a hop aroma. Golden yellow in colour with a good mouthfeel.

Keep it ice cold  to keep it legit. Heineken made me burp like a happy homeless dude. Swilled a sixer just now. The palate is ok. Dry,with grainy maltiness and a sweet tang. I  wanna locate their dark lager .Its cool that a dark Heineken lager is even in existence & i’m not sure why..

12 ounce bottle, Pours a clear pale golden with a small head. Low head retention and light lacing. Taste is major sweet corn with some grassy notes. Taste is skunky with sweet corn notes and light toasted grain. LIght bodied.

BOTTLE: Light gold pour, fizzy, taste is a cross between novocaine and skunk rectum. The brewer’s core competency is marketing, not brewing - proof that if you raise the price a bit and tell people its a better product, some will believe....

12 oz. bottle courtesy of a friend. Clearly, not a very good friend. Pours a light golden hue, yellowish with white carbonated head that dies quickly. Little to no lacing. Aromas are grainy, a touch of funk, and adjucty. Just not a beer that keeps well. Initial is similar, grains and skunkiness are this beer’s defining factors. A touch of bitterness that is very little, a smooth body, a clean finish. Nothing special about this, as it does what every macro does. Some people just think this is a preferrable macro.

*I am drinking both the Heineken and Heineken light simultaneously to gauge the subtle differences between two beers that probably fulfill the same roles in our beer society... identical tawny orange-yellow bodies.... more effervescence in the original; head overfills the Javer pokal and holds to a half-finger head... pingish, metallic malts, as expected... an active (?) early bite that finesses into a soft, bubbly faux champagne finish.... straw malt that lacks an offensice or offensiveness; either way, another green beer meant for mas consumption.... gassy ending doesn’t endear... only visiting the brewery itself can softne the otherwise droll rounds this beer makes at backyard barbeques, holiday celebrations, baptisms, birthdays, etc...
Light golden body with a thin white head, a bit of a metallic taste and a similarly unpleasant aftertaste.  Worse than most mass market lagers.

From the moment the bartender poured this beer in the glass, I hated myself for trying this beer. The aroma of the beer that I inhaled made me think the beer had gone bad. However it had a good golden color to it so I decided to choke it down and I do mean choke it down. The beer left a horrible aftertaste that I still can taste just thinking about it. The only thing that made me finish it was the fact that I got charged $10 for the one bottle and even at that I was thinking of leaving it. There is only so much pain a person can take in one night.
i love the skunky aroma and tast a good all around beer best served very cold

Heineken is very carbonated and acidic making for a burp infused drinking experience. The beer is gold in color with a soft, white head. There’s a strong aroma here that some say is of straw. I don’t know what it is exactly, but it’s pretty unique to Heineken. Taste-wise, there’s a pleasant dry bitterness that lingers into the aftertaste. Sweet malts and grass constitute the minimal flavor presented. The body is watery and thin.
Can. Pours a fizzy yellow. Grape taffy flavor. Bad metallic flavors too. Okay in a pinch.

You see? Everybody loves Heineken. Kind of reminds me of Mom! A peculiar sweetness that you may have once been embarrassed to admit that you love, - oh what the.... Thsi is the go to beer anyplace where there is noplace to go. Crisp, somebody, hops, malt, a lot more going than any obvious American counterpart. Have you priced a case of Stone Ruination lately? I’ll come back when I acrually have a bottle in my hand and paint the picture.

If your in one of those places where you read their beer list with a frown, this isn’t so bad. If you need to make the family reunion go a little a better, or the only place open is the gas station, why not. It’s not a waste of money.
Sweet, metallic, and noticeable alcohol flavor.
What else can be said? A tasty macro that is turned to in times of beer strife. Yellow body, dry hop with lemon taste, thin palate. Fun in the sun, but most of us prefer the shade.

I would say its more of an accustomed taste, not a bad beer to grab a six pack (or mini keg) of and chill with your buddies and drink

---by the way, i just got out of high school

Pours a clear yellow with a fizzy white head. Atroma is of grass, straw, malt, and hops. Taste is of funky malt, straw, grass, and weak hops. Watery mouthfeel. The earthy funk taste makes it hard to drink. Funkier taste than other pale lagers, but lacks that watery poundability akin to poor macros due to the taste.

Pours a clean looking, pale gold color. Thick white head that stands up. Nose of grassy hops. A bit light mouthfeel, but malt is present with hops in back. Clean finish. Like it or not, an industry standard for a European lager.

From 500ml can. Smells like grass or straw. Golden yellow colour. Crisp clean and hoppy. Good carbonation.
I like it better on tap.
From bottle, yellow color with lively carbonation and medium to thick head that diminish quite quickly, aroma is grassy with som flowers,  flavor of citrus, malt with hoppy aftertaste.

Pours pale gold with a 3 finger foamy and somewhat chunky head. Aroma is sour grainy malt, sweet straw, grassy hops a lot of metal and some skunk, but not as bad as other Heineken bottles I have had. Flavor is lightly sweet grainy malt, straw, grassy hops, and some melatllic notes. Not bad for the style, fairly crisp, light and sweet in body, carbonation was a little low but I probably poured too violently and killled it off myself.

Pours a golden color with a thick carbonated white head
taste a little sweeter than other lagers
Pours a pale yellow, gold.  While light on flavor, some hops contribute to the skunkiness factor. Definitely better than the standard American pils/lager, but overall not that good.
bottle. light color strong carbonation.  excessively bitter taste.  not pleasant.  will avoid in future.
Pours light gold. No significant aroma, but some sweetness. Flavor is sweet with little hop characteristics. Clean finish.

[Keg at The Gateway, Reading] The taste reminds me slightly of Stella Artois for some reason.  However, while I cant stand Stella, this works a lot better for me and I found it reasonably drinkable by macro lager standards.  Herby/green leaf taste to the fore, a little citrus, a smidgeon of rather cardboardy malt behind.  Slightly sour, with a dry, bitter finish.  Its got more flavour than a lot of macro lagers, but is still pretty bland and I was struggling to maintain interest in it by the end of the pint.

Canette de 500 ml. La bière est de couleur miel avec un col de mousse modeste. Au nez on respire des arômes de céréales mielleuses. En bouche le corps est mince avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goûte des saveurs douces de céréales qui s exprime en parfaite coalition avec des saveurs de miel et de houblon aromatique. Une bière bière de brosse qui procure des lendemain de veille facile.

Bottle. Pours a bright yellow body with lots of carbonation. Decent sized, fizzy, white head that dissipated quickly, however, slower than anticipated. Left an ok lace on the glass. Aroma of pale malts and caramel, but a noticeable hop smell. Better than I remember and definitely better than an MGD or Bud. Taste is similar. Pale and bland, but more taste than most cheap lagers. An actual hop backing and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Palate is light and crisp with lots of carbonation. Overall, I know this isnt one of the most popular beers amongst RB, but it really isnt THAT bad. Its drinkable and I would easily choose this over another crappy lager because it has a decent spicy taste.

12oz bottle, pale yellow color, boring head. Rumor has it that every Heineken bottle in the US is skunked and weve come to like the taste. Too much of a sting with a watery finsh. Too expensive. Great holiday present. Oh, and they taste better after the third or fourth bottle...
Yellow gold in colour with a strong acidic aroma.  Bland taste compared to other European beer, but one of the better cheap European beers on the North American market.

330 mL. This beer is highly inconsistent. In every country I try this, it is completely different yet still bad overall. Pours a pale yellow with a small white head. Weak hops, sweet malt, cereal in the nose. Taste is watery and overly carbonated but not offensive. Sometimes I get some muted fruit notes in this beer like strawberries. Clean finish.

Appearance: Yellow golden, very clear. Little bit of white head.
Aroma: Hops and malt, some fruit. Bit of alcohol.
Taste: Bland. Some fruit, hops and malt. Easy-drinking but boring.
Info: 330ml bottle, 21/12-2008

Rather pungent aroma of horse-blanket yeast. Pine/grassy hops. Sweet aroma with hints of lime zest. 
Light, straw malt and perfume hops. Slight taste of pear and cereal malt. 
Pale yellow appearance, white head quickly diminishes. 
An off taste of burnt plastic the whole way through. Only enjoyable when very cold. Meh...
Out of a keg can came a yellow color the classic bitter taste and a watery ending to this Holland voyage.
Pale yellow colour, weak hoppy aroma and flavour, light bodied, watery finish.
a so.so brew...a watered down fruity flavor, slightly cloudy, small head, pretty smooth but rather boring

500 cl can of 4.5% Heineken. Due the alcohol laws here in Finland the beer is specially brewed 4.5%, not 5.0%.
Well carbonated beer pours with some head. Taste is very basic lager but good for a European lager beer. Not much of a aftertaste. Extremely easy to drink.
It was my first Dutch and European beer prob. like most American boys. I like its skunk taste.  Its a dance club beer becasue its usually a dollar or less more than a big three doemstic

Floral aroma, as mentioned below. Light appearance, nearly blonde in color. Mildly hoppy and drinkable, but nothing to write home about. Not nasty like Bud, but not really distinct either. Put it on the shelf with Stella among overrated Euro beers corrupted by mass production.

Tasted from a 24 oz. keg can, then poured into glassware to avoid the nasty green bottle. Light straw color. Nothing to look at. Hop aroma seems contained, like a floral bouquet that never quite comes out. Taste is clean. Thin mouth, slight bitter. Overall this beer is all about the marketing, with taste taking a back seat. A mediocre beer, and that is putting it kindly.
Clássica cerveja lager, com o seu amargor mas suavidade. Varia muito conforme local de produção, podendo ter toques adocicados.

On.
Always hated this stuff...
Pours like piss, smells like piss and looks like piss...
I wouldnt drink this even if it were the only thing availible.
pale with the pour but has a decent head for a pale lager. This is definitely one of the better pale lagers out there.

Clear metallic gold, with huge, just yellowish tinted head, leaving some lace. Dry, spicy, peppery malts nose, straw. Very dry spicy, even bitterish onset, then, however, everything goes b&&#35;40;l&&#35;41;a&&#35;40;n&&#35;41;d to near-imperceptible flavours, reduced boring sweetish malt, like pre-sliced industrial white bread. Bereft of EVERY trace of aftertaste. Light. Starts better than expected, then thinks the better of it, as if horrified of its boldness.

Clear yellow color with small head.  Not much aroma.  Not much taste, but nothing offensive about the taste.  I don’t mind having one now and then.  I think of it as the best beer for people who don’t like beer.  Maybe that is why it is so over-hyped.

CaryTheDude and I had crushed a ridiculous amount of awesome brews for several days on a road trip to Cali. We went to this bar to celebrate a friends wedding, but we went to the wrong bar. But the wrong bar was awesome, and we crushed some more ridiculously awesome brews. So, in reality, it was the right bar. But, then we had to go to the other bar. CarytheDude orders a Heineken, right? And I wanted to be all "Fuck That Shit! Pabst Blue Ribbon!" But I didn’t. Then he turns to me and says, "I never noticed how skunky this beer is" and handed it to me. And I took a sip, and it was seriously like someone had carbonated a skunk. And then some other things happened, but that’s how we saved the day and realized how horrible Heineken is.
Wow, is this beer bad.  You can get it anywhere around the world and it tastes the same:  bad.

clear yellow, quickly dissipating white head, some lacing.  nose of skunky corn.  no skunkiness in the flavor, but the corn flavor is rather syrupy.  light bodied, slightly sweet corn syrup finish.  not a very interesting lager.  inoffensive and mostly forgettable.  i get a bigger kick from budweiser.
Bottle.  Pale lager, smells like a skunk just strolled on by, yet everyone looks so happy, am i the only smelling this, i guess ciesla nose.  What can i say corny, grainy and easy drinking.
Macrobrew in the can taste but you pay more for it because it’s an import! What a scam, though I loved the part Heineken played on Mad Men.

Bottle form the LCBO
I have never liked Heineken
Another mass produced aweful pale lager

This lager is a fine example of the dutch brewing art and recieves favourable marks from a lot of people. Having not imbibed this continental lager for a good while I decided to buy a five litre keg from my local stockist and see if it was the same as I’d remembered from my time in Amsterdam. Drank the whole lot whilst playing poker and threw up on my shoes on the walk home. What’s more I pissed in the goldfish tank mistaking it for the toilet and now my wife isn’t talking to me. A fine lager I would reccommend to anyone!
pale with the pour but has a decent head for a pale lager.  This is definitely one of the better pale lagers out there.
Pour from a 24 oz can. Pale yellow with thin head, not much of an aroma. Flavor of light malt  with a decent dry hops finish. Not bad.

Draught (from a good pub). Pours appealing gold with pristine, very durable head, with some lacing too. Not much on the nose, faint hops, and slightly tart on the palate, with undertones of yeast. Not bad, one of the better mass-produced beers.

Bottle,can,tap.A good, clear, clean golden lager. Not much nose. Taste is a little bitter, a little malt, kind of a skunky hop thing. Not bad all in all. I drink this if nothing better is on hand when I go places.

24 oz. bottle. Pours a thin, short lived head over a clear pale yellow body....mild grass like nose...minimal taste of anything perhaps a bit of hops. The interesting thing is that 30 years ago this was a great (at that time) beer. How we have evolved.

I’ve never been big on Heineken. It’s only ok if it’s really really cold. The only way to really describe a Heineken is skunk. It tastes just like a skunk. I can’t even force myself to choke down more than one.

Fuck it, I kind of like Heineken.  What?  Bottle.  Clear golden pour.  Just kidding, I drank it out of the bottle.  I always taste grape juice/grape candy from Heineken.  Not all the sweetness, but the flavor.  Some hops.  That weird, kindy skunky Heineken thing.  This beer is really easy to drink.

As far as pale lagers go, this is one of the best. Not the greatest beer, but in its nose you can get notes of bananas and fruit. Much more going on here than in Bud or any other mass produced pale lager. Even the color is better than other PL’s.
Pale lager, thin head, a bit watery. Good for drinking at the club, or if you’re in the fuckin’ zone.

I used to be a big heineken drinker but no more. The main reason is I’m fairly sure that this beer is brewed with nyquil.  I can never recall a time where I had a great night drinking heinekens, just getting tired after 2 and feeling generally bad. I suppose this isn’t a knock on the taste and what not but when you associate a beer with sleepy boring nights somethings up
Pale in color with a thin head with aromas on the grassy/herbal/earthy/skunky side.  The palate was dry and bitter.  Fine at a baseball game.

Not a bad Euro-macro, not much to it, a bit bitter, sweet and skunky (no taste difference whether from their mini-keg that’s mostly foam, or bottle, or can). Lots of fizz, nice golden color, a great beer for if you’re on a weekend bender, plus most of the time cheaper than some of the domestic beers. Cheers.
Very pale in color with minimal head.  Barely noticeable aroma.  Flavor of citrus (lemon in particular) and very sour.  Fizzy on the palate.  Pass
sewage water, way to popular. It has that factory taste to it...............
resin, pale, aminimal head, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, fizzy, bitter,
This beer is skunky macrobrewed. If you are into skunky beer (some people truly are) then this might be good for you. Aroma and color average skunk. Overated and over priced.

Bad by any beer drinkers standards, if you like this skunky sour beer I must say you sir are not a beer drinker. Reason being the only beers you could be comparing this to are all the other mass produced beers in the us, ex: bud, bud light, coors, coors light, fosters, mgd, and other crappy beers to name a few. Don’t get me wrong I love to drink coors light on a very hot day when I’m broke but as far as complexity, taste, and overall drinkability, heineken fails.

doesnt smell like anything except a little grassy, little tiny warm smell typical of all alcohol. it is almost clear and yellow. tastes a little grassy and bitter and disappears from the mouth almost instantly. totally inoffensive but expensive and really boring i would rather drink anything even something a little poopy tasting as long as it has a taste.
This isnt bad, but certainly not worth the money. Theres better stuff thats much cheaper.
Can. Low white fluffy but lasting head. Clear yellow body. Thin sweet and shlighly hoppy aroma. Thin barley malt flavor, heavily carbonated and a long aftertaste.

Clear yellow substance. It’s taste is weak a does not last long in the mouth.
Good simple choice for heavy drinking... ;-)

Skunky smell with a nasty taste.  Never really understood the deal with the popularity of this crap.  Tried it last night for the first time in years, thinking my pallet may have changed.  Tasted worse than I remember.

<br /><b>9/18/2008</b>:  Where’s the skunk?!  Heineken has a very transparent and a very pale straw color.  There is a moderate level of carbonation and a white head that quickly disappears.  The aroma is grainy and watery with some pale maltiness evident.  To be honest, it doesn’t even smell skunky like I would typically associate with this beer (from historical experience).  The flavor is also much more mild than I remember and doesn’t even have hardly any of the sharp skunky twist that is usually there.  Huh.  Interesting.  Either this bottle is extremely fresh or they have changed the mix...  Without the skunk bite, the flavor is too mild and on the sweeter side (nothing really but some light pale/Pils malt and delicate Noble/slightly spicy and floral hops).  The body of this beer is light and it is really soft on the palate.  Overall, this beer is nothing exciting and even less memorable than the skunky version...<br /><br />

<i>12 fl. oz. green pop-top bottle from 12-pack purchased at Jungle Jim’s International Market in Fairfield, Ohio.  Rating #2027 for this beer...</i><br />

Keg Can...  Poured straw yellow with a thin white head.  Corn chip aroma that’s grainy and peppery.  Actually wasn’t that skunked this time I had it (maybe it’s the green bottles that skunk it).  Anyway, just a little citrus pine-sole and a metallic finish.
I’m a fan of the style, but this is just not a good Pilsner. There’s very little going on here. Watery, thin, unremarkable.
Poured from 12oz bottle a pale yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma is very grassy. Flavor is a slightly sweet malt then a mild hoppy bitterness.
Very distinct, skunky to barnyard smell, goes down quite smooth, disgraceful to call this an import and pay the price though.  Used to like it more in college, you know it was the cool thing.
I didn’t expect much, so I was a bit surprised at the hops. No skunk taste. Nothing exciting , but nothing bad either.
Well nothing special in this beer, is not bad but is not good, lets say it’s drinkable.

Wow, this is imported, from where a sewer??  I do like this better than Stella, but just the same, what does this have to offer that makes it so special????  Hardly a fruitful taste to grab on to, or anything.  Maybe it will taste better in a keg can?? hahahah
I must say, this beer tastes like beer out of tinfoil bowl and for the price, fahhhgettahhboutttittt.
Dutch beer can be good, but this does not cut the mustard. Nothing good to say really, taste is uninspiring. It is beer though! Thats a positive.
Yeah okay.  certainly a palatable brew, but didn’t ignite any excitement.

Pours a pale yellow with a fairly decent white head.  Mild aroma of hops and wet bread.  Taste is sweet pale malt and a touch of hop bitterness.  Overall not bad tasting, but muted and watery.  Those who remark that it smells skunky or like dirty socks should try to purchase it fresh, rather than stale and light struck from sitting on a shelf for months.  Were this brewed in the USA, it would be considered an above average macro.
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a yellow color with a small white head.  Aroma of skunky, malt and perhaps grass.  A little sweeter than most American macro pale lagers.  Overally, pretty lousy.

Nothing to write home about.  On par with the American lagers.  I can’t stomach this stuff unless it comes from the brown bottles available in the Netherlands.  But, as some of my co-workers say, "brown bottle Heineken is the best beer, hands down."  Ummm...No not even close.
It smells and tastes like Europeans who don’t use deodorant, or atleast all the French ladies.  Nothing more than collected armpit sweat.  I would rather drink COLLEGE beer.
Pours a clear thin yellow with no head. Smells like body odor. Taste is grassy with slight hops, some corn, and more B.O. Not great.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head.  As pointed out, has a skunky aroma.  Smooth flavor with bits corn flavor, a better, thicker flavor than most macros.  Slight sweet aftertaste.
Pours yellow and smells skunky.  Slight malt taste, but the taste is mostly skunky imo.  Overall not very impressive at all.

I recently bought a six pack of Heineken and was down to the last one when I realized that I haven’t rated this yet. Pours from the familiar 12 oz. green bottle a pale yellow with a half inch white head. The head vanishes immediately, leaving a modest collar. It’s quite fizzy, as expected. The aroma is lightly hoppy, with some corn and a slight hint of skunk (the Curse of the Green Bottle strikes again!!) 1st sip is dry, with some corny maltiness that gives way to a lemony, metallic bitterness on the swallow, as if low grade Saaz hops were used in the brewing process. Mouthfeel is light & crisp. Drinkability is ok...I used to go through a few of these in a session im my macro days, when this was somewhat of a "status" beer. It’s better than BMC, but not on a level with any craftbrew. I’ll take it if it’s the best option available...as it was when I purchased the sixer...but I won’t seek it out by any means.
unattractive yellow straw like appearance with mild head.  flavor has only a tad of munich malt and no hop crispness.  worthless
Slightly malty aroma.  Pale yellow with lasting white head.  Crisp, slightly more flavorful macro than a typical North American offering.
Skunky aroma, a bit spicy.  Pale yellow, thin quick finishing head.  Not a terrible beer, enjoyable from time to time.  Tasty served cold.

Bottle, pours a pale yellow with very little head and lots of carbonation.  Smells of corn, metallic hops and the typical lager skunk aroma.  Flavor is of grains and hops, and it comes off slightly sweet and watery.  Not bad, decent aftertaste, but nothing special and definitely overpriced.

Tasted several times form a bottle and on tap--Pours a pale straw body with a small white head.  Lots of bubbles rising in the glass.  Skunky spicy almost metallic nose.  Crisp, easy to quaff.  Spicy hops and prickly carbonation.  Not my thing.

Okay lets get this straight , just because its a main stream lager doesnt mean its bad, in fact its very good. Everyone who says its weak must drink some strong stuff ordinarily because this stuff has a sound strong taste and texture. Granted it is overpriced. It has a slightly malty bitterness, with a skunky edge.  . The UK version is hoppier and so strong it can almost be deemed syrupy ( on an empty stomache the taste is more apparent) , sure, to some it could be too skunky....But is clean and refreshing. Its better in bottles and can be inconsistant on draught. It’s a very good Euro Macro. 
Edit - I dropped the ratings on this one because I haven’t had a good Heinee in maybe a year. I am wondering if it is made in Asia now? If it is they would never admit it . But in the UK I loved Heinee ...since moving to Taiwan I rarely get a good one.....only the small bottles seem nice.Different beer from the UK Version. See Beck’s for a similar opinion.

2008 Bottle - Grass and a bit of skunk on the nose, flavour has decent bitterness, nuanced spice, light for the summer but thin as anyone could guess...yes overpriced, yes pretty rudimentary, but still a good brew now and again...

As with many green bottled beers, eau-de-skunk for me.  Just a big time example of marketing over substance....who can drink and enjoy this stuff?  Was considered "high class" when I was in college....but now just depressing and worthless.
Bottle. A rather light lager that still has a lot of character. One of the best on the market to have with dinner.

Here we have the perfect example of what good marketing can achieve. Overpriced, one dimensional pale lager. Aroma is malty and what i suppose to be some hops, but that smell and taste like pee. Watery but not refreshing , gets really disgusting after a few bottles. Considering the 33cl bottle sells for around 1€ in the grocery store, where you can get an urquell or staropramen for around 0.75, this gotta be the biggest ripp off ever, but marketing seems to work for all the teens that buy them.
Okay beer but way overpriced l.  Too much hops for a pale lager.  I would prefer it if it were a little more sparing with all the hops but then I’m afraid all i would have left is water.
Bof...sweet pale lager taste but sorry not my style. Anyway, better than Molson/Coors/Labatt’s stuff.
chiara schiuma non abbondante note maltate dolci un lieve erbaceo gosto non molto amaro beverina sentore lievemente particolare rispetto alle altre lager commerciali
Draft - A little sweet, reasonable bitterness, nice pale lager. draft seemed to be better than bottle?
355ml bottle from the LCBO.  Looks, smells and tastes like typical lager. Doesnt do anything special for me.
This was the nastiest beer I have ever had in my entire life. Normally I will not throw beer away, but in this case I feel that i have to for my own health.

500ml can (4.7%, canned and brewed by Hansa Borg in Norway). Gradually fading white head over a straw-yellow body. Light smell of grassy hops. Vague, sweet fruity (peaches) taste. Light to medium palate. Easy drinking and overall rather tasteless (shared with Finn A. while watching TIL-RBK 4-0 on TV, 03.08.2008).

22 oz bottle from local grocery store. Slight malt aroma with a touch of spicey hops in the nose. Clear light golden with a large rocky head that falls quickly. Slightly sweet pale malt flavor with some spicey nobel hops. Light body with clean crisp finish. Touch of bitterness in the finish.

smells like urine, looks like urine and taste like.. sorry I haven’t tasted urine. Is something to drink in a rare warm day in the Netherlands, but nothing really enjoyable on it. watery, poor flavor, not sensation at the end...
no head whatsoever, smells like skunk, tastes no better, I’d drink it if it were free... maybe.
Old and reliable. Has a light body and a watery texture. Doesn’t leave aftertaste.
If I could give this beer a zero I would. The only reason that I have a a 3 for the overall is because I want to rate the light even lower, because it’s even worse.

Pale golden color; tiny, white, bubbly head; virtually no lacing.  Aroma is light, bready malt; hints of nondememo  hops.  Flavor similarly bready, more nondescript hops, accompanied by a prominent metal/skunky finish.  Light body is somehow lightly sticky.  I don’t understand why anyone with $15 to spend on a 12-pack would choose this beer.

Heineken is a very clear, sparkling, pale straw colored lager with a small, foamy, off-white head.  It has a funky, skunky aroma.  It smells like a homeless guy’s socks.  It’s light bodied, but pretty smooth-- not watery, with a crisp finish.  It has a fusel flavor.  There’s a touch of bitterness at the end... but the poison taste is overwhelming.  Even my dad stopped drinking this.

Bottle.  Better than the mass produced US pale lagers, but still nothing special.  Yellow in color with no real head, just fizz.  Weak aroma of skunk and corn.  Watered down flavors of malt and a very small amount of hops.  Thin weak mouthfeel with no finish.

Why have I never reviewed this beer? Boring and dull with a fusty malt nose. Mouth equally poor, with a thin mouthfeel and some bubbles. Mouth tastes dusty and some malts, with a little bit of hops, but not enough to be interesting. No real words of note.
Highly overrated beer.  Skunky flavor, with too much carbonation.  Very low on my list for sure.
Bottle, very pale lager .. was superlative in college...  but now it’s just disappointing. Beer like flavor, yeasty, highly carbonated, highly filtered, devoid of any personality.

Bottle.  Pours a straw yellow, piss colored, with a white head.  Aroma is not bad - light fruits and wheat.  Flavor is just gross.  Skunky, watery, pissy, grassy, stale wheat tasting.  Pretty bad stuff.  Heineken Light is better.

22oz keg can from Publix Supermarket (Tampa, FL). Pours a clear golden with thin white head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is faint: wet straw, hay, some pepper, hints of barnyard. Flavor is much the same: some sweet malt, barnyard, wet hay. Watery mouthfeel and general quick uninteresting finish.

I grew up with this stuff, so maybe this is not the most objective of ratings. To me, a good clean pilsner, refreshing, albeit a bit on the sweet side. Import bottles or from the so-called "Friends Pack" seem to be thinner in taste and a lot sweeter. 238213 Re-rate: Ever since they switched to green bottles in NL, it’s all been downhill. Fizzy, sweet, even from tap not very tasty, I really don’t want to drink this anymore. Also because it seems to give me a headache everytime I drink this. 23326
Sure I used to like it.  Seemed "exotic" back in the day.  Hadn’t had one in quite a few years.  Will drink again in a jam, but don’t really need to.  Malty beer, skunky, cardboardy finish.
this beer is good when ice cold on a hot day very easy beer to get down sometimes a little to easy
simple skunked green bottle pale lager.  Not unique.............................................................
Very light beer, flavor and color. The taste is not very good, I have tasted much better imported beers.
Pretty average. Amber yellow with a quickly dissipationg head. Pretty easy to drink though but there are way better imports out there.
Bottle. Smell of skunk and urine. Transparent yellow in color. Very light body. It tastes like I imagine urine would taste like.

Green bottle served at Hector’s in Kirkland. I’ve drunk a bunch of greenies along the way, but never rated one before. Pours clear light gold with a frothy white head. Mostly grassy nose with flowers a little bread. I got lucky - this bottle hasn’t been light-struck. Medium-light body and carbonation. Lightly sweet bready taste. Sort of a stealth finish. This seems to be a one dimensional pale lager for the hops-averse. Not a bad substitute for water with a meal.

Basically a macro light lager with a little more body and flavor.  I enjoy this more than other large pale beers.

Re-Rate:  Had some out of a mini draught keg which really gave a nice thick head. +1 for appearance and +2 for overall impression. I really liked the convenience of the kick ass little keg.
Makes for a great rinse after brushing your teeth. Never understood the hype around this import. Must have the same ad company as bud and coors.
bottle. aroma and taste of skunked hops, hay, and corn. fizzy palate. had a couple - the first wasn’t bad but the light struck hops and corn flavors wore on me. two was more than enough... ugh.

12oz bottle, no date.  Clear amber yellow with a one finger fizzy eggshell head that faded to a thin ring after about 10 seconds.  Sweet malt and a bit of corn make up the aroma.  Flavor has some straight bitterness up front with no discernible hop presence, though fades quickly in the clean finish.  Sweet malts and corn are again in the flavor with not much else to speak of.  Burps just a hint of sulfur--the only skunkiness I got from this bottle, which is one of the better bottles I’ve had.  Watery body with light to moderate prickly carbonation.  Inoffensive, but pretty bland.

(Sample from March 23, 2007 Beer Club Meeting; Bottle at Chili’s in Buda on July 1, 2008) Noticeable grainy aroma with a pale flavor.  Standard lager, no lingering skunkiness… a clean-tasting, refreshing beer.  Easy going down.
Clear golden in color with no head. Has to drunk when ice cold.  Corny vegetable aroma. Light malty flavor. Skunky bitter taste. Bad beer.
This beer is just a bitter skunky beer to me. It appears crisp and clean and looks very refreshing. Then the moment of truth hits when you taste it. Garbage!
This is certainly not one of my favorites. Its got an awful skunk flavor and aroma, no matter on tap or bottle.

6/27/08 From the bottle. Aroma is light pils corny and simple, but pleasant.  Appearance is clear yellow with a chunky white head.  Flavor is sweet malt forward, with only the faintestof sourness and moderate noble hopping. Mouthfeel is light bodied and surprisingly low on carb texture, but some spritziness lingers on the tongue.  Overall, quite a bit better than I remember, but far from the best.
Bottle.  Yellow color.  Thin white head that disappears quickly.  Sweet, bready aroma.  Flavor is much the same.  Skunky finish with a lot of corn adjunct flavors.

Tap and Bottle. No real flavor or aroma to speak of, but personally I would prefer Heineken over most macros. Tastes like water but with a little bitterness to it. The only recommendation I would give is that a 6 or 12-pack is cheap way to get drunk.
in a bottle. Don’t like this one. Small head. Great colour but a verry bad aroma.
Great hot weather beer, however only good when ice cold. Sweet corn flavors are mellow when cold, but hitting room temp the beer turns into beer soda.
I will only drink this one if I’m caught at a holiday party without bringing my own craft brew.... That just won’t happen again. Nothing impressive to this pee water.
bottle and tap. A standard for the world. At least you can get it anywhere!

Pale beer with no head; bready aroma with some hop; malt flavor with a slightly off hop; finish is slightly bitter with a sweet undercurrent, but seems a bit off; probably won’t have this again unless it’s free

Definitely an easy to drink casual beer...Much better than the leading national brands in Canada, however not the greatest beer in the world. I do however, enjoy the distinct and faint herbal essence brought on by the hops that are added in the later stages of brewing. That’s what gives Heineken it’s unique taste. I would buy it again. It does the job of quenching the thirst on a hot day.

On tap, Newcastle.  Pours standard fizzy lager with lasting head.

Fairly high carbonation, little in the way of taste or flavour.  Slightly hoppy, not very good even for a lager.

On tap in Amsterdam.  Drank a few after visiting a couple of coffee shops.  In the bottle does not come close to how it is at the source.  Has a bit of a bite to it, but I like a beer that can fight for itself.
Drank from bottle.  I enjoy this beer room temperature and drink with some scotch or cognac.  Overall, boring, but drinks well with liquor.

Can, 50cl. Pours a pale yellow, very clear, beer with a white foamy head. Aroma is pilsner malts, without any interesting aromas. The flavor is uninteresting, with notes of malts and fruits. Overall a boring beer, below average.

Dit wordt dan mijn eerste proef notitie, er is meer van dit goedje beschikbaar in Nederland dan slootwater, doch drinkbaar. Met dergelijke bieren hebben wij toch een stevige reputatie opgebouwd hoe je het niet moet doen. Lichte kleur, fris en fruitig aroma, mild bitter en daar stopt het ook.
Biere de couleur gold avec un moyen collet collant. Petite senteur de houblon. Gout  agreable en bouche avec un effet salé.
Straw yellow with a white head.  Head lasted OK.  Light sweetness in a thin body.  Not all that hoppy, about right for a pale lager. Slightly bitter aftertaste that’s not unpleasant.
simple straigth out pale lager. not good but then neither not real bad just ok.

I had this from the "kegs" they sell in supermarkets.  It was an improvement.  While the bottled version lends itself to skunkiness, this wasn’t so bad.  The pale lager, aka the Budweiser prototype, is among the most ubiquitous and yet odious of beers.  In this instance, this beer was relatively ok.  The aroma was of the corn/sweetener adjuncts and things of that nature.  The color was piss yellow, but had a tinge of orange making slighly more attractive than an average pale lager.  Like the color of piss when you forgot to hydrate yourself all day.  The taste was corn and sweet maltiness.  The finish had the usual slight hoppyness.  This was ok.  i would never buy it, of course.  But I was at a friend’s house, he had this stuff, it was 95 degrees, so wtf.
Skunk.  Grass and some skunk.  Malts?  Nope.  Skunk.  Skunk in a green bottle.  Skunk on draft.  Skunk in my belly.  Yuck.  Big ass yuck.
golden, white foam, medium sourness, medium bitterness, light sweetness,  sparkling, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, astringent,

This is completely unfair now that I rate beers.  I still love the taste of this skanky beer.  It is not meant for the non-beer drinkers or the beer experts.  It is a beer that just sticks with you once you’ve had it. Love the bottle better than tap.

Big 650mL Bottle, which seems to taste quite a bit better then the smaller 330mL type bottles. Faint hoppy aroma, decent size head and head retention. Light golden colour.  I didn’t notice any skunk aroma/ taste in this beer, but I have in the odd smaller bottle strangely. Weak hop flavour dominates, though reletively complex for a "international beer".
To drink heineken is to have a skunk run up your ass and crawl into your mouth and go to sleep there.
Did anyone see a skunk run through here????  Sulfur, Skunk...not too mch to write home about...
Bottle and on tap.  Refreshing when cold and can get skunked so be careful.  Like it for what it is.  Not exactly cheap but decent body and taste.  I wouldn’t turn it down.
I know people that love this stuff, unfortunately i am not one of them. IMO tastes skunky and bitter, probably a few of these in my fridge that i will never drink.
Pours light, with a bit of skunkiness. Some mild bitterness, but not especially so. Just a touch of citrus. Not a great beer but drinkable just the same. I’ve always liked the bottle!

You know, it’s just not that bad. Really, as far as pale lagers go it could get a lot worse. When you see one of these bad boys sitting in a tub of ice, and it’s humid as hell outside, well it does the trick . . . more or less. Oh yeah, pale body, decent carbonation, nicely peppery malts and a smidge of hops. Bland of course, but less execrable than the usual BMC.
33cl bottle. One of the most famous beer here, very light and drinkable, little sweet malty taste, good for refreshing in hot summer’s evenings and nothing more.
mediocre beer. my uncles swear by it. my grandma loves it. i can see how it would be nice on a hot day. tastes better than bud/miller/coors.

Every time I have ever had this beer before it had been light struck. Knowing that it was easily available in a can I decided to wait until I had a can available to rate it. Sampled from a 24 oz can this beer poured a bright yellow color with a huge soapy yellow-white head. The aroma was sour, tangy and industrial. The flavor was sweet, tangy, a little bit fruity and had just a hint of pepper. The finish was long, tangy and sweet. Better than I expected but still not good.
[Poolside, MGM Grand] Poured a dark golden color with a small white head that left no lacing. Aroma of toasted corn, toffee, and dough. Taste of metal, more corn, skunk, and a faint hint of citrus.

0.33 l bottle. Light golden color with small fading head. Malt, honey and herbal hops in the aroma with a hint of lemon and alcohol. Malty flavor with honey, low to medium bitterness and herbal-fruity hops. Watery palate.

this beer holds a special place in my heart. i drank it throughout the entire time of the pregnancy of my first born daughter. and was the first beer i had after she was born later that day. so she was eating for two and i was drinking for three. so the nostalgia of the beer is there and i only now drink it on occasion. very good overall beer for mass production but you HAVE to pour it in a glaas before drinking. out of the bottle its 1/4 as good but i guess thats true for alot of beers except for crap like miller lite.
Good flavor not skunky but piney. Smooth with just enough carbonation. I will take this over any american beer bottom line.
Tastes and smells skunky.  Just can’t get into this beer.  Not feelin the hops and the watered down taste.  Better lagers out there.

en cuanto a cervezas popularmente distribuidas y disponibles esta me gusta menos que la becks.  hay que tomarla cuando no hay mejores opciones en los star mart y vamos de paseo.  pajita pajita pajita [insertar] mas pajita para cumplir el requisito

very average beer. I work as a barman and it is the flattest beer to pour, the head disintegrates within a minute of pouring. Tastes nothing special as well. Much better beers to taste then this one. Not bad at best really
Very good beer, refreshing yet bitter sparkling white foam sorta sour medium bitterness slick feel medium body fizzy. Ok i i would recommend it

I really want to like this beer. I really do. It’s one of Grandfather’s favorite beers, and a lot of my good friends love it. I just can’t. It stinks, and it tastes of stink. Every time I take a sip, I try to concentrate on the piney, hoppy taste that there is, but the skunkiness is so overpowering that I just cannot enjoy it. It’s also relatively watered down. There is some taste there, but the drawbacks are so severe to it that I just can’t bring myself to enjoy this beer. Somebody recently suggested to try this beer canned to avoid the skunkiness from the green bottle that kills its taste, so I may have to do that. But I think the watery aspect of the beer will keep it from ever being one that I prefer.

Smells bad, looks just as unappealing. Tastes bland. I used to like this before I tried beers that are actually well made, and if you’re only used to Coors and Bud, then I suppose Heineken tastes alright in comparison, but in the broad spectrum, it fails.

I used to kinda enjoy this brew years back up until I started on the micro-brews. As almost everyone can attest to, there is a defiant skunkyness in this beer. Its also watered down. There is a slight hint of hops in the flavor, or perhaps a pineyness. Also has a not so pleasent aftertaste, being kinda dingy. The more you drink this the less you can taste its impurities, so keep drinkin em!
Alright, major skunk factor is huge turnoff of this beer. Pours a clear peepee yellow colour with a taste that is well carbonated but grainy and watered down. What else is there to say- pretty lame.

Had it right from the bottle.  A very drinkable macro, with a lot more flavor than many other (American) macros.  Like others, however, it’s best very cold.  On a side note, I was amused when I ordered a "hiney" and the bartender had no clue what I was talking about.  Made me sorta chuckle.

Pours a pale gold with a small white head. No lacing.
Aroma is minimal, not skunked probably since it was from a can. 
Taste is light, somewhat sweet with a mild hop bitterness. Exceptional brew for the style.  Good warm weather beer.

As mass produced lagers go, and they are an overwhelmingly grim bunch, this is just about drinkable if nothing else is available. Although I have drunk my share of this in the past ,before I’d seen the light, I’d never actively seek this out now. Just had one to be polite and it was a shallow, watery experience. 
Is this really what the masses crave or just what they are programmed and force fed to like?

Poured from tap pale blonde with small white head.  Aroma of tart grass, slight toastiness, and wet hay.  Flavor was somewhat muted when this one first arrived in a frosted mug, extremely cold.  First impression was watery malt with a caramel toast.  But, as this beer warms a much more astringent toasted hop, wet cardboard flavor comes out.  This flavor tends to linger in the aftertaste.  If your drinking this one, do so extremely cold and drink fast.  I’ll be skipping this one while bowling in the future.
gold blond coloured sparkling body with a white head  a malty aroma a malty wattery bitter taste with a wattery bitter finish
Une très bonne bière de tous les jours très rafraichissante. une bière que je ne me tanne pas de boire
Really malty skunky taste. Pretty good a warm summer day but other than that nothing enjoyable at all.

Skunky, Skunky, Skunky, why do they still serve in green bottles?  The mini-kegs taste better, but thats not saying much.  Just bitter and un-refreshing to me.  I felt like a poser in a snooty nightclub......."The dirt won’t come off"!!!

Rated: june 2007

Bottle green, 330 ml

Appearance: The head is very regular, snowy white, quite quickly disappearing, rather frothy, carbonation is very weak and the beer is rapidly decarbonating itselfs in few seconds, no lacing, after 2 minutes from nice looking head there is nothing, body is light, colour of pee, yellowish, transparent, clear, quite bright.

Aroma: Some gone of, fermented fruits and malts, rather of not good quality, a mild alcoholic base, aroma is one dimentional, what is characteristic there is a repulsive strona skunkness of hops in green bottle, in aroma the carbonation and alcohol and skunkness is predominating and it is hard to get to the aroma of malted barley. Rather poor though quite intensive.

Flavour&Palate :Very harsh, there is a hoppy bitterness and storng additional skunking aroma that violates your palate. After a first sip you have strong alcoholic nose and terrible, dry, tangy, very unplesent aftertaste, it would be a nightmareto be up and about after the hangover. The aroma of gone off malts. palate is raped by dryness and aroma of old socks. When it becomes warmer the skunkness is even stronger. After 0,1 ml it is likely to have hangover without intoxication, very unbalanced. I think that it is the poorest macro- beer. It really blow, it makes my tongue woolen and ill, it hurts me, this beer really violates my childhood that I’ve already grown up from. I think that is not the point for a beer to be interested in music and it is really like pop- culture, wattery, shit, pee, wee, piss, excrements, feaces (poultry like) DAMN IT!

Not a fan. I am a dark lager and stouts drinker, but this is bad. Skunky the three times I’ve had it. More to have something to do with your hands, than an enjoyable beer experience. Jay-Z must never have tried any good beer.

Que puis-je ajouter?
Consommée plusieurs fois avec des résultats variables selon la fraîcheur.
À son meilleur, c’est un produit qui atteint son objectif : désaltérer dans la facilité.
So I’m cruisin down the freeway with Honkeybra, aight, and I ran over a skunk.  We look at each other.  "Smells like someone just busted out a Heineken," I say.  Phew.
it’s just so boring! Have to say I’ve drunk this a lot and it doesn’t serve for anything else but .. get drunk
Pours golden yellow. Aroma is skunky. Flavor is Hopps, malt and mainly skunky. For some odd reason I enjoy this sometimes.

Bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a very thin white head that fades away.  Light aroma of malt.  Taste is of malt, hops and is a little bitter.  Kind of watery and has that aroma/taste that can be construed as skunky.  Overall, this is a decent beer, but it is overrated and overpriced for what it is.
i agree with bhef25, this stuff is highly overrated and very trendy to drink.  it costs a shitload per bottle at the bar, and it isnt even that good.

1) 330ml bottle. How the hell did this one sneak under the radar?? Dense foam collar on fizzing gold. Weirdly vanilla-like malty sweetness in aroma (kolsch?!), grassy hops, biscuit, straw, metal. Clean, grassy, slightly (white) bready, with a cereally cornflake sweetness in the aftertaste. No face-wrinkling off-notes, and a very soft palate.There are plenty of beers this globe-straddling that are far, far worse. Uncomplicated refreshment to swig brainlessly whilst doing something other than agonising over what beer tastes like. I enjoyed drinking it. Annoyingly flat and ’smooth’-like by the bottom of the glass, but a modicum of credit is due for pumping out something so mass-produced that isn’t totally shit.  
2) Warm tin in Sharm airport, Sinai, Egypt. Horrid soapy vegetable, slight green herb and almond flavour. Hints of rubber and cake. Luckily I have some lipsmacking chilli and lime crisps to take the taste away. Bout 4 quid a pop. Ouch. 32327.
Overrated amongst alot of beer drinkers.   Bitter beer face gets me every time and its been a long time.
300 ml brown bottle.light golden colour. just another pilsener, nothing special.
12 oz bottles drank as an early lover of "good beer". We always thought it had more alcohol then listed.

24 oz keg can. Aroma is mostly skunky. Flavor is very similar to bud; too sweet, carbonated, somewhat malty and skunky. There are worse out there but I don’t understand why anyone would want to pay a premium price for such a below average beer.
Nothing special going on here. Rather metallic even for a cheap-ish lager. Tries to present some bold flavors but ends up being off-putting. Not a huge fan.

This isn’t budweiser, it’s not that bad.  Drinkable, albeit thin-bodied and bland.  I think this is another beer that’s just different in the US than abroad...although even in Amsterdam, it’s nothing overly exciting.

Basically, if you like this, you probably like budweiser. Although this is a bit better. I’ve actually heard that they call this the "budweiser of Europe"  It just has a tiny bit more flavor and a better aftertaste.
Pours a pale yellow with a fizzy white head. Lots of bubbly carbonation in this one. Aroma of malt and not much else. Flavor is sweet malt and slight skunky bitterness.

let me start off by saying i like lagers, they round off the day well. heineken happens to  be a great lager with the right amount of bitterness to it. It has something of a fruity flavor and is definitely not watered down. overall it is a great lager
Poured a bubbling yellow color with light lacing. A malty smell with a funky taste that lasts skunky on the palate. Not really one of my favorites.
Bottle, pours a clear piss yellow with no head.  Aroma is almost present of malts.  I would never buy this beer, I don’t see why everyone seems to talk about it so highly.
Quite skunky with a sweet undertone. Clear yellow no head. On the weak side with a touch of sweetness.

This sample came from a can, has been shaking around in my golf bag for three hours, and is old but I don’t it will make this one any worse. Sweet grainy aroma and light yeast. Clear light golden color with a small white head. Mildly bitter beginning with a very light fading malt finish. Watery palate.
I haven’t tried many beers but this is one of the smoothest beers I’ve ever had. It pours light yellow with a wonderful aroma of barley , malt, and hops

No where near to being a great beer, but miles above Bud, which I use as the zero base as the worst beer I ever had the displeasure of drinking. Has a good eough aroma and appearance. Nice but not delicious flavor. Goes down easy leaves good taste on palate. Overall better then average, but theres so many beers I would pick before this one.
Very light, almost clear, for some reason my friends really like this. It was bad, but I have had worse. like coors light

Clear, crisp.  Twenty years ago this would have been one of my top beers for summer.  Wait could I even drink then?  Doesn’t matter.  Had this on tap in Edinburgh - not that much different from the bottle.  Can see why it is Europe’s largest brewery - it’s simple, predictable and refreshing (but nothing more).

Bottle pours a clear golden yellow with an average head.  Aroma is grainy, slightly malty, and sort of skunky.  Smooth, light flavor mostly shows the malt but some hops.  Goes down quite easy and when given the choice of this or the usual domestic Budweiser or Miller product I’ll gravitate towards this one.  Not great, but not terrible either.

Pretty solid beer.  Wouldn’t go out of my way to go find some.  I miss the old labels that were made out of paper and left that awful residue all over the bottle when you peeled it off.  Anyway, has a distinctive taste, maybe even an acquired one.  Have some!
I thought someone ran over a skunk in front of my house when I opened this beer. This is very overrated and not worth the premium price!
Poured from the bottle green - just kidding. Pours a light yellow with a slight head. Tastes almost skunked but it was refreshing enough at a local sporting event.

Golf course in a can.  Very refreshing.  Poured a pale gold.  Aroma of malt and grain.  Taste was also of malt and water.  Some bitterness, which made this better than most lagers.  Very light and refreshing.  Not a great beer, but not toooo bad.
no better than bud, yet frequently more skunky, worse than macros because  its premium status is unwarranted

Very lively, highly carbonated, bright and crisp.  Very refreshing year-round! I disagree with the stigma this lager has faced over the years.  There is no skunk here.  Just pure Holland lager beer.  Then again, it’s all in the uniquness of individual taste.
Skunk, Skunk, Skunk. Known in my brain as the gut rot brew, way over rated, taste like a thicker coors or bud with a roll of nickles mixed in the glass. Makes you feel like taking a long shower.
I don’t like it.  Golden colored.  Corn, grainy, musty and most importantly quite often skunky.
Yellow in color and clear with a thin white head.  Grainy in the smell and the aroma.  A little bit of hops in there.  A touch of bitterness.  Light and easy to drink.

Mass produced and overpriced i grab this whenever a corporate sponsor says hey guys its on me its a little bitter but drinkable and will get you buzzed before the millers of the world its not overcarbonated it goes down smooth i mean if your choices are the typical bud miller coors corona and this you grab a heiny for sure

12oz bottle. Pours a light yellow with a thin, medium-sized-bubbled, white head. The aroma is sweet with hints of hops and sulfur. The flavor is a little grainy and sweet with definitive continental pilsner malt character. The breadiness of the malts is slight. The middle of the palate detects some subtle hop flavor and a balancing level of hop bitterness. The hops taste noble - maybe even Saaz - like a real pilsner whose growth was stunted... The finish is dry and refreshing with a nice balance of the soft hop bitterness and soft, pale malts. The mouthfeel is spritzy, but medium-full in body. Overall, drinkable but not great. Next to a Bud, however, it is quite tasty.
Bottle.  Pouts light yellow with an unimpressive head.  Flavors are bitter and light.  Over-produced.
Can. Pours pale yellow with white fizzy head. Some malty sweetness in nose and a little hops. Flavour is grainy with some malts. Quite boring mainstream pilsener.

Pours a pale clear yellow with a little bit of a fizzy bone white head.  The nose is a corn sugar sweetness with a bit of hops and grainy notes.  The flavor is about the same.  Kind of a flat sweetness with a very single-note bitterness.  Nothing to really add any complexity or depth of flavor.  Pretty weak mouthfeel like most pale lagers.
Clear gold color with thin head.  Very little aroma.  Slight corn and grain flavor with moderate bitterness.  Unfortunately leaves a bitter, skunky aftertaste.

Bright gold colour,medium head frothy,good.Carbonationis good.Aroma strong pungent,bit rubbery but okay,hops and malt.Flavour,good hops and nice bitter,taste is plesant a little sweetness to finish with hops,okay premium.
Sorry this isnt a good beer.  Bitter on the palate and then guess what? It finishes bitter too.

Reasonably good pale lager.  Nothing special.  Pale yellow color, virtually no head.  Taste of corn, grain, a little bread, and a slightly interesting bite that’s hard to pin down.  If you’re in a restaurant in the USA that doesn’t focus on beer, or you’re in an airport bar in the USA, or on a US-based airline flight, your choices are going to be: Bud, Bud Lite, Miller Lite, and Heineken.  Given that selection, Heineken is the no-brainer choice!
Obviously superior to all major American Pale Lagers, however nothing special overall. Just a decent beer.

Went to Amsterdam and the Heineken there is nothing like it is in the USA. This was a good beere and i enjoyed it at many establishments including the brewery (ok its not the main brewery anymore but it was cool non the less) 
If in Holland try the Heineken on tap if nothing more than to see what we’re missing over in the US.

a little bitter, but creamy, easy too drink, not much taste or aroma, bubbly but watery, too much publicity, not very good beer, great to start a party..again it´s a party beer nothing else. bit expensive about 50 to 60 pesos/six.
Not offensive but nothing special.  An everyday cheaper beer that is not an american macro.  Its a european macro so its just better.

Light golden with an OK head. The aroma has mild and light floral and malty notes, and the flavour has the same notes. Even if it’s a harmless and easy-to-drink beer, it’s quite watery and boring - yet another "cold & wet"...
Just because they market the crap out of this stuff, doesn’t mean I have to like it. Skunky tasting, thin beer-really no redeeming qualities.

Whatcan I say about this not more than an ordinary pilsner. It’s world famous. It has a yellow color, with a white head. Of course it’s clear. If you are thirsty, you can drink 1 or 2. It has a little aroma and not so many taste. It’s a little bitter. Drink it while nothing else is available.
Good cheap European beer. Nice golden brown colour and a little head. Hint of citrus. One of the better mass mrketed beers from europe.
Again, not bad for a mass market beer. See this quite a bit in Cape Town, but there are better.
canette, pression: bière légère, sans arôme fort, mousse aromatique et rafraichissante, un peu trop chére.

Pours nice golden to yellow, white fading foam, little dense body or foam. Spicy cereals aroma with a touch of citrus. Tastes just the same, adding some hop flavor, very bitter with nice bitter aftertaste. Nice macro beer, nothing but that. / Um corpo dourado legal, espuma branca, some rápido. Corpo ou espuma pouco densos. Aroma forte de cereais com um toque cítrico. O sabor é praticamente o mesmo, com alguns sabores de lúpulo. Bastante amarga, com um retrogosto amargo bom. Cerveja de massa legal, nada além.
Skunk Skunk and more Skunk. What else is there to say.  Smells and taste skunky wether in a can, bottle, or draft.
not a bad beer for something that is mass produced. id much rather have this than have a bud or miller. meh what do i know

Pours clear gold with a yellow head. Aroma has corn and faint orange. Taste has a small malt presence with slightly more hops than a standard lager, giving it a bit of flavour. Above average (for a lager). Very little aftertaste.
One of my least favorite beers ever. Tries to be slightly aggressive, but just pushes you away. Very sub-par brew for as much talk it gets although that praise is unwarranted

Slight citrus and musky nose.  Straw colored with some yellow-gold hues.  Large head.  Subtle malts, heavy bitterness, without much hop aromas coming through.  A bit thin bodied.  Not horrible, but  there are better easy drinking Pale Lagers out there.
A fairly standard lager, with a nice golden colour and a clean taste. Not exceptional, but there are much worse on the market.

Not what I would choose to drink.  Don’t like this very much at all.  The taste is boring.  I always find myself gagging on it after only one or two beers.  It doesn’t make me hate beer but I do hate myself a little bit when I drink it.

The beer for metrosexual primadonnas. What one orders if they know nothing about beer but want to look chic anyhow. Also a favourite among men who attend house parties where Friends is watched. I bought a 24-ounce bottle just for the purpose of rating it, so maybe I’m the queen here. Now excuse me, as I have to go see if Johnny’s banging Sara again on that hilarious and cutting edge, yet caclulatingly unoffensive Friends.
Golden color with a white large but thin head.   taste primarily of hops.  light, and smooth.  taste is all at the beginning

250ml can (KLM flight)

Yellow to green (shut up, Anna!), fizzy head. Lightly perfumed lagery smell. Horribly perfumed taste, some slightly metallic hoppiness - chemical and from concentrate. A touch of alcohol. Dry hoppy synthetic finish. A whole can is just drinkable, but wouldn’t want a pint.
bottled. it is smooth, lagery, and yet full. not heavy like some standard beers. Really good value.
This beer has a malty, smooth, full flavor with a very clean finish.  It’s just strong tasting enough and doesn’t overpower anything.  A very clean beer that is grossly under-rated.
This was from a can.  The aroma and flavor were weak and watery.  Some hop but weak unremarkable malt.  It seems like I remember it being better from a bottle.
Slightly sweet with kinda skunky odor.   Never liked this much ... Euro-Budweiser to me.
0,33 l bottle. One of the worse "global lagers". Very dull and one dimensional, with  an artificial sweet flavor. Very disappointing and irritating beer, especially because of its global presence.
yellow body, white head. no lacing. little aroma of grass and nothing else. a little bitter in the finish. this isn´t like a beer. a poor beer.
Thank god they stopped brewing the 3.4%abv version of this in the uk!!! The imported 5%abv version is a far superior beer, with a far fuller flavour.

Man... The beer scene in Vegas really sucks. Bottle Paris Las Vegas. Skunky aroma. Light grassy hops. Crisp, sweet, skunky, but mostly flavorless. Heavier on the tongue than expected. Finishes with a skunky hop flavor.

Filth.  European overcommercialized rubbish.  Comparable to an assembly of other worthless bitter yuck buckets.  It tastes like Beck’s, Moosehead, Tsingtao, and I could go on.  It’s void of aroma, appearance is dull, flavor is bitter to a flaw.  It’s the import that is cliche and worthless.
I think a little underestimated quality pilsner. Clear view, bright taste. Taste best in green bottle, only available in export.

Not a bad beer from Amsterdam altogether. I’ve seen much better in my day, this is a light beer consisting of a malty taste. Tries and masters with its other competitors on the market, but just can’t shake it. However, it is sold in a 5 liter keg, with it being out of the light, it does taste considerably better that way. Don’t throw this one out, it’s a bit more expensive than domestic, but it is better than domestic.
Slightly above average macro beer. Nothing special. If nothing else is available its an OK buy. Overpriced for sure.
a boring, dull beer, my friends overrate it a lot! if i had to drink, however, i would.
It’s skunky.  The unique aroma, the famous green bottle and label give this import from Holland its reputation, nothing else.

I do not consider this a real pils. Taste is more like a bitter lager. aroma is akin to many cheap "college beers". Appears as an extramly light yellow color. Rather sharp pils feel as one drinks it but none of votable after flavors of a pilsner. In a sentance : all hype no substace buy a czech beer if you want good pils.

Worst pils ever. It has a very poor taste, but may alleviate thirst. 
Certainly not drinkable at temperatures higher than 8°C.
Drink water if clean enough.
Super refreshing.  Perfect for after a long summer day... or in a smoky casino.  Smooth.  Light.
It is a avarage beer, that is the reason that is it sold every where in the world. Everyone can drink it,

On tap or in a bottle, the appearance leaves much to be desired. Heineken is not a pretty beer, but don’t let it’s asthetics get it the way of your enjoyment (I mean, the bottle looks nice doesn’t it?). When you crack open the bottle your nose is confronted with an appealing and slightly skunky aroma. The carbonation level is a bit higher than what I would prefer, but it’s not overbearingly bubbly by any means. The taste is not unpleasant; but don’t expect it to blow you away either. I would never turn down a free Heineken, but if I needed to pay for it I would likely select something else (unless my options were very limited).
Excellent mass produced beer; great flavor, aroma and consistency.  Seems to be hated or loved.

12 oz bottle:  pours light yellow with white head. aroma ius of malt if anything. flavor doesnt have a whole lot going here slight malt taste and thats pretty much it. i cant hate on this beer it could be the easiest drinker ever made but it doesnt have anything going for it in terms of being good.

of the super commercial beers, it maybe in the top 5, but not a good beer overall. Is of light color, and is of light taste. Lots of carbonation. If i have to choose between that and a coors, Bud, or Miller, I’m picking the heneken. However, Yeungling and Sama Adams are still much better if were talking pure commercial beer.
(Netherland) Skunky Aroma with Sm-White Head. Golden color, flat taste  Not much to say about this import,  But better then some.

12 oz. bottle poured into lager glass- poured transparent thin golden yellow, white head quickly went away, light aroma of malt, light carbonation.  Hits the mouth with a light thin body, very light malt is detectable, about the same for hops on the finish.  If it’s on sale- below average session brew.  If not- overpriced.
Not a bad brew. Lacks personality. It doesn’t necessarily make me want to drink it when I see it.

I had this in a bar (in a bottle) and it tasted different from what I buy, so this rating is sort of generic.  It had a pleasant flavor with no trace of the body that it usually has when I drink it.  It was very light and mellow tasting more akin to my staple beers like Molson and MGD.

12oz can (keg?) poured into a lager glass.  Why o why do I put myself through this?  Heineken pours yellow with a medium sized head that resembles mattress foam.  Somehow the brewery has managed to include the decidedly green flavor of bottled Heineken into the can.  Amazing.  Unfortunate but amazing.  Unsurprisingly the aroma is mostly corn and green.  If you don’t know what green smells like sniff your Heiny.  Goodness!  The green has a flavor too.  Lick your Heiny to find out what it is like.  All I can say about this beer is that it is another typical pale lager, better than Budweiser, worse than Harp.

Mini Keg. Poured a crisp clear gold with a thick white head.  Aroma was very light and mostly grains.  Taste was similar, but clean and crisp.  Much better than the damn green bottles.  Not much flavor, not much aroma, but not bad out of the mini keg.  I won’t buy it again, but I would drink it if someone else bought it.  But not from a bottle.
Dit is een flauw aftreksel van hoe bier bedoeld is, bah. Geen greintje smaak of aroma, echt heel verkeerd bier.....
Not a bad Pale Lager. Could have a lot more flavor. Overall not the best but not the worst out there. Is very drinkable with food.
if you get a good sale deal not a bad beer to get drunk off, but flavor is really poor. bad palate, overall mediocre beer. that’s all.
Clear golden with no head. Aroma is slightly grassy. Flavor is very watery with nearly no bitterness. Never again...
Small glass, 2 fingers of white foam down in Budel for Carnaval. Light yellow, lively body with lots of carbonation. Not the best of Dutch pilsners
Pours light yellow. Minor, fine head. Aroma is grassy and sweet. Moderate mouth feel. Nutty quality takes over with a fair hop bitterness. Very sweet grassy undertone.
I have never understood the attration to this beer.  A very average lager with a terrible skunky finish.  No thanks.
good beer with a slight skunky odor, light head with a perfect color. kind of pricy but overall a good beer

Pretty much as bad as it gets... Except for Coors Light.
Head = Virtually None
TASTE = Skunky

Recently voted by askmen.com as the best beer available in the U.S...I’m inclined to disagree quite strongly.  It’s an overall just a so-so beer made bad due to the green bottles skunking...they just won’t learn.  That being said, between...say, a Budweiser and this, Heineken all the way...anything else, I don’t even look at it.

Bottle (330ml). Poured a pale yellow with a small fizzy white head which was fully diminishing. Aroma was of cornish malts, honey (some) and metallic notes (light). Taste was similar to aroma with more cornish malts, honey, metallic notes and hints of lemon. Light bodied with lively carbonation, watery mouthfeel and short finish.
24 oz. "keg can".  Pours a golden yellow.  Taste:  Nothing special, but definitely refreshing.
Gold color.  Light honey malt in aroma and taste.  Sweet.  No hops.  Thin.  Faintly bitter finish.
The aroma just kills this beer. It smells like cat urine. Other than that its somewhat tasty...if you can get over the cat smell
On a long flight this can taste pretty good compared to the alternatives. Medium golden color with small head, mild flavor with some dryness on the finish.
drank this a lot when i was young most of the time the beer was skunked phew better on tap wont ever drink again

April 2006 - Out to lunch with my Mom...she was buying and they didn’t have anything decent, so I figured I’d take the best of the junk I’ve never had before at Friday’s, at least to have a review. Beer poured the "piss yellow" people attribute to macros. The aroma, the mouthfeel and the flavor all brimmed with corn syrup. CORN CORN CORN CORN CORN CORN CORN, LOVELY CORNNNN, WONDERFUL CORNNNN! Anyway, this is about as low as I can rate a beer that doesn’t have any flavor that is putrid. It’s just to sweet and too corny (meaning, tastes of CORN)

0.25L, 0.33L. and tap.
Very soft lima soda aroma.
Pale yellow colour with very little head.
Carbonatate water flavor (insipide) but with a surprising bitter nice palate.
Not a good beer but an easy one to drink.
Note: Friends that have traveled to Nederland told me that Heineken beer there is different and better (I suspect they are talking about a different Heineken beer).

Aroma of water with a hint of lime on a good day.  Skunks easily.  Often the aroma is that of monkey urine.  Good carbonation.  Goes down smoothly.  The finish is bland and sour.  Recently I’ve learned that Heineken is a huge hit amongst the Asian community.
I like Heineken..something about it is refreshing to drink (like after a hot day kind of beer).  Is pretty bitter like other have mentioned, almost seems skunked.
Good beer, smells weird and taste kinda funky in my mouth yet it changed on its way down the throat.
The first time i tried this beer i thought it was skunked.  After suffering through it on a few more occasions I  came to realize that the horrible flavor was just the real Heineken taste.
A pour from one of their mini-kegs.  Aroma is malty, skunky, with some slight corn.  Taste is very malty and nutty, and almost some corn syrup in there.
Clear color.  Smell of hops, malt, skunk and some corn.  Taste of hops, skunk, malt, and a touch of butter.  Crisp aftertaste.

What a step up this was 30 years ago as I graduated from Schmidts (a damn good beer BTW for $5 a case). It’s still the hands down choice when the waitress at the Italian restaurant gives you the beer "menu" (Miller, Miller Lite or, uh, Heineken). The skunky smell is actually pretty nostalgic.

bottle. I used to really like this beer but I’m thinking I was young and didn’t know any better. I have never liked the smell of this beer(it always smells skunked).you can really taste the water in this beer. I have found that this beer tastes a bit better when it warms a little. It’s not terrible but it’s not the best out there.

this is what I bring to drink around my non-beer loving friends. as long as you don’t get a six pack that has been sitting too long it has a nice fresh hop smell and crisp tart taste. not exceptional, but certainly more palatable than any of those American Megalagers.
This beer reminds of the crowd at a sporting event... "over rated, over rated..."  OK beer at best, not so OK when you consider the price.  Terrible aftertaste, reminecint of Coors Light

Everyone knows this one, and in the bottles it tastes too apple-ish and light - not to mention its easy to look like a DB with it in front of you.  However, I had it on tap for the first time due to a tasty price and I was pleasantly surprised.  Still pretty watery, but highly drinkable.

Tried to make this one fun. . .DraughtKeg (i.e. HeineKeg) for POWER HOUR! No smell out of the Keg. Small frothy white head. Actually pretty fair lacing all things considered. Clear light yellow color. Taste is corn and faint skunk.  Well it goes down well if taken one shot at a time for powerhour. Light, watery, fizzy, and metallic are the four things you need to know.

From the bottle. Really nasty beer. Clear urine color. No real aroma. Tastes very bitter but yet with no real flavor to back it up. Not much to say about it, its just bad. I’d rather drink Michelob Ultra to be honest....

Tap from a pony keg. Pale perfectly clear yellow with a short dense head that hung around and never left the sides of the glass. Smell is of light malt and maybe some noble hops, not really much of anything. Taste is the same tiny bit of alcohol taste some buttery type smoothness and a tiny bit of hops at the end. This beer if fine if you are thirsty after working all day but it don’t have anything to get excited over.

Bottle. Appearance: Clear light amber, off white head. Aroma: Some very light malt. Palate: Very thin and watery. Flavor: Alcohol taste is noticeable. Very light malt. Some bitterness. Overall: Pale lagers are hard to rate. Not much going on in this beer.
clean, pale yellow with a bright white head. doesnt taste light much. more refreshing than some of the other major beers

Clean, light, smooth flavor.  This is a beer that I have found has its good batches and its bad batches, probably due to the green bottle and questionable shipping and temperature control.  Good but inconsistently good.

Not an exceptional beer and I can easily think of countless beers that are better, but it’s pretty good for a pale lager and definitely better than most of its American and Mexican competitors. Readily available, easy to find and at a decent price - definitely a plus.

Can:  Poured a light yellow color with a thick white head.  Aroma was almost non-existent but pretty much smelled liked beer.  The flavor was light and smooth with nothing notable standing out.  A good beer for mass consumption.
pale yellow with a thick white head... little aroma... little flavor (mostly water)... easy to drink but no great beer

Came in a "beers of the world" pack although I have had it before.  I guess I always assumed it would be better with all the hype.   Pours attractive with bright color and small white head the disapears quickly.  Aroma not strong, kind of thin with with a little bitter after taset.
Golden, clear and fizzy, skunky aroma and flavor, little hops, well carbonated, light body.  Good for a hot summer day or with oysters.

0,33 bottle 5% alc. Very popular beer in Europe but i dont understand why??? Large corporation. Not the best.
 Soft sweety flavor. Hops less then average. Simple, usual.

From a beers of the world mix pack, thoughtful xmas gift. This was the first time i’ve had this beer when it wasn’t skunked, and well it made it better...  Pours pale gold, fruity malt, grainy aroma. Watery and not much to it, sides toward sweeter, no real hop character to be found, faintly bitter, just enough to balance it.

I can discern absolutely no differences between this beer and Budweiser. They taste exactly the same, only Heineken for whatever reason is held in higher regard than Bud. For the price, I would even take a Red Stripe over this.

Bottle (Australian brewed under license). Pale yellow with short-lived slight white head. Pleasant sweet fruity aroma, maybe a hint of pear drops. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Flavour has a subtle sweat fruity start that moves to a bready malty taste with a pleasant somewhat bitter finish. Bland, but acceptable.

Essa Pale Lager holandesa tem espuma média, aerada e branca, de reduzida longevidade. Moderada formação de colarinho. Corpo ralo, borbulhante e amarelo. Aroma: mel, lúpulo pesado e pão branco. Sabores inicial e final: leve dulçor e moderado amargor; média duração. Paladar: corpo médio-leve, textura aguada, forte carbonatação e final metálico. amargor lupulado de maior intensidade e qualidade que da média comercial brasileira, dulçor de mel

Pours a pale golden, one-finger white head. Aroma is your basic lager scent. Slightly skunky, but I guess you’ll have that. Tastes like an average American pale lager, but a bit better. Not as bitter, slightly more crisp. A bit more sweet malt taste. More carbonation than necessary though. Finishes smoother than most American macros. Not bad, but nothing to write home about. Better than the big American names though.

Can.
Pours a nice clear gold with white head. Aroma of malt and some hops. Flavor is malty with a balanced bitter. Palate is light- medium body with high carbonation. Over all, it is a pretty tasty lager...

This beer is brewed under license in New Zealand but wannabe bourgeois twats will pay top dollar for it because it’s seen as the middle to upper class ‘premium’ imported lager…..just goes to show how stupid they can be! Pours a pale yellow light fluffy head that disappears quickly, smells like feet and tastes like boiled vegetables…..it still makes me laugh when people order it with a superior snooty expression on their face!
