In the states, this is a pretensions person’s beer. You know the type, smarmy and over dressed, trying to project that they’re cultured. In reality they haven’t the palate for real beer. I like where someone called this the Holland Budweiser. If you’re looking for a lite bodied vehicle to transport alcohol into your blood, this will work.
PS: A minute after I opened it my wife asked if I smelled a skunk?

Heiniken is not a bad beer at all. However I think that it is to expensive. It tatse relativetive good it has a nice skunk/sweet taste to it. Good to drink when your golfing but there are many better beers for the price.
nothing premium about it except for it advertising $ - pretty standard - light malt and bitterness. Its amazing how crappy beer gets pushed
A straightforward lager with limited, uni-dimensional taste. A slight hint of floral hops, but otherwise unimpressive.
I have never like the beer, too bitter for me.  There are far better pale beers out there.  This beer is definitily not premium.

Pours clear yellow-orange with a lot of white, quickly dissipating head.  The odor is overpoweringly corn.  Pretty bland taste, with a little bit of a pale hop aftertaste.  Not a lot of bitterness here, but not a lot of real...flavor here either.  Props to their marketing department into fooling a majority of people into thinking that this is "premium" beer.

Poured from a bottle.  Poured a clear straw color with a thin white head.  Faint aroma of corn and pale malts.  Tastes, well, like a pale lager.  Not much different from most others, crisp but often have that skunky taste to them.  And to think, when I was a senior in high school this was "good" beer.
Always this famous beers. I don’t like most of them. This neither. For my taste it’s too washy, not really interesting.

Fyraftensøl (33 cl. flaske).

Kedelig øl med megen kulsyre, som dog er god til at slukke tørsten med eller drikke sig fuld i.

Hvis der er andre muligheder at vælge i mellem ville jeg aldrig vælge denne.
Always smelled like skunk cabbage to me, still wonder to this day, is this supposed to smell like this?

Draught, 12 ounces, at Montana’s, savoured on June 14 2006; eye: clear, straw with a light golden hue, tiny ring of white head, no lacing; nose: light hops, light cereal grain (malt and hops), lightly sweet; mouth: quite foamy, light malt, substitute sugar, a bit of pepper, abysmal drop in savours that ends in a finale that is sweet with a hint of cereals, quite carbonated, medium body, texture is a bit thin, mildly sweet, lightly bitter; overall: so? and a bit too sweet

FRANÇAIS 

Fût, 12 onces, chez Montana’s, savourée le 14 juin 2007; oeil : claire, paille légèrement dorée, petit anneau de mousse blanche, pas de dentelle; nez : léger houblon, léger céréale (malt et houblon), légèrement sucrée; bouche : très mousseux, malt léger, succédané de sucre, un peu de poivre, chute abyssique du goût pour terminer dans une finale sucrée avec une petite pointe de céréale, très carbonatée, corps moyen, texture un peu mince, moyennement sucrée, légèrement amère; en résumé : bof! et un peu trop sucré

(24 oz. can from Lou’s Beverage Barn) Bleh...Pours clear very pale yellow with a big white head. Aroma is a little bready with some hops. Mouthfeel is kind of pebbly, thin but actually a little more heft than alot of pale lagers. Lots of ugly, foamy lacing - looks kind of like a rash. Flavor is some corn-like sweetness and some unappealing, biting bitterness. Some hints of bread in warmer samples. Did not like although I was surprised there was no skunkiness (due to can perhaps?). One of those you just want to get through.
Ok beer, very typical european lager, every pub has it, in the same group with stella, grolsch, kronenburg, holsten etc. Nothing special but ok for your thirst

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is a light malt with a bit of skunk. No lacing on the glass. The taste is a bit skunky with a typical lager finish, easy to drink but thats its. not worth the import price.
An ok beer. I really wasn’t crazy about the smell. It always smells skunked to me. Has a light crisp finish. Not terrible.

A global brand-without a character. You can drink it all over the world, when you are thirsty. It is all  the same in Greek, in Hungary, in Australia, Nepal or Argentina...A gold color, a little head, a poor nose. Some acidic taste with malt and hop, a hopy aftertaste. Taste the specila ones:Tarwebok or Oud bruin

It has a crisp taste, I enjoyed it better when it was served really cold.  It is a refreshing beer when working outside and you need something to quench your thirst.  Nothing special but a little pricey.  It is a golden beer with a white head when poured correctly.  Has a rather strange taste unlike anyother beer.  Can anyone explain this?  I sampled it in Amsterdam while on the Heineken Experience.  Even then it was good but nothing special.

The very first beer I ever got drunk on therefore it will always hold a special place in my heart. that being said it is not a particularly great beer. Fairly watery with a skunky smell. Very easy to drink and refreshing. Mini-keg= fun as hell but waste of money compared to bottles

pours a golden amber with a white head.  aroma is malt with some sweet notes.  taste is what you’d expect, sweet malt.  a little creamy.  a little more substance than its competition.  not bad, but overpriced IMO.  haven’t tried the ’draughtkeg’ yet.

Meh. Alright beer. Way too pricey. Smell is hoppy, flowery but not unpleasant. Smells almost like weed. Color is golden clear. Taste is semi sweet with not too much hop bite. Palate is crisp and leaves your mouth wanting more. Id buy it more often if it wasnt so damn expensive.
An excellent beer for a regular person who knows nothing about the "great" beer.  Its crisp and clean tasting.  Popular for a reason.

One of my favorites.  It’s got that wierd taste you can’t really place, must come from the malt.  Sweet, and well rounded hop wise.  People were brainwashed by the samuel adams skunky beer  commercial.  I think this beer is crisp and clean tasting, there’s a reason why this beer is so popular.  The only beer my wife will drink!  the minikeg system is more expensive per ounce but worth it.  I cant keep one for more than a day or two.
Around This Part of the Country Heineken is King. Not to bitter not to Sweet nice look and goes down smooth

This is another macro-brew that gets bashed by the neo-beer-snobs (nbs), but when I was serving in the USAF in Germany and we couldn’t get downtown because of war games, this was our "fallback" beer.  It sometimes had a slightly skunky aroma, but the taste was always decent and it was very popular.  I still like it and wont let the nbs influence my vote.

Bottle. Pours clear straw yellow with a fizzy head that disappears quickly. Tastes tinny and grassy. Big skunky odor, and highly carbonated. Easy to drink like water though. I prefer the local pale lagers to this overpriced commercialized swill.

Can. Pours a clear, straw yellow, no head to speak of. Not much in aroma, maybe a touch of malt. Very watery flavor, slight bitterness. Thankfully this was a can, so I didn’t experience the "Skunk" that I usually do with the bottle version.
I love this stuff. A South African friend introduced me to it and I haven’t gotten enough. It’s not bitter while not terrible sweet either but just right down the middle.

Pours a very clear yellow color with a bubbly white head.  Not a very good flavor... but a lot of it, a little fruity?  Not worth it.

Keg can/bottle/Heinekeg.

For a lighter beer, it has a lot of flavor.  Not particularly good flavor - but flavor.  I can’t really figure out what gives it it’s weird taste, as its not a hoppy taste, nor is it a malty or grainy taste.  It’s just kind of bitter and seltzery.  Little banana on the finish. Leaves a pretty bad taste in your mouth.
Pour a light yellow with a fizzy head.  Smells like a foot sprayed by a skunk.  Tastes like grassy water,  but smoother.  Goes down easy but that is about it.  Waste of money.

It’s Thanksgiving, I’m at a relative’s house, and it seems as though I’m all out of the beer I brought. However, I found a six-pack of Heineken in the fridge here and have been given the green light to have a bottle. Lucky me!

Appearance: Pours a pale, straw-colored body with a thin, fizzy white head.

Smell: Only a hint of cereal sneaks past the big whiff of skunk.

Taste: Cereal grains with a decent level of sweetness. Grassy hops with only a very subtle touch of bitterness. Hint of green apple in the finish. At best a simple beer, at worst a simple beer riddled with skunkiness.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Heineken, a beer that will punish you bad flavors if you don’t drink it fast and absolutely ice cold. Forget the skunky bottles, instead stick to the cans, draft, or mini-kegs (delivered by robo-chicks).
pours clear golden with white head.Hint of hops on teh aroma. Flavor is lightly sweet but lacking bitterness

Although I would never buy this product in bottles (due to skunking), I actually enjoy it on draft.  Has a delicate German malt profile with a hint of honey and flowery hops with a very mild bitterness.
Bottle 33 cl. Clear golden with a small head. Nothing special, nice hops but in total it’s a really plain beer

This is the worlds most popular beer and I don’t understand why.  Is it the worst beer I’ve ever had?  No, long way from it but its also a LOOOOOONG way from the best.  Better than the typical American macro stuff but not really by much.  Its overpriced and overhyped.  Just because everyone else is drinking it doesn’t mean that you should too.
A thirstquencher of international "starquality". Go anywhere and Heineken has been there before you like McDonald, Mars-bar, Carlsberg and all the other moneymakers.

[630-20070918] 330mL. Sweet floral apple aroma with yeast dough. Clear, dark yellow body with a large medium-lasting foamy white head. Apple yeast dough flavour. Light body is a little grainy. Enh - it was free.

Never liked heineken never will. Skunky aftertaste. High price. Not very good. People drink it cause they watch the comerials, it’s obtainable and they think they are "cool" when they are drinking it. Not for me, a waste of money.

(Can). Pale yellow color with almost no head. Aroma of cereals, grass, wirh some weak skunkiness. Flavor is mild bitter, but it lacks of body and tends to be a little watery.  But this version is totally different from the Dutch, I guess.
This really is not a very good beer. I can’t understand the hype/price. I find this brew to be very off tasting, bitter and harsh.  Thin with little palate. It even smells bad.
I’ll take a nice Pabst, thank you.  This stuff sucks.  Horrible macro-euro Lager stench, thin, watery, skunky, insipid, and expensive.  The celebrity of beers.

(Draught at Schiphol Airport, Amsterdam, 5 Nov 2007) I suppose I had to try this one eventually, so why not while killing an hour before a flight from Holland. Yellow colour with brief, white head. Malty, clean nose with notes of malt sweetness and hints of grass. Malty, clean, slightly grassy taste with balanced sweetness and notes of citrus. Actually nothing wrong with it, just boring.

The Netherlands version of Bud, however this actually does taste like beer opposed to the hop-seltzer that is a normal macrobrew.   I’ll take this over other mass produced stuff but not my first choice
A hint of hops. Not very tasty. Its almost like drinking slightly hopped club soda. Sour skunky aftertaste.

Ya know, so much has been said, so many have been tasted that it almost gets a Bud critique - lost in its own fame. Really if you put aside all that fame and typical other beer mentality - it really is not that bad, crisp and typical, but no corn or rice taste typical for a mass produced lager.

I was settling in to watch a program about Mata Hari, one of my most favorite women in history. Since Mata Hari was Dutch, I picked a Heineken as beer accompaniment. When I was a kid, back in the green-bottle-equals-good era, this was one of the few decent things you could get easily. I got the 24 oz. drum. This features the traditional black-and-green label across a shiny little keg-shaped can, which I think looks quite nice. It poured with a very foamy head that lasted well. The color was an exceptionally clear light-to-medium gold--altogether an attractive picture. Aroma was clean, clear, and lightly sweet, much better than many mass-market lagers. The flavor had a noticeably bitter bite on the first sip; the taste has more character than many pale lagers, and the hops are also more noticeable than usual in such brews. The tail, however, was sour and unpleasant. Palate was on the watery side, with a little fizz. Altogether this is a pretty fair pale lager, about as good as you can get among the mainstream brews. It’s widespread and not too costly. Take this before any BMC product.

Heineken is another one of those beers Im rating because I drink it so often. It becomes a little like a broken record, but this beer isnt perfect, its a macro beer, ectra. But, here the catch. Like guiness or sam adams, theyre so widely available, that they become staples of my beer drinking obsession. Its crisp and clean tasting. Its got a bit of a fuzzy taste to it, but mainly the smell and taste are that of almost any other skunky pils/lnorth european skunk lager. It doesnt matter what it looks like. Its cheap, its everywhere, and the rednecks will think youre a yuppie for drinking it, but by god it makes a perfect every day any time beer. Not simple enough on the palate to be consider trash, but not so complexed you have to be in the right mood for it. Bring on the heine.

Bright golden color with 4 inches of pure, white head that settles to 2" then a thin film after 2 minutes. Smells like a lot of malt and hops and some heavy grains.  Sweet, flavorful, light, golden yellow, translucent color.  Great skunky hoppy flavor for a pilsener. Just amazing how much better it tastes out to the can than the bottle or a keg. One of the best choices. Tastes is really bitter and skunky. Body is medium light and has a good bite. Finish is sweet and bitter.
Never have and never will like this beer. The initial taste isn’t that bad, but for some reason the aftertaste is not pleasant at all to me.
Bottle. Flavor is unoffensive but not particularly enjoyable. Very little aroma and not very pleasing to look at.

Sample from a visit to  the heineken brewery about two years ago.  This was by far a much better beer at the brewery than out of the bottle.  It was very light in color and had much more of a crispier bite than in the bottle.  I am rating this beer with confilicting interests because it really was a surprisingly elegant beer in the brewery but just loses so much in the bottle. It still, however, is a macro weak lager.
An okay beer, though not much to look at or smell. Tastes decent, at least better than your average macrobrew. More of a thirst quencher than an experience.
Jagerbombs and Heineken all F****** night... yup.. thats what happened. not bad brew.. has a taste but not an enjoyable one.

I first had this some years ago but don’t remember when and occaisonally drink it when it’s the best choice around.  It is typical, golden, somewhat fizzy, with a mild aroma and light but decent flavour.  Drinkable, it has some crispness and an enjoyable grain element along with even a light herbal hop quality, but not enough for the money. It has nothing at all ofensive or unpleasant.  It seems to me to be somewhat comparable to Stella Artois, but less hoppy in flavours and less bitter.

You know, the bottled version of this is better because it actually TASTES like something.  On tap you get one of the blandest beers around.  Terribly boring.  I’d rather drink skunk green bottle flavor than watery pale lager idiocy.  I can’t believe people spend $8.50 a 6-pack for this shit.  Sam Adams is probably right next to this shit on the shelf but nooooo better get the shitty one instead!  IT’S GREEN! AND AUSTIN POWERS DRINKS IT.  what a world!  only drink when it’s available for free at a party or something.

12 oz. green bottle from Corti Bros., Sacramento. Light pale malt aroma with some grassy hop. Gold color with a white head that was respectable. Thin to medium in body, almost creamy carbonation. The flavor is pale malt, accompanied by light bitter. The finish goes a bit watery, but otherwise light hop and light malt. Crisp. Certainly competitive with American macros.

24 oz bottle.  Poured like a Bud--pale yellow with a decent head that was brilliant white.  Grainy yet standard aroma for a lager.  Maybe a little more intense than American macros.  Refreshing when served very cold.  Light hoppy flavor is very crisp.  Not filling and only very slightly bitter.  Very good for a pale lager.
Personal Keg Palle gold color.  Typical taste and aroma.  Not bad for a Boise State football tailgate party and especially when its free.

This is actually the first beer that i purchased in the US, it also holds a especial place in  my heart.The beer itself Has strong aroma, a white , fast fading head, a good flavor when cold/cool, like all lagers and pilseners,the palate is so familiar to me that i only can describe it as average, with a salty aftertaste. VIDA LARGA AL REY!
This beer is what started me drinking beers that are not the "miller buds".It’s a little watery for my taste now but holds a place in my heart!

Tap.  Golden color with a (Czech?) hops aroma.   Flavor is dominated by the hops and the malt is more of an afterthought. In addition it is a little a watery but refreshing.  For what it is( a mass produced product) it is not that bad.  And strangely I liked the Dutch version better that is not exported.
12 ounce bottle available at Total Wine Ft Lauderdale, FL at $1.49 Great tap at Heineken Experience, Amsterdam!

For a lager, this beer really disappoints.  The taste is mostly watery with some hops in the end that give this beer a horrible aftertaste that you just want to get rid of.  Pours a light gold with not much aroma.

Despite Heineken is a very comercial brand all over the world, and, does not taste the same in every country. If you are in a place and don’t not what to drink, take a Heineken and decide later. Classic pilsener, very refreshing, good taste, good palate.

330ml bottle.
Pours a clear golden yellow with an average white head. Aroma of strangeness for a lager with a small bit of hop. Taste and feel  is very watery. Hint of hops in the finish, Overall not a lot of flavour and not an amazing beer.

Draught at Lunds nation.   clear gold body with a small, weak head.   Weak vegetable aroma.   Tastes really grainy and adjuncty, even though it is supposedly all malt.   Hop presence is alright and is really all that this watery beer has to offer.   very thin body.   Overall, not too offesnsive, but definitely not worth drinking if there is any style other than macro pale lager available
It’s something I get every once in a while, but don’t really know why. There is virtually no hops to taste, and the flavor is reminiscent of High school
smooth, medium body slight hop bitterness, aroma is very low, decent but over priced beer
Decent beer when there aren’t any micro choices like at a golf course.  Average all around - aroma, flavor, color.
Smooth.  Good flavour.  I slightly dry taste.  medium body.  light head.  golden colour.  This is based on Heineken in Europe.  It is US, it is not the same.  :(
Very skunky (in a good way) hops, rather green on the nose, not much body to back it up, finishes rather sweet with slight hop bitterness. Really not too bad for a macro.
Typical pale lager. Not too much aroma, and not too much flavour. Refreshing though- better than most in its class.

Abbinata con lasagne precotte e pane raffermo, sul treno; era da tanto che volevo votarla, e non pensavo proprio che mi sarei pentito della mia masochistica scelta. Ma questa è veramente troppo! La metto in fondo a tutto e non per principio; non troverei un solo pregio nel bicchiere pieno e ogni vantaggio nel bicchiere vuoto; non riempitelo di nuovo, per favore. Offensiva.
Decent effort for a lager... I will jump on the overrated bandwagon.  Funny how I thought this was so exotic until I went to the Netherlands and the only people drinking it there were American.
green bottle means that it cant be that good, once you open this beer all i can think of is SKUNK...totally overrated
I find it funny how I used to think that this was a really great beer, but after drinking real beers... I admit I was wrong.

"I had to change my review after coming back from South Africa and Holland. Its contract brewed in Namibia, not a bad "copy" but lacks the skunkiness of the "regular" ..which is a bad thing.....Then back to normal in Holland until I tryed the fresh stuff from the brewery. now that fresh beer was the best heiny ever. full flavourful, slightly less skunk and more ...wholesomeness. I am now a bigger heineken fan because of my intense various tastings? . but for a lager its actually quite refreshing and just gives you enough."

This is a yellow, watery lager. Certainly much better than Budweiser or other American pale lagers. It has a fizzy, malty flavor. Doesn’t have the corn flavor that is so prevalent in the least of the lesser beers. Cans are definitely better than bottles with Heineken. They taste fresher. The bottled Heiny can smell skunky, too.

pours pale yellow with a pure white head. a very standard lager everyone has has 1000’s of times. if you must partake i suggest cans to help you avoid the dreaded green bottle skunk. unless your into that.......sicky.
I’ll drink this if there’s nothing else, but drink it ice cold or else you’ll actually taste it.
Will only drink on tap.  Rather lame, incredibly simple, kinda bitter.  Not bottom-of-the-barrel, but nothing great.
Nothing good to say, but nothing horrible to say either.  I will drink it again though, but not by choice.

I don’t know what came over me that i decided to rate this beer, but here goes...  0.5L bottle. Version brewed in Israel. Big head that dissapears quicker than road runner. Aroma non existent. Light yellow colour reminds me of an over diluted lemonade. Agressive bitterness that dissappears almost immidiately and leaves some sweetness that seems artificial  and also dissapears with no aftertaste, so at the end you can’t be sure you even drank anything.
grass, skunky, pale, clear, sparkling, light sweetness, medium bitterness, average carbonation, slick feel, medium body, astringent, Its good in a bottle than a can.

It could be worse, but Heineken is jus not very good. I think once you start drinking
truly "clean" beers you realize how artificial this beer tastes. In terms of appearance there is nothing really wrong or right about it, but the smell is a little skunky and metallic. Yes, the hop profile is more evident than say, Budweiser, but is that a good thing? No, it’s a very bad thing, because in this case the skunky and metallic qualities in the aroma also constitute the flavor!
What’s really problematic here, though, is the weird coating it leaves in your mouth. Kind of chemical tasting IMO. Also I get a headache from about one half of a bottle.
Yet another beer I surprised on the negative comments. I find it refreshing with mellow hoppy flavor.

Can.  The best I can say for it is that it was free!!  Not even Pat Burrell hitting a home run could make the experience any more pleasurable.  Pale golden color.  Thick white head.  Aroma of hay, yeast and a little corn.  Taste is not much different.

Out of the portable keg, yellow pour with big thick small buble head.  Nose of malt with very lttle hops.  Flavor was not of the normal heineken skunk, rather that of a fresher clipped grass and somewhat sweet.  Clean crisp finish.

I used to kind of like this stuff...but after a Stone Ruination its not so great.  That being said, I could and have drank a bunch of these at an afternoon bbq.  Nothing special to note, just another beer out of a can.

No taste - I thought they hads mistakingly filles the bottle with water - and as soon as it heats up a degree or two becomes rightly unpleasant. Like  mass marketed pop music - all sales and no substance.

The best Heineken in the world can be had at the Masters golf tournament.  Don’t believe me?  Try and score a pass and go have their Heineken on tap.  It’s the most luscious and creamy form of this lager I have ever had.  Seriously.  I think they must have it flown in from Holland prior to the tournament.  I’ve never had a more delectable Heineken in my life.  The bonus to it, although it doesn’t influence my rating in any way, it’s only $2 a pop in Augusta.  What other sporting event can you go to and enjoy 6 Heineken’s for $12.  Enough said.
From the bottle I am not much of a fan of Heineken but today I had it from a mini keg and I found the beer to be very enjoyable. The flavor was smoother and it was very easy on the way down.
From the bottle, I just don’t get how this is one of the highest selling beers. Smells & tastes like skunk. Bitter skunk. I would sooner drink Coors light than this, and I have. Will never try again.

Bottle - just as weak and light on taste as in person in Holland.  Not helped by extra yeast.  Dull, uninspired and over rated.  Like an American macro-brew without the corn and some extra yeast.  Leave it.

Can. Light straw notes for the malt component with grass for the hops and pepper in the background whch was the only good part of it’s aroma. Average sized creamy white head with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is a sparkling clear yellow. Taste starts lightly acidic and finishes moderately bitter and a bit acetic. Palate is light, between dry and watery with a fizzy carbonation. A good beer for pounding when the day’s fishing is done in the Florida summer sun.

Name: Heineken Lager

Date: 04/01/1996

Mode: Draft

Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs



clean yellow, thin head, lots of bubbles, slight hop aroma, skunky (tap) hop flavor, just a touch of hop bitterness at the afytertaste



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 4/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 3/10; Overall: 7/20

Rating: 1.7/5.0
Score: *+/4

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Time to rate the Heineken! A skunky aroma, but very drinkable, slight hops,  abit watery, always old by the time it reaches the states, but nothing wrong with it, Had it fresh in Europe,a Pale lager, what are you expecting? drinkable. Ghetto Champagne in my area. Eh.
This is Heineken; it is overpriced, usually skunky and, not very good.  Try something else, even soda pop.
Bitter! Drink this ice cold or you are screwed. Let me tell you, if you drink a Heinie in Holland it tastes much diffrent and lots better. So this ranking is for the US version. HOLLAND RULES!
How can people drink this stuff?Marketing, marketing, marketing. Well it did win some Gold Medal a hundred years or so ago. Maybe it was the best around then......

I would say when I drink this I have had several kinds of sensations.  When getting it from the tap at a bar around here, the head is flat, the taste is tingy no citrus, bland aftertaste.   Cans, is somewhat better than at the bar, needs to be cold, still taste bland.  Bottles you get skunky ones ruins taste pretty much when you get these.  Best ones I ever had was fresh from brewery in amsterdam, cold good head, hoppy taste. Too bad that experience couldn’t be replicated in cans or bottles.
unfortunately this brew has a penchant for becoming terribly skunky. I only order it when there’s absolutely nothing dark available
aroma is skunky reminds of corona but worse never liked it. taste bitter and salty at times .try at your own risk

Edited review with new sample

Just reading the comments, strange...mostly people do not like it, but every one has different reason. Fine, tastes are different, only I could not understand is that this beer is BITTER. Hell what beer is possibly less bitter than Heineken. 

Anyway, my 0.33 l bottle poured pale yellow body with medium head. Aroma of citrus hops, some slight malts... Flavor is well balanced, but a bit too watery. Moderate carbonation. Finish is long nice and pleasant with slight bitterness exchanging with sweetness. Definitely not the best beer, but for those who like such a light and potable styles this is the right beer. Although still my best pale lager it goes -1 to appearance,flavor and overall
Its an awesome beer when its not skunked. I think the botle and the fact that most common sources dont realy care for their beer contributes to this.

My least favorite mass-produced beer.  I would rather drink just about anything than this.  

The marketing people must be effing Einstiens to get people to buy this skunky flavored skunk piss in a bottle by positioning it as some kind of "Premium European Import".

Hell, I’ve even had this stuff out of the tap, at the damn brewery in Amsterdam, and even then it was STILL skunked.  Blech.
Heineken doesn’t do much to stand out beyond the many macrobrews, but it is better than most. Though it seems everytime I have it the aroma is skunked. Overall quite smooth with a light gold color.

THE MORE TIMES I DRINK THIS LAGER THE LESS I LIKE IT. BITTER TASTE, ESPECIALLY ON THE ROOF OF THE MOUTH. IF ITS NOT ICE COLD HAS A SMELL OF A SKUNK TASTE. AND EVEN IF IT IS, STILL HAS THAT TASTE IN A LESS HARSH MANNER.

Although I will drink this in a pinch, its only because bud or miller are my other choices. Every time I open one of these the first smell is skunk. (Might be the green bottle.) The best glass to pour this in is someone elses. Weak , tasteless, watery,skunky....run away. Might be ok near the brewery.

On draft @ Hooter’s. If it wasn’t for the Hooter’s girls, I probably wouldn’t have enjoyed this beer quite as much. 1 cm of frothy white head sits atop a bright piss-colored beer. Decent lace for a watery lager. Nose is grains, skunk, and flax seed cereal. Taste is more grain with more skunk and an astringent bite in the finish. Ultra-high carbonation does not help this beer. Slightly off-balanced and surprisingly rounded mouth-feel for a thin-body such as this. This is decent compared to most macro-produced crap. A step above toilet water. However, I would much rather drink this at a party than consume something worse like anything from Miller, Molsen, Pabst,  or Budweiser.
Unpleasant in all regards. Excluding discount brands, one of my least favourite beers. Too carbonated, poor taste, looks and smells poor as well.
Bottle at home. Clear yellow - white head. White bread, egg, sulfor, light citrus, light metal. Just a plain boring pale lager !!!
I can’t believe I haven’t rated this yet.  A classic import with a taste only a teenager could love.  I got the mini keg, which is pretty cool, but the liquid inside, not so much.

Had many times, including 3 free ones at the brewery in Amsterdam.  Basically the marketing behind Heineken is awesome.  Unfortunately the beer is far from awesome.  Ill only drink this if its free.  Id much rather have a LaBatt Blue.

Quite drinkable really. Ticks the boxes for a decent quality mass-produced lager, clean and crisp and all that jazz. The sort of beer I’m happy to come across at a BBQ in place of something much worse.

The familiar green bottle.  Poured pale yellow with thin white head.  Faint skunk in aroma, along with a sweetish malt.  Light body, with a some malt in the taste, and the faintest trace of hoppiness.  Flat watery finish, with tiny bitterness.

There was a time I thought this the best beer in the world.  But then I liked Castle then, too.

For a mass produced lager its not that bad. It’s a good party beer in thats its cheap at the store. I find it amazing that they can sell this for upwards of 8 dollars a bottle at the bar!!!! Not a sophisticated, flavorful beer at all. Its water, carbonation, and a little bit of alcohol, I think i picked up hints of beer flavor as well.
Not a bad beer once you get over the smell.  That aside, good for drinking on hot days and for the alcohol.

12 oz green bottle,when i pored this beer I could already smell it.can you say skunky,this beer stinks.I think alot of people drink this beer only because they think it is a cool beer.yellow fizz water.the taste is super sweet.I was only able to get down 2 sips.never again will I punish my taste buds this way!!!!

We’ve all heard of skunky beer, but I never knew the true meaning of skunky beer till i had this.  It absolutely stinks.  That said:  the taste is actually very nice.  im suprised how good it tastes considering the stink.  Not the best lager, but not the worst.  Rerate:  I tried this out of the Heineken Draughtkeg thinking that it would be without the skunkiness.  It was but gone with the skunkiness was alot of the taste. The little there was.  The Draughtkeg is nice, but the product inside could be much much better!!!!
A blah beer with the typical mass produced bite and bitterness.  I can only stomach a couple of these at a time.  Next.  Side note:  the "keg" can does not help the taste.
This beer seems to be enjoyed by everyone but me.  Although i’d drink it if it was free, I would probably never purchase it for my personal consumption.

16 can at wrigley field. pours straw with white head. nose is peppery hops and wet grains. flavor is crisp, spicy hops, clean and refreshing. out of the can, this is pretty good, very clean and a pleasent saaz hop character. everyone knows the green bottles are all skunky so try this in the cans or on tap cuz it is actually a nice clean lager.
Bottle. One of the better mass produced beers because it still has some character - fruit and floral qualities, but it is still mostly watery and boring.
Bottle. Another Euro Lager. Gold with a slight white head. Not much to say about it...a slightly hoppy aroma followed by a hint of sweet flavour and a dry finish. Run of the mill.
This is maybe one of the most famous pilseners but certainly not a good one. It almost has no flavor.

Can left over from daughter’s 4th b-day celebration. Not as skunky as with the skunk-enhancing green bottle but still there along with some corn flavored malt water with a sweetness that puts it on the same shelf as the Becks and Grolsch’s of the world.

[b]CAN[/b] Gold white head. Soft malt aroma, some noble hops-still a little skunky, but not in a bad way. Taste is light with some initial malt sweetness followed by some earthy hops. Nice finish, real crisp. Not a bad beer from the can. On tap and bottles generally are pretty nasty, this can was nice though.

Bottle. Gotta say I’m not a big fan of lagers. This is one of the VERY few drinkable ’large-scale’ beers available in Brazil. At least it’s 100% barley malt, unlike other watery commercial beers around here. Just drinkable.
This beer is sold through marketing and not by flavour. Very poor for an "international premium". Malty, almost heavy, emphasized bitterness (but no Aroma), skunky. harsh, lasting aftertaste

On tap, served in a 23oz lager glass.  This pale lager poured a crystal clear golden color with visible carbonation running up the sides of the glass.  A small off-white head dissappeared almost immediately.  The aroma of this beer consisted of grain, sweet malts, and some skunky hoppiness.  I was a bit surprised to find the fairly strong skunkiness since this was not a bottle.  The flavor was mildly dry and bitter, with a faint lingering skunky aftertaste.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied and heavily carbonated.  Decent enough.
one of the best beers ever and you can get it almost everywhere. there is no need to tell more about it...
fantastic beer... until you drink too much of it. goes down smooth and up even smoother
Not my favorite by any means. Aroma is strong and not appealing. Almost skunky!

Heineken boggles my mind.  It’s truly a commentary on the sad state of beer in the USA when so many people consider this a premium beer.  The flavor is basically not there and the beer has the consistency of water.  Yet another awful thing everyone loves.
Pale yellow colour, medium white head. Aroma is grassy and hoppy, a bit skunked. Flavour is metallic and sharp. Some faint malts and grassy hops.

what can you say its heineken. no one really would like to drink it at any given time but we all have and its not the worst thing ever. skunk smell with a very thin body bitter with a strong addition of grains whatever else they got laying around. but its pretty refreshing.

The prestige beer of choice for Asian men the world over. Pale yellow, light white head. Light nondescipt lagery fusel aroma. Somewhat inconsistent from bottle to bottle (surprised?) but when it’s good, it offers a clean crisp grainy flavor that’s pretty refreshing.
Not impressed either, didn’t like it but it was all they had on an Amtrack one night.
i don’t understand what all the hype is about this stuff.  i was not impressed.
dont know what the big deal about this is... yea its better than natty ice but not by much... you can get some decent brews for that price

Can. 4.6%. Best before 15.09.14. Brewed by Royal Unibrew. Pours a clear, and a bit pale, straw yellow with a white head. Almost no lacing. Sweet, slightly spicy, hop and cereal aroma. Flavour is sweet, with spicy hops, cereals, and a plastic note. Feels somewhat watery. Finish is sweetish, a bit tart, and mildly bitter with a lingering light hop note. Feels a bit dry. Overall not particularly good, and too sweet. 10.02.14.



Old rating (same score):

Can. Pours yellow with a white head. Sweetish cereal aroma. Same goes for the flavour. Metallic and corn finish. Dull. 09-07-07.
maybe because it is the only beer you can get in some places of the world, I have a mild heart for this tame and watery lager, but there are hins of fruit and citrus in there, and it looks good!

Okay, in a green bottle this beer is a low rated beer.  But in Amsterdam, fresh off the tap, it is a crisp and clean refresher.  Everywhere we went they pulled it.  I will not buy any out of the green bottle stateside, but I would like to compare this to the Dutch draft version.  I hear that it is a different recipe here and that the only place to get that good version is over there.  

P.S.  they have it in brown bottles in Amsterdam as well.  I’m not sure what that is about.

Another from the list of ’alright’ tasting beers.  Heineken is a beer that I expected more from.  With it’s place among the classic beers of the world secure, let’s get down to the review.  The colour is a straw gold colour that it representative of so many North American style lagers.  The aroma is slightly hoppy and not too overpowering.  The taste is pretty mild with nothing to really distinguish it from anything else.  Not a bad beer, but it isn’t a favourite of mine either.

I bought a Heineken Draft Keg, and I can honestly say that this is the best Heineken I’ve ever had, which is not saying much.  This package claims to keep beer fresh for 30 days, which I am highly curious about.

The Draft Keg does prevent the light-struck skunkiness that many of the "green bottle beers" are notorious for (Beck’s is the worst - take away the skunk and nothing remains).  What’s left is a straw colored beer with a fair amount of head composed of consistently-sized bubbles that smells a bit of Saaz hops and tastes like straw or grass and leaves a sticky film in my mouth.  Even from this package, which has to be a high point for this beer, it is still at best mediocre and IMO Pilsner Urquell remains the best of the European green-bottle imports.

(330ml green glass bottle) - Pale yellow liquid with average carbonation and a medium frothy white head. Flavour, lightly sweet/bitter. Clear, light bodied. As pale lagers go it’s not too bad but rather bland. Dry finish. Nothing special.

330 ml bottle - Clear pale yellow with a rapidly diminishing white head. Thin to medium bodied with l low to medium carbonation. Grassy floral aroma and flavours with  a bit of citrus. Sweetish with a mildly dry, finish.  Drinkable but not if there’s a choice.
bottle.  tastes skunky old hops.  way overated.  Drink 4 or 5 and get ready for a hangover.
xxx I’m sorry, but heineken doesn’t do it for me, its gotta a funky taste, and why use green bottles?!?!
12oz bottle from any bar.  normal pale lager almost an IPA taste, with a lot of hoppy-ness.  I wouldn’t pay extra for this beer.

Bright and without body but looks really nice in a bar terrace when it is sunny. Really easy to drink nice hop tasty even floral on the nose.  Quite standard. I can’t help liking it, it has nearly invaded my town!
Eh, don’t know what the big deal is over this beer.  I’ve had better pilsner and lagers then this.  Nothing special.  Give me something with flavoring.
Typical looking pilsener. Slightly musty, bready aroma. Sweet, fruity flavour. Too much sweetness, not enough bitterness. Not one of the better Dutch pilseners.

Bottle. Quite hoppy, a little bit citrus, straw. Clear yellow body, white head, mostly dimishing. Started sweet, enden more bitter with a short duration. On the palate the beer is light and rather dry. Not as good as the Hertog Jan, a summer-/lawnmoverbeer.

Pours golden from bottle, can or newer small keg variety. Like most of the mass market beers it lacks any kind of palate. But was useful in an experiment to show that most mass market beers taste almost the same (blind taste test with people who drink to get drunk, haha)

Bottle. An Israeli version brewed in Tempo Drinks ltd. "Under the supervision of the Heineken Brewery, Holland" (haha). Golden colored with a small disapearing white head. Light aroma of malt and a bit of hops. Malty sweet with some bitterness in the finish. Light-bodied. Unpleasant.
Dominant skunky aroma and taste.  Much like Green Eggs and Ham no matter if in a can or in a bottle or in a party keg, I do not care for this Sam I am.
one of my favorite beers. the bottle is classic. but the smell has a hint of wet dog.
Pale yellow gold with a medium white head.  Very skunky, corn malt aroma and flavor.  Tastes like very cheap malts were used.  Not very good.  Overrated.
Expensive, golden, smelly, skunky, chalky, don’t let it get too warm. I drink this at weddings only; when it’s paired up with Bud it’s obviously the best choice.
am surprised by the scores. obviously it ain’t great but don’t think it’s as bad as some of the other mainstream lagers.

Bottle. Disappointing - I was hoping it would be better than other mainstream lagers. Mediocre malt, mild hops, very carbonated and the palate is too watery. It has a little more flavor than other pale lagers, but that flavor isn’t great.
Used to be a great tasting beer. Is it me, or has this beer really changed for the worst over the years? Almost undrinkable.
I had to rate this beer 5/5 because it’s my #1 beer of choice, i love this beer, perfect on a hot day, mornings, and it provides that crisp taste that i need, Fantastic Beer!

Pours a pale sharp golden with decent carbonation. Average white fizzy head. The aroma is corny, basement, sweet. The flavor is light and kind of sweet. More tolerable than most macro americans, but still not very good. Crisp clean palate with no finish.

Poured a white head, thin, and it did not last long at all.  Smelled a noticeable sweetness of honey, especially as the beer warmed and neared the end, but also a bit of skunkiness.  A quick nice bitter bite to the aftertaste.  Overall, this wasn’t as watery tasting as some pale lagers, and had a decent enough flavor.

My wrath against green bottled beers continues.  Skunky aroma and taste overwhelm the hops and malts.   Somewhat Bitter and I guess refreshing to some degree on a hot day but with so many other good choices, I believe this is one best left on the shelf.

The overwhelmingly sad fact about this piss water - aside from its widespread availabiilty, is that people in the US conceive of it as a "premium" beer, and offering something extra over Miller, Coors, etc......newsflash, aside from being more expensive, this crap does not.

Large keg-can.  Straw yellow clear body with an inch or so of white head that leaves a fair bit of lacing as it dissipates.  Smells sweet with just a hint of hops.  Tastes sweet and malty with a hint of hops toward the finish.  Fairly drinkable.  Fairly full-flavored, though a bit on the sweet side for my taste.  Decent for what it is though.
Can. Pale golden colour with a white head. Light grainy aroma. Discreet flavour, slightly sourish.

Heineken pours a transparent golden brown. The pale white head is about an inch thick but fades quickly leaving no lace on the pint glass. There is a subtle hoppy scent.  The aroma is slight but easy to discern.  The taste is quite malty having a wider taste than it appears. There is a very subtle hoppy finish. An interesting note on this beer is that you can really taste it with your entire tongue. I find it impressing that way.
I drank seven and then had to vomit.

12oz Bottle - This stuff stinks - literally!  Skunky, skunky, skunky is all I can say about the aroma and flavor.  Not a very good beer, and way too expensive for the taste.  Some may like the taste, but I don’t care for it.

12 oz bottle pours a yellow gold with a white head.   Nose of grain, almost always a bit skunked, sometimes more than others.  Malt and hops both faint with more grains and fizzy carbonation.  I liked this beer before I knew anything about beer, now the only time it is drinkable is when it is out of a keg and not ruined by light.  When it is that way it can be quite crisp and refreshing.

consistently a great brew. Some grassy hops, a little malty, a little bitter. Clear and crisp, with a nice finish. Among the best mainstream imports. My personal everyday beer along with Sam Adams and Stella. I feel it falls right between the two rather nicely.

Bottle, Can and Draft: I am sticking by my rating of this, one of my every day drinking beers. I truly feel that populararity does not always equal herd mentality stupidity (ie coors light).  A clear crisp refreshing lager that goes with everything.   while not hte hoppiest criter or the strongest , a backbone of the industry and a very nice building block of craftsmanship.
One of the best pale lager’s out their...always consistent in taste and clarity.

I’ve had this beer many times, but have finally rated it.  A clear, light gold color with a small, bubbly white head.  The aroma is not too strong, some grassy hops, and a bit of malt, but nothing too noteworthy.  The flavor is ok, mostly sour and bitter, but not excessively.  Texture is ok, with light fizzyness, a thinner, smooth taste, and only mild carbonation.  Overall it is not bad for a mass-produced beer, and is quite drinkable, but not worth getting excited about.
Reasonable colour, quite sweet. Generally just not very nice. Hard to say whether Coke or Heineken has the better marketing clout?
No better than other pale lagers, just more expensive. Don’t waste the money. Some detectable malts, no noticeable hop flavor. Bad aroma.
nasty skunky nose, light straw color, watery bland and skunky flavour probably because of the green bottle
A beer that I won’t cringe at when it’s free. A better choice than most American Pale Lagers.

24 ounces bottle. Smooth, hoppy and malty with distinctive, slightly bitter taste.  Nice flowery aroma. A well ballanced pilsner/lager. Although widely available, it is still a good beer nevertheless. Stating that Heineken tastes like Budweiser is an insult. It obviously does not.   
On tap. I didn’t enjoy this beer on tap at all. The taste was lacking for some reason and was pretty stale.

This is the kind of Beer that’ll get the job  done after you’ve been mowing or golfing in the heat. This latest can was given to me. Better in cans than it is in bottles...try it...recognize...and please proceed to up your Beer game.

12 oz green slightly stubby bottle. Looking back, I have had many a heinie. But I rate this one as I drink.  Funny how this used to be the standard from which all others were measured!  Funny how opinions change! Pop the lid and you get a slightly sour beery aroma. Has a ubiquitous pale yellow american lager color and appearance. Not quite as Heinekeny as I remeber from long ago.  I’m not sure if my taste buds have changed or if the recipe has changed.  I recall it being more odd and offensive to an extent. Good carbonation, medium low. Has an interesting bitterness bite on the back of the throat that just keeps on building with each sip.  Perhaps this is the offensive attribute that I recall. I think the mowing over of my girly taste buds by impy stouts and IIPA has conditioned them a bit. Not bad overall but there are many other inexpensive american lagers out there that come across with more manners if you are seeking a pale lager. Schmidt’s and Old German come to mind immediately cause they are better tasting!  Finish has that odd slightly industrial charactaristic hangen of the back of your throat for a moment or two. A burp yeilds some skunkiness.

I bought a dozen Heineken’s yesterday for the first time in years. But it didn’t taste like I remembered it in the old days, though. That distinctive subdued hallmark taste seemed to be gone. It was just very bland. Fizzy and bland. Almost no taste of anything. Much like an American macro brew lager. Not offensive, just a very bland beer.
The packaging looked very nice though with the see-through plastic label on the green bottle!
I bought a six-pack of Grolsch the other day too, that’s what really prompted me to buy the Heineken’s - they are both Dutch beers.
But I have to tell you the Grolsch still had it’s original nice distinctive taste and smell. So now in the Dutch lagers -Grolsch over Heineken here.
Flavour is not strong enough. A little bitter. The price is high and the quality is low.
Bottle. Not much to write about. Weak in flavor. Metal taste. Fill the minimum....

Cannette. De couleur jaune dorée et transparente. Nez de grains de malt pâle, léger de houblon herbeux (foin et gazon mouillé) avec de petites notes de riz. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas mais croustillant ainsi qu’une texture aqueuse et aux petites notes huileuses. Goût de grains de malt pâle légèrement croustillants lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi d’un moyen goût sucré rappelant le riz ainsi qu’un goût de malt herbeux (gazon mouillé) et des traces de maïs sucré parallèlement à un goût légèrement amer de houblon herbeux et asséchant (foin) jusqu’en finale. Post-goût moyen-court et un peu sec, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux (foin).

Can and Bottle:  In my opinion this is skunk beer.  Watery and metallic, bitter in the wrong way.  Awful stale smell.  I have had this beer on more than one occasion so I know it wasn’t just a past date can experience.

Everybody knows this beer.  Only thing I can say is that this is not a bad industrial beer. Impossible to compare with homebrew ones, but for being an industrial beer, is pretty good (with Warsteiner as well)

Bottle.  Pour is clear gold, aroma is slightly skunky, though no hint of this if poured with a big head.  When fresh, this is a very tasty lager.  When sitting in a bottle for too long, this is almost undrinkable.
A really ordinary lager with not much taste. So for me if they do not have any other beer i will not try it anymore

Rated 1/3/06:  Although highly overrated and definately overpriced Heineken is still a solid all around european lager. I have always enjoyed drinking a few of these (especially if somebody else is picking up the tab). I don’t know why but I am drawn to the "skunky" qualities that this beer has become known for.

Pours a golden yellow with a very thin head. It has a faint grassy aroma with a hint of hops in the background, but the aroma is very weak. The taste is of watery grass with a hint of hops. Overall, this is a very bland beer.

I’m an IPA drinker to start with but when i go out and have to order a commen pale lager its heineken. it has the taste that sets it apart from other beers that every single resterant sells (unless they got sam adams...)
Can. Pours gold, big creamy white head which vanishes quickly. Light hop aroma and flavour, soft malt, thin body. Refreshing, clean and actually quite pleasant lawnmower/football beer.
12oz bottle. Very pale bland lager that is very drinkable. Light bodied and smooth. Tastes of rice and strong water presence.

24oz can. Has a rather large, slightly off-white head that diminishes rapidly. Pale gold colour. Sweet malty aroma with some grassy and fruity hops. Flavour follows suit, being mainly sweet malt with fruity hops being quite apparent. Not as malty as the typical pale lager, it thankfully has some actual hop flavour. Very thin mouthfeel but just the right carbonation. Although nothing particularly special, it is enjoyable and out of the pale lagers I’ve tried, this is about the best. It’s relatively cheap and readily available, too. Very easy to drink and far better than the typical American macro-brewed pale lager.
Should be higher than the 9 percentile on my scale but not by a lot.  This beer is very thirst quenching but that is about it.  Taste is nice but nothing special.

Fut au bar de l’ÉTS. Blonde, jaune claire. Mousse qui s’estompe et forme un mince lacet. Arôme faible de céréales, encore plus légèrement de houblon. Goût en légère amertume, effervescence bien présente. Mince. Se boit bien, mais sans avoir aucunes particularités distinctives que plusieurs lui accorde.

There was a time when fellow Dutch brewery Grolsch could look at Heineken and  laugh at it’s wannabe national cousin. Sadly, those times have passed. Whereas Grolsch’s legendary uniformity of taste has slipped as it has gained global mass market acceptance, Heineken has remained rock solid in terms of its quality, taste and overall excellence. With a beautiful floral fragrance and taste, this is a beer for the ages - at least if you are partial to hoppy Pilsener-based lagers that go down easy and are big on taste. An absolute standby beer of true international stature. Will never let you down when others fail.
Underrated in my opinion. It is a light lager, yet, very quenching and distinct. A Heineken is that, and nothing like it. Like drinking skunk piss.
0.5 can. Quite big but fastly dissapearing head. light golden colour. Aroma of hops-grass. WATER.
bottle.  Grassy aroma.  Clear golden color with a head  that disappeared quickly.  The flavor is also grassy and hints of corn.  The mouthfeel was thin and watery.  Not that great a beer.
(500 ml can) Hoppy, surprisingly strong aroma. Nice flavor with a hint of hops. Still pretty light and easy to drink. Beats normal "mass lagers".
Can 50 cl. 4,7% (Norwegian, by Hansa Borg). Golden, no head after 10 sec. Thin, boring, some sweetness rescues this from 0,5 points. Easy to drink... - so is water.
Smells skunky and sweet.  Not much of a head.  Enjoyable in some situations, wouldn’t get this to sit back and taste really.  Not a bad beer though.

Of all the mass marketed beers that can be bought in most places, this is the best (i.e., vs. Bud. Bud Light, Miller Lite, Coors Light.)

Becoming popular in the African-American community.
Not bad at all.  A solid taste with balanced with a strong and malty aroma.  Very good lager makes it worth buying

POLE CAT BEER!  In the south we call skunks: pole cats.  This is the skunkiest beer.  I cannot understand why the guys in the office always drink this at our parties.  I am a beer drinker and I don’t drink to get drunk but I would rather drink straight liquour (yuck) than this skunky piss.

12 ounce bottle into a shaker glass. Pale golden with a medium white head. Aroma was light and of grainy malt. Taste was very light with a subtle note of malt, not much else. Right on par with many pale lagers.

Not outstanding, but easy to drink - a good party beer. Color is typical beer amber, no cloudiness. Aroma is strong and malty. Taste is malty, not complex but pleasant, no bitterness. Crisp, smooth, tangy,  it makes a good accompaniment to dinner or lively conversation. A nice beer, a little above average, worth a try.
good beer overall. nice crisp likeable flavor. goes down smooth and will make your taste buds pleased.

I really like this beer, but only original one, I was at Heineken Experience and could test the really good beer.

Eu adoro essa cerveja, porém somente a original, pq a envasada no Brasil é uma merda. Se tiverem a oportunidade de importar, aproveitem...

Drank out of the can between the 10th and 11th holes at St.Marlo Golf Course in Duluth GA on a beautiful GA day.  Typical lager, a perfect beer for the course.  Like potato chips, can’t have just one.

24oz bottle, $2.79.  Another macro lager, another skunky beer.  Aroma sucks. Appearance is below average but not the  worst I’ve seen.  Flavor is watery but better than it smells.  Feels like a macro lager.

Many times bottle and can, a few times on draft. Light straw color with medium-large head. Bottle can be pure skunk-nut lager aroma (and flavor) about 1/2 the time; canned has less chance of skunk. When not skunked, flavor is neutrally nice, with a sweet and nutty tendency. Light palate, with seemingly less hangover than American industrial lagers, and should be chosen over them in places where this is the "high-end" beer. Otherwise best left alone.

This beer is not bad overall, but would not be my first choice while standing there and looking for beer... It has a great apperarence but the flavor is laking and it hits the mouth strong... I like it but like I said it’s not my first choice...

“On tap”.  transparent amber Coloration, dense, but little consistent cream. Watery, but with evident presence of malt. .......................................PORTUGUÊS: "On tap". Coloração âmbar transparente, creme pouco denso, mas consistente. Aguada, mas com evidente presença de malte.
Bottle.  Aroma of strange malt and grain.  Flavor and finish are also grainy and very dry.  Kind of like coors.
330ml bottle. golden with a white head. smells like hops a bit with some skunkieness. taste is very bitter with some detectable malt and hops. very average, very boring, not very good.

Overly bitter taste and pretty much no redeeming qualities other than the fact it theoretically gets you drunk eventually (if that is your goal). Way too generic, the taste is virtually the same as premium discount crap, yet it’s from Amsterdam? What? I swear they just like playing jokes on North American drinkers. Or maybe they’re appealing to the market, which would make more sense as I pointed out how generic and un-recognizable this stuff is. Don’t be fooled by the fact that it’s quasey authentic imported beer (would anyone in Amesterdam actually drink this when they’ve got hundreds of other beers?).
A little too bitter for me, even though it shouldn’t be. The bottle itself is the biggest attraction. Nothing amazing about the beer for me...

I want to get this one out of the way. Pours a pale straw yellow with hardy any head. Aroma is a bit skoan-key with light hops. Taste is a bit skoan-key as I was looking for a can of tomato juice. Finish is dry and grainy. Remind me to bring some of this brew the next time I go deer hunting. Maybe I could use this brew as a camouflage scent.

From a 5L draught can. Turned out to be a pretty awfull idea...
No matter how carefull you poored this one into the glass, it turned out with atleast 70% foam which meant the palate was completly flat and lazy. When thats said, nothing unpleasans about the beer, just a mainstream pale lager with the usual easy to drink but boring flavor
Pretty good version of the style.  Can actually detect hops and malt in this one.  Crisp taste.  Some sweetness.  A little on the watery side.  One of the better generics.

33 cL can. Pours pale yellow with white head. Aroma is distinct straw and bitter hops. Taste is a again dominated bit bitter hops, but this is only there for the start and doesn’t go into the finish. The bitterness is rather odd somehow. has some wellrounded sweetness into the finish.

A somewhat neutral straw beer with some weak hoppy taste to it. Good when you are thirsty and dont want a beer that tastes of too much beer. Available all over the world as the same old same waterish brewish thing. Not bad, just hardly anything.

This is always the beer I get when the bar has nothing to offer but domestics...Truthfully, its not that bad compared to your buds, coors, options, and drinking a few too many of these won’t result in that terrible a hangover. That’s about the best thing I can say about this beer.

Tough deal...at a wedding last night and the beers to choose from were Coors Light, Bud, and Heineken.  I probably should have gone hard liquor but went with the Heineys.  Drank it right out of the bottle and I tasted malt, skunk and yuk.  I could only drink two of these and that was all I could stomach.  I used to like this beer, but times have changed.
i wasnt a fan initially but this one does have an ability to grow on you. does smell skunky, get past that and you have a decent cheap beer that drinks easy. great in a mini keg.

Draught at the Heineken Brewery in Strasbourg France. They stated that Heineken tastes the same around the world, well it doesn’t. It was poured into a pint glass with a light golden colour, thick foamy white head. Smell of malts, some hops and slight grain. Taste was completely different, a sweet taste with hint of hops and slight citrus. Was completely surprised and overall it was a very enjoyable brew. If you ever in strasbourg definitely stop by and taste the difference.

A: pours a clear piss yellow color with a weak white head that dissapates before tasting, no lacing, looks like your drinking piss

S: SKUNK!! strong at first, after 5 minutes it dissapates and reveals a malt grain smell and grassy hops, very standard for a macro lager

T: nothing too impressive, short initial bite followed by a light sweet bannana flavor

M: light body, semi dry texture, light carbonation nothing too fun

D: It’s ok.. heavier than their girly beer flavored water, probably good for funnels frat parties and yuppies not really anything to enjoy here cept for a slight buzz

Only slightly better thanalot of american macros.  Pale yelloe with medium white head.  Not much aroma to speak of.  Taste a hint of hops and malt; nothing special.  There is a skunkiness to the finish.

from notes taken 2 month ago
pale yellow color
foamy withe head is dissapearing quickly
smells malty,some hops
in tast some malt, some sourness, some hops
aftertaste some hops, a bit of bitterness,bread
rather booring
Pale. Un gout peu prononcé. "Skunky". La cannette est belle mais la bière est décevante.

Bottle.  Decent color for a massed produced import.  Light lager, with a bit of bitter in the finish.  I would say this is another refresher beer that is affordable to stock and I would definitely stock it en masse over most of the American macros.  Decent, affordable, light.
Bottle, 33 cl. Pale yellow, medium white head. Neutral malt aroma, some grain. Light bodied. Well balanced, with very short, slightly bitter finish. Ok, but boring.
Fizzy yellow. Small white head. Some wet grass and lots of skunkiness. Horrid.
Bottle.White head.pale yellow.A little skunky.Bitter.Thin.The best of a few available macros at the time.Not very good.
I dont normally rate the commercial beers, but this has sentimental value as the first non-light beer I tried.  Skunky. Watery.  Not very interesting, but refreshing on a hot summer day.
I am no fan of this Dutch beer. Belgians often make jokes about this drink, and I agree with my countrymen. This is refreshing, but the taste is not very full and even watery. Not my cup of tea!
I think the italian version is not that bad. Refreshing in summer more than a soft drink. That’s all.
Bottled. a pale golden beer with a light head. Light aroma of malt. The flavour has a very industrial touch. Not a beer i will drink again.

The last time I remember having this was the last time I got really hungover, and pretty much the last time I got really drunk. It started off a night lush with southern comfort, free red wine at a chinese food restaurant, shots of vodka, and once I’d decided I’d sobered up after the puking, a pint of SNPA. That was probably what did me in. Nothing quite like walking across harlem at 9 in the morning 98% of the way towards vomiting up the nothing in your stomach for a 10th time. Mm mmm mmm. I didn’t rate the SNPA (tap) sample from that night, but I feel it’s only fair to rate this. For even if it was the SN that really did me in, it is this that just sucks that bad.

I’ve never been a fan of this beer, but it was at a party with not much else so I stole a bottle.  Pale golden color with a big, fizzy white head.  Sweet corn nose with some wet cardboard.  It has flavor, unlike a lot of pale lagers, but that is not necessarily a good thing.  Wet cardboard, old nickels, and something medicinal really impact the light caramel sweetness and buscuity malts in this beer.  Maybe its better in the Netherlands.

Bottle 0,33l. 4,3%. Looks like dirty water. A creamy head rapidly collapsing into a thin white layer. Some sweetness in the aroma. Cardboardish flavor with some bitterness. A dry bitter finish. A bit too carbonated.

Not one of my favorites. Overpowering aftertaste that I can’t get used to. Drank a few in Antigua (the gift shop was out of Wadadli and Caribe) and  it did taste better than the Heineken sold here. There was not the skunky aftertaste or aroma.

Ugh. This was simply awful. Smelled bad...Tasted worse...Poured from bottle at local bar...Horrible skunky taste. I drank it, because I really had no choice, but it was pretty darn nasty. I would actually drink a Bud light over this...Very disappointing...

Poured a clear gold with an ultra-thin white head that evaported seemingly in an instant.  The aroma was sugary sweet.  The flavor was sweet initially but this beer has always finished with a medicinal aftertaste that has forced me to for the most part steer clear of this turd.  Plus, is there a more dildonic beer than a Heineken?  Is this beer not the ultimate bankers happy hour sausage party beer?
At first crack of the bottle I smelled skunk.  Which to my knowledge is normal.  Pours golden yellow (clear) with a nice head, but that quickly vanished.  Average taste and average beer.  Not bad.

Overrated worse than Corona. Cheap corn taste.  Carbonation is off.  Wasn’t even refreshing after walking 15 blocks.  I just had it because it was the same price as all the others.  After having it, I think it should probably stay that way.  Second Netherlands Pale Lager that I have trashed to date.  Sorry Deutchland.

Free bottle. Palest ghoslike straw, almost colorless. Phenominally transparent. Airy head dissipates in under a minute. Listed in order of prominence, aromas are sweet buttered corn; floral/honey; metallic; new vinyl shower curtain. Very, very faint sweet grainy malt, some tast, and inappropriate banana flavors. Distracting element of sludgy used frying oil. Startling rubbing alcohol finish. Although well-carbonated, the beer is limp, watery and waxy in the mouth. Strange mint mouthwash/antiseptic aftertaste. No detectable bitterness. I relived this single beer for a full six or seven hours via stale greasy-doughnut-tasting belches. Whats with all the rancid oily character? Very sad and worthless.
Look, its a fairly reliable beer, not great, bit not bad, take it or leave it, its certainly popular **edit** have just drank some in the brewery in AMS, certainly tasted brilliant there!
tastes like corn. smells like skunk. did i metion it tastes like cheap corn? why do people like this? why do they think its fancy!? its beyond me.

Mildly sweet tasting beer with a hint of alcohol in the background. Goes down real easy kind of like water does.

Overall  Not  bad  ,but it,s definately over rated  , no doubt due to it,s availiblity . If you happen to be out in the boonies somewhere , it,s probably  the best beer that you can get.
  This is the only beer i prefer to buy out of the can because i like them Keg cans !!

I like the commercials a lot more than I like the beer. My friends bought a six pack of this half-a-year ago because it was the only thing they could get at a gas station about to close one night. Guess what; all six are still in my fridge.
Probably the most over-rated beer in yuppie-dom.  I’d much rather drink a bud light than this stuff and that aint saying much
Bottle, 330 ml. Typical pilsen, with a very weak aroma, taste and coloration. Nothing more to say...
A nice beer for a Macrobrew. Aroma is different but the pour is very nice and leaves a nice head. Mouthfeel is just average, best served cold. Flavor is nice and unique. Hard to avoid this beer.

The keg, 12oz mini keg can, 16oz can, and 12oz bottle, tap, all taste very different....however each one is consistent with it’s particular flavor. Skunky aroma, and not kind to the body the following day. Where beer is limited, it usually winds up being my choice.
A kind of bit bad beer taste, dominates the flavor of this one.  Leaves a bad lingering taste that can only be overcome with some citrus.  Not too bad with a lemon.
Clear, clean, amber color. Small malty aroma, slightly skunky. Not too much to this beer, average flavor. Light bodied.

the bottle is green.  It sits on a bar.  I drink from it.  the contents hit my lips.  they ease their way down my throat.  I throw my head back in a fit of confused fury and howl.  I howl because the beast needs let out of his cage.  I howl.
Can. Pale yellwo with a nice medium creamy white head. Aroma is quite sweet with a citric hoppyness. Quite watery. Boring slight bitter flavour with citric notes.

Bottle from airport, Amsterdam. Expected a difference from a local bottle. This lager cost as much as a bottle of water - when faced with the choice, I guess I now know where my heart lies. Pale lemon in colour with white head. Lemony hop nose and taste. And that’s pretty much it. Still refreshing after a hectic day of travelling.
Pours a watery yellow.  Aroma is of a recently flattened skunk with a little honey tossed in.  Flat watery taste with just a hint of skunk.
Pours a clear barely yellow with a giant frothy white head.  Hints of biscuity malt aroma as well as a slight hoppiness.  Very tinny with a hint of malty sweetness and very little hops.
barley malt aroma.  Notes of malts and hops with a slightly bitter finish that lingers longer than I like.  Palate is carbonated.

Pours with a nice white head that is short lived.  Nice aroma; floral.  A bit darker in appearance than American lagers.  Very clear and clean looking.  Seems to me that the hops completely take over the flavor and the aroma of this beer.
Not very impressed with this beer not a very good taste to me and its over priced.
Just another party beer - nothing special by a long shot. No head, bit too bubbly for me. At least it’s better than Bud.
This beer is extremely overratted and over priced! That being said, it’s still one of my favorites when its really cold, or if it’s 2$ you call it, it’s better than Bud.
Good head, minimal lacing.  Very light, hops the only flavor, no character.

Slightly more flavoursome then the likes of Bud. Also whereas I find Bud or Carlsberg are actually unpleasant experiences, this is at least drinkable. That said, ‘at least drinkable’ is not what I look for in a beer.
Very enjoyable beer.  Beat out it’s often times compared to Beck’s by a mile.
had this plenty of times, but as with guinness, seemed to taste better when sampled at the brewery in amsterdam. maybe because it was a free unlimited supply...

I am tired of people talking bad about this beer, although everyones tastes are different. This beer has a strong, nice aroma to it and goes down smooth. Definately a lighter beer in color and taste. Good beer to try.

It kills me when people say this beer is great or something.  It’s really thin, lacks any depth in the aroma or flavor, and is too bitter.  The only way to drink it is out of the bottle if you’re really thirsty, or as an accompanyment to spicy food or italian cured meats or something.  In that context, it’s more than acceptable, but as a good beer in itself, absolutely not.

I give this beer a nice solid 2.  It’s completely inoffensive and has some taste, i think.  Not bad for free, but don’t buy this watery junk.  At least it’s not brewed from rice.  Heineken dark is markedly better.

Just a big disapointement when first trying this one even thou I was really  looking forward to taste this well known trademark.  I can´t understand why it has such a huge worldwide comercial. It tastes like some cheap beer 1:1 with water.

Pours pale golden, with a half inch white head that quickly fades.  Excellent clarity and a mild malt and hop aroma are present.  Not the usual skunky aroma and flavor that seem standard with the green bottle.  MIld malt taste with hops definitely in the background, that carry all the way to the back of the tongue. Little glass lacing, but mildly refreshing.  Pretty good for a pale lager, and close to style, which is my view of how a beer should be rated.  Every beer doesn’t have to blow your socks off.

Skunky aroma, pale color, bitter metallic taste, and pissy palate ("unsurpassed clarity" indeed!).  Hard to believe I quaffed this stuff by the gallon when living in Europe twenty years ago.  What in the world was I thinking?

This 24 oz. bomber was a drain pour after a few sips in favor of a REAL American beer - Sierra Nevada pale.
Golden color. Has a unpleasantly strong aroma but overall a nice micro. A good light beer to drink.
Gold, white head.  Nose is noble hops, light dough malt, lemon.  Flavor is sourish noble hop, light malt, a little dough in tie finish.  passable.
Generally un-offensive, this beer is very thin. No palate to speak of, a slight honey sweetness - which may be its only redeeming quality. And yes, the trademark subtle skunky characteristic..
Always tastes really skunky and sour to me.  I try to avoid this beer at almost all costs.

Boa cerveja. Cheiro característico muito bom, marca da cerveja (porém já encontrado em outras cervejas do mesmo grupo). Coloração mais dourada que as normais brasileiras. Espuma normal. Amarga e mais forte que as cervejas brasileiras - traços cítricos, refrescante e leve. Cerveja fabricada no Brasil, sem diferença da importada.
Hawaii’s king of beers but not sure why. Not sure what provides the trademark flavor which to me is an unpleasant skunky chemical/soap flavor.

12oz. bottle. Pours light, clear golden with a small white head that disappears rapidly. Mild malty aroma with some skunk. Flavor is fairly sweet with a some skunky hop finish. Light body and significant carbonation. Not a very well balanced flavor, yet fairly drinkable.

When I was in high school, this was the beer of choice.  Somehow this association with quality has remained with me ever since.  As has been mentioned before, it goes down easy and you can pound them all day (or night) without disastrous consequences. There is a lot to be said for using only barley malt, hops and water.   It think that this beer is underrated.
I couldn’t find any Stone beers at the grocery store and everything else was bud/coors. This is an ok beer in a pinch what more can you say.
Your going to have to beat the hell out of me to try another . . . why bother . . .

I mean...it gets you drunk...

Definately very, very drinkable, but not a normal choice of mine. Was forced to choose upon less expensive brews to appeal to the masses.

I have to say this beer is overrated in the market. It is passed off as a premium but its not any better than the big 3 .It is very skunky and bitter. It does have a nice golden color. Summer type beer i guess but wont see me drinking it.

What can I say.  I used to hate this beer but I can honestly say that after years of indirect exposure, it has crept into my heart as my all-time favorite old-standby beer.  Is it skunky?  Yeah.  Is it pale?  Oh yeah.  Can I drink 24 of these suckers in one night and still feel like a human being the next morning?  Hell yeah!  That’s why I love it.  If I drink 3 Coronas, I’m out for the night with heartburn.  Give me 9 (insert favorite American mass-produced beer here) and I’ll show you a pile of vomit that resembles Estelle Getty.  Give me an Arrogant Bastard and I’ll shut up for a few.  Give me a Heiny and well...  give me another... and another!  Don’t you people understand?  That’s the beauty of Heineken.  While undoubtedly smelling like the rear quarters of a particular disturbed mammal to which it owes so much for brand recognition, it is still one of the only beers I can drink until I pass out without any noticeable side effects the next day.  To me, no taste in the world could equal that feeling - so Heineken - you’ve made a friend for life.  To all who don’t understand you, I pity them and wish they would try you again and greet you with with an open mind.  Don’t jump on the "afficianado" bandwagon and bash it because it’s popular.  It’s popular for a reason.  Some of you need to go back to beer school.

Bottle, from mug. Barely existent white head; extremely pale yellow body. Smells like skunk spray, as everyone knows. When will they let go of their green-bottled image? It’s hard to detect what aromas might be beneath that stench, but I’ll go out on a limb and suggest that it’d be uninspiring. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is average. Tastes like a pale lager; I’m finding it hard to tell one from another anymore, although for what it’s worth, this one shows the signs of being well-brewed (it doesn’t taste artificial). Finish is sweet, with perhaps the faintest touch of bitterness. I’ll never forget the time when, as a kid, I saw an older friend drinking a Heineken and was totally impressed by his ability to handle something so "potent." This was back when I had to repress a grimace while forcing down a can of Budweiser, so as not to look like a wuss among my buddies. Ah, memories...

People who do not know truly good beer always make a big deal out of heineken. I find the aftertaste to be poor, almost as if it was skunked. Better than most of the american light lagers but still not very good.
Bottle.  Clean, plenty of carbonation.  Have trouble with aroma and many times skunked when purchased.  Why...why the green bottles.

Very good beer. Refreshing yet bitter. grass, sparkling, white foam, lightly sour, medium bitterness, slick feel, medium body, fizzy. Actually,really good with sake so if you wanna sake bomb with a non-asian beer i’d recomend it.

I always thought that Heineken stunk, not in taste but literally it is a stinky beer.  The best thing about this beer is that it comes from Holland.  It beats 99% of the big american light lagers, (not saying much).

From the bottle, yeah....  Not going to give this a serious rating.  It does go pretty well in a stein in a pinch.  It’s not bad, but it’s not quite what you’re looking for in a "classy foreign beer."  Their slogan "Wise men follow the star" is pretty good, but I’m not going to buy it based on that.  Actually, I’ll buy this even less than ever after its attrocious Heineken Light ads.
Canned, light, smoot, frutied, and harmonic but little tastely beer that should have more taste to be good
