Best served bottle to mouth in a direct fashion....when served bottle to glass,  the aroma is not strong and the color is pretty pale but actually very pretty..taste is still a tad sour with refreshing qualities...a balanced lager...love the bottle’s drinking rim...flavor is appealing in a non-offense way

A pretty beer, but what itrigues me is that this is many peoples wet dream. I just don’t understand how something as fizzy and unremarkable can be so highly regarded. Bartender! Get me something that lets me know I am drinking it!
Light sweet malty aroma.  Slightly bitter watery flavor with hints of malt and corn.  Easy to drink and sweet.  This bottle was not skunky.
Bottle and draft.  There is nothing new to review about this bland bier but the Experience in Amsterdam is a fun trip and you get some glassware at the end.
Beer 33 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/5/06 draft at the Heinken Experience in Amsterdamn.  Fun tour, but the beer just plain sucks.  My brother said, "tastes like nothing."

12 oz. bottle from a case.  Pours clear golden with moderate to little crown - retention is minimal with little lacing.  Aroma is weak with a hint of hops, some malt is noticeable.  Flavour is crisp and moderately hoppy with some malt balance, but overall not very impressive.  Palate is extremely thin with moderate carbonation.  Finish is relatively clean but leaves a little to be desired.  Please drink it quickly out of the bottle, as leaving it exposed to light or having it exposed multiple times in the fridge to light oxidises the brew quickly through the green bottle and leaves you with skunked beer.  If buying a 6-pack in the store, pick one that is towards the rear of the cooler, if possible.  IMO, it is better than other american macrobrews, but unless I’m desperate, I’ll just have a water instead.

I don’t know why this beer has become so popular. The appearance is nothing special. This lager has no distinct taste to it. I think that between this and Corona I would take a Heineken, but I must say that would not be because I wanted to take it. Their fancy marketing hasn’t done much to enhance the taste. I have an idea for the company. Instead of spending millions upon millions of dollars on advertising, IMPROVE THE FLAVOR!

Hey, If you don’t like this beer, you are either a snob, or you forgot just how bad a Budweiser is, or you just don’t like ANY lagers. To me it’s got more flavor than a Becks, and it’s as fine as Pilsner Urquell or Chechvar. And it’s got that distinctive ’skunky’ taste. Years ago they used to write on the label ’serve at 50 degrees". Ice cold or 50 degrees it’s refreshing and flavorful. Like I said, don’t give this beer a rating if you don’t even like lagers. This is and always has been a very good beer and is for many, a stepping stone from the Buds and Millers of the world !

24oz. "mini-keg".  Pours pale gold with substantial average-lasting white head.  Aroma sharply hoppy, but pleasant.  Taste the same as aroma, bitteness OK.  Better than average rating. Great for when you are not in the mood for something special, just comfortable.  Quantum leap from the BMC collection.

This really isn’t a bad beer, especially for a European Lager, and one I used to really enjoy before I started tasting the "better" beers. Like most of these type, it pours a very pale color, with some grainy aroma and a thin white head. Taste is nothing special, but pleasant, and the finish and aftertaste are okay. 

Again, this has slid a long way in my book, but still a beer I can enjoy when none of the good stuff is available.

pretty much the same as all the other ratings on this page . pours yellow with a one finger white head and yes the taste is skunk i have no idea why they would brew it like that! i gave it a two overall because it is better than some drain pours but not by much.

Golden yellow with faint aroma. I don’t drink Heineken but recently tried it again. Kind of bitter and flavorless. Tasted a bit skunked..not sure if that’s the flavor or if it was...but it wasn’t that great.
Pours pale yellow with a quickly fading white head. Nose is very hoppy and grassy. Flavor is very malty. Strong malt character. A good beer
skunky crap.. clear smells kinda skunky.. tastes bad... I wont drink this. and ratebeer says I need a few more characters so I’m writing this sentence.

I love Heineken. it is my "everyday beer" it has a decent aroma. and tastes similar to grolsh or becks. it def has a very light color and almost non existant head. I suggest drinking them at room temp to enjoy the full flavor.

Danish version Heineken: It is an almost transparent light golden beer, with nothing on the top that I possibly could be temped to call a head. The aroma is almost non-existent, however there is some traces of brewing cereal or lager malts. The flavor is easily bitter with some brewing cereal, a bit thin malts, and only an absolute minimum of hops in the finish is present. Body is only a bit better than water, edgy carbonation.
I didnt know it was possible, but this stuff both sucks and blows. Take it back to the netherlands and tastes like it came from your nether regions!

Pale straw colour, very clear. Good head settling quickly to a creamy skim, slight lacing.
Nice gentle aroma, low hop and malt, pleasant sweet breadiness. 
Low bitterness, good medium carbonation. Refreshing.

Keg at Schiphol Airport
Having previously worked in the Netherlands for many years, I feel this beer hasn’t been given a fair chance in recent ratings, so I had a quick taste on a flying visit to Amsterdam today.


On draught it’s a pale straw colour with a dense lasting white head, it smells of grain with a metallic edge, it’s cold, sweet and refreshing with a hint of bitterness, but is a bit cloying afterwards.

This beer is best drunk as the Dutch do, cold and in small servings, with friends. It’s not intended to be the centre of attention, so doesn’t merit rating as a serious beer. However, in my opinion beer is always preferable to cola, so that makes this one OK.
Why do people pay $5+ for this stuff at the bar?  In my opinion the colder the better, as it warms the more sour the beer tastes.

Bottled (355ml), brazilian version brewed by FEMSA Brasil. It´s a lager with a carachteristic flavour, and it´s better than most of brasilian pissed "pilseners". Its color is light golden with a small head. The aroma is very weak and hoppy. It´s a watery beer with a "heineken" very light taste. Neutral Aftertaste with citric notes.     Brazilian Heineken comes together with Brazilian Stella Artois in preference of a upper-class golden youth in their parties. God for then!

Bottle from the minibar of some DC suburb hotel.



Very pale yellow with a short-lived white head. Dry grassy aroma, a bit sour, grainy. More grassy hops in the flavor than I might have expected, grainy flavor turning sweeter on the finish to actually overpower the hops, but otherwise passable. Slightly overcarbonated.  Compared the alternatives in the minibar - Corona and Miller light - this is a drinkable beer.



Bottle in the minibar of some other suburban DC hotel
I guess I only drink this stuff when I’m staying in some McLuxury hotel in DC. Still sucks. More like 1.8 this time due to some major flavor flaws.

Brown bottle from NL: Pours a golden amber with white head. Aroma is a grassy skunky hops. Unlike the import that is more of a pils not a lager this has a somewhat sweet malty flavor that finishes dry. If I was rateing this on the import my rating would be: 1.8, but the one you will see here is for what I consider the real Heineken!

There are three beers that all the yuppy bars in chicago stock and charge $5+ for...
Corona, Amstel and....Heineken.   WTF?  avoid the keg can at all costs...too bad it looks so damn cool

In a chilled mug: Pours a pale gold with a modest, white head. Very skunky and grassy aroma with just a touch of sourdough bread. Very bland taste, bordering on sour with a distinct, skunk finish. Eh...it’s not a bad pale lager, but there are much better ones out there with much worse reputations.

Here is proof that not only America can produce bad beer. It certainly has a distinct flavor. Years ago I would wonder about just what it was. Now I know. It’s that “Bad Thing”. Bad Thing is present i many brews but somehow the Dutch have given it a higher status then most.  It tastes like grass and not the good kind. It smells like a horse barn. Drink a Pepsi and save your beer money for something else

330 ml bottle - Pours pale yellow (urine?) with a foamy white head. There are people out there who think it’s the best beer on the market.  I am not one of them.  Fairly off-putting aroma and a popishly-carbonated corny taste.  Ice cold - ok; anything else, you’re in trouble.  Drink it quick.

This beer seemed to be better years ago; either the brewing has changed, or maybe it’s just that my standards are higher. Anyway, nice gold color, but lacking much of a head. Very faint lace. Aroma is of hops, and that carries through in the flavor. Clean finish, for the most part. An average pale lager, and not really worth the premium price.

Can. Norwegian version by Hansa Borg Bryggerier. Clear golden color, minor vanishing head. Slight earthy hop aroma. Taste is a bit skunky and sourish with a light malt profile. Watery texture. Salty, semi-dry finish. My first Heineken in many years... years to go for the next one.
Not bad...but not great either.  A mild bitterness but still watery.  I would not pay a premium price for this beer though.

green bottle skunk.  that is my only opinion.  if this is your favourite beer, then you probably found this site when you were drunk one night by your lonesome.  the best part about this beer is the label.

Why would you pay more for this lager than a domestic?  Often this beer is quite skunky, and when its not its a lot like any other lager...  So why would you pay triple for a beer that is only quality sometimes, and when it is its only ok?  I suppose people think you look cooler with one of these, and may look like a "beer snob" too bad those people dont know jack.
My current go-to beer. Will update after a better variety of beers have been tried.
Easy drinkability and modest appearance. Although lack there of flovour and aroma hurts. A half-decent macro.
Unsurpassed is a marketing term.  There is better beer available, but I like Heineken when I have to choose between crappy pale lager. Good with a burger.
Overrated but easy to drink, Lets face it: Heineken is a Wedding reception beer that tastes like piss. RIP Dennis Hopper.

Can’t understand the appeal of this one.  Aroma of skunk.  Aftertaste of burnt tires.  LIght color, some carbonation and thin fizzy head that disappears.  Probably one of the last beers I would drink, even if it was free.

Thin, light, weak, and very forgettable.  I don’t anyone would turn down a Heineken, and I don’t think you would ever go wrong serving it to a group.  I just don’t think anyone would be impressed.  I am amazed that a beer this unremarkable is shipped around the world for all to be bored.
Not terrible for a macro brew, but still to me seems kinda like a "fake" import.
I hate this with a passion. If you wear wooden shoes drink this. I know this is considered a high end pale lager. Blah. Even fresh, this beer is skunkier than Pepe Le Pew(sp)

Classy beer. Slightly skunkish aroma. Very smooth taste, especially smooth on tap. Pale coloration is very inviting. Good pleaser if you want to avoid the Bud’s, Millers, etc. Not nearly as strong tasting as other lagers from the area. Great Beer.
What can you say about this one other than pretty green bottle and below average taste?  Light color, 1/2 decent aroma, and light malty taste.  Not too bad when thats all you can get/
Well, it’s one of the better beers to get on tap just about anywhere. When there’s a choice between bud, miller, and heineken, I’ll go with the heineken.
I’ve always liked the "green" taste of Heineken, and have always pondered if it’s just because the bottle is green. It tastes quite fresh, hoppy, but not as hoppy as pilseners from Germany and Czech.
Sort of expensive for the taste it has. More like bottled water than beer, has a sweet taste. Overall its sort of a bland beer, I can’t even describe it and I even have one here with me.
Holland’s second beer. Isn’t special at all, watery beer. Very popular in public. It’s just a brand with a good campaign and a big reputation.

Heineken
12 oz can
Medium pour from the can to my mouth, and in a shot glass for color.
Recent brewing, imbibed 11/06

Poured golden with a mostly diminishing fizzy white head.

Smelt of light corn, grass.

Taste was upfront moderate sweet corn candy and light bitter grassy hops followed by a bittersweet perfumed hops and sweet dough on an average finish.  Palate was light bodied, watery, lively carbonated, and slightly astringent.

Overall, it’s tasty, but a tad too sweet.  Drinking this as my "cheap swill" bring back good memories of my Canadian youthful days, of when I didn’t know any better.  Classic in a harmless novice  kind of appreciation.

Incedibly, I haven’t reviewed this swill yet even though I’ve reviewed the NA Heineken! So to fix this malady, I went out and bought a single bottle of this just to give it a fair review. Sure, I’ve had this a thousand times before and it’s always disappointing. This is served like water in the casino’s I frequent and your choices are pretty slim while rolling the bones or playing cards. So I thought, let’s get down to business with rating this beer. Aroma is skunk. In fact, when you look in the Webster’s dictionary there’s a picture of Pepe LePew and a bottle of Heineken next to the word "skunk". Appearance is light golden yellow, white fizzy head. Mouthfeel is practically nil, no body, and close to the consistancy of water. Flavor is rancid corn, like someone plucked it from the shitter from beneath the sewers of Netherlands and used it to make this swill. The concept that people "enjoy" this beer is an idea that is difficult for me to wrap my brain around. Because it is "imported" does not make it a good beer. Ugh..
Nothing special. Seems to always smell skunky. This used to be about the only import available so, it was thought to be better than it was. It’s not. Still better than Bud.

An overrated beer (not here at ratebeer, but by the general populace).  Not much substance, though still a few notches above the standard American macro gruel.  Way too clarified...to the point of looking almost fake.
I’d take it over a lot of other streamline beers but that may not be saying much.
Better than most other macro lagers, but usually fairly skunky, far too fizzy, very watery
They say that this is "probably the best lager in the world".  I say, no it isn’t, it’s rubbish!  Well, a bit harsh, but it’s pretty average fair and over-priced - comes in a nice bottle though!

[b]330ml bottle[/b] - I’ve never really understood why people think this beer is so great. On a hot day it would be refreshing, but it’s pretty watery and there’s very little to it outside of that and its aggresive carbonation. Pours a clear gold with very little head. Aroma is [i]slightly[/i] hoppy, a lot metallic, a bit skunky. If it’s really cold it’s certainly drinkable as a refreshing beverage, but this is far from being "great beer". It’s a macro lager and its watery with some minimal hops toward the finish. I’d choose it over Blue or Bud, but otherwise I wouldn’t choose it at all.

Botle 0,3 ltr, Tap 0,3ltr, can 0,5 ltr. beertender 4ltr. Its now time to rates this beer. Live almost 3,7 miles from the plant, grown up with this one golden standard lager and its standard head, taste and headache after drunk it by many liters after Leidens Ontzet. Buyable in more countries than the United Nations.

Canned. Pours just like an other macro lager. Discernable hop aroma with some malty sweetnes off the bat. Flav is malt and dry but sme peacy fruity flavor coes through. Standard hop is present to finish. For me, much better than teh average macro with some interesting flavors coming through. Fresh

The better of the readily available ones at any bar I guess.  Was a personal favorite of mine as a youth, and as long as it’s ice cold, it always goes down crisp and refreshing.  Excellent for a day on the patio.

Pours a translucent golden yellow with a small bubbly white head that went away.  Aroma of malty sweatness, corn, hints of floral hops.  Flavor of grassy, sweat malts, corn, some hop bitterness.  Pretty much a standard macro pale lager with a touch more hop bitterness. Had this from a keg can which is probably the only way to guarantee a skunk free Heine...or is it?

Nice ice cold, light crisp taste.
I like it once in a while but not an everyday beer for me.

I really need to drink a good pale lager so I have a standard.  I find a good plae lager is hard to come by.  Doesnt help that it is my least favorite style of beer.  Watered down, skunky.  Somewhat bitter.  Not much too look at and more expensive than equally poor beers.  Drinkable.

Watery, no real hoppy taste to it, skunky and bland.  Not to be an ass, but my asian friends REALLY love this stuff and it kinda makes me wonder about their tastebuds.  But then again, I went fishing with them one time and one of them pulled a bass right off my hook and sank his teeth in it.

I was forced to drink this cheap piss beer when I was in Amsterdam. I had already tried it before, but there my disdain for it just grew. It is completely not appetising. The hoppy taste makes me cringe. Yeah, it is watery but it still tastes more like beer than even worse American pale lagers.

I won’t lie. I like it. It’s not a complex beer, but I sitll like it. It’s simple and its watery, but something about this beer makes me like it. Very bland with a pale straw colour. Smell is plain. I would drink it again.

from can.  very pale in color.  thick, frothy head that dissipates quite quickly.  Fairly strong initial and finishing hops unlike its North American cousins.  heavy lacings that did remain.  While I would take this over most of the standard macro brews, I still would be more likely to choose Stella Artois.

I remember the days when this was considered the king.  One night I paid $3 bucks for one back in 1986 at Masquerades Night Club in Waikiki.  Bottom line, this beer is boring and inept.  The aroma smells of wet bar carpet.  The taste is of strong flat bovine piss.  Gives me a bad headache.  Sorry Heineken, your outclassed by 1000 other micro breweries.

Haven’t had it for a long time but thought I’d rate it. Nothing special but do not think it deserves its horrible rating. Do not like pale largers. This is a bit skunky and chalky/bland but better than many. Too funny that it postures as a premium-- all the money is in the ads.
Can 50 cl. Danish version a little bit lighter than other versions. Golden colour with a small head. Hoppy aroma and flavour.

Awesome stuff.  The Dutch definitely know what they’re doing.  Heineken is what I wanted Beck’s Oktoberfest to be....and more.  It’s tasty, tangy, and there’s no bitter aftertaste.

Just a great way to honor my Dutch heritage.
Bottle at home. Nice color, very light taste. Well, I don’t know what else to say. I drink it very rarely.
I’m not a big fan of pale lagers, and this is no exception.  It’s probably on the upper end of the pale lager spectrum.

There is just something about this beer that I do not like. I would drink if it was offered, but I would never buy any. Skunky aroma and near flavourless. Certainly not Hollands best offering. Not recommended.
Lacked flavor and kind of skunky.  Overall, not really that great.  It’s especially bad in my opinion, if it’s drunk after eating or anything else.  I like it best by itself.

Strong notes of roasted coffe and dark chocolate.  HAHA not really, but for a pale lager and MACRO, this is not too bad.   I get the skunkiness, and the lack of flavor, but its OK -- not great-- but OK
A pretty good beer, but has aftertaste issues.  The appearance, aroma, and palate are all okay.  It has a pretty good taste, but the bitter aftertaste makes me shy away after one or two.
Watery and no head.  Although when you’ve had nothing to drink but nattie light all year, it tastes pretty damned good
Ever since I went to the brewery in Amsterdam and had the best beer of my life i have been addicted. Nice casual flavor and fun to drink!
Clear, pale blonde color, medium fugaceous white head. Weak aroma of malt. Not something I would buy but if it is there, I will drink it.

250 ml can, brewed in Holland. Light golden coloured with an average white creamy head. Seemingly high in carbonation. Citrus and raspberry in the nose. Crisp, but also slightly sweet fruity flavours. Soft texture and mellow mouthfeel. Again raspberry in the flavour. Little bitternes and hops, if the are there then they are certainly well hidden. Well, some bitterness can be found in the aftertaste, but it is very soft. Surprisingly good, and of course well-made. Definitely a lot better than the licensed Norwegian version.
Not a bad brew.  First had it in Jamaica believe it or not.  That one was skunky so my first impression was poor.  The rest have improved my opinion.
Thin body, yellow with white head. Some aroma of corn, wheat. Flavor is slightly sweet and better. Watery lager.
Heady!  Urine colour.  Perfect, dead-on colouring, too.  White head.  Corn and wheat aroma, grassy tones.  Sweet hoppy flavour.  Just not much else there.
OK, but a big step down from Grolsch. Too thin in body to suit me. Less hop taste than even Becks.
Bottle-Clear golden body with no head and an aroma of corn, rubbing alcohol, and skunk. Taste of corn, alcohol, and nothing. Bad

golden yellow wuth carbonation. tiny short-lived bubbly head. crabby, skunky smell with a variety of commercial cleansers mixed in. oily heavy mouthfeel. flavour is persistent garbage water malt and spitoon hops.
Bottle (330ml & 500ml) and Tap. Who has not tried this beer. Not the best ever but nice, cheap and easy to find.

Bottle. Pours gold. Smells somewhat well - off. Taste is actually surprisingly sweet with very little bitterness. Extremely thin beer, but I’m sure you knew that. You can do worse as far as macros go. I know, what a compliment.

It is amazing how ones palate can grow. 10 years ago I thought this was a good beer. Know Heinken reminds me of a skunked beer. Pours clear goldish looking color. Smells skuned.
Slight bitter finish

nothing to brag about
Bottle. Tasted alot like every pale ale i’ve ever had. Watery ,with a semi-clear looking color.personally i don’t feel it was worth the price i paid for it.
Had this from the bottle.  Never cared for it.  Very thin and flavorless.  Never even liked it when I was living in Holland and could get it on tap.

Can

I haven’t had one of these in years and never from a can.
Pours a thin, pale light yellow with a big white head.
I have always had this from the green bottle and this is entirely different without the skunky. Light dirty vegetal aroma. No hops. Acceptable amount of DMS.
Lightly sweet with a ghost of hop bitterness in the finish.
Thin and watery. I think I like the skunky stuff from the bottle better. At least it HAS a flavor. ;-)
The choice "green" beer for most enthusiests. I like the unique/bitter taste. Pretty good beer.

12-oz. My boss came in and poured me a nice warm Heineken over ice--ice!--just now, and sat down to sip with me and my officemate. He gets a 5. The beer gets rather less. Skunky as can be. Been that way since my dad drank it in the 80s. Golden yellow, fizzy, skunky, corny...what a mess. Still, I gotta thank my boss for this. Nice midday treat that it is.
I can’t believe how readily available this crap is.  Yellow with foamy white head, Strong, strong odor. Can smell this skunk 10 feet away. Taste like burnt pears.
Can. Light yellow with diminshing white head. Aroma offers a little hint of corn and some metallic notes. It has next to no flavor. Ultra short watery finish.
Not the best beer for its price. Drinkable if nothing else on offer, but is the same as drinking water with a sweer corn flavour. Poor quality beer for true beer lovers.
330 mL bottle.  Pale yellow-gold, with no head.  Mild aroma.  Pretty watery; not a lot of taste.  Sweet finish.  Drinkable, but not interesting.
A pale gold body with a very thin white head.  Grain, corn and maybe some light hops, typical of a mass market beer.  Taste is sweet, grainy and some corn sugar.  Nothing good at all.

Left over from a party, from bottle.  Pours a yellow straw color with small white head.  Nose is sickly sweet malt with adjuncts of corn.  Flavor is watery, corn syrup.  Very thin.  Still, I’d choose this over many others.
Bottle. Clear golden color with thin white head. Skunky aroma typical of some of these european lagers. Flavor is similar. Very dry and grainy.

Was at a salsa club last night, took a few sips from my cousin’s bottle, after a while she gave me the rest.  Not sure if this is enough to constitute a rating, since I didn’t get to pour it, but what the heck...  Flavour was very bland.  I do appreciate the maltiness of it, but overall its very watery with little hops and the skunky aroma doesn’t help either.  I use to love this beer when I was younger but now I discovered craft beer.  This is down there with the bland macro stuff despite all the nostalgia.
this beer sucks.  the taste of it is just horrible. whoever actually likes this beer has some big issues and clearly has not tried any thing else

This had a very light fragrance.Color was light amber.It tasted smooth,but light bodied.Crisp.Small head.Not too bad for a mass produced beer.Good choice when the beers at your local pub suck.this is a pleasant beer to drink,but it is not that great compared to the great micro brews.Good bar beer.
Pale, skunky. I like Amstel Light better. Very malty with no real hops flavors.

it was this or the coors light my gracious hosts offered (taste the cold! mm baby), and i bent to peer pressure and wanted to drink. pale yellow. tasted pretty grassy and bready and weak and maybe skunky.. well you get the point. not at all worth it, but hess stations at 11:30 pm aren’t known for their impressive beer selections, and i wasn’t feeling "ironic" enough to rock the smirnoff ice 40.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow colour with a longlasting white head. Malty grassy bready aroma. Sweet malty grassy bitter flavor. Malty bitter finish.
Solid beer, but quite overpriced. Hints of a celery flavor in this lager. Tastes great ice-cold, but doesn’t have much depth to it. Good refreshing beer as long as you’re not paying for it.
Better than the standard macros, good on a hot summer day, but nothing special.  Not much head, and weak hopping (dull bittering).
Pours a clear yellow with no head. Sweet corn and wet paper smell. Flavour is sweet, watery, bland, slightly skunky.
Out of the awesome 24 oz. keg can.  Pour: dark yellow pee.  Aroma: skunky pee.  Taste: Surprisingly pee-free.  Better than most macros.
I don’t know if I got a bad bottle or what but all I could smell was skunk and rubber cement.  Taste wasn’t much better. Watery.  Maybe they should switch to brown bottles.
Over-rated because it was one of the first widely available imports and was better than Miller and Bud.  Better on tap than in bottles as bottles do often attain a skunkiness.
The finest brew around, Light & Lovely! Mmmmmm Yummy! All who say otherwise are cleary mistaken! T-Bone T-Bone!
22 oz . . pours golden . . little head . . aroma us skunky . . tastes watery, skunky and sweet . . kind of a bitter finish . . not too bad, but not worth the price . . hands down
skunky blond beer. Non lastins small white head. light flavor and aroma. not impressive for one of the best selling beer in the world
Bottle. Pours golden with average white head. Sweet fresh and crisp. Hops, malt faint and simple.
Beer of choice for yuppie wankers at trendy bars, in the bottle of course.  Not much difference really between this and a local pale lager, except this is minus the POR and added skunk.

Can at home. What to say, this is the most well-known Dutch beer. But every time I drink it I am dissapointed. It is weak, bland, generic and with little taste. A bit skunky. Drinkable, sure but amazing how this and Stella Artois are premier beers outside the Benelux. Chalk it up to marketing.
Smells skunky, tastes skunky, mild bittterness, and total garbage. I wonder if it’s any better in Holland....Eh, probably not.
Skunky. Nothing special about it. It did seem to taste better in Amsterdam, but that might have been to do with freshness and atmosphere.
This stuff is expensive in Australia but the Dutch drink it like water, not bad but not worth the price tag outside Holland.
Better than the cheap beers, but not as much as the price suggests.  It’s not a beer that I would pay the price for.

Very small and quickly diminishing head. Clear goldenish yellow, very sparkling, tiny lacing. Skunky-metallic aroma, sweet with cereal traces. Light body, overall sweet taste with a slightly metallic aftertaste.

A mini tasting of Orangeboom Premium Lager (NZ Breweries, Auckland) 5%, Stella Artois (NZ Breweries, Auckland) and Heineken (DB Breweries, Auckland).  I tried all three of these licensed brews on a sunny afternoon.  They are all similar and all pretty average.  The Oranjeboom was the worst - and with sugar listed in the ingredients it should be - it had not much taste, fizz or head and poured the same golden lager colour as the other two.  I had this beer in Holland and it was better than the Auckland version.  Heineken was the next - slightly more head but not much carbonation.  It had an astringent aftertaste that I associate with processed hops and industrial brewing.  The Stella was the best of the three with a lasting head and a hint of hops.  It amuses me that all three allude to a long brewing history on the labels - O associates itself with 1671, Stella with 1366 (hundreds of years before lager was invented) and H claimes to have been established in 1873 and won a Gold Medal in 1875.  That surely must have been the last time it tasted of anything good.  This long history is probably supposed to divert the punter from the fact that these beers are crap.  These are office drinks beers - the boss gets to say he’s bought the help something exotic and everyone has to be thankful.  The tragedy is that for just a pittance more per bottle you can pick up an excellent Macs Sassy Red or similar brew that really is quite tasty.
500ml bottle.  Yeah, I remember when I wanted have a GOOD beer I’d buy this one.  It just had a little more character than Bud is all...

Yeah this beer is always rough. It doesn’t matter how many times I’ve tried this stuff and it always tastes skunked. Aroma is skunky with an attempt at some hops, color is yellow, and taste is kinda bitter at first and VERY carbonated. Then of course the skunk factor again at the end of your sip. Not worth it. If you want an "upgrade" beer from Budweiser and the rest of the huge macros for the same price as this choose Yuengling or Red Hook.
I enjoy it with some greasy/salty food, but too much of it can really sour the stomach. A good beer if your other choices range from bud to coors.

citrus, pale, clear, a minimal head, heavily sour to the point where it tastes like arse, light body, fizzy to the point where it attempts to cover up its rank flavor.  This is a beer for those who think they just got something European and thus good.  Someone needs to donk-punch them over to the microbrews or better lagers.
yeah, I hate this beer.. seems that whenever I frequent crappy bars and ask for something they don’t have in store (ie real beer), the barkeep always offers me this instead. Skunk in a bottle.
very skunky beer, light color, holds a nice head but that doesnt really make up for the smell or the odd taste... smells rather like vomit and tastes little better
A good beer that can be found pretty much anywhere. The 25oz keg cans are pretty neat, keeps alot of beer cold without fridge trips! I’d like to try this one on draft. Refreshing on a hot day.
One word: SKUNKY. Quite fizzy, too.  Still better than quite a few of the other macro lagers out ther, but low by Dutch standards.
This is the beer I go to when I am out somewhere and they don’t have a great selection. Easy drinking, better than domestic alternatives.
I like the taste of hops. Nice head for a pilsner. Not much to say. Everyone know and have tasted a Heineken.!

A cold heineken is a great beer. Excellent character, while still maintaining enough drinkability to be conducive to a long night of drinking. Downside: gets skunked easily and then it is beyond saving; also tends to produce hangovers.

Can rated at 32,000 feet en route to San Antonio - and ya know, it wasn’t half bad.  Clear light gold, thin fizzy white head.  No skunkiness from a green bottle at least.  Was lightly floral and grassy in the nose.  Crisp and clean soft sazz hop bitterness up front that continues to the end of my lovely Southwest Airlines plastic cup.  The secret truly is to take it in the can.....oh wait.........now that just ain’t right at all....

Another ber I was enticed into drinking last weekend,okay,I did not drink this
rather just had a drink which was emough to make me remember why I do not drink this.Pure skunk piss.
Good beer.  Not outstanding.  For the price, you’re better off with Stella or Becks, two other skunky green bottled beers.
(Tap) Pours golden with average white head. Sweet for the type and very unbalanced. Not that a beer I enjoy drinking.
Aroma suggests quality hops. On tap, it tasted fresh and crisp. Hops were good, malt faint and simple. I found a pleasant finish with no offensive aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma is malty and dare I say it, "skunky". Flavor is malty and watery. Nothing complex here and I think this beer is over priced.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Fruity malt aroma. Flavour is fruity malt.
urine yellow, skunky aroma, skunky taste.  Beer tastes slightly fruity and ummm skunky.  Friend offered it just to rate it, and I won’t ever have another.

On Tap. I’ll have a Heiny, never again. Clear yellow color with white head. Mild aroma is all sweetness of some kind or another, malts and maybe corn. Sweet malty corn taste with some added hop bitterness (that’s why the flavor rates a 3 rather than a 2). Like so many macros served absolutely ice cold for obvious reasons. You don’t want to really taste it. There is no balance here and just too sweet.
What a terrible beer. Tastes of corn and basic brewers ingredients. Not a beer that lives up to the advertisement. Pours piss yellow with a large fizzy head.
Yellow with white foam. Little malts & hop aroma. Thin body. Finish has slight bitterness. Average lager!
Has a skunky marijuana aroma.  Sharb bitter taste, and thin for a lager.  Definatley not one i liked at first, but it grows on you, and is very refreshing on a hot day.
this is horrible. cant stand the taste. i forced myself to finish this one.

Poured from a bottle. Golden yellow colorwith thin head. Earthy/grassy aroma, skunkish but not skunked. Mild malty flavor with a touch of hops in the background. Creamy texture. When I was younger, this was the beer to have. Now I realize we paid a premium price for a lager that was just above average. I’ll still order it if the selection is all swill beers.

I first tried a bottle of Heineken in 1987.  It was backstage at an Alice Cooper show at the good ol’ Boston Garden.  This is the "gateway" beer most people discover shortly before they realize there are much better beers, not just lagers, on the market.  Often times this beer gets "skunked" as do many green bottled beers due to the light factor.
Yellow colour, with a white foam. A bit maltty in the aroma, no bitternes I think I colould recoudnice. Sweet mais mouth feeling? Short bitter finish. Light body.

Thin but decent lacing.  Very lagerish in appearance (ie dead clear urine yellow) but then again it’s a lager so not a total surprise. Ho hum nose with macro hops and characterless malts, almost a touch stale.  Lacks any interest right throughout the palate save for a surprisingly sharp(ish) bitter finish.

My favorite. A definite acquired taste. I didn’t like it the first time I tried it thinking that it was bitter. That’s back before I knew what a good beer was though. Has a VERY distinct aroma to it. Almost like....liquid marijuana! I’ve always said that this was a very "skunky" beer. But good skunky. If you can’t smoke it, drink it.
even if I get one for free its hard too drink, the tast is very bad not malty at all just this weired bitter with a horrible aftertaste... take something else!!!!!!!!
Ohh my god, how is it made and does it take any time at all too make.? lightly bitter, grass, give me a glas of milk.

From can. I’ve had this 100.000 times before!  Well, uhm,  skunky, sweetish, bit fruity, some hops, dry finish. Not as bad as many people suggest, but i life next to the brewery. (I’ve even worked there and tasted it unpasteurised, that’s a real treat people!)
Light yellow color, not much head. Skunky, light hops. Ugh. Why people pay as much as they do for this stuff is beyond me.
cereal, herbs, leaves, cooked vegetables, golden, sparkling, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, paper napkin, medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, medium
This beer relies only on advertising and image.  It’s pissy, skunky, and overpriced.  Some people actually think its good though.

33 cl can from Swedish Systembolaget. Very light yellow color, white bubbly head. Dominant malty scent. Malty taste as well. Medium mouthfeel and low bitterness. Nothing wrong with it but also pretty boring.

If it wasnt for the name, this beer wouldnt even be on the American market. At $26 a case, I cannot rate this beer well. If this beer was in the 15-20$ range, then I might buy it on a regular basis. Way too expensive, way too overrated, way too marketed.
Not real impressed with this one, adn very expensive for the poor quality.Very bitter and harsh
bitter and acidic. hardly an aroma. I too, used to think this was a good beer. I’d still drink it over any miller beer.
Typical piss yellow color with no head. Tastes like every other light euro lager, but with that special skunkiness-the Heineken trademark. Dont bother.

Clear yellow body, short-lived little white head.  Lightly malted, lightly hopped, lightly everything.  Light on taste.  Very cold it can be refreshing because it’s totally harmless but as it warms up it starts to taste something and the something is not very good.  When the most popular beer in the Netherlands is the Heineken it’s no wonder that they came-up with the Amsterdam concept so people could at least smoke themselves silly.

If I could drink a skunk, this is pretty much what I would imagine it tasting like.  

What’s the deal with people buying this stuff with the mindset that it’s some kind of premium beer?  I would rather drink Coors or Miller over this swill.
Another beer for the masses. Skunky aroma. Low quality hop flavor with a metallic like malt hint. Mass produced brew....

bottle 24 oz. Aroma and flavor of fresh cut hay, a bit stale light roast malt & the slightly skunky euro in the bottle hops. Rather sweet, but with a decent hop bitterness esp on the finish. Better than BMC. Light bodied. Ok to drink when you will die of thirst and can’t get anything better.

500 mL can:  There it is, the tall green can with the red star, everywhere you go, but why? The initial aroma says it all:  bitter, harsh, and almost acidic.  You want a lager cold, but this is smoother when it warms up.  Gimme a Lowenbrau, Tiger of Castle in a can anyday over this.  I think the masses are buying tradition when they reach for this, but there’s likely way tastier side brew’s with this Amsterdam brew’s lore than this mass import lager.

Slightly skunky and bitter tasting beer. Overall, not a very great tasting beer. Needs to be served very cold and I like it better in the can. Price could be a little better for such a mass produced import. Not too bad on a hot day. You can buy it anywhere.

Decent beer, another one of my fallback beers if nothing better is around. Nothing fancy, just decent.
Draught, bottle, can, ect...

Draught, can, and bottle (at various times).  Pours fizzy yellow with a light head.  Has a deserved reputation for often being "off" in one way or another, whether due to being lightstruck or subjected to temperature variations.  The bottles seem to be the worst there.  When *not* ruined, it has a weak nondememo  aroma, and a similarly weak but refreshing taste, finishing slightly bitter.  Not exciting, but not bad, although again that assumes you don’t get a skunked one.

Has a strange sort of salty/ skunky taste, which is different. Soapy light head. I have no problem picking up a pony keg of this beer because it goes great with tequilla. But the tasty is way to light and corn like.

Bottle and Tap. Im really trying to be positive here. Help me here people. Is it suppose to be skunky and acidic smelling that turns your stomach? Is it suppose to have a non refreshing and bitter finish with a soon to come headache? People seem to enjoy it. Only in desparation will I drink it. Otherwise, id rather drink from a garden hose. 

Tell me where i can get a good representatuion after numerous attempts at kegs, bottles and cans....

Pours light amber, with quickly diminishing white head. Slight sweet skunky aroma.  An initial sugary yeast flavour gives way to a very slight bitter aftertaste.  Overall an average mass marketed beer.
I WILL ALWAYS LOVE THE KEG CAN AND THE SUMMER TIME AND THE BEACH  CHEERS TO THE ONE BEER THAT GOES DOWN GOOD.IN KEG CAN ONLY NO SKUNK TASTE  OR SMELL
Not very good I found it to be extremely skunky. Would take it over bud/ Canadian but thats not saying much.
One of my favorite mainstays.  You can always find it, and it always tastes the same.  A little bitter, but in a good way.

If anyone has a palate, Heineken is easily distinguishable from a Bud/Coors/Miller product.  Brings the import flavor with a smooth finish.  For those who think this is a horrible beer: you have a skunked bottle/keg/can or you are addicted to USA Macros.  The keg pours weaker than the bottle/can, the latter retaining its unique and often posed taste.  An original import.

i gave it a 3 for appearance because i had it out of a keg-can.  i can’t think of any reason to give any other category any points.  will rerate perhaps in the future.  i did not like this and found myself wishing i had taken a budweiser instead.
I know that this beer used to have some kind of pedigree, but I don’t get it. The only difference between this and bud is that this tastes skunkier. Might be the most over rated beer ever.
very skunky aroma. can’t get past the smell to taste anything else. i tend to stay away from this beer

Heineken Lager Beer. Alc 4.6% vol. 330 ml green long-neck bottle. By agreement with Heineken this beer is brewed and bottled in Denmark by Royal Unibrew. Pours a light amber.  White head, that quickly fades away. Clear. Aromas of fresh white bread and crust, with some citrus, and a little alcohol. Fresh and watery mouthfeel. Very uncomplicated and light tasting beer. I like it.

Typical overrated and trendy beer. Poured a deep golden color from the bottle. Taste is light, with a noticable skunky aftertaste, courtesy of the green bottle. Not sure why this is so popular, but I guess it could be a lot worse.
Typical mass produced beer.  Not great but consistant bottle to bottle.  A beer to drink if you only have to choose between this and say domestic swill.

One of the best draft experiences I ever had was "Heineken." After one pitcher, they "ran out," and I’ve yet to repeat that success. Otherwise, a pretty bland beer with a few skunky experiences. I won’t refuse a Heinie, but I won’t seek one out. Too light/flavorless for me.
Draft. pours yellow with a decent white head. aroma of skunk, and grain. Flavor is also skunk and grain with hops and carbonation. drinkable yes, however crap brew.
12oz bottle-pours a white head with pale yellow color.  Aroma is faint grain.  Taste is funky, musty, grain, some hops.  Good carbonation.
bottle. white yellow color. big white head. this is probably the worst beer ive ever tastet. thin weak with no taste. its almost like drinking sparkling water.

If hell had a beer, Heineken would be on the menu.  I will never understand the appeal of this skunky, disgusting brew.  Beer in a green bottle, why, why, why???  When you drink one of these your obnoxious trend-setting breathren will think you’re cool, but the "eau-de- Pepe Lepieux" should convince you otherwise.

Tasted one recently to confirm that it hadn’t changed in the last 10 years. It hasn’t and still is a non-event. Like a tupperware party. A bit contrived and as a result the ladies commands all the attention.
gave a lower rating than bud light.  what? at least you can drink Bud...this stuff is way too bitter and sweet.  I mean, this is BITTER.  and way too damn expensive for the quality...
Zbyt drogie przy takim smaku !!! Nie przepadam za nim ale nie jest oczywiście aż takie do d....

On tap @ the Red Light Bar in Amsterdam NL.  I’m no stranger to this beer.  We all know what it tastes like.  Tastes better from the source than it does after making the trip to the US.  Plus, add to that the fact that if you’re sitting at the Red Light Bar in the Red Light District in Amsterdam, you’re probably thoroughly cooked, making this taste exactly like fresh pumpkin pie nectar.

355ml Bottle: I don’t get this at all, this thing competes with Corona for the title of macro-import in these parts, but for what reason?  Pours boring, smells boring, tastes boring.  It’s not bad nor offensive, but if you’re going to pay this much why not grab an import or micro with character?  Granted, if your watering hole offers Molson, Labatt, or Heineken I’ll grab one of these.
Beer that got me into the ale, lager, style beers I love to sit back with a couple of heiny’s!! Damn exspensive though
Sweet and sour dominates the taste.  Aroma is a bit rotten, the taste is drinkable.

Bottle.
A typical pale lager that costs 3 times as much as other pale lagers. But still decent. Sweet bitter aroma, decent flavor.

Bottle. Light (very) golden in colour with almost (and quick disappearing) head. Oh dear. Taste where are you? The eternal question: is it better to drink a beer that tastes bad - but at least has a flavour. Or is it better to drink one who tastes of nothing? Not for me to judge. This one however has no taste.

Bottled.
Pale golden, large white head.
Sweetish and bland. Sourish with vegetable-notes.
Possibly the most boring beer in the world. Whenever I get it in my mouth I get the same feeling I do when I have a throat ache coming on.
the appearance is green like, smells like a skunk, never goes down pleasantly....i’ll have to try the light version
This was big living in college.  Now it’s an occasional something different.  Looks, smells and tastes like beer as opposed to mass produced beer-like beverage.  It’s a good change of pace.
Vegetal aroma- a little skunky. Mild sweet lager with metallic flavor overriding everthing. Thin body. Marginally more interesting than Bud...not exactly high praise.

The first  time I had one, I hated it because while it tasted ok, it smelled like a skunk (this was from a bottle).  I’ve since had the mini-keg cans and while they taste about the same, they don’t have the bad skunk smell, so it was MUCH more pleasant an experience and about on par with Becks in that regard.  That’s not to say it doesn’t still have some skunk overtones, but I wouldn’t have thought "skunk" like I did with the bottled version.
This was my first imported beer a very long time ago. It is a light beer refreshing in it own way.  Rely nothing special about it.
light gold color with a light foam and average body. good barley aftertaste.

I was in the grocery store today and for some reason I thought "I’ve never had a Heineken that wasn’t skunked...why not" so I picked up a keg can.  Pours extra pale yellow, nice fluffy white head with big bubbles.  Smells like beer.  Just the kiss of the hops.  Pretty smooth flavor, watery, thin.  Leaves you with a bit of aftertaste.  Definately go with cans, they don’t put the skunk in them :)

12 oz bottle at Redmoon Central in Chicago.  I grew up thinking this was the be all and end all of beers.  Shows how much I knew.  Pale golden with a small white head - typical lager look.  Average lager smell and taste.  Decently drinkable and better than the American mass market swill, but nothing special.

Bottled. 4.3%. Pale golden with a small diminishing head. Grassy aroma with some hops. Weak, malty flavor with some hops. Not as many off-flavors as many other macros, but the finish has some unpleasant bitterness. Thin, watery body. (060417)
golden, clear, aminimal head, medium sweetness, light body, average carbonation,

At a friends house, it was between this and Coor’s Light. So Heiny it was. It reminded me of my youthful days when I thought this was good beer. Pours golden, with a malty and strong skunk aroma. Typical pale lager flavor, but a little heavier on the malt than BMC. Very faint bitterness in the finish, complimented by more skunk. Yuppie BMC drinkers rejoice!
The old standby....a bit above average if not much is available but when you get a skunk...it is a SKUNK!
Odd aroma of caramel from such a light colored beer.  The flavor is about what I remembered from high school.  A bit sour and heavy.   Not quite sure why this beer is so popular.

The bottle poured a sparkling, clear, pale yellow beverage with a small white head that was mostly diminishing and left some lacing on the glass. The Aroma was typical of a premium lager in that there was almost no malt presence and the hops presented floral and spicy notes. The body was medium light with lively carbonation and a watery mouth feel. The flavor starts off somewhat sweet with a subtle fruitiness in the background. The finish is medium in length during which the presence of corn can be detected as the fruitiness persists.
I agree with Dreadu.  Overrrated without a doubt!  It really just tastes like a flat Sierra Mist.
Overrated beer... Too much commercials,  tastes bad, lookin bad. Beer for women only.
Very clear blond coloured, with almost no head. Very light hoppy aroma, little metallic like. Rather wattery taste, light bitter. Short finish, some bitterness. Overall not really convincing.
The apitomy of belgian beer.  Has fruitiness, but overall is very harsh and bitter.  Can be hard to drink at times.  good if this is all you have, but if you can upgrade to another belgian, do it.
It’s a sweet flavor with a white head. surely tastes a lot worse here in the states than what i remember while in amsterdam
I’ve never had a Heineken that I wasn’t convinced was skunked.  Could I be any clearer?
Pours crisp, clear yellow. Sweet aroma, sweet flavour. Thirst-quenching but very fizzy. One of the better swill lagers.

this beer pours a golden yellow with a large white head that leaves a little lacing down the sides.  It has a very skunky smell like other german beers and has a very malty and bland taste.  Although this is better than the BMC beers, it’s only slighlty better.  Cheers!

Danish for Budweiser, no wait, Danish for Bud Lite.  What swill.  No hops, no malt, and none of that classic pilsener taste that at least should be there but no.  They claim 100% Barley Malt and choice hops, but they just forgot to put them in the damn beer.

Clear yellow pour, with an initially large and fizzy head, which recedes to nothingness.  Typical lager aroma, seems watered down though.  Not really as much corn taste as I expected... a little malty toastiness.  Very crisp finish.  I may be a beer snob, but it’s actually pretty good compared to American macros.. ain’t saying much though.  It carries a premium price, however, and for an equal price or a few bucks more you can get something with a lot more character.
Out of a bottle.  A highly overrated beer.  Just a crap, overpriced lager, in general.
Canned. Had a watery and slightly metallic taste to it. Faint hoppy taste. I thought that Heineken lacked carbonation. There are better beers out there. Heineken has never inspired my taste buds.
Pale gold with a thick golde- hued head. Malty aroma and flavor with a bit of hop bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle. Hard to distinguish from American macro-brews. Aroma was skunky, although only slightly. Taste is watery although with a cleaner aftertaste than most American macro-brews, which is the only real difference I could notice. Not worth the import price.

Not as terrible as the other macros I’ve been trying to give a shot the past few ratings.  Skunk to the nose, golden in the glass.  No head really of which to speak, and the flavor is of indistinguishable malt, with a hint of hay, straw and sweetness.  This is backed with a light bitter back, rather dry on the finish.  Feels medium and drinkable to the palate.  Too bad it gets a little muddy and unclarified during the pull, but there are certainly worse offerings out there.

I have had worse beer.  If a beer is exported all over the world, it must be good to some, right?  Very plain malt blah.  The aftertaste of this beer was used by U.S. television advertisers to convince people that imported beer was "skunky".  What a shame.

Revisiting this beer after laying it down from over exposure ...the original Dutch import that represents the quintessential sulpherous "skunk" aroma that distinguishes the top import bottled pilsners. This beer has changed in quality and flavor profile since the canned version was made available ..the light-struck skunk is gone in the cans!... same crisp-tart-dry flavor profile that only gives up a hint of grain husk notes mid gulp then finishes clean dry and crisp...WYSIWYG!!....what you smell is what you get. "
Draft in Norway. Pale apperance, small head. Smooth and easy-drinking, will hardly offend anyone. A bland mass-produced beer - and it does not claim to be otherwise , either.
Very light yellow with a white head that diminishes quickly.  Very heavy carbonation with a slight metalic taste.

I used to drink this beer alot til I discovered there are a lot better brews out there.  It does beat a Budweiser though.  Light color, with a vanishing head.  Light "skunky" aroma.  Prevalent carbonation, can be refreshing, but it leaves a stange taste that lasts (kind of metallic?)  Overall, I drink it if there are no other interesting brews available.
Fermented skunk piss in both taste and smell,the nastiest most nauseating excuse for a brew I have ever tasted.

A slight improvement over American mass marketed beers.  Pours very light with a medium head.  Aroma is more often than not skunky due to the green bottle.  Flavor is very light with minimal hop or malt presence.

[12 oz bottle] Poured a pale gold, crystal clear with a decent white head that vanished like a phantom.  Grainy malt nose with a hint of grass but the skunk aroma kills it.  Reasonably sweet with a bit of sour hops showing through but again, the skunkiness destroys anything it had going for it.  Light and thin, fizzy, and a short sour/skunk finish.  

It’s a so so beer, not a bad thirst quencher for those dog days of summer but not worth what you’re paying for it (which hurts it’s overall score).  Apparently people buy their beer based on the marketing.

(24 oz bottle: $2.79 at BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Sweet, grainy, lightly skunky nose doesn’t smell bad, but also doesn’t have anything resembling a quality aroma either.  The flavor is sweet and lightly bitter, but really there just isn’t much flavor and it has the obvious Euro-macro character to it.  Light bodied but not watery.  Carbonation is fairly light as well, so the palate isn’t even all that refreshing; if you make a pale lager, at least give me something that is really refreshing on the palate.  Pale straw in color with precision clarity and a tall but short-lived, snow white head.  I hadn’t had this in a few years, but wow, it’s even worse than I remember.

(Draft at brewery.  12oz bottles.  12oz cans)  Don’t kid yourself -- the stuff that comes in a green bottle (or even can) is a pale comparison to the brew served cold from the brewery taps.  Sure you have to put up with a really hokey tour, but a Heineken in Amsterdam is like a Heineken no where else.  Which is to say it is tolerably good on a really hot day if you don’t have more interesting choices available to you ... and in cans it is usually the best you’re gonna get on an airplane ride, so what they heck, eh?  Fresh, you get a noseful of hops.  A rich maltiness and nicely balanced bitterness.  Not the best lager/pils in the world, but not the worst either.  Ultimately, it suffers from being just a little watery -- why?  All right ... we all no the answer to THAT question ...

Never liked this that much-better than most us macros but still not good enough to justify the price. Skunky, corny, wheaty aroma and taste. really just not worth it overall-agree with the marketing dept comment- definitely true--people use this as a macro-import standard-really just goes to show how much influence advertising can have. 
*re-rate-just about the same...

ive never liked this beer.  its watery bitter and a little skunk.  it doesnt have anything that grabs me or justifies its cost.  i guess im going to give it a bad rating just to spite all those heineken lovers who i feel just buy into the hype
An old favorite. Clear, golden beer. White head dissapates quickly. Medium bodyand mouthfeel. Wheaty taste.
Its better than the usual BMC but not fantastic. They have a great marketing department though....standard light lager.
This beer is not good. Even compared to American lagers. It’s more expensive and dumbly bottled in green bottles, which go bad quicker, and just another lager one could do without.

Bottle. Poured to a golden yellow, with a white head that was "gone in ’less than’ 60 seconds." I thought I would have trouble with skunkiness, due to the bottle, but I was surprised to have a crisp, clean smelling beer. The aroma was disappointing, but I could smell hopps and this I expected, but the flavor was more malty, to my surprise, and the aftertaste was decent. I like it vs. Budweiser, but nothing I would go out of my way often to hit again. The bottle itself was the most interesting part.
Decent beer, but not as great as it’s made out to be.  Nice appearance, the initial taste is a tad bit metallic, but not to the point where it’s terribly irritating.
Excellent Beer! - Beautiful new packaging. Round taste, nice  yellow/gold color with a white crown. Always a good choice.
not to good metallic taste!!!sour and bitter wouldnt consider drinking it again.
Well, what can I say about this one. Why is this so popular? All I got out of it was a really bad metallic taste and skunk. No good at all.
This is a typical giant corporation product. No enthusiasm, no love, just marketing and probably ti works.
Heineken isnt bad, but it is definately way over rated. As far as I’m concerned its a decent beer.
Skunky bottle. Somewhat skunky from a can. Bland bland bland skunky bland. Somewhat watery. Small head, strange finish.

Had this stuff many times before and it was so much worse than I remember it.  Yeasty aroma with a soapy white head.  Clear yellow color.  Weak taste.  Some yeast and hops on the aftertaste.  Not great. Tastes a lot like an American macrobrew.
Can.  Golden colored pour.  Skunky aroma with toasted hops flavor.  Brown bottle tastes much different.

710 ml Bottle. 5% a/v
Pours a yellowy gold color with a white head. Smells sort of spicey, but also very unassuming. Tastes of alot more malt then i would have expected and a little toasty, id prefer more hops myself. 
Not bad, but no reason to pay for it as a "Premium" beer at the bar. its all about the label and not about the beer.

biere trop connue pours ses publicités trompeuses qui n’affichent en rien la qualité de cette derniere. jen ai bu trois fois dans ma vie et je regrette les deux dernières puisque la premiere netait qu’un essai. le gout est sec, la couleur etrange, la bouteille est bien belle mais pour le reste, je vous conseille de vous boucher le nez regarder les femmes autour de vous lorsque vous la buvez.
Sans contredit une bière de terrasse!  Son charisme en bouche dévelloppe la convivialité.  Pour ce qui est de l’aspect visuelle de celle si, et bien : Heineken!

I always find it funny when people at a bar/restaurant insist on paying more for this import. Just becuase it’s from another country doesn’t mean it’s better,and this stuff is pretty terrible.  Almost everytime I’ve had one of these it has been skunked: smelled skunky, tasted skunky and sour...makes me nauseous just thinking about it.
This was available at a party, so I had a couple.  I don’t know why Drew on Fark is so fond of this beer, but it was okay at best.  I won’t spend a nickel on this stuff.

I never thought much of this beer until I had one right after drinking a Miller Lite.  Suddenly it was bursting with rich flavor, interesting malt-hops balance, bright and layered.  Am I talking about Heineken?  Everything’s relative, I suppose.
Greenish yellow color, aroma is very dank and skunky.  Tastes like mid-grade herb with a bitter aftertaste.

From a tap, I don’t think it was stored the best (I’ve had better from this brand before)  It smelled kinda skunky and sour, and not at all like beer.  The taste was normal, typical lager with a little more bite than the american ones, and a tiny bit of toastiness.  Light in body, and a tiny bit of the wet sock comes in the finish, but I usually don’t get that either.

Bottle. Plain average overrated lager :)
Very malty - lots of grain. A bit boring
The best beer ever created!!! Perfect in every way! Very hoppy. Goes down like a baby bottle. lol
Canned. Pale golden colour with minor white head. It has a sweeta n malty aroma. It has a sweeta, malty and almost neutral flavour. There are hoints of a minor bitter aftertaste.
Clear yellow, quickly lost head. Lightly sweet, clean, gassy malt aroma. Thin in body with some bitterness. Some malt flavor. Is best on draught but nothing great.
YUCK... Smells skunky and tastes similar.  Appearence is very light yellow.  Very Thin.  This is pretty much an American Beer

Terrible.  When this clear yellow piss water is your best choice in a bar, you know the selection is crap.  It smelled skunked, because they all do and are.  It’s a pale lager  too... great , It blows.

J’ai toujour dit à mes clients que même si c’est importé, ça ne veut pas dire que c’est meilleur, surtout une bière dans une petite bouteille verte. Avec son apparence très claire, son goût légé et un odeur de céréal fade, ce n’est pas une importation impressionnante. Si vous le trouvez, c’est parce que vous n’avez pas esseillé d’autres.
Very pale yellow body, medium white head.  Smells slightly of hops.  Great before, mid and after all around.  It easily beats any of the MAJOR American pale lagers out there, hands down and mugs up.
"this is a lot of peoples beer??? don’t get me wrong its way better then the bud and coors, but not great. Have run into some skunky bottles, must be the light green bottles. "
very appealing because of the media, and the keg-can, but presents a skunky smell.  the flavor goes downhill as the temperature of the beer rises, even slightly.

Pale yellow body with a sickly thin white head.  Skunky grain odors afront the nostrils and a bitter flavor assaults the tongue.  Some flavors of lemon peak through and bitterness has a somewhat refreshing quality to it.  Very little aftertaste aside from a touch of bitter hops.
I personally like beers with strong flavors, especially bitter flavors. Heineken simply overdoes its bitterness.

Green bottle, ack.  Mine wasn’t skunked, pleasantly.  Smells hoppier than it tastes.  Decidedly lacking malt, but maybe you go for that.  Refreshing enough when it’s cold, but I dislike the afterfeel it leaves in my mouth, and something about the bitterness feels off.  Oh, and the bottle looks nice, but keep it out of the light.  If you’re going to drink it, I’d suggest you buy it in smaller quantities so it doesn’t have time to get skunked in your fridge.

Hmm . . . a little skunky and grain in the nose. Starts a little sour on the flavor but ends with some suprisingly apparent hopping. Skunk in nose INCREASED TO me as the beer warmed I wouldn’t drink this regularly but would take a bottle at a friends to be polite and liberate a space in their fridge for a better beer. The only place to get a good batch of this stuff is in the UK... their brewery didn’t even have it good on tap. US and Netherlands versions are awful. But the UK’s is slightly above average. (better than Carling/Carlsberg/etc. crap)

Hmm . . . a little skunky and grain in the nose.  Starts a little sour on the flavor but ends with some suprisingly apparent hopping.  Skunk in nose decreased as the beer warmed(?)  I wouldn’t drink this regularly but would take a bottle at a friends to be polite and liberate a space in their fridge for a better beer.
This one pours out a golden yellow.The aroma is skunky and so is the taste.Everyone drinks this because they are brainwashed to consume it.Must drink Heineken,must drink Heineken,must drink Heineken.
Bottle.  I can’t stand this beer, it is so bitter and undrinkable, I can’t describe the taste besides bitter and this is one of my headache beers.
Pours a nice golden yellow color.  Aromas is kind of skunky with hops, with a grainy cheerios like aromas.  Flavor is crisp and a nice touch of hops.  This is one of my favorite mass produced lagers.
Good if it’s cold and you’re thirsty in the hot summer months.  Otherwise, nothing spectactular as it pours without head and has virtually no palate. Go for Urquell instead (if you want yellow).

Pours an unattractive pale yellow, white foamy head.  Overly fizz and skunky taste.  Has a taste and aroma similar to a Bud left out in the sun for a few days.  The beer has a skunky, rancid odor to it.

aroma: banana, clove & lager stink.  Pale yellow with white foamy head.  Fairly smooth palate.  No bad tastes, a slight malt with bittery finish.  Starts to have a uriney aftertaste as it warms up.  Drink it real cold, I drainpoured the warm stuff.

I had this beer aboard the Constellation.  It was one of maybe ten beers onboard, and one of about three which I had yet to taste.  I was also on tap, which may have boosted my rating slightly.  This is your standard pale lager:  not much to look at, kind of sour aroma, very carbonated, some really one-dimensional malts.  Moving on...
Fizzy, skunky, somewhat watery, but not bottom rung.  Plus, if you want, you can get it in a minikeg - kind of entertaining.
Not up to par with other german beers; but it gets the job done. This beer is simply on my top ten due to the fact that its easy to obtain.

The beer seems a little skunky to me, I prefer Beck’s over this. Over all, not bad, but not something that I will drink regularly. Rather bland, with a typical color and smaller head. Lots of carbonation and a watery palate. Easy to drink though, it wouldn’t be a problem to take down a six of these in a night.

bottle - To me Heineken tastes a lot like Beck’s... a fairly weak lager, a bit sweet, some hops character.  I like it a little bit more, though honestly I’m not sure why.  It’s not complex or impressive, but it’s good when you’re in macro beer land and downing a few beers.
I’ve always found this beer a bit skunky...but some days are better than other, and thankfully yesterday was one of those days.

Long-neck Stubbie. Not the most brilliant beer on the planet, but fortunately, as I live within 100km of where they brew Heineken here in New Zealand, it is at least fresh. This beer doen’t travel very well at all ( I remember when it was an import-only line). The NZ outfit (Dominion Breweries) that brews it here has it right- one of the best Heineken brews in the world (according to heineken). My tipple-of-choice for the summer months :)

This was the first mass-market beer I’d ever drank (in a performer’s green room never the less at Madison Square Garden) and was not impressed. I can cook with it, but as a drinkign beer, it’s too dry and bitter, especially one the sides of the tongue.
Golden yellow color with an aroma that is all skunk. A mild skunk flavor that fades towards the finish and is replaced with higher than usual carbonation.

One of the first beers I had. It’s not so much that’s it’s the only import you can get at gas stations, but it’s just a plain beer. Nothing strikes or moves you in any way; it’s simple if you’re not looking for domestic and that’s it.
12 oz bottle  Pours a clear golden yellow.  Has a fizzy white head which leaves rather quickly.  Smells rather skunky.  Very slight bitter taste.  A very uninteresting beer.

You know, I just never cared much for this beer, even when pale lagers were all I drank.  I have heard it’s better closer to the source.  Until then, my score stands.  Probably OK on a hot summer day when there’s no water

Chilean licensed version to CCU: 
Pours a clear and pale golden liquid with a white foamy head. Aroma is typical of lagers. Flavor is fairly simple being bitter in a moderate way. Thin bodied but very refreshing. Pretty good for a cheap beer. There is not much more to say but drink it very cold.

Old rating: [1.5].  Long-awaited re-rate, now from the keg can.  Big yellow body with a hint of golden tint.  Aroma just waves upon waves of corn with faint grain, and surprisingly, I’m not feeling so anti.  Tinny malt flavor with just a hint of industry and a lurking headache.  Medium-fullish body for the style. [1.5]
bottle, pours pale yellow with small fizzling head, aroma of skunk and grain. taste is slightly bitter, with corn or someother filler grain and i think i tasted hops. watery.

As soon as the lid is popped off of this beer the smell of skunk drifts upwards.  The amber solution is topped with a thick white head.  The taste similar to rotten Brazilian nuts—bitter and sour.  Fortunately, the taste fades rather rapidly.

OK, I know what everybody is thinking: Why the high rating?  Let me just say that the bottle version of this beer DOES NOT DOES NOT DOES NOT do this beer justice!!!  I’ve had it in the bottle countless times, and never bothered writing a review.  It’s got to be the green bottles.  Although they’re pretty to look at, they skunk the beer because they allow sunlight in.  Also, venders display it incorrectly.  It cannot sit out in the isles where light can creep in.  I finally had it on tap at Fox & Hound in Southaven, MS.  Wonderful.  Delicious.  Tasty.  Who would have thought?  It’s a lager, so most of you know what to expect from the aroma (Sweet but balanced), head (Decent for a golden beer), color (Duh) and taste (Very fresh and yummy).  Do yourself a favor and try this on TAP the next chance you get!  And this is coming from a beer snob!
750 ml bottle. Aroma is skunky hops with grass. Pale yellow colour with small white head that quickly disappears. Nothing very much in the flavour.

Bright yellow color, with a foamy white head, but falls quickly, fresh hay and citrus hops nose, with a hint of sweet pale malt aroma, follows through on a light-bodied palate with a crisp floral hops flavors, and soft pale malt sweetness, leading towards a zesty bittering hops finish.
Pours a golden yellow color, nice big white head.  Not much aroma, slightly malty, tast of malts, pretty smooth.

Bottle - appearance typical of the style.  Almost no color, little carbonation, white head.  Slightly skunky aroma.  Thin.  Some malt sweetness in the aroma.  Forgettable ... without their marketing campaign.

I used to like Heineken. At one time it had a nice skunky hop character that actually gave it some flavour. But I have found that this has changed over the recent past. It is now an overly sweet, underhopped lackluster lager that is overpriced. Where did the hops go? I have a feeling that as this brew has grown in popularity in N. America, the contract brewing macros that handle the recipe have bled it dry of any euro character it had. I don’t know what happened, but I know I no longer have a soft spot for this beer.
As a rule, I tend not to care for "green bottled" beers, but this is one of the exceptions.  Has a bit of a bit and a small after taste.  Serves as another alternative to the "usuals".
For being so popular, sure does suck. Lackluster in appearance . Poured with minimal head. Very bitter taste. Aroma wasn’t good at all. Way better beers out there. Especially for being an import.
pale appearance, minimal head.  taste has a slight citrus twist but palate is to acidic for my liking.
This is probably the most famous beer in the wordt, but probably also one of the worst. I like the people from Holland, but their beers can be better, especially the Heineken.

(341 ml bottle) Having lunch in a small town restaurant with just a few beers on the menu. My brother ordered this beer and he let me tasted it. Bringing the glass to my nose was enough. I asked my brother what he liked about this beer and he replied : it is imported from Europe and that is why it’s good!!!!Well well....to each his own. Unfortunately  this is not for me.

Pouring with a thick white head with no lacing, this beer is a pale yellow and has a very very mild corn syrup and citric extracts smell. The beer itself tastes strongly of corn-syrup and has a fizzy acidic aftertaste. Not bad for a commercial larger, but not very good if you have a full-malt of any kind around.
Clear yellow pour with a white head. Flavor is pretty weak with a corn taste to it. Better than your average found everywhere beer, but not one i’d drink often.
The most overrated and poor mass marketed beer on earth. It;s better than Coors light, only just. Nuff said
From a can.  Smels like a lager.  Pours yellow, clear, small white head.  No lacing. Tiny hint of citrus.  I will probably never drink this beer again.
The only time I drink this is when my yuppy side comes out.  Horrible smell and taste.  Give me miller lite over this any day.

I’ve warmed to this over time, deserves a re-rate. Reasonably crisp and hoppy for a mass-produced pale lager, no particular off-notes, very drinkable. A big improvement on Cold Filtered which it has replaced here in the UK.

I hate this beer.

Mass Producto Eueropean. 

Smells like Shit.

Tastes like Bleach.

Head  Like Bleach.

Beer for trendy people not for men that love beer. 

Drink a Bud over this. 

Good skunk whiff on Heineken. 

No

No

and 

No

Smells acrid and stale of hops and malt.
Piss appearance with synthetic looking white head.
Rich palate but watery and overwhelmingly slimy and fizzy.
Tastes like club soda with gall.
Somehow sweet. Drink this and spoil the appetite.
Slightly better when served so cold that it becomes scentless.
It is awful on can.
Btw, I’ve suffered though enough of these to know what I think, if it’s gonna be bland pale lager á la adolescent bars I prefer Stella Artois. Beer for the people who actually don’t like beer.

Superior to American beers, which is what I’ve had to an extent.  I like it, do not think skunky defines this brew.  Smooth and crisp, clean appearance.  A little hoppy bite, not much for a head.  Sensible palate, rated understandably for a macro brew heavily imported into the US.

This stuff sucks.  It is clearly intentionally skunky, which I don’t understand.  That, and maybe a touch of noble hops, are the only flavors here.  I guess it’s refreshing if that’s what you’re going for, but I’d rather have a quality pilsner than this.

The recent debate about skunkiness and green bottles got me thinking about this, which led to the discovery that I’d never rated it. So here goes: pale gold with a 2cm frothy head that quickly deflated to a thin covering. Predictably skunked aroma which also shows wet cardboardy malt, sugar and grassy hops. Soft, slightly undercarbonated mouthfeel. Sweet honey and malt upfront with an intrusive hop bite. Marginally above average for a Euro macro lager but so what.
bottle.  Tastes like mildewed straw, followed by one of the most bitter aftertastes on the planet.  Always skunked.   How can this beer have a following?
Keg. Sweet malt. Chemical/alcohol aroma. Of the 7 or 8 mass produced lagers available I thought I might as well get a new rate.

Above average pale lager, some hop in the aroma, your average somewhat blah grass smell too.  When not skunked, and I realize that it often is, this is a drinkable beer for consumption in place of water or cola.
If I’m going to have a mass-produced beer that isn’t a Newcastle it’s going to be this. While it doesn’t bring anything to the table, it doesn’t take anything away either.
Far too comparable to American lagers (which I hate). Pale, watery, lacking in flavor. Just not a very good beer.
interesting how many people talk about hating this beer.  i’ve had some of the beers that people tout as superior and found them to be nothing to write home about.

Can. Not a whole lot going on here, but not actively offensive. Watery, whatever. I was at a wedding where the only things available were bud, bud light and this. This is about 10 times better than the other two choices, but next time I think I’ll have a soda.
Rather sulphury and sweetish. There are much better pilsner style lagers in Europe
Uggh, someone brought this to our tennis league party proclaiming "I brought good beer". Skunky, watery, and generally insipid. Nothing "premium" about this
Pretty average lager, better than grolsch though. I like the little 6 pack cans we get in the UK, diddy lil coke size cans.
Bottle. light golden. no real head. Skunky version of Becks. What people who want to look cool at bars drink.
Overrated, really not all it is cracked up to be.  Over priced based on its "luxury" differentiation.  Buy something else if you can.
Skunky, grassy aroma - Quite waters down and  carbonated.  This beer is just not for me.  However, it will get you drunk....

Funny, this beer was the ’in’ import for a while, now it’s cool to bash it.  I hated it from the beginning.  The surname is Heiny for a reason, because IT TASTES LIKE ASS, PEOPLE!!!!  

Bittersweet taste typical of these types of imports.
I really dont see the big deal with this beer. It is way too bitter and just not very drinkable.
Funky, skunky, flat tasting and everything I don’t like in a beer.  Rather drink a...Michelob Ultra than this.
draught at emmas grill in burlington.  not skunked for a change, though very pedestrian, almost watery, and nothing remarkable.
I like it, but it is expensive for the value.  I probably just drink it cause it makes me look cooler since it’s imported.  I hate college.

Frank Booth: What kind of beer you drink, neighbor?
Jeffrey Beaumont: Heineken
Frank Booth: Heineken? Fuck that shit! Pabst Blue Ribbon!
[courtesy "Blue Velvet" by David Lynch]

... not sure Pabst Blue Ribbon is the better choice .... but Heineken Lager would not be the beer for the desert island either ... another brew made big by advertisment millions rather than taste ... anyway, this one is clean, has a nice bitterness and as a flaw just some sour notes in the palate ...
