the bottle I had was of course not the original one, but brewed under license in Switzerland ...
What can I say? Clean tasting, but not much noteworthy. A tad better than some of its Amercian counterparts, as there is a little hop influence to be found. Any port in storm, as they say.
Very average. But better then any domestic. Clear clean brew. Won’t break the bank or your indies.

A decent pale lager. Yellow colour with a rather small white head. Slightly malty taste and aroma, but not much of it. Wonder why so many people all over the world drinks it .. its not that cheap and not that good.
Bottle, generally tastes sort of mutedly tart. Slightly better than most macros, but not worth the upcharge.
Bottle. Not too bad, but nothing overly special.  A little skunky, but better than many of the more common beers out there.

Can, at home.
Light with white head. Aroma light malty and hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet, light bitter. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

At one time this was the US leading import.  It has a gassy taste and straw color.  The head was frothy white.  It has some hops and math flavors.  It has more body some of the US bulk beers. Not worthy of further examination.
It’s pretty good, it’s the best beer you’ll find at a college party most likely.
Plow by that eau de crotch rot aroma and this is drinkable, if just. No real taste beyond barley and water, but at least it doesn’t taste like it smells.

24-oz MiniKeg Can. NEVER drink from green bottles! Don’t buy green bottles - maybe they’ll get the message! I have NEVER had a non-skunk hiney from a green bottle. This one in the mini-keg pours a pale gold with a nice white head. Decent malt-lager aroma. Taste is a bit of malt, very very slight bitter from hops, and finishes clean. Very drinkable, surprisingly so (been a while since I had one of these). Would like a little more ’hit’ to the flavor, but overall, it’s not bad for a macro. DOWN WITH GREEN BOTTLES!

Pale yellow color with a very light aroma.  The hops where very fait to none.  This is a good sitting by the pool when it is free in Vegas beer.  I am sure in it’s day.  Now so large they produce large MFG Beer.

Bottle. Tastes pretty light and surprisingly not bad for a tasteless, bodyless beer. It doesn’t have that gross stale cereal flavor that other commercial pale lagers seem to display. I’d drink this over domestic lagers any day.
world best marketing beer, the quality and taste is regular but it sales the best

Bottle.  Very pale with a fizzy white head.  Overpowering skunky aroma.  Very light bodied with a bit of malt in the flavor and a slightly bitter finish.  This could actually be a decent session beer if it didn’t smell like someone washed a dead skunk in it.

Bottle. Very pale, yellowy colour, bubbly disappearing head. Nice mild hops smell, maybe with some notes of corn. Light flavour, a bit too thin, malty end. Not horrible, I wonder why some people give it the same ranks as for half-water stuff like Corona or Bud. This one is definitely better. Not great, but certainly drinkable; an OK lager.

Well... I really don’t like it. First time I tried I was expecting a great beer. "Uhhmmm Heiniken? It must be a good imported beer!" It was looking like a good beer but when it came to my mouth...arrhg Terrible. No tastes at all, strong bad beer taste in the water. White head that dissapears in 2 seconds. Strong bad beer aroma.
Not a horrible beer, but it never grew on me. Not a fan of the after taste, although I will drink if options are low

Can.  Agree with those rating the bottled beer and those rating the draft or can.  The can vs. bottle versions are basically different tasting lagers.  I was surprised to find the canned version crisp, a little malty and non-skunk weed in aroma.  A very fair brew.

Grab yourself a Heine…or don’t - I wouldn’t blame you.  I’ve never been a big fan and would likely choose an American macro over this one (but the thought of having to choose between the two makes me cower in fear).  Never had one that didn’t taste skunked and have always come away disappointed.  This is what the trendy kids think of when they think of a stylish imported beer.

It has a skunky smell, which I personally hate in any beer, much like Tsing Tao. Very clear as the commercial description describes it. with a thin white head. lively carbonation and light bodied, malty flavored with a bitter finish

I’m not a fan of Heineken. Colous is somehow too pale with a head that doesn’t last long. Very bitter flavor and finish, not a gift for your tongue.
I’d drink it along a warm and strong french cheese.

Sampled from a 12oz keg shaped can poured into a pint glass. Makes a clear yellow color with a light white head, not really any lacing going on, head dissipates quickly. Aroma is light caramel malt, not really anything else going on here, and I am honestly surprised to see anyone call this beer "skunky" when sampled from a can or on draft... in my experience the only skunky heineken is the stuff in the green bottles that has had some exposure to sunlight. Flavor is clean with nearly no bittering, sweet, light caramel and cream with a slightly fruity finish. Light bodied and smooth on the palate, spicy carbonation and a dry finish. I’ll only drink a heineken if my choices are severely limited and never when served from a green bottle.

A Mes rate:
It’s a lager what can I say. Choice hops my backside. For English chavs who wish to get lagered. Drinkable only because its sinkable.
A bit bitter. A typical lager. Suprised by the bad ratings. Certainly not a great beer, but not horrible either.

Bottle, 25cl. What can i say about this one that hasn’t been said yet? It seems all this green bottle lagers taste the same: water! Few hops, a little bitterness and that’s it! Ok, maybe Heineken isn’t the worst but in my opinion, only drinkable in hot sunny days and in a place where you have no other options....
A Heineken is always the same. But that’s kind of nice too. It’s a standard on it’s own. A standard lager that is. Drinkable, but not enjoyable. Not bad either.

branch... but in the aroma! Truly... terrifying.

Ramata, ma nell’aroma. Intensamente terrificante.

I like Heineken but I never buy it.  It just isn’t the style of beer I usually go for.  It has a skunky taste and smell.  The color is nice and it feels good on the palate.  It is best ice cold.  I think most people are caught up with the fact that they really want to go to Octoberfest and never will get there.  But they don’t realize it is brewed in Holland.
Pours a light gold color. Smell is rather skunky. Head dissipates quickly. Taste is about average for a mass market european beer. Not enough hop bitterness for me.

Afwaswater heeft meer aroma 
licht waterachtig met een toets van sop
levend voorbeeld van ’hoe minder smaak hoe meer verkoop’ klasseren onder afval

Pale golden, thin white head. Metallic, malty piss-like aroma. Flavour is grainy, malty and simply......awful. Highly carbonated. I had nightmares of the apocalypse four horsemen after drinking this. The comercial says: Meet you there. where?? IN HELL??

Bottle (330ml).  Hands up all who think green bottles are a good idea?  I didn’t think so ...  Poured pale gold with a big white head - bubbling stopped immediately.  Aroma is skunky sugary-metallic harsh.  Taste is bland, sucrose-sweet, almost lke fake honey flavour or pancake syrup, no hops, not much of anything.  Mouthfeel is like watered-down hummingbird feeder fluid.  Ice cold, you get a thirst quenching alco-drink that smells bad.

Smells like Mikey’s malt liquor but I drink it anyway because it’s usually on sale and I’d rather drink this than Miller Lite.  Gives me gas something terrible though.  Kind of skunky, pungent, but has enough bitter flavor to keep me happy and not noticing the negatives.
When passing a dead skunk on the road a few nights ago, a friend and I both exclaimed that it smelled like Heineken. (see NachlamSie’s review below) This is pretty bad, but I’ve had worse.

out of the bottle. medium color lager. ends slightly bitter.  highly carbonated. I dont think its tastes like piss like some of the other raters. lets leave strong sentiments like that to Bud and Natty Ice etc.

bottle. Smells like a dead skunk, it hits me before I can even pour even though the bottle is nowhere near my nose. Papery hops are noted in the flavor along with boiled hay and some corn. Oh, and skunk.
Dutch beer! ok taste, not my pick, gets you drink fast! a little sour for my taste, but then again I ain’t European.
Medium colour lager, hardly any head. No appreciable aroma. Very fizzy with a crisp, pear taste and slight bitterness. Unremarkable eurolager
Heineken is too skunky and too thin. I find it hard to understand why it is so widely available. Is it really that popular?
When going somewhere that serves Miller, Bud, Coors you can usually get this which is better.  Little use besides that though.

12 oz bottle - Pours golden with a foamy white head.  Aroma was pretty skunky a little malt behind the skunk.  Flavor is light grains and malts almost like cereal with a bit of a hop finish. On the palate this is light and airy.

Out of Keg Can.  Had this one at the metrodome in the Wine Bar.  Tastes a bit skunky.  However, at least there is some flavor here compared to most american lagers.  I used to prefer this to many other beers before I delved into more complex offerings.  But it is hard to justify it for the import price charged at most licquor stores when I can get Summitt or Sam Adams for the same price.
Like that one.Specially the bitter flavor here in Brasil.One of my favorites
Another macro piss fest.  This has a little more flavor than MGD.  Kinda tastes skunked.

Why is this so popular world wide? First off it;s better in the can rather than the bottle, unless you’re actualy in amsterdam where it’s fresh, but the green bottle leads to a almost asuredly  skunky import. From the can {or keg} it’s nice and tasty. Well not tasty, but adaquit. Pours standard pale yellow, thin whispy head, gone in a second, no lacing, on the low end of high carbonation. aroma is of mild malt, mild herbal note. Flavour is simple, fresh wheat overall with mild bready malt charater and a slight hit of mild bitter hop. Undertones metal, lemon zest, wild chive. After taste is overall dry with that almost ancient taste of you’re first beer memory hinding in the back. Just a pale lager, a decent one mabby, but not worthy of the high class snobby beer statis. If you like this one, try the folowing other world wide distrubited lagers, and I’m shure you will like them better:Grolsh Premium Lager, Charles Wells Lager,  and to a lesser extent, Stella Artois.  Cheers

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear yellow color with a thin white head that disappears somewhat quickly. Over carbonated. Decent hop bitterness and flavor. You do have to like the slogan though..."Grab a Heinie"

Pours a thin yellow with a medium foamy white head. Aroma of hops and spices. Tastes of bready yeast with a bitter hoppy bite and aftertaste. Not bad but there are other pale lagers I’d rather drink personally.
Pale yellow with thin white head, mostly receding.  Effervescent.  Aroma of spicy hops and bready malt.  Bitter finish, slightly metallic.  Not bad for a macrobrew.
650ml bottle now 5% in UK. Had it on a train as there was nothing else. Not bad for a mass produced lager. Had some nice citrus hop and kept that distinctive heineken taste.Took me back to being 19
Nice beer.  Must be consumed out of a keg can. Pretty much what i expect from a good lager.  I drink about two cases of this each semester.

Clear, wan yellow hue, big sturdy head that holds at first, then settles to a slim layer of white...
Nose is not my cuppa. Too easy to call it skunky, but it’s a typical lager-y smell, not one I particularly like, and find hard to describe without getting into vulgarities. Designed for people who have no intentioin of inhaling the aroma, or who’ve settled for the bottom. (not true, there’s lots worse)...
Taste: Big carbonation, small flavor. Soft and creamy at the start, very clean, smooth, with a grainy aspect riding at the forefront of the palate, drifting back. Leaves easy, soon forgotten. Brilliant tactic, as the thirsty imbiber will have dismissed any memory of it’s faint flavor and wispy character.
Nothing that terrible, really, it’s "just beer." Which is why this is one of the most popular in the world. I spent more time in it’s company than I do any of my favorite’s, not due to any desire, but through my occupation: I serve beer, and that’s what my customers clamor for, Lord love ’em.
Oddly, in bottles, I’m often put-off more than I am by this can. Makes me wonder if it’s somehow even more superior on draft? 
And P.S., I really thought I’d end up knocking this, but, hey, it is what it is.
"beer"...
Golden in color with a frothy white head.  Not much aroma and a grain like flavor with a little hop bitterness.

You know, I absolutely HATE rating crappy Pale Lagers! I have actually rated Very few of them, but tonight I’m adding a coupe to the checklist! 
 I’ve probably had 200 bottles of this beer in my life and every time I’ve had it I thought to myself…. “THIS BEER SUCKS, but somehow it doesn’t suck as hard as all the other beers I have to choose from at this particular moment”… and that is such a sad thing! A pale golden body, a fluffy foot smelling white head, the aroma of rotten  lemons and cheap honey,  a crisp taste of sweet corn with a squeeze of skunked lemon….. Marketing…. Yuppies! 
Lord help us!

Replacing another of those mysterious disappearing ratings. A boring sweet beer that enough people have said enough about for me to not bother adding any more descriptors. If I’ve got a heineken in my hand, someone else bought it.

Bottle Pours a pale light slightly hazy straw color.  Lots of visible fizz and a modest shortlived white head.  The moment I poured it I though...what is that smell.  Up close and personal it has a sweet, honey, bread aroma but my wife walked in the room after I poured this and thought it was me and the beans I had yesterday that she smelled.
Thin watery bready taste and feel. Plain flat cardboard aftertaste.  Blech !
After I have enough to rate this fairly, down the drain it goes.....OK that’s enough.
Joe average bar beer, but probably the best out of them next to Sam Adams as far as Lagers go.

Haven’t tried one of these in a long time, saw one left over from a party and said why not. Well, I remember why I haven’t had this in a while. The aroma is bad, but not as bad as other mass produced beers. The taste has that cheap almost skunked taste with little to no depth. Very drinkable when cold, but watch out when this one warms up, o man does it get bad, really bad.....if I had to drink a pale lager this isn’t a bad choice....that said it still is very liberal that they call this "beer"
Taste is very very average there are much better beers out there then this pale lager
this beer is the average pale lager.  good flavor compared to the other mass produced beast  beers, but very blah

This is an intresting one, iv always had a weee soft spot of Heineken as it has a stronger european lager taste than most and has particularly fine carbonation throughout. Howeveer in saying this its nothign to shout about and just the best i can get in the subclub.
Ah les bonnes bières réputées à travers le monde.  Cette bière ne se dément pas, elle est aussi velouté, elle goûte quelque chose et elle a un ensemble qui nous fait pensé au conifère.  Voilà ;)

A commercial success, but a very bland lager. The taste is not bad, but it is not good either. In fact, it tastes like nothing. Unsurprisingly, this beer is almost impossible to find in Belgium (except in international hotels), a country few will deny has a rich beer culture. Only if nothing else is available. Amstel from the same brewer is worse.

This lonely beer has been sitting in the back of the frig for weeks but my other beer is still chilling and it’s 96 degrees outside so I need something. Surprisingly it has a bright golden color. Small, white head that disappeared quickly in the heat. Not much in the smell area, maybe some lemon. Taste starts bitter but turns sweet, I think a hint if pine. Light body, dry texture. It’s keeping cool and hydrated, but.....next beer please!
I like it! Found almost everywhere. Some drink it just to tell people they’re into "imported" beers. Some, like me, just enjoy it chilled on a hot summer night.
Compare this with American macro brews and it’s great.  For the import price though it’s somewhat overrated.  Go for it if you crave skunk.

After all these years of drinking beer I finally got a bottle of Heineken - 101.4 oz, it lasted us the whole evening. It tastes better than I expected - I had a preconceived notion that it was the Budweiser of Europe but for a mass produced beer it isn’t bad. 

From my notes 6/5/2007 part of an €11 ($15.10) tour where you get three 250 ml glasses (on-tap) of their lager.  Pours one-finger white head that fades quickly to a ring leaving a very good lace.  Crystal clear amber color. Slight hoppy nose, not skunky.  Light carbonation and light bodied. Flavor is balanced with hints of sweetness, slight bitter finish.  At one of the bars it is served ice cold which killed most of the taste. At the Heineken Brewery Amsterdam, NL.

Bottle.  This is a very decent macrobrew.  The head and golden pour is not the most inviting.  The taste is nice a gentle hops flavor like a pils with a bit of golden amber pine mixed in.  When it is hot this is the beer to drink in a 6er.

When you open a bottle and smell it, it smells  like a big old marijuana plant that is about ready to be smoked.  Combine the smoking and the heineken and you will get crosseyed.  god bless things that are green.
One of the most common beers here in Greece (along with Amstel). When it’s very chilled and there are no alternatives then it’s ok.

This can be found most anywhere, it has too much aftertaste for me and if I drink more than a few of the bottles I start to get quesy, the keg can however at the right temperature tastes significantly better.

I used to strangely like the green bottled skunk taste. Now, even that is gone. I was forced to have a few of these this weekend and hated them. Boring taste and instant headache. Ahh….with the death of enjoying coronas and now the undrinkability of heineken,  the old days are officially gone.
[bottle from anywhere] pours yellow and fizzy. nose is almost non existent a little hops, thin body, nasty.

Smells like skunk.  Looks light yellow and fizzy.  Tastes like skunk with a little beer thrown in.  It’s crisp which is about all it’s got going for it.  I’ll never understand why this stuff is so popular.
I have never enjoyed this beer at all. It also seems to be skunked out, and watered down.

So overrated it gives overrated a bad name. Smells bad, taste is terrible, looks normal which seems to sucker some people to drink it.Anyone who drinks 2 has no taste buds. Any TV commercial(s) that try as hard as Heineken to be "about the Beer" tell it all.
Nice aroma and bitterness. Pale yellow with fizzy, light head. a little watery, but good bite and malted taste. Not heavy or low on crispness like Rolling Rock.
Very overrated. Often skunked due to green bottle. Not a very good beer even if not skunked. Can get a good microbrew cheaper.
Pretty standard lager, the sort you down in the pub without thinking. Like many others of the shop bought tackle.
Aroma is slight malt the pour is pale yellow with a nice head.  Taste very much like any macro American pale lager with just a bit more flavor & bitterness.
Alright, but not great.  Kind of sour, wrong mix of hops.  It’s drinkable, but only if I run out of beer.  Not my first choice.
Standard lager. I don’t need to write a book about this one. I am happy to find others taste and smell skunk.  I sure did. I always do with Heineken.

Updated rating from a can... don’t drink this from a bottle if you don’t absolutely have to.  Medium golden-yellow pour with a short white cap.  Nose picked up sweet malts and a faint floral hoppage.  Flavor carried through the aroma, and it was smooth and easy-drinking... Nothing exciting here, but the can vs. bottle made a whole world of difference.
Pale.  Doens’t smell amazing.  Nice white head though.  Smooth going down, tastes like a pale lager.  Would drink over others of similar type.  Good beer for party, has taste and market style.
does smell like its skunked but doesn’t have the worst taste.  Goes down farily easy, but not watery or anything.  many better choices for your money.
First beer I ever had. Because of that, I give it a better rating than most people do. Still love it, some of the bedt easy to find beer.

From what I smelt this had a very pungent smell.  Like smunked beer, but that’s not neccesarily a bad thing. Some beers just smell like that and taste wonderful.  But alas  this is quite bland.  I’d say this is a better version of Rolling Rock, but thjat’s not saying much.
Almost no aroma, but nice mostly lasting head a bit of a surprice. Flavour like bad bread though, a typical industrial pale lager.
Out of a bottle, I don’t know why but I drank it.  Aroma of what I call whale piss.  It was pale and the flavor was about the same.
drinkable, kinda taste a little skunky not great at all, could be worse. feels a little thin, and not big on taste.
Drank this in Amsterdam.  Beer color.  Thin mouthfeel.  Beer taste.  Not a great beer, but it’s, you know, beer.
(can) Poured a nice light head.  Slightly sour.  Good to find in Guatemala (at a price below many domestics here), but I wouldn’t drink it elsewhere.

If I were De Koningshoeven, I’d be pretty pissed at Heineken for driving down the Netherlands’ national average for beer quality. I’m drinking a teeny little 7-ouncer in the hopes that it won’t give me such a bad headache as I’ve received in the past. I’ve sampled Heines now and again over the past 15 years and I cannot recall a one that hasn’t smelled skunked. The one I’m drinking now smells like a humid day at the zoo. Golden amber, fast white head, yadda yadda yadda. Grassy, sour and thin, with a lingering sour aftert... oh, crap... the headache is here.


Mainstreet Wine & Spirits, Countryside, IL

Bottle bought in Amsterdam.  Smells slightly skunked (so it doesn’t really matter if it’s bought 1 mile from the brewery or 3,500 miles, it still comes out the same).  Clear golden color with a thick head.  Medium fizziness with a mellow (not much there) flavor.
The head is gone, the thrill is gone.  It’s really pretty tasty, just bland.

smells a bit sweet.
Clear and pale colour.light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sourlight body, thin feel, average carbonation, abrupt finish.
No big headache.
Not bad for a pilsner but  not good either.

Pours a clear pale gold, kinda the color of ginger ale and very fizzy. Not much of a head. Smell is grassy and lightly sweet.

Taste is grassy and very clean. Crisp. Lightly bitter finish. Not much agftertaste though and very thin mouth. Not much to add because there is not much here. Very drinkable. 

This sample was much better than previous tries as the bottle was not skunked. A passable macro lager if it’s taken care of.

Bottle. Last beer in this pub I have not tried. I now know why. Relative to drinking a domestic major light beer, this is a step up the ladder.  The aroma and taste is not inspiring, it is an average all-around brew.

Since I feel the need to rate every beer I try, I am going to waste my time with this one as well.  Pale Yellow, well carbonated of course, head fizzled away in seconds.  Aromas were stronger than most low quality pale lagers but not much better, mainly consisting of cherrios and tap water.  Flavor and mouthfeel were overly watery and bland.  Extreme, hardly anything there, but maybe a hint of hop bitterness in the finish which washes right out of your mouth.
Before I started drinking craft brew this was my preferred beer, so it is only appropriate that this is my first review. It is better than the Millers and Buds, but now I could never go back!

The original Dutch version. Just one word to describe this beer.....TERRIBLE..I am not too fond of lagers anyway, but Heineken gives me a headache after just one beer. I can believe people drinking this beer in The Netherlands, because of the price and because it is so popular (I really don’t know why) but in the US, an expensive import beer ???? WHY???

(Bottle 33 cl) Swedish version brewed by Spendrup’s Brewery. Full golden colour, limited head. Hoppy nose, mild and harmonious yet not very exciting. 081203

(Bottle 33 cl) Thai version brewed by Thai Asia Pacific brewery. Nice hoppy nose. Quite harmonic and balanced lager. But lacks personality. 5/2/5/2/10=2,4  191103

(Bottle 50 cl) Greek version. Pale golden with a small, white head. Fine, flowery, hoppy nose. Malty and just enough hops to add balance. Very uncharacteristic and anonymous - but easily drinkable. 5/3/5/2/10=2,5  110999

I thought i had rated this but i guess not.What was I thinking.My palate surely has become sophisticated.I used to enjoy this beer now its a drain pour.I couldn’t get all of it down.Reminded me of Pepe Le Pew.

This, fellow beer drinkers, is not a beer. It is merely flavored seltzer water. It has too much bitterness  and hoppiness in its flavor, which completly dissolves any real flavor that the beer hopes to have. AVOID THIS AT ALL COSTS!!!!

Had the funky keg can.  Poured nice carbinated yellow with thin head. OK aroma.  Flavor had an interesting and surprising bitterness.  Not bad for a can,  I dont like the skunk factor of the bottle, but not the best.

Poured golden in color. Foamy head quickly disappeared. Lots of carbonation. Noticed a light skunky smell but beer still tasted good. Hoppy with little diesel after taste as beer got warm. I liked this better than the Molson,Coors, Bud brands but a generic is still a generic and not worth the extra $ for an import
another generic pale beer.  nothing outstanding and i cant say im a fan of the sour flavor.
Pissebier aka ochtendurine aka middagurine aka avondurine aka gerecyleerd rioolwater aka uitgekotste nastro azurro aka a really bad lager.

Wow. This is the  best beer that I’ve had in a while, so that is a pretty scary thought.

The taste was hoppy, with a nice long finish.  Not too strong.  color was light.  
Crisp feeling, not sweet.

I thought that this is brewed here in Panama for Heineken, but my bottle said Import.
I will buy this beer again, though not when I am in the states.  Did i get a lucky bottle?

12 oz bottle, shaker.  Medium straw hue beer with an average, frothy, white head that lasts decently.  Not a terrible aroma, actually.  No skunk per se.  Just floral/earthy hops, grain, and a tinge of dms.  Bland.  The taste continues said blandness.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic flavor becomes a  lightly acidic, moderately bitter flavor.  Decent bitterness, though my use of "moderate" is likely a slight exaggeration.  Husky aftertaste.  Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: no skunkage here, thankfully.  Just a boring lager.
I drank this a long time ago and didn’t have a notepad so I’m rating this from memory.

drank right out of the green bottle.  I definitely smell and taste the skunkiness that everyone else is mentioning.  Very thin feel in the mouth.  Have had this many times before and I am less impressed now more than ever.  I used to think this was "good beer" in college.
Skunky is definitely part of the aroma and the flavor.  Is that right?  Is that what they were going for?  I never liked this beer much.  Bad aftertaste too.
smells very skunky and also tastes that way. To me that is a bad thing, why anybody would want to drink this is beyond me!!
I like Heineken.  Its not as good as some dark beers but it’s a nice beer for what it is.  Its a great "chill beer".

Yellow color.  Aroma was malty and tangy and some skunk but not as much as I have had in the past (It was also my last drink of the night after many others).  Tangy and malty flavor as well.  Light to medium body.

Can you say GREEN BEER!, yeah for the lover’s of green beer. And the Bachlor that’s out at the local hot spot and want’s to look cool ordering an Import.
Dont get me wrong I drink the shit out of this beer in bars after all there’s not many bars in anchorage that have much finer brews avalible. With out a hassel, except 1 if you are ever in town try Humpy’s other wise order a Heineken.
Real skunky, real soapy tasting.  Why this is so popular  I can’t figure out.  Defanitely not something I would get again.

So, of course I’ve had this many times but just realized that it wasn’t rated. The other night I was handed one after drinking a few nice pale ales and I have to say, it was just terrible in comparison. The well-known skunky character just killed it.  On other nights, when drunk against other pale or american lagers I’ve appreciated it’s more distinctive malting and sourness.
Not one of my favorites, but I can drink it.  A somewhat pungent, skunky aroma.  Rather bland taste with a hint of bitterness.
Rating #100.  A beer that is way overhyped but not that bad.  Easy to drink, although can be a bit skunky if it is old.  A unique sour flavour seems to be present.  Decent colour, little head.

light yellow color, skunky aroma. Also very skunky tasting.  Stay away from this beer,  one of the worst on the market.  Also the morning after are brutal, if you drink a lot of this beer in one sitting.
Highly over priced.  The beer is drinkable, but not a whole lot to it.  It seems to always have skunkiness to it.  Not a good finish.  When you want a better Heineken, go with a Dutch Windmill.
skunky aroma.  yellow in color.  not much flavor and very watery.   easy to drink but i’d rather drink something with more flavor.
always smells skunked, but other than that it is just an overpriced beer that is nothing really special i will drink this beer only when i have to or it is offered to me

Looks fancy in it’s green bottle, yet aside from the fact that you’re drinking a Heineken, which adds to your ’coolness’ factor, it really has nothing else going for it.  Very unpleasant smelling, along with it’s taste.

Pale greenish yellow in appearance, fair lacing.  The aroma is ambiguous...the only major smell is that of generic beer.  I really don’t understand the success that this beer garners.  The only thing that I can imagine is that the ambiguous taste appeals to beer drinkers who want to be cool and kitzchy but have no idea what they’re doing.
A truely classic beer. The colour and flavour are unduplicated. Maybe it doesn’t stack up to the sophistication of the great beers of the world but there is just something special about Heineken.

From a 440ml can. This looks really nice with a lovely gold colour and a good thick white head that leaves a nice lacework. Little in the way of aroma, sweetish malt if anything. Malt is initially on the palate, but all fades after a few seconds..I have to say that this was tasted after a LONG HARD day at work, and although it’s not a top quality beer, I must say very cold,straight from the fridge, it went down a treat.. so much so that I had all of the 4 pack at one sitting...hey, it’s Saturday night and sometimes it’s good to drink something that doasn’t tax the tastebuds too much. Anyway, it’s much better than the Heineken that was available when I was a student... but that was long ago and probably best forgotten about, this is ok, and I would have it again, much better than other simalarly priced lagers,eg Miller or Bud.
A skunky taste and smell, this beer is too light to possess any kind of true flavor.  Watered-down and weak, this brew is good for college kids that can’t see past the "Imported" sticker.  Pass.
This is a week beer, and I dont care for it much. There are holland brews I like more like 1620 and hollandier.  This one is not in the ranking in my book.
Nothing distincitve at all. Very little aroma other than the normal Heineken skunkiness. Nice lasting head. Little bitter finish.
i like the bottle, but never really enjoy its taste.  it’s a beautiful beer, just not that tasty.

From 12 oz. keg can:

Sounds flat when can is opened. Poured into glass and foamed to a huge, fairly dense head that took about a minute to all but disappear. Very little lacing. Extremely clear pale yellow. Slight smell of hops. Tastes both carbonated and flat at the same time, if that’s possible. Kind of a hop taste, not much malt, and mostly a watery taste. Not objectionable, just not a robust tasting beer. Not skunky at all, like Heineken in bottles. A bit of a bitter aftertaste. Head is totally gone now. I agree with most on this site that it is overrated and overpriced, but I feels it is better than most domestics and is drinkable, even as a session beer (if you can afford to). In fact, it may be best as a session beer. Once it is warm, all bets are off.

500ml can. From the "I Can’t Believe I’ve Never Rated This Yet!" file comes Heineken.  Golden beer with a fast vanishing white head. Light malts in aroma, and none of the grassy-skunk aromas i find in the bottle. Despite it’s claim to be all malt, I still find it has a corny edge to it, underneath some grainy flavours. Very light finishing hops.
One of my most hated beers. Tastes extremely skunky and too much carbonation. I refuse to drink it again.
Bottled.  A very clear coloured lager with a corn grass and ice aroma.  The taste is also corny and there is virtually no hop or malt quality.

I drank it last night, and I’ll probably drink it again tonight.  Why?  Because it’s that or Singha, and I’m tired of Singha. Unsurprisingly, the version of this beer found in 7 Elevens across Thailand varies radically from other versions I’ve tried.  Missing is the green-bottle-induced skunk, but also gone is almost any hint of pilsner at all.   It delivers a decidely sweeter swill than it’s emerald siblings, but not to the extreme of its domestic rivals.  The changes are enough that I am disappointed when I drink the beer trying to be reminded of Vegas vacations past, but when I compare it to other Thai offerings, the beer often comes through.

Come on.  You know what you’re getting when you open one of these: you don’t expect a micro imperial IPA that blows your socks off, or that creamy double stout that tastes like boozy mocha.  No, you drink this because your brother had you over for dinner, this beer was in the fridge, and crisp lager goes well with curry.  The mouthfeel is actually well balanced for the light malts and Saazy pils-near-skunk.  I’ll drink this again, and you know that you will too.  Death, taxes, and pale lager.
Another marketing major has set this up to  appear better than it is!  Stiff after-taste followed by a nasty bitter flavor!!!  All in a funky GREEN can...Ouch....
This beer seems to always be skunky.  Good thing that have a good advertising group...they aren’t gettin’ by on taste.
average, run of the mill...not horrible, but not the best i’ve ever had.. I’ll take this over the coors light budlight anyday of the week.

Canned. Pale golden with small white head. Bitter aroma. Pretty waterish beer with hoppy bitter taste. Bitter aftertaste which smoothens out in a soft way. Pretty standard "boring beer". 2 2 4 2 7


Canned (re-rated during the 10th anniversary of 2Pac on RateBeer). Yellowish golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and bitter floral hoppyness along with some mild bready and herbal notes. Flavour is quite similar. Watery palate. 3 2 4 2 6.
From A Bottle,Can.Light gold in colour,no head,quite sharp and bitter,fizzy and dry.
Average import.  Clean taste, not a bad beer to drink on occasion.  Aroma is that of your typical European lager.  Taste has no shocking aftertaste and is a bit predictable, however not bad overall.

One of those "I can’t believe I haven’t rated" beers. Had one 2 days ago at a French restaurant and a popular choice when at The Keg. Not a great beer but better than average for the style. Clean flavour, no diesel flavour at the end or when warm and some hop flavour.
might be a better beer if they took the time and energy to ensure that every beer they turn out doesn’t get skunked.  I was very disappointed in this one.

It does have a some skunkiness to it. I like the looks of the bottle, have to admit I used to drink this all the time, but only at stripclubs where this is the best "premium beer"  they’ll carry around here. I do prefer to most N.A. macros.

CAN. Stale aroma detected. Nice head to begin with but dissipated quickly. Clear gold color. Bitter on the palate. Over commercialized beer more geared to the Corporate Office cubicle worker than the guy who welds steel on a 14 story skyscraper in the east at 0 degrees for a temp.

The Heineken we get is brewed in Costa Rica so I think there is a quality control issue.  The beer is watery with no head, and a bitter taste.  Heineken please send some Quality Directors to your brewery in Costa Rica.
this is like the skunk beer of all skunk beers.  How in the world did this get such a stellar reoutation? " Marketing" that evi thing that tries to manipulate us 24/7l
Clear golden, some head, lacing and retention. Aroma is light grains and bread, a vague hint of hops. Very light and clean. Inoffensive as long as you don’t drink it bottled.
You mean, I can’t go lower than 1? You would think it would be illegal to vomit in a bottle and sell it to the general public.  Europeans are strange people.
Decent lager.  Golden, medium-bodied, too much on the watery side though.  Bit of a bitter finish.  Good with pizza.

Oh yeah, a real classic. You know it’s a great beer when somebody names a type of body odor after it (Heineken pits.) The proud display of the word IMPORTED on the label says it all. You drink this to look classy if you don’t know a good imported lager from a cabby’s armpits.

Bottle. Pours a nice amber. Moderate carbonation. Good hop profile, for a pale lager. Not too much flavor, but not watery at all. One of my more favorite beers produced by large commercial brewers. Head was thin, but that is because of the way I pour it, trying to keep the carbonation in. Not a bad beer, as some others rate it.

I love it when I go to places where this is their one "premium" beer.  And I actually liked this beer when I was 17 years old.  Skunk in the aroma, skunk in the flavor, skunk in the aftertaste, skunk the next day.  I’m being pretty harsh.  If it weren’t for the severe skunking of this beer, it may not be too bad.  It does have decent hop profile and mouthfeel for a pale lager, just can’t get past the skunkiness.
Never had a beer lose its flavor so fast.  Leave it for a few days and its game over for Heine, keg can or not.  Way overrated.

In my opinion, this is the best mass produced beer by far.  A decent head and lacing, clean crisp color, slightly pungent aroma, and a clean, crisp, flavorful taste that makes this a great everyday beer.  There is nothing better than a crisp, ice cold Heineken on a hot summer day.
Not that bad, but they keep buying up other breweries all over the world and homogenizing them until they’re all the same.
Just a very avarage lager really, nothing special. There are better Dutch lagers out there.

Poured golden/yellow with a thick white head. The smell was grainy and grassy. The taste started sharp and clean with a slight metallic flavor. Light barley is prevelent throught. It finished smooth, not too bitter, more like oak. Tried this from the keg can, hence the metalic taste. Nothing special here, just another mass produced beer.
ill drink bud before i buy this crap and pay more for it urine yellow with similar taste....not good even cold
Heineken is the first beer I ever had, and probably the reason I didn’t start to drink beer until I was 24.  It’s skunked by design, and there’s simply nothing to it.
Different than most domestic lagers, but still pretty boring. A little bit of hop taste sets it apart, as does a distinctively sweet and sour flavor. Drinkable, but hardly worth talking about.

Not very interesting.  There’s something very toned-down about this beer tastes.  It has become the de-facto "standard european import", and it lives up to this status, but barely.  To its credit, you do taste the hops, although they’re not much.  Perfectly drinkable but lacks complexity.  There is a hint of macro-sourness towards the end.  One thing that disturbs me about this beer is that I think it tastes considerably worse on-tap than in a bottle.  On tap the beer tastes heavier, less refreshing, and the macro-sourness hits me much worse.

I hate Heineken. There’s very few good things I can say about it. In fact, I can’t think of any at all. I’m automatically biased against green bottle beer because of it. It’s as pale as pale ale comes and the taste is god awful. Go away Heineken. Don’t ever come back. Love, Diode.

Seems to be at it’s best as bottles served on ice, or straight from the tap. As long as it’s been kept out of the light in it’s case the green bottles and skunking aren’t much of an issue. Light amber/yellow color, decent head and inoffensive flavor and palate make for a respectable import. Just don’t try to twist off the cap.

More hoppy than your usual macro lager, with European hops,  but the flavor is rather clumsy and not really balanced with the malt.  Fizzy with a diminishing white head.  Standard lager characteristics.  Light noble hop aroma.  Drinkable in a pinch, but there are better import lagers around.

Back in the day, this was something special.  Now, it’s merely middle-of-the-road.  Skunky and hoppy, just like a typical lager.  It’s a good beer; but it just doesn’t stand the test of time.  Especially with the ghetto 24 oz. in the convenience stores.  That makes me ill.

Pale yellow, some white head, mild hops aroma, hops taste and finish of more hops.  Heavy carbonation.  Not much in the way of other flavorings detected.  I like the hops used and hops in general so am always willing to settle for one of these.
Better then the AmBev crap, but still not a "good" beer. There is better stuff out there.

This is a beer I would recommend to anyone who enjoys drinking urine.  Over-hopped urine.  Come on dude.  The hops are harsh, the malt, nonexistent, color = jaundice, carbonation = seltzer.  I’d drink Heineken if there was no Busch Light around.  And I like Busch Light like a fish likes sandpaper.

One of the best things about Heineken is that you can get it almost anywhere on earth and it is almost without fail the same as the last time.  That’s pretty impressive.  The beer’s crispness is perhaps its best feature.  Not worth getting too excited about, but better than most macros.
Not bad.  Very snobby beer.  Has hints of skunk and smelly cabbage with a watery mouth feel and small particles.  Definite snob appeal but not bee drinkers appeal.

A very crisp and bitter beer with a strong aroma. The hops dominate the experience. I think it has been so well said by others here that this beer is just above par, but don’t you want a premium beer like this to taste great? My personal feeling is that this beer could be improved by malting it up a bit. Only drink this one when your Dutch family comes into town which you hope isn’t often.

Not impressive, but it’s okay enough. I found it smooth and accompanied my meal fine. Not remarkable, and I won’t buy it when I have so many other options available. The bottle I had was fresh, crisp and smooth. As far as ultra-mainstream industrial beers go, it’s above par.

Thank you, but I’ll pass.  You could do worse (Sol, Fosters, etc...) but Heineken is a good example of a bad beer beloved to many.  Skunky, dirty, metallic and cheese-like.  Why do my in-laws love this beer?

Ya know, I really thought that I had rated this before, but I guess that I hadnt. Well, here is the deal. everyone has had this stuff and I cant really think of anything clever or witty to say about it. I wonder whta it would taste like  if it werent skunked, or I wonder what it would taste like if it were a different beer? Hmmm, that sounds good

my friends and i call this the "two dollar bottle of mickey’s".this is a brew that tastes skunked when its fresh.it boasts a body that looks the same going in,as coming out.not to mention it costs the same as a nice 6 pack of your favorite local micro-brew.drop the heini and move on to something finer.

Can’t complain about the arome like most do b/c I didn’t detect one, good or bad. Tastes far too dry to me. Actually doesn’t even taste like a Dutch beer. To me it tastes Mexican or Peru ala Modelo or Cosuquenas(sp). Really thin like the barley was corn. Quite undrinkable. Now I know why I’m just now reviewing this one.
My first bar choice when going out (hey, slim pickin’s in Oklahoma sometimes).   Consistent smell and flavor, not the best but I still like it.

24oz bottle:  Back in the day i thought this smelled and tasted good.  I realize it smells like the other pale lagers, and tastes like them too.  Medium gold color with a fizzy head.  Corn flavored with some grainy grass.  Its okay drinking beer for BBQ’s or buying in a keg for a party but...  I don’t find myself drinking this like i used to.

Pale yellow color with proper carbonation. I removed an appearance point as the beer poured no head. Aroma was impressively inviting as there was no skunky odor. I was very pleased with that since I really wanted to taste a good heineken to give it a fair rating. Dry hop came out of the first mouthfuls. Very little aftertaste. Disappointing flavors with a metal-like finish. This beer felt like making love to a crippled old lady.

This beer is consistently pretty good for a pils.  I’ve drank it in a lot of places around the world and am never disappointed.  One morning in Amsterdam, I saw a small tank truck pull up on a quiet street.  The driver took out a crow bar, opened a manhole cover and attached a flex hose from the truck to a fitting inside the manhole.  It was, of course, a Heineken truck.

I was not sure why it took me so long to get around to rating this one, but after opening a bottle I figured out why. This is a really average beer, and is again a case were marketing seems to be better than the brew itself.  Some odd odors greet you, after pouring golden with a medium white head.  Hops are the main flavor, and not much else.  How in the world do beers like this sell so well when there are so many better alternatives out there.

In the famous green bottle- Poured a crisp looking, golden body with a nice looking white head. Aroma is , not suprisingly, skunky, and sweet malt with some metalish aromas as well. Taste is bitter, hoppy, watery, crisp. I’m not to fond of a beer that is skunky every time I have it.

slightly better then bud or coors.. pretty craptastic. piss yellow, soda like head, smell of straw and cardboard.
Yum... :|
staple in clean lagers. consistent golden yellow color. taste begins crisp with a noticable skunkiness or dankness in taste and smell. finishes smoothly.
This is a very good dutch beer :-). Tast good - its best on bottle. Nice beer on 4.6% (rate is for the danish produced version)

Not a bad beer.....just not much to it.
Clear, golden yellow with no smell.  Better than miller or bud or whatever else is available at the local gas stop.
Very nice, slow drinking beer. very standard. golden in color, and has a nice hoppy taste.
Probably the best readily avalable lager in Southern Africa.  Smoothish with a nice little bite at the end.  Not too bitter, but very easy to drink under the african sun.
This is not a very good beer.  It does not have much taste except for a bitterness that is not very impressive.  I do not recommend it.
Slighly better then carlsberg but still, it’s a bad beer, little flavour, thin body, flat, just another commercial piss beer.
Compact foam. Common beer and trades them for excellence. Bitter is made to feel above all in the nose.

It must be the soft water, because this tastes like ’Evian’. Poured a crystal clear gold with a carbonated sparkle of white rings. Aroma was more CO2, than hops, slight floral hint before it hit the mouth. Taste was like cheap champagne mixed with a pale lager. Thin body, typical mainstream-inoffensive taste, sweet, and a slightly dry bitter and crisp swallow. More of an advertising campaign than a beer.
To think, at one time I used to think this was a good import beer. Poured a lighter, clear yellow with a small white head. Not much to the aroma and tastes. Skunky in both. Thin and watery body.

Pale and yellowish, crystal clear (why are they proud of that?) and an off, mildewy aroma.  Taste is not much better, some grain flavors are present, but zero in the way of complexity.  A worse beer than I remembered.

This rating can go one of two ways. Heineken in the States or Heineken in Holland.

ATTN: Only buy Dutch beers in the Netherlands. For one reason or another they taste a lot better there, and that goes for Heineken, Amstel, etc. I never was a fan of Heineken or Amstel, until I visited Amsterdam. The beer that we get must be their skunked ruined batch and tasted like cat-piss. To all you yuppies out there acting cool, you are drinking a very crappy beer.
Its ok. It has a funny, skuny kind of taste to it.   I think Grolsch is far superior, a nice flavor, without that tiollet water taste.

Standard appearance - clear yellow body and wafer thin white head.  As always a kind of skunky aroma.   This beer is definitely light on flavor - only a touch of hops can be found.  Mostly this can be characterized by having a very weak generic "beer" flavor.  Overall this is one of my least favorite beers ever.
a little scanky shitty taste better than bud,mich,miller.wouldnt drink it a gain
a little skunky. difficult to drink. pretty flavorless. better than bud. wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.

sitting at the Kof C with a friend did not have a big  choice but to order this, the only one that sounded half way good. poured, golden with a white head. aroma, malts , wheat, corn, malts. flavor, a sweetness but can not figure out hat it is, malts. hops. I guess this would be a good beer to have with burgers or pizza or just to slam a few
Pours out pale yellow with a head.  Very light.  Kinda crisp.  Better than other domestic beers (Bud, Coors, Miller).

Pours yellow with thin head.  Nose is mildly skunky with some adjunct.  Almost no flavor except for slightly rancid malt.  No aftertaste.  Quite bad and I have no idea why many Americans find this to be good beer... many American pale lagers are better in quality (Even Genny Light!), and this is not good.
Nice lager,i like the the scent of this lager.Not stays so much in your mouth but taste bit sweet.Better than most of mass production beers.

This is one of the better beers I’ve had in this category. My biggest complain is that it has very little taste. It has an odd finish, at least to me.I’m somewhat torn, I don’t hate this beer, but it isn’t somethng I’d choose to have, nor recommend. It’s decent when the other choices are limited to miller or bud.
I like this stuff. Also my first beer ever. Not bitter, not a whole lot of flavor but good stuff.

I remember years ago when this was "the" beer. Taste great if you’re drinking it in Holland but that’s the atmosphere not the beer. I still get one evrry now and then when I’m feeling a little nostalgic but then I wonder what the fuss was all about back then. Its not a bad beer but certainly no more than average

I really do not understand the popularity of this one (although at least my fellow raters on this website have great taste)!  This is really bad, watery with a horrible finish, makes me feel disgusted after I drink it.  I will never ever drink one again.

First beer I drunk in my life, and probably the main reason why I didn’t like beer for a long, long time...it’s all around due to heavy advertisement and hard to avoid at party’s..

Well, OK, rate the beer...very pale yellow colour, aroma??? Head can get very big when served in a Dutch bar, but disappears very quickly. 

Tastes like water with alcohol, faint...when served chilled on a very hot summerday it’s OK, but still, there are SO many better beers in its category
Good, but as they say in the comercials. It’s good if you are thirsty. But you can find some others better.
Golden with an ok but quite quickly disappearing white head. Weak but ok aroma and a flavor that passes as ok. Some malt, some hops and a bitter finish.

Don’t know why I like this one, but it has a distinct flavor.  Goes good with a second one and gets better from there.  Smells like a frat house rug. I perfer it chilled well and tried the 22 oz bottle once and it tasted better? Usaully the best option beyond the screw tops.
Somewhat skunky smell, but tastes ok.  I sure wouldn’t choose this, given a choice, but its adequate.

White, fizzy head.  Good lace.  Pale, yellow body.  Smells like a beer, when opened for 12 hours.: lightly yeasty, ligthly soapy.  Lightly sweet, lightly bitter initial flavour.  Lightly bitter finish.

Very light yellow with a white head.  Big saaz nose but not much else.  Very thin mouthfeel.  Watery taste, some malt adn some hops.  Clean finish, could use more malt and flavor.  Overall, it is a very drinkable beer better than the cheaper american lagers, but still not something that you enjoy or appreciate.

I went to the brewery once and thought it was fantastic (I even bought a shirt). This one was out of a can, and it could have beeen better. Little to no aroma. Pleasantly sweet (banana/bubblegum flavours), and lightly hopped. Slight soapiness. Crap gassing. I’m sure the draft I had at the brewery years ago tasted much better.
I enjoy Heineken. Prior to starting the whole rate beer thing, it was one of my favorites. Still not too bad for me.

Hmmm...another crappy pale lager.  Why am I not surprised?  Well, it’s watery and tastes similar to Bud...maybe a bit sweeter? Not worth drinking, unless you’re poor, which I am.  But I still would choose water over it.  Plus, water’s better for the system.

This pale lager is  substantially better than any American mass produced pale lager I’ve had. Pours with a full head and pale yellow color. Tangy hops astringency lingers for a good long moment making it quenching and refreshing. (Was tasted from can)

Probably my favorite every day beer or beer to order at a nice restaurant when I don’t want liquor or the place stocks nothing creative.  It’s in the process of being upstaged by a lot of other Euro-lagers that have made their way to the US in a big way.  Heineken smells like a locker room, but it tastes pretty darn good.   Funny how everyone comments on the smell.

A regular green bottle beer.  Slight head.  Mild skunkyness to the smell but the taste was acceptable.  Not something I would buy but if it is there, I will drink it.  Not a big fan of the small neck bottle, I dont know why but it irritates me.

New Review: 
 0.5l green (surprise surprise) bottle. Brewed by Brau Union Hungaria, Sopron, imported and bottled by Karlovačka Pivovara. Hm. I’ve seen recently some cans brewed in Netherlads, and I think  some of it is brewed in Karlovac, so i might do a side by side of those. If I’m feeling particulary crazy. Big thick but fluffy white head. Goes away  at a medium pace. Pale golden colour, noticable carbonation. Nose....not skunky !!! Well, that’s a surprise. However, skunk didn’t hide much in terms of aroma. Slightly sourish malt + dust nose, maybe some hints of white grapes if I stretch my imagination a bit. Some very slight traces of alcohol. Taste....hm. Some weak, unimpressive, but not offensive malt, some hints of hops (mainly present as a slight bite on the tongue and a tingling weak lemony taste, maybe some bready and  metallic hints. It’s maybe one step above "watery". Aftertaste ? What’s that ? Unimpressive, but hey, I drank a green bottle of Heineken that wasn’t skunked, and that’s something that doesn’t happen often.  My rating won’t change though. 

Old Review:
It’s not one of the best European mass produced lagers, the smell was rancid, but the taste was passable. Nothing I would mind drinking again.

Not a lot of aroma here and just skunky enough to taste "imported."  But, overall, an enjoyable and highly drinkable session beer that quenches your thirst, even if it doesn’t particularly excite the palate.
500 ml can. Clear, pale blonde color, medium fugaceous white head. Weak aroma of malt. Weak and boring flavor of malt. Very light body, lively carbonation, watery texture. A cheap and boring lager.

I had a Heineken’s when out to dinner with my lady last night.  Both of us had the special, a half roast chicken with bread dumplings and the timmings.  She had a merlot, I had the brew.  It reminded me why Heineken is okay.  Not too heavy, not to bubbly... goes along with almost any meal.  It’s not offensive.  But that’s not much of a selling point.  It slides down fine, but offers little taste, little addition to the meal.  A step above a lot of other mass-produced light lagers, but that’s not saying much.
Half the taste, all of the price and hangovers.  just does not sit right from the beginning, but i only drank it because somebody else ordered it.

Drank at fridge temp from a keg can and only cuz it was free. Imagine if you will eating (spoiled)canned fruit cocktail offa skunks butt. Here ya are. AND,as an added bonus it left me with cotton mouth. I can’t believe we actually use to think this was "good" beer back in the day. Horrible ,vile crap!
It is what it is...A smooth pale lager with no funky aftertaste. Not worth all the hype, but not a bad brew. I think it’s coming dow in price a bit also...if so I’ll keep a couple on hand.
SIL (Standard International Lager) Give me another one, just like the other one. Boring

I have never had any of this beer that was not skunked, or at least that did not taste of skunk. I don’t like drinking skunks. I am going to leave this beer to the art majors and  community college drama departments.

Poured a nice head that diminished quickly ? the lacing was decent though. A yellow/gold color with a fair amount of CO2. Smell was yeasty and skunky and not very distinctive. Mouth feel was ok. 
Not a beer with a lot of character, but it is one of the better mass produced. I have had it numerous times on tap in Europe, and I remember it tasting better. This ain?t a great beer, but it has done in a pinch.
Expensive, imported macro swill.  Slight hop taste, corny aroma, thin and overcarbonated.  Boring, drinkable and not much better than inexpensive, domestic macro swill.

Pours golden yellow with a thin white head that leaves a lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light with some hops.  Initial taste is bland and somewhat bitter.  Body is thin and heavily carbonated.  Finish is unbalanced but thankfully brief.
one of those beers you accept when offered, then remember that there’s nothing very exciting about it besides its being drinkable and having a successful ad campaign
Can, 5%. Grainy aroma. Clear golden colour. OK stable white head. The flavour starts off sweetish. Mild bitterness. Not so bad.
Not as good as its premium status suggests.  A little to arrogant for me.  But not bad for a very macro brew.
A fair beer. Apparently Austin Powers likes this....I hate Austin Powers and mildly dislike Heineken.  Too metally and "macro"-y, like a Dutch Budweiser
A Lager that thinks it’s a metallic cider and priced about the same.  How novel!

When I was in Amsterdam, I drank this stuff like water.  I don’t know why, it just seemed to taste better over there.  It was probably just because Amsterdam was awesome and I associate the beer with it.  Not my favorite, a step up from the Buds, Millers, ect., but IMO too expensive for what you get.

Heineken is just not interesting at all.
Of course it goes down (as we say in Denmark), but that’s just not enough.
(too) Easy to drink. The pure hoppy taste is ok.
skunky with soem hop profile. Better than MBC, but not good. Metallic with some skunky malts and a touch of hops. Blah, blah, trendy, blah.

Faint hoppy aroma then smells kind of like alcohol too.  White head disappears fast on top of the carbonated gold beer. Not too bad taste, hit more in the middle and end, is bitter, with slightly bitter aftertaste and short to medium finish.  Feels a little strange in my mouth.  Overall pretty good for a widely distributed session beer.  I don't think I will be drinking too much of this otherwise.

What can one say about Heineken that everybody doesn’t already know? It’s drinkable and better than some stuff. Alot of people really seem to think it’s a great beer. I think it’s alright but never buy it, I only have it when others buy it.
This is a great beer, one of the most widely consumed beverages worldwide, with great reason.

(on bottle)a very hard metallic nose hits at first encounter.When I drink it, it´s very heavy carbonation makes my stomak feel gassy afetr two sips. Iritates my palate, finishes very metallic again. Not my favorite...
Smells skunky and tastes skunky. A bit of bitterness. More skunky than bitter i guess. Not that bad, not that great. I like it.

Sort of refreshing...yellow, skunky...I guess they use all the ingredients in the commercial description...I would rather drink this than have my genitals kicked...I guess...wait, how many do I get to drink?
Good looking beer, one of the most common availible.  An excellent flavor for such a popular beer.
Golden color, light weak hoppy aroma and taste, light body, light watery finish.
Why does every Heineken I’ve ever had in the US taste skunked?  The version they serve in Thailand is better, just.
Because it is available just about everywhere and is comparably cheap to the higher rated beers, i’d say this is a good beer.  Gimme a six pack of this and I won’t complain

A decent beer that is available everywhere, yet is better than the American macro lagers.  While not a great beer, serves its purpose as a gateway beer for newcomers to better beer and as a cost effective mid-range beer.
this and becks taste so much a like, to be honest i probably wouldn’t be able to tell the difference between the two of these, some hoppy taste to it, light aroma....an ok brew.
Grassy smell.  I’m fond of the bitter taste. Easily accessible.  Not bad. A good ocasional buy.

Yellow/gold color with a small white head. Has a somewhat skunky/musty
aroma. Flavor is skunky also with just
a touch of hops. Is it a bad bottle or is it supposed to taste like that?

Ew, I forgot how terrible it tastes, even when cold.  It tastes light but isn’t, and has a dominating syrupy sweetness that beleaguers the tounge.  Just terrible to drink, unless its all you got and you’re shooting to get drunk.... but even then, I’d watch later for the body damage.
Heinken Lager is sold in the Netherlands as Heineken Pilsener. It is a simple beer.

A true yuppie beer. This is way too expensive for what you get. What you get is a lager that my dog won’t drink. Thankfully she likes IPAs! It has this skunk flavor I can’t get over. I’ll pass on this stuff. A notch above the usual crap though.

aroma: skunk  taste: same
but i feel like a pretentious yuppie when drinking it so that is a plus
obviously great marketing
pours a nice head but is gone in a flasd. aroma is a little pissy,and the taste is rather bland,,your average corner store beer.
Smells so skunky I can’t hardly drink it.  I thought that maybe this batch was bad and someone had poorly handled it.  Nope.  Every batch smells like a skunks rear end.  Awful.

The wise man said: "Pours a yellow color with a medium white head. This beer brings back memories of college. I used to drink this stuff then wake up in my roomates bed. Not sure what it is about this beer but it makes me a wee bit crazy. Anyway, it has a metallic aroma and a flavor to match. The body is fizzy and cheap feeling. I can’t believe I actually liked this beer. Ugh!"
Bottled.  One of my favorite standards.  Golden, non-descript, fizzy.  Decent mouthfeel, light flavor, although the flavor present it kind of hinting at yeast, but kind of barley...session beer.

pours yellow with a white head that vanishes quickly. smells like a bud or similar macro. has more flavor than aroma suggests, but then again the aroma suggests no flavor. sour barley taste that is not overly offensive. i can’t think of anything that stands out as overly good or bad about this.

Can (keg can, how cute). Ok, automaticaly loses points for the cutesy can. On to the taste...Nose is nothing special, kinda corny and sweet. First flavor notes are cardboard, staleness, and (seriously) soy sauce. Watery, and bland, and they try to cover the blandness with over hopping. A poor attempt at masking a crap taste with too many hops. Makes Grolsch taste like ambrosia. Finishes bitter and still stale.

Pale gold with a decent head.  Aromas are sweet and sugary with corn, grain and metal.  Flavours are sweet and syrupy for a lager, although some floral hops are present, too.  No great aftertaste but this is basic and inoffensive.
Poor head and colour. Did it taste anything? A sweet, light aftertaste. Good as a thirst quelcher.

You have to be in the mood for something sweet. This beer tastes like sugar water. It has something more that can be strangely addictive at times. More often than not it is a poor choice, however sometimes its taste may fit your fancy.
This beer is one that really seems to vary depending upon something. Sometimes I love it and sometimes it just isnt right.
A mid range beer.  Nothing fancy or special, but never a bad choice.  A good full flavor, but still sharp and crisp when cold.  Not my first choice, but I’d never be unhappy with one.

Pours a yellow color with a medium white head.  This beer brings back memories of college.  I used to drink this stuff then wake up in my roomates bed.  Not sure what it is about this beer but it makes me a wee bit crazy.  Anyway, it has a metallic aroma and a flavor to match.  The body is fizzy and cheap feeling.  I can’t believe I actually liked this beer.   Ugh!
Pours Yellow...little head.  I guess I would drink it over Miller and MGD but that’s not saying much.

I can’t believe i have not rated this yet.  Pours yellow with a big white head.  Skunky green bottles that we all know and love.  Its heineken..nothing special. I love when you go to a resturant and this is the "premium" beer.
I thought Europeans were supposed to know beer better than us?  So why is this beer popular?  I have no idea.

So many beers taste similar to this skunky, mass produced brew.  Lump all your moosehead, molson, etc together.  Thin, fizzy, with a nasty aftertaste.  Its better than some beers, but worse than most.
Bottle - Pale yellow in color with a thin white head.  Skunky aroma (green bottle??).  Not a very good beer; not sure why it is popular.
This beer is not one of my favorites.  It is very light with a pale color and a white head.  Sweet aroma.

You know you’re in trouble when this is the best beer at the bar. From the aroma you might guess that a baby skunk is floating inside that bottle. That is impressive. I have to admit, there is some kind of magic appeal in that aroma (I didn’t say it was good). Flavor features moderate sweetness by way of adjuncts mixed with sharp skunk bitterness. Very lightweight body. Brings shame to the lager family. Just ever so slightly drinkable. And in no way is this a pilsener.
Big Can.  Slight bready aroma.  Taste is sweet, weith an unpleasant metallic aftertaste.  At least its unskunky in can form.
Not the greatest beer in the world, but not terrible either. Good now and then for a change of pace. Better with food to cheat the bitterness of it.

Back in the day, when we didn’t have a great selection at Brewers Retail, you could go to the Liquor Control Board in Ontario and find some gems ... this was one of them. It was won of the first imported beer that I had tried in Canada, and I was surprised by the skunkiness (which I find refined) and great body and after-taste. I think it has become one of the most popular beer in the world for a reason - as well, from what I understand, many breweries in other countries, have modeled their own fine lagers after the taste, body and flavour of Heineken.

Good pilsener. Easy to drink. Slighty sweet. Very light. Good head but does not stay very long. Easy to drink and one of the easiest beers to drink cool on tap. Very pleasant soft aftertaste that leaves you wanting another. Excellent beer for bars, parties and terrases.
Decent good pilsener. No specific charactaristics apart from the image. Good with a sunny day in the garden.

Pours very pale yellow colour with a descent Head. The Scent is pronounced with a bit of a Skunky Aroma with a yeasty Staley Hint. Not abhorrent at all and kinda pleasing in a Rustic Pastoral sense. The Flavour is of a mixture of sweet malt Liqour and some hops. The Head dissipates quickly and there is virtually no lacing to speak. This beer does not let up any thinner than it already is so one can rest assured that you can pour a large glass full and enjoy the Dutch Treat till the finish. This beer is not one that I will purchase on my own volition lest its given to me, but one beer that for Nostalgic’s sake I will never turn down. It has been a part of my Youthful Indiscretions and it will always have a place in my heart. Salud!

Pours a light green color, like green lemonade.  There are more things about this beer that I don’t like than I do.  The initial aroma and taste is terrible, but gets a little better throughout.  One of the worst in my opinion.
I don’t see the allure. It’s a decent brew, but has a skunky smell and isn’t that flavorful for the price. It is smooth and light, though, so it does have its good points. Very overrated, though.
i like this beer. granted its overrated and overpriced but still a good beer.
Nope, not a fan of the brew at all. Pours a straw golden yellow with an off-white head. Skunky aroma. Taste is very lightly malty and hoppy. Boring, forgettable and overrated.
Very light, almost clear, for some reason my friends really like this.  It was bad, but I have had worse.

My second forced down pint at bar with no selection.  Had only had it in the bottles before - aroma not nearly as skunky on draught.  Still, very pale colour, thin body and no discernable taste to speak of - slightly bitter I suppose, but only in a sour sort of way.  Worst beer I have had on tap in a long time – I’d rate in below some national mass market stuff.
Hardly a step up from American macrobrews in taste, but will cost you much more.  If you want this taste, stick with Original Coors or Miller High Life - they’re cheaper.
ok, ok its skunky.  But it still has great flavor after a few gulps.  Absolutely superior to any domestic Lager.  The keg can is genious marketing.
i thought it would be alot better, but a skunk must of taken a dump in it while i wasnt looking

This beer possesses the "skunk" aroma common to lagers of many mid-northern European countries. The clear difference is that that element also dominates the _taste_ of this beer perhaps more than any other. Heineken scores a minor positive for some pronounced hop bitterness. However, with all the choices out there I think I’ll avoid these well-known green glass bottles. Maybe if I visit Holland I’ll give it a try, since I’ve heard that "it’s so much better over there". As it stands, even with the skunk this has been many an American’s first sample of "higher quality beer" and as such even the skunk might taste good in comparison to the typical American swill!
Run of the mill.  Grassy and slightly skunky.  Better than American macro’s when no other choice is available.

Even out a vending machine, in Holland this beer is indeed a different brew to the insipid muck available elsewhere. The bottled variety is even better. It's a refreshing beer that,even when chilled cold, has a hint of citrus in it. Better lagers, for sure, but not bad at 4 in the morning when the vending machine runs out of coke

Bottle/Can.  Fruity, slight floral barley malt aroma.  Golden color with large head.   Mildly sweet creamy barley malt and mildly bitter hay flavor.  A much better beer when you get it fresh in the Netherlands versus the usual light-struck American version.   Really a nice light beer in its home country. / 11-20-16 - Mexico City Edition - Mildly skunked but otherwise the same - wonder if they did that on purpose?
This beer tastes skunk from the get go. It's watered down and overpriced. Waste of time.

It taste decent when chilled and iced correctly, but this beer WILL skunk up FAST if not properly refrigerated.  And when that happens, it is the wrost of the skunk down to the smell!!  better than Bud, Miller, or Coors tho.

In the great realm of beers, Heineken isn't even near the tops. But I will say this. If I'm at a bar with no microbrews, 9 out of 10 times I'll order a heineken. Why? Because it's better than bud or any of the other watered down American bigs. I like it as a solid choice. But a couple of notes: This beer smells like ass, unlike it's taste. If the temperature is changed too much with Heineken it will skunk faster and worse than you can ever imagine. And skunked Heineken is probably the worst things in the world.

Bottled From local bodega my ratings for this beer are basied on that when i do get it it’s sold ice cold out the freezer. i think it’s the only way to drink it . Above about 40 dergees it is vile and skunky. and yeah  a million times better on tap
re rate: this kinda sucks
Another 'premium' lager that is more advertising than anything else.  Its a bit on the grassy side.  Its better than Bud I guess, but not as much as people seem to think.

I know people that absolutely rave about this beer.  I don't get it.  To me, it tastes really unbalanced, astringent, and odd.  There is some aroma, flavor, and finish to this, but I just don't care for it at all.
When you can find an unskunked one, this lager is pretty good. Very light tasting, good for barbeques or after mowing the lawn. Needs a little more malt character.
Definately one of the best.  Its a little pricy, but looks great and has a nice taste.  Would definately buy again
Two 12 oz bottles while waiting for AAA tow truck.  Been a couple of years since I had one of these.  Dinged for green bottle.  Nicely hopped, served cold, this goes down good on a warm afternoon.
Es la cerveza estandar. No esta mal, pero tampoco es una maravilla, eso si la encontraras en cualquier sitio
I'd rather have this than a bud or something cheap like that, but still a below average somewhat skunky beer with good advertising. Nothing special about this one.
Has a unique taste to it, it's a the a heineken taste that I have never really seemed to catch on the tongue. Looks guds with a light aroma. It has big following which makes me anjoy it at times.

On that rare occaision in the states when you can find this lager unexposed to light, it's not too bad. In fact, you see the balanced flavor that the maker intended. Sharp up front with a leveling maltiness to wind it out. Unfortunately, most Heineys that I've put my lips on taste a little skunky (hee, hee).

Bottle – Poured a blond type brew with minimal head with below standard retention. Aroma is in part skunky with some touch of malt. Carbonation is below average. Taste is really light with again that bit of skunky taste coming out. Overall, this is not a great beer but [probably on the same level as those American macros and I also believe we don’t get the same version they produce overseas which is probably a shame.

Not a phenomenal lager, although far superior to Canadian and American macro-brews. Simply, my favorite beer to drink. Aroma undeniably "skunky;" head remarkably thin. Mouth-feel is refreshing, if strong and hoppy, with a distinctly soured aftertaste. Complements pizza and chinese food well.

It's too easy to bash this beer.  Heineken isn't anything special - fake feeling carbonation, mild flavour with the slightest hint of hops - but there's certainly a lot worse out there.  Compare Heineken to your standard Canadian or American macro and you'll see what I mean.  At least Heineken will remind you of a good beer.

Bottled, Pasteurised. Pale yellow with bubbly head. Pungent aroma before even getting close to the nose, had to fight past this to get a carbonated mess of a malt beer. My tongue was attacked throughout the beer leaving a sour aftertaste. Not for beer lovers I think.

I simply hate to do this. This review is not a fluke. Pours yellow, quick dissipating head, without a trace of lace after a few minutes. Beer shouldn't smell this bad, besides the "skunk", it smells like I lit a match in the room. Crispy snap in the mouth, with the skunk just about destroying anything going on underneath and lingering around just long enough to kill any finish. It is one of the worst beers I have ever had. If I can't finish the glass...well...it's horrid IMO not just "awful." A mistake and an insult

Slightly skunky smell, not too much head when poured in a glass. This beer, however, is best served straight from the bottle. Best served quite cold.  Overall taste is quite good, is non-offensive in anyway, and good to the last sip.  Not the best beer I've ever had, but a decent green bottle brew

(Canned, 4.5% ABV, BBE 03/2006) Paleish golden color with a medium, foamy head. Mild, slightly buttery and corny aroma with metal and toffee hints. Sugary-sweet, corny-malty flavor with a somewhat bitter (kitkerä!) feel. Light-bodied, although not watery, acidic and foamy-carbonated palate. Reminds me of some less impressive, light Swedish lagers.(Bottled, BBE 12/2004, rated Mar 22, 2004, same score) Paleish lager color, medium, foamy head. Quite offensive, hoppy aroma - slightly skunky. Harsh, hoppy-bitter flavor with very little malt. Light-bodied, carbonated, crisp and reasonably refreshing palate. A good-quality but mostly watery and tasteless, although crisp and reasonably hopped lager. Not well-balanced.

Unfortunately, the friend who bought the six-pack mildly ridiculed me when I reached for a glass, so I had it straight out of the bottle. Didn't smell like much and didn't taste like much except an initial bready smoothness. Maybe there are some nuances waiting behind the bread, and further sips will bring these out? Nope. Instead, the skunk came out as the beer warmed. Next time, I'll buy.

While being faced with a choice of drinking no beer, Heineken, or a US macro, I’d always choose Heineken. That’s what I did last night, and what I got was a nondememo  Euro Lager with no overly offensive characteristics. Pale clear color with bubbly artificial carbonation. Thin white head is very short lived. Aroma is clean to grassy with little touch of hops, and due to the bottle having been protected no skunk. Taste is dominated by grainy malts, but is not sweet like a US brewed macro lager. Body is also more substantial than the big three US products and does not project a watered down cheap image. A note of what I think was fusel alcohol became pronounced as the beer warmed up, resulting in the mouthfeel becoming harsh. Drinkability is quite good and beats the other choices mentioned above any day.
this is a doable macro beer in my opinion.  It is after all the number 1 import for europe.  When its nice and cold it isn't so bad
