another "green bottle" beer. very tin like flavor to it. much better in the tap, i said much better, i didnt say good. it is way overrated in my opinion. i will only get this at the bar if its the last one on my list(so i can keep away from bud or miller or whatnot). dont buy into the media hype, very overrated skunky beer. i think you would be better off saving a couple bucks and getting hollandia. just my 2 cents

Canned
Pale yellow with small white head. Sweet light malt aroma. Taste is very typical "American standard" or lager: metallic malt and very small hint of hops. Very watery.

16 oz. can. What was I thinkin'?  Pours light, clear golden with a small white head that falls quickly to a ring of bubbles around the rim of the glass.  Mild malty aroma with just a hint of the skunk.  Flavor is sweet and thin with a metallic hoppy finish.  Light body and significant carbonation.  To think, I once believed the Heineken myth and the advertising that would have us believe this is a quality beer...
The overall flavor and aftertaste is slightly bitter and weak, yet I still find myself buying a six pack when there are no good imports to chose from.

The only reason IM drinking this is that it was the most decent beer at the concert last night. Bodily evacuation fluid colour with skunkorama nose. The skunk sprays in your mouth initailly, but then leaves to yield some of the malts and nice dry hops... i still would like to try a fresh heineken to know what is its real taste.

I hate this crap. It does have some taste to it, unfortunately the taste is that of tin foil with a minimal beer flavor. Another green-bottle skunk-brew with which to fill my trash can. Anyone know why all the green-bottles taste like aluminum?? The excessive metallic taste is far to common between them to be a coincidence.

This beer is decent, but nothing to go out of your way for. Like so many other beers out there, it just lacks distinction. 'Unsurpassed clarity' it says in the commercial description - I heartily disagree.
I can taste the flavor of not quite ripe hops in water. One of the worst beers I've had

The old standby at many a bar, this beer really is more interesting then most US domestic macros, but not very good compared to what's available here.  It's pale yellow color and thin white head make it look like most cheap domestics.  The aroma is really faint, you can almost sense some malt if you wish for it hard enough.  The flavor is sweet, with a nice dry finish, that's the only reason i've drank it all these years i guess.  Not very great, but i'll probably always order one once in a while.
Heineken appears to be a cheap light beer, but it suddenly awakens the taste buds with a crisp flow.
Hard to find fresh in the US but when you do find it you will enjoy.  Good even taste with good carbonation and appearance.

As you open the bottle, a skunky smell greets you. Nice golden and heavily bubbled beer that lacks anything that looks like brew. Probably the most overrated beer on the market. Only ignorant or brainwashed people can believe that this low quality macro stands a thousand miles above north-american industrial lagers. Actually it's closer to real beer, but not that much...

One of my faves and with all the recent Australian Open promotion here in Melbourne it was hard to find a place without the brew. I like it and always will I suppose. Its fresh, clean and tastes of Europe. No tartness here.
Had this right after Beck's and realized this is the inferior of the two.Aroma and flavor were seriously skunked,skunked and skunked.Body was thin and this lacked anything really special.

Ah, the poster child of the skunky green bottle brew. Funny how you order something in a bar that they don't have, the always say "But we have Heineken." Like that's a good thing? Skunky, watery and metalic tasting. I still have one every once in a while, even though I know better.
Slightly fruity with hops.  Golden, sparkling hue.  Bitter taste with a hint of smoke.  Dry palate.

bottled: not good in the US anyway.  and most markets promote it as an import just to raise the price. adjunct city, corn. and alway skunky. never had this on tap. going to holland this summer maybe ill try it.
Nasty commercial beer. Smells bad, tastes bad and it's not particularily cheap.
Light colored lager with a head that dies quickly. Weak and watery with a bit of a kick in the finish.

Rare to find one that isn't skunked. Might be drinkable if they'd put the damn thing in a dark bottle. It's a malty beer when you try to taste through the skunk. Some metallic things happening in there that are rather unpleasant as well.
Why do people bring me this for parties?  Time to stop the BYOB policy!Metallic and Thin. Bad bite and high skunk factor = NOT good.

Not as full-flavoured as I oncce remembered, but it's invigorating taste will delight the cold-filtered-loving set.
Spanner.

Golden yellow, with fluffy head that shrinks quicker than Rick Moranis' kids.

Smell is a bit skunky, but somehow, I don't mind it that much.

Taste is on the skunky side too, but not overwhelming like some skunky beers can be (see Crapona, err Corona).

Nothing special about Mr. Mouthfeel.

Pretty clear stuff; no head...this looked rather like apple juice.

It has that weird Dutch flavour/aroma which I can't put my finger on but these are nowhere near as evident as they are in many similiar beers.

Basically this has been brewed in order to convince the masses of their being chic.

Far from "bad" but also far from "great".
Drinkable.
Well, what can I say about this one.  Why is this so popular?  All I got out of it was a really bad metallic taste and skunk.  No good at all.

Tap pour. Clear, and virtually without carbonation. Little to no aroma. At least nothing stands out. It smells somewhat like beer. It also smells somewhat like nothing. Used to fill out the import selection. Hey, people know the name. Very flat in taste. A little bit of late hoppy malt nothingness. Popular. When I close my eyes and really think about what I'm drinking I see (1) a hulking macro brewery import surcharge, and (2) A bunch of Netherlanders rolling around on a pile of money. Keep up the good work.

Hoppy... similar to Becks, but with a bit less favour. Light yellow in colour, and not much head. I liked this beer when I was younger, but now I feel like I (along with my taste buds) have grown past this one.
Not too bad. Despite what others say, preferable to a lot of beer you seen at college.  I liked the bit of bite.  Drink it cold to avoid the skunk.
Before the great beer rage sat in, this was as fancy as things could get in Denmark when it came to foreign beers. Happily things have changed, and to day one can get plenty of better lagers.
Not a very good beer. It was just way to skunky. Any flavor or aroma was dominated by the skunky taste. I will never order this one again.

Not anything outstanding, but around my arean this is some high quality stuff, you order one of these people raise thier eye brows.  not what the drunks drink.  if there is no becks i can stomach this stuff. the two are somewhat similar.

Used to be way back in my time you could look cool like Mick Jagger if you walked around a bar with one of these in your hand. That's about all it was good for back then, and today it's just not good for much. There's so much better stuff you can spend your money on. Don't fall for the marketing and the rep. Avoid.
Blond and bland. Inoffensive, but entirely lacking in character. Nothing much else to say really.
I end up getting it sometimes in the $2, 24 ounce bottles as a "backup", along with a six of something good.

the only foreign beer skunkier is grolsch.  hard to believe that i used to think this was one of the best beers out there.  wow, how i've grown to appreciate beer.  this beer does not hold a candle to the great micro-brews of today!
Before I learned too much about beer, this was my favorite beer. It's okay, but there's nothing great about it, really. Not bad either.
standard pissy color with a skunk nose.  carbonated water.  i can get some cheaper lager with basically the same taste.  you can do better for your money.
Skunky aroma frequent if not drunk from tap in Nederland. traditional pils. nice finish. refreshing

Very pale straw-coloured beer with a thin head fading to thin lace.  Has a sweet malty smell with plenty of great fruity-smelling esters.  I don’t know what the skunky smell everyone else is talking about is, I’ve never gotten that impression.  I think this is a pretty good straight-forward lager.

Truck stop men's room nose.  Initial bite of nickel finishes with clean quarter notes.  I've never had one that wasn't skunked.  What, do they store these things on the sun in their pretty green bottles.  I'd rather drink ODouls.
[bottle] Smells skunked. Even when fresh it has that bitter smell to it. Very watery and thin. Has a sour/bitter malty taste. Nothing special.

On tap. Clear and pale, not much head retention.
Aroma vaguely like a witbier (so THAT'S what it smells like unskunked!).
Flavour slightly malty, lacking any hops. Vaguely reminiscent of soda water. Thin (!) body. Avergae, but there's worse.
Watery.  Lacks body.  Skunky aroma.  Entirely forgettable and avoidable.  Adequately carbonated.

From a can. Light, highly transparent golden yellow.

Fairly watery, yet noticable malts. Nothing to get excited about, though and neither are the barely noticable hops. Little aftertaste and body, lots of carbonation.

Nothing vile, really, but not good either.

Indeed pretty skunky.  I get the feeling that it really would be a decent beer if not for the sunlight exposure (green glass).  Alas, I must rate it as it comes, and it always comes Pepe Le Peu.  Curiously, I actually dislike it on tap.  I can drink this beer, but it is rather pedestrian.

I like the skunky aroma, LOVE the bittery flavor. A good everyday beer, but not really one to get drunk on. More of a hot summer day after mowing the lawn kind of beer. I don't see why the skunk smell or flavor would be a turn off, it gets me excited and I enjoy it very much.
A bitter, bitter beer.  Not a fan of this stinky, flat, putrid offering.  Take a pass guys.

I can't believe that so many people like this skunked up piss.  Good ad campaign I guess because this is one more shitty brew in a green bottle.  Light in color, skunky in taste, skunky in smell.  NO good!
bleh.  beer for the euro creeps.  bland hoppy flavor coupled with a skunky aroma make this something to avoid

Not a bad lager when compared to the USA macro-brewers. 10 years ago, I hated this beer. Now that I have had a few more beers in my time, this isnt really bad. The aroma consists mainly of hops, and the flavor is hoppy as well. I'd easily drink this beer if given to me.
Your basic commercial beer. Very little complexity. Yeah, it's OK if it's hot and you're tired...but I'd almost rather have water.
This beer is very similar to most other commercial pilsners. Really nothing to it, very little aroma and flavor.
A nice light hop taste. Was expecting it to be skunky because of the bottle. But that wasnt the case, goes down really smooth.
A good standard beer.  Decent flavor, but just middle-of-the-road in all categories.  I like the special dark a lot more.

decent quality lager, had a few around the world cup and grew to like some of its qualities, it actually has more body than i at first appreciated, but there's no standout quality to this beer, it gets extra marks for sentimental reasons.
Some initial malt sweetness but it just doesn't hide the skunky hop smell and taste.  The only time I drink this is when it is the best of the macros a place serves.

The classic lager that I swear is so much better in the Netherlands than anywhere else in the world.  the US-import version pours dark yellow with a marshmellowy head.  It's got that Heineken-skunk smell that makes me think of green bottles.  The flavor si malty and a bit musty.  This is an OK beer, but again ... this is the nectar of the gods in Amsterdam.
I don't care for the smell of this one.  It's a good looking beer, golden with a white head.  Taste is ok but not worth going into detail.

A very watery, skunky beer that epitomizes the mass-produced lager flavor.  However, I've had this in the Netherlands and it's much better there than in the States.  Still, not much worth talking about.
This beer tastes like absolute piss.  I guess im not really a big fan of imports though.

I have a dual opinion on this one: In the UK, whether on draught, or from a bottle or can, this is not great - tasteless and sweaty; however when tried on draught in Rotterdam, this was nice - refreshing, fruity and light.  Even with this recent good experience however, Heineken is still a mass produced and bland beer, which should be despised for it's efforts to take over the world.

Super pale beer, no head. Skunky aroma, though once past this, there is some hoppinness not usually found in macro stuff. Taste is pretty non-existent, nothing happening. Skunky finish. Thin body. Really not very good at all. Bottle.
Love the fruity aroma. The flavor is light and refreshing.  In no way is it a GREAT beer, but it holds its own, and if the price was competitive it would be even more popular.

Not a bad beer of average ABV (abv is my one of my primary factors in selecting a favorite beer) but not good to drink around females, left me with some killer skunk breath, would recommend to friends though.
Must have had an above-average bottle.  A dry, lightly hopped taste was complimented by an unskunky body with a nice sweet taste to it.  Pretty enjoyable, really.

Musty straw aroma with a yellow color and white head.  Flavor is acidic and dry with a mild hint of malt and mildly odd aftertaste.  Thin palate and water mouth feel.  If you listen to all the advertising on this one you would think it is great, well it's not.

This stuff really isn't much better than the big 3 Americans,(well o.k., better than Miller) so why pay more for it. Must be an image thing. I can understand the green bottles, but how did they manage to skunk the keg cans? Has it become a signature aroma? This and Corona are called American beers in eastern European bars. Gotta love advertising.
Better than the american standard lagers I know, but still pretty watery with no distinctive taste. Luckily the beer wasn´t skunky, despite the green bottle. For a lager, it´s ok.
Better than most beers it shares the shelf w/, but barely.  Light lager, with short lasting head.  Not too different from Bud.  This can't be what Hollands known for.
I first started drinking beer on a trip to Europe.  I tried this stuff because I thought it was top European beer.  So little did I know.  Smells of a skunk and has the flavor to match.
When I first tried this beer, I loved it, then I discovered Becks, but it still has a certain nostalgic value to me.
Becks is better and Warsteiner blows this away. It’s an ok beer, but not worth all the hype. Does anyone smell a skunk???

Ok second green monster from The Netherlands,,this time I splashed out on the 24 oz bottle.
The beer pours a rather dull lackluster yellowish..nice head ..pure white..that goes fast.
The aroma was not too good I can smell some hops but the overall impression is of boiled cabbage for some reason.
Taste is much more watery than Grolsch..its sweetat the beginning and just trails off at the end non of the nice smooth bitterness I got in Grolsch.
Average as can be on the tongue..It is a clean beer.
Not too drinkable..but its not horrid.
EDIT REVIEW: after having tasted this beer in a can..much better.
Bottle: From all mass market beers this one is slightly above average and probably the best you´ll find in most restaurants.
A good lager that finishes cleaner than many. Has a huge price tag on it though...
Very ordinary beer. The succes is based on good marketing. Drinkable, but so insipid...

like, i've heard so many cooool things about this dee-vine beer, i just had to give it a try. i mean, i usually like a lite sauvignon blanc; and, well, beer in general just has too many carbohydrates, don't you think? but it's bright green bottle is SO chipper and happy and inviting, as lush as little spring peas!  not like those  grumpy old brown bottles like all the other expensive beers have.  and it's from holland where they have all those darling windmills and wooden shoes, right? heineken! it's like heidi and munchkin rolled into one!  too cute!  who can resist something so exotic and rich and extravagant?  i mean, six-fifty a six pack!  are you seeeerious?!, that's a-LOT for beer, helloo?!?  so, what ELSE must i say for your silly "rating"?  let's see... aroma? oh, i don't know, i'm not going to be seen sniffing everything like i'm a pack animal, it smells fine, leave it at that.  appearance?  mercy, i already said it was beautiful green. flavor? okay, let's see, it's sparkly and not very sweet, like coke or a blush wine is-- and it makes me burp like a drunken sailor for pete's sake. and, well, gross out a little bit: it's like uncooked spagetti and frosted flakes!  aftertaste is like i've been licking stamps all afternoon.  you know, i'm not sure i really like these fancy beers.  maybe i'm not cut out for beer or your serious beer website which is (yawn) just about beers and not webcams or current events or pretty pictures.  please, don't get up.  i'll find my own way out.
Pour pale yellow.  Very skunky aroma.  Slight sweet start with very little bitternes.  A small but unpleasant aftertaste.  A watered down subpar lager.
Strongly skunked aroma. Anemic fully diminishing head on clear yellow body. Mild sweet malt and gentle bitterness. Light effervescent body. Bottle (green).
Looking at the commercial description, I agree with the phrase "pure water" completely.
I'll take it over a Bud any day.  The aroma is  a bit skunky.  Appearance is bla.  Well carbonated somewhat malty flavors.  Drinkable, if it's my only choice.
Thought this is what stong European beer was all about in my younger days. Had an ok aroma, a nice sweet malty first taste, then bam US macro nothingness. Rate slightly ahead of US big three
Well it went down alright it wasn't that flash, didn't smell that great and not much taste but I finished it up easily enough.
A little more taste than  the typical megabrew.  But not much, and certainly not enough to make it more than a 2.  Typial color, typical skunky smell, typical lack of character.
Light golden color with a small white head. Taste is water with notes of malts and hops.

Heineken pours with an average size white, foamy head that diminishes quickly.  Body is Clear(filtered) and golden colored.  Light to moderate malty aroma (light bread, grain).  Slightly sweet, and very slightly bitter flavor, does not finish with much flavor.  Light to medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation.  Overall not one of my favorite beers, but still at least average for its comparable style and market.
Typial mainstream beer.  Good carbonation.  Not as skunky as Becks.  Flavor just isn't there with this beer, might as well buy Budweiser.

I got drunk on this once and I will never do that again! This beer gives great hangovers and if that's what you're into then I highly recommend it; for the rest of us I suggest drinking a wino's urine before Heineken. One possible exception is if it is ice cold. I built a snowman in Brooklyn, New York last February and since this was all there was to drink I did have a few. I buried the bottle in the snow between gulps and kept it icy the entire time. I won't say I liked it but it was not that bad. I have had worse beers but not many. When poured into a glass it looks pretty good and has a foamy white head that tends to stick around for a while. I think there is an overwhelming hop flavor in this beer and it is not the good kind of hop flavor. I am not sure if they use malt or gym socks to brew this but if they do use malt then it is not very tasty malt. My first impression was that the beer was stale. I have come to understand that stale beer is the normal Heineken flavor. I just hope Jelly Belly never tries to copy this beer as a jelly bean.
I honestly dont comprehend how people can deem this beer to be 100x better than any cheap beer. it's pretty pathetic.

Pours a pale yellow with white head that quickly diminishes. Plenty fizzy. Aroma and flavor are about like most big brewery beers. A little more citrus in this than American macros, but still leaves much to be desired, especially for the price paid.  Definitely toward the lower end of my list.
Why is this beer so popular?? Ill admit it's not terrible, but still unremarkable.

A beer designed for mainstream success.  It delivers somewhat of what you expect; easy down the throat, a hint of sweetness thanks largely to a big dollop of malt.  Not bad but for the price of it down here ya dreamin mate. cheers
More hoppy than the average American Lager.  Otherwise... why drink it?  It's cheaper to buy Bud or Miller or something fairly similar.

Very overpriced for a quite standard lager. No aroma at all, but a little fruity and malty and a strange but pleasant aftertaste. Quite hoppy get it on tap over the stubbie or can if possible. Very overpriced so not worthwhile. Easy to give up on as it doesnt meet its expectations.
No real smell, a nice gold appearance and a reasonable flavour.  Its available everywhere and is actually quite drinkable.  Not too bad but slight chemical aftertaste

The bottle I had was fairly crisp and devoid of skunk - I guess this one had minimal exposure to sunlight. The two most obvious traits to me were significant carbonation and the presence of corn. Good to cleanse your palate (as long as its fairly cold) but nothing to get excited about.

Bottled. Well, it was being served at a reception so it was free, which is about the right price. Yes, it does skunk  up in the green bottle, doesn’t it. Pours a very thin head that’s gone immediately. There’s a noticeable touch of maltiness at least. No hops. Hard to believe, but this was still better than the 3 Horses I had a few weeks before.<hr>Rating from draft, 9/10/05.Okay, I found a bar that was serving Heinie from InBev’s "PerfectDraft" system, using those 5 l minikegs, with a nice Belle-Epoque steel tap handle. Thinks, "a chance to fairly review an unskunked Heieken." So I ordered a draft in an appropriate .3 l tulip glass. What do I get?

A slightly deeper gold lager color than I expected. A frothy head that thins quickly. But I still can’t find anything resembling a "taste." Almost a total lack of malts and a very slight bitter "tone" instead of bitter"ness." Nothing "off" about it, but also nothing that makes me want another. True "barley pop." No reason to change my rating.

Typical. Everyone is brought up to believe that Heineken is a premium beer. It really does suck but about once every year I have a craving for one or two. I used to steal them from my sister when I was underage. Skunked usually.

I know. It is yuppie beer. But at least give it chance. I did. If I was on an island and a keg of Heineken washed up would I drink it? Yes. But we are not on an island, and there are SO many choices out there for a good light colored beer: move on!
It is “okay”. That is all you can say. No head. No lacing. No aroma. Just a mouthful of light maltless beer.

Can. Light golden color with a good head on it and highly carbonated. Not much of a smell to it. The first hit to the tongue isn't the most pleasing, but otherwise the flavor isn't bad - a fruity/malty taste. Finished fairly cleanly, but there's a hint of an aftertaste that's not the most pleasant. If it wasn't so carbonated, the beer would be much better. The carbonation just gets in the way of an otherwise ok lager.

(keg-style can) Corn and yeast sweetness in the aroma. Pours a golden yellow, flat with little carbonation. Body is weak with little malt to speak of. Flavour is dominated by corn tastes and alcohol. Becomes less desirable as it warms up. Other than the packaging, which is pretty cool, not much to get excited about.

The bottles that I bought came wrapped, I assume from the factory, in a plastic (coloured) wrapper, which will prevent, or greatly reduce the effects of light strike on this beer.  The arome was pleasant enough, but a little lacking in both malt and hop notes, just a promise to be a non-threatening type of lager.  Pour was great, with a nice tight head, nice pale gold colour, and a good degree of carbonation.  Flavour followed on from the aroma, nothing out of place, but nothing to set this beer above the host of others on the market.  A bit light and bland on the palate.  Not worth premium money, but a very acceptable brew.

Can.  Medium yellow, fizzy, retained touch of head.  Smells a bit of corn even though there isn’t any in here.  Not much else in the aroma department.  More taste than Bud, but I would have sworn that there used to be more hops in this beer.  RERATE:  3/21/10 - I bumped it up a bit because there really wasn’t anything wrong here - just not a whole lot right either.  Corn note probably from DMS, faded over time as it left the glass.  Basic impression otherwise the same.  Maybe paler than I had recalled.

Bottled. An over-rated, over-priced beer which was highly skunked due to the green bottle.  I will never buy another one of these beers unless they start using brown bottles.  I am tired of buying beers in green and clear bottles because the light MAKES THEM SKUNKY!  Can't the breweries hear this?

If this were a rating based upon kegged beer then it would be totally different.WHY do beer companies insist on GREEN BOTTLES? Yes the average American finds cache with beers such as Heineken but it's because of the name. Please,any marketing powers that may be reading these reviews throw us a bone and put Euro-beer in BROWN bottles. The trendies will still buy because it's Heinekin and the discerning non-sheep will get to enjoy a decent Lager. 
RATING: good on tap, skunky in the GREEN $&*#@ bottle.
Light golden in color with a white head.  Tate is below averarge.  A step or two above a Bud or Miller beer.
Light gold, white head. Some floral hops. Pretty light. Beware the green bottle though; it tends to get skunky.

Light golden in color with a mild head.  Strong wheat/barley scent (too strong) which carried over and  detracted from a nice bitter flavor.  An acceptable brew, but far too pricey for my tastes (and wallet.)
Very bland inoffensive danish beer.Some slight hop character,light on flavour.
Bottle. Blond color. Skunky smell. Good taste. Not a bad beer but way overpriced. Generally more expansive than some other better import.
Bottle. Golden coloured, more malt than many macros. Enough bitterness to be nice. Pretty average. Bonus point for being served backstage at the VIP area of a Blue Rodeo concert!
Clear and crisp golden yellow lager with no taste to speaking about. Neutral aroma, high carbonation. A beer 2 forget.
Nothing special. One step above a bud light. Overly wheaty flavor. The most over-rated beer I have ever consumed.
Blond color. Light honeyish aroma. Watery body, quite strong bitterness, maybe too much.

This brew poured a medium head of fine to large sized mostly diminishing white bubbles and a carbonated straw yellow colored body.  It has a mild malt hop aroma, a fizzy mouthfeel and a mild malt hop flavor.  The best thing about this brew was the facte that we had gotten a first class upgrade on on plane trip and was able to drink several of these for free!
Ok, I tried one and was underwhelmed.  Citrus aroma and flavor are the beers most prominent features, not to mention its advertising campaign.
Skunky taste that lingered forever. I found it way to carbonated for my liking.

You know, there’s just something cool about having a green bottle of Heineken in your hand. While that "cool" is obviously the result of clever branding, this beer actually is a touch better than average when it comes to substance. Very light yellow in colour, the pour is about as headless as an enemy of Louis XVI during the French Revolution. An abundance of confectionery sugar fills the nose, rounded out by traces of skunk, cellophane and honey. The instant the liquid hits the lips, there’s a spine-tingling, thirst-quenching liveliness that follows through to the finish, with good balance and savoury effects such as white rice and cereal. A dependable guzzler, Heineken’s a pretty good beer to order at a bar or restaurant, but its lofty price tag isn’t worth the green if you’re taking it behind closed doors.

I like it, used to like it more when it wasnt so damn commercial.
I still cant figure out what that taste is though that seems to linger on and on and on
I could choose heineken over a lot of other beers. I really like the name "Heineken", it just sounds kinda cool. Otherwise, i think it's sort of average and not as great as some people say it is.

In all fairness, a decent continental lager. Similar to St. Pauli's Girl except not as good. Now the drawbacks - Heineken has a terrible head, is overcarbonated  and  is generally unattractive in appearance. It's horribly overpriced and overhyped  as well. If you have money to burn on a mass-manufactured beer, buy Guinness. It's truly good instead of just decent.

Undiscernible bottling date; however, who cares? Pale golden color. Not much to recommend. I have had samples with an intense, cloying saccharine-like sweetness. However this one was just bloody awful with a hint of cooked vegetable off-flavors. Geesh.
Tried the big Heine in the can. Pale golden color. Very light bodied with a clean palate. Refreshing but fairly dry and boring.

Much better out of the tap than from the bottle, and not even worth trying out of the can.  For some reason, tastes much better in Europe than in the US.  Very good simple flavor, nothing offensive about it at all, just goes down smoothly with a nice flavoring of barley and hops.
Way overhyped as most big name brands are. Heineken just has never done it for me.

Pale yellow, bit of foam. Crisp body, grassy and slightly skunky smell, tastes a bit sweet with little to no aftertaste. An inoffensive, passable, non-horrid lager that happens to be backed by great commercials.
Everyone's tried a Heine haven't they?  Skunky yet tolerable, nice balance, easy to drink 9 or 10, even for a dumbass Budweiser apologist.  Decent beer, no complaints.
Horribly bad beer.  Bitter and horrible.  Expensive and horrible.  Skunky to the extreme and muy mal overall.
Not an awful beer, but definetly not one a sophisticated drinker would have with a meal...better suited for parties...
Aroma is more often than not skunky. Straw color, very light and refreshing. Some citrusy notes linger around in the malty taste
Urine-yellow colour. No notable aroma. Crisp, watery mouthfeel. Some fruity malt notes, but no discernable hop character. Bleh.

Tastes different than I remember from years ago.  This was the first "premium" beer that I had ever tried and I remember it being bland and slightly sweet.  The one I just tasted has light lager aroma, some hop aroma and taste, very light malt, dry aftertaste.  Mine was not skunked at all.  A decent very light styled lager, light flavors and very light hops. Not bad at all, but not somthing that I will look for.
A light pale lager. Clean taste lacks an abundance of hops in the taste of the beer.

Pale straw color with thick carbonated, quickly diminishing head; little lacing. Aroma is hoppy and skunked. Flavor is decent with some hop bitterness; skunked. Mouthfeel is fuller than expected, but still watery, and has good but not overdone carbonation. Finish is fairly clean and has a goog hop bite. Overall better than expected, but far from exceptional.
Yellow, with a shortlived foamy head. Pleasant malt nose, clean taste, but too watery. Flat aftertaste with a nice hoppy finish.

Overall I may be getting soft or somethin’, but I think this beer has improved?Nice clean bready yeasty aroma with enough hops to get the balnce going on.Mostly lively Co2,but this is crisp,clean,and whatever gets you through the night,right?I am rating the 24oz. bottle which might have a slight difference and yes it is fresh.I think I prefer this over Sam Adams BL bro.(imagine that).Either my taste in beer is very jaded or this beer has improved and slightly over-rated,but too expensive,Yes.I can deal with 2.41$ w/tax for a24oz. though for a late night jones.
Cant say antyhing good about this one. Smells skunky, tastes skunky (green bottles!!!) makes you feel skunky. A drain pour. I refuse to try this again.

Popping the cap releases Heineken’s distinct skunk cloud every time. Tastes bland and watery at first, becoming more skunky tasting as the film builds. Smells like the floor of a country club. How actual malt and hops can be used to produce a beverage (and so many others) like this is beyond me. It’s perplexing to think of all the profit made from this product. Great marketing!
A light golden pour with a foamy white head. You can clearly taste the malt and rice in this beer. I used to really like this but it kind of gets old after a while.
Is this a beer? I thought it was dirty water. It´s just like drinking yellow soda, it is tasteless. The only reason why people drink it is the huge amount of money that heineken spends in comercials.

Yuk Why would people drink something like this? Their commercial description:  100% Barley malt, choice hops and pure water give this brew unsurpassed clarity.... water is clear too and doesn't give you a hangover.

Pale lager, very limpid. I didn't notice any skunk aroma nor taste. Hidden aroma of malt and cereals. Refreshing taste of cereals and ... water:) 
An honest bitterness puts it more into the pilsner category for me. It's very simplistic, but remains a beer I'd appreciate immensely after a beach volleyball game. Must be drunk cold, goes down well, calm the thirst (what else can you ask). Note: It seemed to me the can version showed a bigger hops presence

Probably the beer I've drank more than any other, thanks to the old college days. On draught in Haarlem. Clean aroma, some malt and hop. Classic spicy hoppiness in finish. Usually rated very low, but is actually a very nice lager. Come on folks!

Nothing special here I can't believe i've never rated this brew i drank enough of it in my younger years trying to look cool.I'm feeling much better now,and this is not a cool brew bad skunky taste mild hops mild hop after taste just a run of the mill brew with little to offer.
The usual utter garbage euro lager people drink because they figure they are onto something you simply can't understand. Filth of the highest order.

Typical light golden color with a small white head. The aroma was almost non-existent...some slight malty sweetness. The flavor wasn't all that bad...some decent malty sweetness...no skunk, but some not-so-good hops bitterness. Watery, thin feel with too much carbonation.
Can. Skunky smell and sour skunky taste. Thin watery body. Nasty. I can't think of s single good thing to say about this beer.

Green bottle is mistake number one, followed by extreme carbonation which led to an interesting and disappointing experience. It was OK, it was expensive, and it left me underwhelmed. I do not know why people spend the money on this product, perhaps it is a signal beer that tells the world that the drinker has little to no clue about beer. Skunky finish, and over carbonation make Heineken very pedestrian and mediocre.
Incredible that a so bad tasting beer can be so popular and well known over the world!

Status symbol. Hey look at me I drink Heineken. Way too Banana Republic for me.
Did they actually put skunk excretion in the bottle?

I just don't understand why this lager is priced higher -- and rated higher -- than any other swill, which is all it is. The only difference between it and Coors: $1 a 24 oz., and I am not one to waste my money.
This is a decent beer at a very high price that doesn't add up to me.  It seems to be more of a status beer than anything else

There are better beers for way less money. This always struck me as something that frat-boy types can talk about in bars and try to sound impressive as though it's the bee's knees and the most extra special wonderful brew ever created. Fuck it, this is skunky and cheap.
my second favorite beer.the taste is fantastic particularly good when ice cold.

This was always the beer to have when we went for an imported 6-pack. It is interesting that is rates so poorly given that, literally, 10 to 15 years ago this would have been a benchmark beer. Comments about it skunkiness or negative hop aroma are related to its state at purchase, not in its overall quality. 

Look, this beer deserves respect as a grandaddy if nothing else.
This would be a lot better if it weren't for the trademark skunkiness. Decent hop bitterness, still slightly cheap tasting. Not worth the prices.
Very pale & golden coloured. Light lacing. Sweet aroma. Light tasting, with some hop flavour.
Now this is what I think of when I think of beer....looks and smells great.  Can be a little skunky...but how can you resist the mini-keg cans?

A cut above the domestic yellow fizzy beers.  This beer pours golden with a decent head.  Unlike the macro swill this beer has a head that is retained and actually has some lacing.  Skunky, hoppy aroma is followed by a skunky flavor with a light dash of hop bitterness.  This is one of the beers I will look for at baseball games.  Decent.
Overall a good beer I like the flavor, and I like the aroma and appearance.  I could drink this almost every night of the week and I usually do.

The aroma was a bit sour, and lightly hoppy.  The appearance is a clear gold, with a thin bubbly head.  The flavor is hoppy, with a slight hint of bubble gum???  The beer is crisp and clean.  Overall average at best.
Yellow, head dissipated quickly. Slightly sweet with a dry finish. Mass produced + heavily advertised = less than average beer.

one of my preferred beers- i didnt like it at first, but alot of my buddies drink it so i bummed beers off of them and eventually developed a taste for it.  when i want a heineken, there is nothing that can beat it.  also one of the more overpriced beers, here in NC it goes up to 14.99 a 12, which is rediculous, however i got me one tonight for 9.99 :) needless to say i am enjoying it.

If its 100% barley, why does it taste like corn? If Stella Artois is the Bud of Belgium, this one is the Bud of Europe. Once considered a super-premium import here, it now ranks much lower thanks to our rising sophistication. Boring, bland and uninspired.

A safe bet lager that can be a welcome sight if confronted with no 'proper' beer and a row of uninspiring looking tap heads in a dark and dinghy late night establishment.  It is actually pretty refreshing, and definitely a notch up from most of the other common pub lager staples.
Another mass produced lager, the kind of drink you have with a few mates if you know your going to be in the pub a good while. Not too intoxicating and rather refreshing
I'ts just an ok beer. Not remarkable. This is slighty better than mass produced largers. The taste is kinda refreshing.

Very light flavour, okay for a light cheap beer, but unfortunately - it's not that cheap.  Average white head fully diminishes leaving no lacing.  Very soft and watery, has a weak start, and an even weaker finish.  Better than some other yellow beers, but there are better choices out there.
A very average beer.  The flavor is weak, it reminds me of cornbread after a while.

Better than most of the mass produced beers.  However, I still don't feel it deserves the accolades it receives from most fellow collegians.  Must be consumed immediately upon purchase because it skunks by the next day; thin mouthfeel is only helped by the decent flavor.  Strictly average
Pale yellow fizzy lager. Not much aroma. Smooth mild lager taste with just barely a hint of hops. Better than Michelob (i.e., a "premium" American lager

Too bad more Americans can't taste Heineken on tap in Holland or Belgium. It is a far better beer overthere than the bottled stuff we have. As for the tasting, Yes, Iv'e had some that have been skunky due to age, but my last one was fine. The aroma had some hoppiness and woody smell to it but didn't do much for me. The taste, well it's a massed produced lager with mild sweetness and just enough fizz to let you know that it's a beer. In bottle, a very average brew and something I would only drink if the other choice was Bud.
I really enjoy this beer.  For being a mass produced product it's very flavorful, pours a nice head, and smells pretty good.  Clear tasty lager.  Thumbs up
not bad, not bad at all for such a famous lager, usually it is with the lagers that the more famouse they are the more horrid they taste. Heineken has a good allround body and nice, fresh aftertaste.
Skunk!!! Not a real good beer.dry bitter finish but one can only assume that this beer is made with crappy water.

After making an unauthorized stroll into the “high rollers” room at a casino (read: open bar) I thought I had hit the jackpot. The bartender recommended this as the “best” beer offered...it wasn’t as bad as I had anticipated, but if I were really a high roller, I would have felt ripped off. However, since I was too busy trying to conceal my cup of quarters, I didn’t really have much to say about it. Faint aroma, and color. Some hops present. I could do without the chemical aftertaste though.

I was desperate for something to rate, but should have known better than try this one again. One would think they would fix that skunkiness after all these years, but I guess maybe some folks think it is supposed to be that way I don't know. Actually looks great, nice head retention, dry with bitter finish, but for me it's ruined by that gawdawful aroma that's all.

Pepe Le Pew in a bottle. Man, was this beer skunked. My god man, what's this world coming to when you can't even believe
the tv ads? ;>). Seriously, this is some really bad pig swill. I wouldn't serve this shit to my worst enemy, if they were dying of
thirst. I just wouldn't subject anybody to this awful beer. It is an off yellow color, no head to speak of, the aroma is of burned
corn, and stale cheesy hops. I bet they make a thousand gallons of this bilge water for close to 50 cents. Stale smelling, stale
tasting, stale everything. Stay away from this yuppy crap-in-a-can.
I was surprised by how skunky this lager was, I just wasn't expecting it.  Other than that, it was clean and is a beer I look forward to drinking again.
mass produced skunky lager that is very unimpressionable definitely not the worst thing i have ever drank but not very far away

This is one of my favorite macro brews. It's definitely has the skunk effect to it , but it you can't taste it as much as the can. The canned version is a far superior to the bottled version of this brew

A global brand the equal of Guinness, Bud, or Fosters. The beer doesn't exit me much. Other it purhaps come at some expense to the taste and flavour, its purhaps one of the most consistent performes on the world tour.

It is slightly better than the average macro. I was unimpressed with the appearance, although it poured a decent head. The flavor was all right. It was very light, slightly bitter, but not skunky. It did get better as the beer warmed up.
Wouldn't be bad if it didn't have such a bitter aftertaste. It is pretty smooth and nice apperance.  But like i said its bittertaste kills this beers chance.
31/3 draught: Highly carbonated, bubbly white head. Clear yellow liquid. Very slight skunky hop aroma. Smooth, though very thin. Slight malt sweetness with astringent bitter taste.
Pretty skunky taste, but has good color and not bad body. Fruity, grassy aroma. Definetely over-hyped, but still not worst you can do.

Ah, one of Europe’s finest exports to the U.S.!  Well, no.  But as I was thrown back to a period many months ago when I was drinking a lot of international lagers, I was struck by...struck by...aw, hell, this stuff is so bloody boring it isn’t worth additional comment here, except to say that you could do much much worse.  // Re0rate with same score.  I just had two bottles of it atop the Hotel Washington on 15th Street, which overlooks the Treasury Building, the White House, and the monuments.  Great great view.  Mediocre beer.

I've never understood what the big deal was with Heineken. It smells to me like horse feed. And it doesn't taste a whole lot better. A cold Heineken tastes about as good as a warm Miller High Life does. And it costs three times as much! Go figure!

Just realized my old rating is gone...strange.  Luckily, I have notes.  Nasty odor, makes me want to pour into drain before drinking.  Think Corona meets ass.  No real color to speak of.  Head is pale and thin.  Flavor is, well, lacking and a little skunky.  Not a good beer.  Generally speaking, I love the Dutch, but this should be poured back into the fjord.
This is a disgusting beer.  It tastes like a mixture of Rolling Rock and piss.  We should let the Dutch keep this shit.  I don't know why anyone would pay $15.99 for 12 of these.
Beautiful pale gold pour. Brief head. Fresh fruity aroma. Sweet hops and malt balanced which stays the same all the way through. Enjoy it for what it is, a very drinkable light lager.
Offensive over-hyped beer.  Last choice, except when given one (as in this case).  Avoid.

I hate this beer and I hate the stupid yuppies that force it on me because they think its great.  I had one yesterday and noticed slight hops and malt flavors, but it still sucks.  No one should ever by this beer, if not for the fact that it's green bottle yuppie swill, then for the fact that Howard Stern endorses it.

Advertised to the preppy crowd who thinks they are consuming a top notch import. Now back to reality. A lager and little else. Seems to get me real messed up for whatever reason. I dont hate it as many as some on this site, but I would prefer Rolling Rock as something comprable. Costs way to damn much. Avoid green bottle skunk.
It's my choice when anywhere other than Australia or portugal.  I couldn't even tell you why - it's so unlike any of my other beer drinking preferences, however I still find myself drawn back to it.

Standard lager flavour, not a great smell of course. Not the absolute worst beer in the entire world, but far from even the best lager. Too bad it's the only 'decent' beer you can get on a domestic United Airlines flight.
I like this beer.  I know alot of people don't but compared to Aussie beers, this is a welcome change.  Good mild hop flavour.

I really was in the mood for a beer today, but I was out of anything good, and so my roommate had some of this sitting in the fridge. I had about 5 sips and poured the rest out. This bottle may be a bit skunked (at least I hope it was). Aroma was sour and bitter. Flavor was flat, short, with an unpleasantly sour and bitter finish. This really is just a bad macro dressed up as a fancy import for the gullible public.

Boy is this a crappy beer.  I bought it in a 26oz keg shaped can because I had never had it and I thought the can was cool.  It had the appearance and aroma of a normal American style yellow beer, but it tasted like pure ass.  I'm not sure how this beer is so popular.
Rocky white, mostly lasting head. Yellow body. Moderate aroma. Light finish. No initial flavour. A beer not to remember.
Once upon a time I didn´t know so much about beer, and in those days this was an exclusive choice. It isn´t anymore...I have seen the light, but this Dutchman never will...

a very very popular beer, and I dont have a clue why? it doesnt taste good, it´s very light, the only thing good about it I can think of is that it tastes ok very cooled in hot weather. it pulls a decent head though....

Is it supposed to be stale tasting, either way they do a good job of it.  Not worth the extra money of an import.   I know Warsteiner isn't a lager, but if you want a half-decent mass-produced popular Euro-import I'd go with that one instead of this one.

Wow, this stuff is bad.  If the color and smell wasn't enough to turn you off, the taste sure finishes it off.  Extremely skunky with that nasty sugary sweet flavor.  I have *no* idea why people think this is a good beer.
It always seems like it is skunked or been sitting out in the sun or something.  Maybe you do have to go to Europe to really apreciate it, but no thanks.
Light, simple lager with some aftertastes that suggest it's been sitting too long. Go to Europe if you want to try Heineken the way it's supposed to taste!!
I used to love this stuff, but now I think it tastes skunky.  If you can get the real stuff in Europe, it's not too bad.  Otherwise, spend an extra buck an get something worthwhile.

smooth tasting lager
much better in palate than domestic lagers.
Despite its ordinary characteristics I much prefer this easy drinking lager to domestic counterparts.
Oridinary but enjoyable

ick ick ick. this is my absolute least favorite beer. i *hate hate hate* heineken. i think it tastes just as shitty as coors light but there's this whole "ooh, we're heineken" attitude surrounding it. if i were queen of everything, the first thing i would do would be to pour every bottle of this craptastic beer into a drain.
Just as little flavor as all the other pale lagers, only for twice as much money...
This is one of the most remarkable tasting lagers out there it doesn't taste like any American lager. Lives up to the name SKUNK. a little carbonated though.

Not as good as some people make it out to be but not too bad either. Good beer to have after a long and hard day at work. Tastes kind of like bud but with a bit more flavor and hops. Doesn't smell to bad either.
It's stale and overrated.  It tastes better from the can than from the bottle.
This beer always seems to be stale out of the bottle.  Little flavor aside from an unpleasant bitterness.

A beer l enjoy when fresh. I really think it is best in Europe, when served on draught. Very enjoyable at the Heineken Museum in Amsterdam. Some yeast, and quite bitter. Should be avoided in green bottle. Old rating below. Good from a keg can; can be great on tap.  While nothing special, this beer is consistently good unless ruined due to the green bottle.  Better than most American macros. 3/2/3/3/5
Drinkable and ok when nothing better is around.  I find this neither remarkable nor offensive.  Preferable to the BMC beers but far from the good beers of nearly any style.
Golden colour with a bubbly head. Bad aroma, while the flavour (like many other "commercial" lagers) is dominated by the bitterness of the hops. Drinkable, but nothing special.

Ivy League swill.  Nice beer to have at a party to show the Bud and Molson Canadian drinkers you have taste but aren't you just drinking Holland's Bud?  Skunky aroma but decent light lasting taste.  Best part is the mini-keg cans.  Props to the canners (I see others like Sleemans are doing this now).

a nice, no frills, a little expensive standard lager. i drank this a lot for a while. haven't had one in a long time. i'm thinking that i won't like it just cause i've heard about the keeping conditions of green glass. we'll see.
Decent beer, nothing to rave about, famous well known beer, that everyone should try atleast once

Never have been very impressed with this beer. Pours golden brown. Strong aroma of hoppiness. The taste is to be expected. Bitter and with a sort of sour finish. This isn't horrible, but I prefer Pilsner Urquell. Worth trying.

Bottled, blind tasting lager tasting with Bitburger and Lowenbrau. Pale yellow, fully diminishing fizzy white head. Light toasty and cereal aroma with some fusel and herbal notes. Cereal and grainy malts, lightly floral bitter finish. Light bodied, soft and lightly creamy mouthfeel.
Tastes like macro beer. Nothing special. It's a mild beer. Slightly taste the hops. Better than Bud or MGD. It's best if you drink it out of the keg cans. The bottles aren't very good.
The bartender offered this to me with a lime, which I refused.  I got about 3 sips in and I had to ask her for that lime.  Ew.
a nice beer for the money. better than most other gas station beers.........
Pale golden yellow with a light body. Some grainy fruity aromas present. Mildy sweet with a low hop content. Refreshing, but not very intense.

Eh, fine but in no way worth the money or having stupid people think you're classy and drink good beer.  I did notice now that most really do have that skunkiness but the overall taste is a least a little more interesting than most american standards.
Not the worst lager I've had, but not very good either. It wasn't skunked as I remembered from my pre-Ratebeer days. Metallic aftertaste and weak on, well, everything.
You know I really hate green bottles, this one ranks right up there with Rolling Rock, although I prefer it to said above.  These should all go in the skunk category.
Very nasty skunk smell with every beer that I have opened. The flavor is also very skunky due to the green bottle I am sure. Not a good beer at all.

When fresh it is what watery flavorless beers should taste like. But it is usually old and skunky. This should be cheep beer but some have been convinced that this rice beer from Holland is special so they pay a premium for it. most outgrow its watery flavor in time especially if they ever actually ever taste a good European pilzener

People can dislike this one all they want, but it was the first beer I ever loved and still enjoy it today.  It does have a strong smell and taste, and is pretty bitter, but it's those things that make me like it so much.  To me, the bitterness and strong odor are "good" in a way that they're not in other beers that I dislike for the same reasons.  Hard to explain.  Still a favorite, nevertheless.
Drank it a lot in Holland. Goes for a easy-to-drink beer. Hops in flavor, but not enough. If you get's to Holland, buy something else, they have a lot and a lot of far ahead better beers.

I'm not a fan of this beer. I think it has an odd smell, as well as an off taste. The flavor of this beer is not pleasant, and tastes like an imported beer which has been sitting for a good deal of time.
Skunky nose and bland, thin body.  Watery with too bitter of an aftertaste.
Not a big fan of this beer.  Its pricy, and doesn't taste all that good.  I cannot put my finger on it, but I just don't like it.  Maybe another sampling will help determine the flaws.

So much evil.  Sweet malt in the nose with an aniemic head atop an unwholsome gold body.  Sweet cloying maltieness and a creamed corn aftertaste.  It could at least have the decency to have good advertising.
So much better on tap or in a bottle than in a can. Very good thirst quenching lager. I like the skunky nose.
Not a bad beer, little too bitter for me, somewhat clean though.  When your out in the country and it is a choice between this and an American macro it is pretty good.
Just another mass marketed bland lager. Thin body, clear golden color, low fizz head. Would rather drink "Amstel" similar tasting but cheaper.

A good, clear, clean golden lager.  Not much nose.  Taste is pretty good,especially after fosters, a little bitter, a little malt, no obvious faults or flaws.  Really uninteresting mouth feel,  just thin, bitter water.  Overall, I could drink this if I had to.
This beer has taken some undue criticism.  It''s not bad.  Light, flavorful, and smooth.  It''s cheap and tasty, what more can we expect from it...
As everyone else has said, a skunky beer.  I know I usually reach for something else when I want a beer.
Has a metallic, grassy taste.  Most of the times I''ve had this is was skunky, but I''ve had a few that were not.  When it''s not skunky, it''s not too bad.  decent on tap, horrid from the bottle.
I""m amazed how often the word ""skunky"" is used to describe this beer.  Almost as often as the word ""foreign"".  It""s much better from a tap.

Heineken despite what has been said is an excellent beer when it has not sat on a shelf for months to become "skunky". It is similar to Grolsch Lager with a lighter aftertaste and a smoother feel. A quality brew overall.

Ha!  I knew early on in my beer drinking days that this was one overrated, overpriced, skunky, sour lager.  Thanks ratebeer community.  I feel validated.  Ok, now for the review...  oh, just read the other comments.

Light struck. No flavor except skunkiness.

Why couldn't the bar serve the cans? It would be safer in the riot-prone area known as the OSU campus! ;o)

Will re-rate after I get some cans.

Can:

Even skunked in the can too.  This beer is way over-hyped.
After re-trying this it was better out of the bottle but still lacks. Try warstiener

1/3/03:  drank straight from the bottle at a sports bar in columbus...  GO BUCKS!!  Light skunky taste, which is probably the result of sunlight hitting the green bottle during shipment.  not a big fan at the moment, but when i had this one on tap in amsterdam a couple of years ago i had a much more pleasant experience!

Rerate 04/13/04: On draught (pression) at Chez Bernard in Fontainebleau, France. Someone had suggested trying a Heineken on my trip which I planned on not doing, but due to my poor French speaking I ended up with one at lunch one day. I literally had to ask the waiter what I was drinking to be sure, even though it was served in a Heineken glass. I was assured in answer to my "qu'est-ce que s'appelle"? that it was indeed Heineken. Wow. Looks the same but the taste is definitely different. Clear gold with a medium white head and little lacing. The nose is lightly hoppy with a pleasant grape character. Very smooth body with a fruity and hoppy flavor that just somehow tastes like this beer really should. It all makes sense now. The finish is refreshing and vinous with a touch of hops. One of the only good beer surprises on my trip.


Rerate 01/03/03 (1.8): I like skunky/nutty beers even less now. Even though Bud drinkers call this a fancy import I think it is pretty awful.


01/03/02 (2.5): Skunky more often than not, it is either in the light too long or doesn't travel well. A decent Lager when it's good, but it is usually a gamble.

Pale golden color topped by a thick white lasting head that leaves some lace.  sour, slightly skunky malt aroma with a slight hop background.  Slightly sweet well-balanced flavor with a sour, bitter finish. Not to bad but still a little on the skunky side.  Light bodied and smooth.

it is one of the vey little beers of wich only one glass/bottle is just hard to finish. It doesnt taste very bad, but it just doesnt drink easyly.  The taste is not very well..
It is a shame for my country! Very overrated abroad.
Why does this always taste skunky. I do not care if Auston Powers drinks it or not.
Drinkable beer, faint trace of hops, very little head.......................
Almost clear, smells skunky and tastes the same. The green bottle is probably to blame, I'm sure this would be better fresh or on tap.
Here is another beer that is better on tap than in the bottle, but to me there is nothing better than an ice cold Hiene right out of the cooler in the summer time
another one they call beer..i think i may have gotten another bad one...its easy to do when u get a green bottle..

re-rate!!!! I used to like this beer but after having it so many times the negative aspects took over any positve aspects the beer ever had.  A skunky aroma is so pronounced that it carries through on the taste.  I drink it out of a bottle because something that yellow should be found in a toiliet.

A very overated beer, but it is usually available everywhere so it has bailed me out of bad beer situations here and there. But the pale yellow beer with little to no foam, smelling weak and of grains and and hops. Tasted alright, but a bit watered down, a very mild flavored beer. But for the most part it is available when your choices are Bud and Coors.
An average lager.  Very bitter finish.  Drinkable...........................
I tasted this beer at a party. Nothing kills a group buzz like a guy scribbling in a notebook. Rely on my score and the descriptions provided by other Ratebeerians.
Gives you no advantage compared to Becks or Warsteiner. Too bitter to be a session beer and too mild to fully enjoy. Let Beck''s stock your green bottle section in the fridge.
Was expecting something considerably "skunkier" than what this was.  Better than mass-produced light beers.  Tastes different out of the can as opposed to the bottle.  Better from the bottle in fact.

Pale straw yellow. Decent head with plenty carbonation. Slightly sweet aroma. Bitter in a bad way--chalky and metallic. I don't know why anyone would forsake a crisp American lager for it's soapy European cousin at twice the price.
now i love heineken. i know the first thing people say is the smell. but having been to the brewery..and tasted it fresh. it''s even more delicious.

This past Friday I had to go to my wife''s company Christmas party. This was the best beer they had (open bar). 
You know what Heineken tastes like.

Den BESTE øl indtil vidre den er bare TOTAL go''!!!!!
alt er perfekt! -WE LOVE YOU HEINEKEN
This isnt bad, but certainly not worth the money.  Theres better stuff thats much cheaper.

Ehhh... Slightly better than the average domestic swill, but not by much.  The same sweet taste, but more of it.  They should make it the same price as domestics and cut the ads in lower income urban areas.
I agree that many mistake this for a great beer, when it is very similar to many green beers but usually costs just a little more than it should.  Easy to drink watery hop-filled beer.

Yippe!! Another crappy european beer in a green bottle.   I can feel like a pretentious douch-bag a drink a beer with no taste!
Ahem...drinkable from a can.  Clean, boring, about on par with fosters.
I like this as much as I like Stella. It might be a nice escape from North American brews but you''d be heading in the wrong direction if you want a good European beer.
Austin Powers is the only thing Heineken has going for it...................
Not one of my favorite''s....but it''s got a good taste and isn''t bad to have one every now and then. I think it''s overated extremely and shouldn''t be considered a "good beer"
Kind of watery and bland. but it does have to stonge points . It like gatorade in beer flavour. I could dance all night long.
Watery and bland. I have no idea how this lager has become so popular.......

Possibly the most overrated beer in the world besides Corona. I can smell a skunk from across the room when someone is drinking one of these beers. Dry, bitter, bad aftertaste. A tolerable flavor attempts to save it but fails.

I hate this stuff.  I don't know why,  a lot of other people think its great, but the bitterness is just overpowering. RERATE:  I like it even less.  Gets worse everytime I try it.  Only people who want to have the cultured look drink this crap.  No head, SKUNKY of course, and little or no flavor other than bitter.  If it smells horrible, then it's not going to taste good either.

whatever..i used to drink it a lot and now i dont..funny how marketing controlled me until i became informed on what is good...lots of nasty sweetness and adjuncts and a 95% chance of being skunked..hmm..i love paying a lot of money for those things, you?

Its pretty much the best i think you can get at your local convenience store. Draught is much better, but the distinct taste left in your mouth after a good Heiny keeps me coming back.
11/18...ok, now that ive had a few dozen drafts and microbrews outside of convenience store land, its time to get away from the skunky carbonated stuff. Heiny"s are still a good clear bubbly to partake of at a bar, but no longer the staple in my fridge.
RERATE 01/06/03: Ahhhhh how good it is to get away from macro land! Bad hops....metallic aftertaste...thank you ratebeer for showing me that other things exist out there!!!
Heineken has helped me realize, above anything else, that tastes change over time.  I used to despise this beer; now i quite like it.  Funny how things work out.

Must be the global hate beer no.1. ;) As a pilsener addict however I like it. Problems may result from many different brewing places. I usually like to know the brewery place.
Nice spicy malt, nice and fresh mouth feel.

The flavor I am so used to...been drinking these since 1974...tasted a lot better then.  I read they cahnged the brewring process around 15 yrs ago.  I get it for <$1/bottle (12 pk), but for the same $$ would prefer St Pauli.  In  the NLs, their homeland, non-export Heinies are much better than the bulk syuff they export
Not bad, but does not live up to all the hype...............................

Either my tastes have changed over the years, or Heineken has changed. I remembered this beer as being a pretty good beer. Last night, I bought some since it was on sale, and was very disappointed. It had a metalic/skunky taste. Do yourself a favor and buy Grolsch instead.

United airlines made it possible to make a remarkable test: Does international standard swill taste any better at high altitude over international waters? The answer is NO:
It has no aroma to speak of. Golden no head. Round and wellbalanced but incredibly boring and it gets more boring for each sip. But what can you do when you have to be on that plane for 8 hours and this beer is the lesser of three evils??? Next time I''ll fly with Lufthansa - at least they have Warsteiner.

Oct 2019 Bottle in a bar in Bangkok with Zelie. Part of a taste test against Singha, Leo and Chang. Standard global pale lager. [2.4]

Nov, 2002 A stand in the bog lager. [1.3]

May, 2004 Can.  Crisp herbal aroma. Crisp and dry lager with pleasant sweet spots leaning toward toffee and a herbal finish. Actually quite an acceptable drink when thirsty - there are decent flavours and a reasonable palate, especially if allowed to stand long enough to let any co2 burn off. [2.3]

 
June, 2006Pub Irish Coffee, Town Square, Valreas, Provence. / Le Sevigne, Grignan, Provence - Pression. Clean. Inoffensive. Refreshing. Sweetish cereal flavour and a dull, soft bitter finish edging into salt.  [2.1]

Nice aroma when you first open the bottle.Taste is pleasant
run of the mill lager but nothing definite. Dry aftertaste with slightly fruity overtones. Nothing to send the taste buds spinning but nothing to
say this is a bad beer-just an ordinary one.
When i go to eat dinner and they only have domestic beers and heineken i always get the Heiny. It goes good with any kind of food but i dont know if i could drink one after the next.
Heineken has to be the most over-rated beer of all time.  It''s a drinkable lager - not much else going on.

In Holland Heineken is thought to be one of the worst pilseners. Probably because most american people (not you guys :-)) tend to say Heineken is the best. 
But after all those years of drinking Heineken, i think it’s one of the better actually. It smells better than the average pilsener. More spicy. When i get the smell of Heineken, i get all those memories of when i was young. I know i’m still young, but i mean the times i legally wasn’t allowed to drink alcohol. Or, well, in Holland age is 16 to buy beer. So my rate is definitely influenced by those memories. But hey! Everybody knows Heineken, so i don’t have to tell ya what it tastes like!
On sale, bought it.  Watered down.  Will drink just because I paid for it.  Not gonna buy again.

pours clear yellow, very little head.  slightly bready aroma.  a bit more fruity flavour in the malts than most of this style, but not enough to make a big difference.  light.  boring.  I laugh at the ones who pay premium import prices for this.  the sad thing is a lot of them think it''s a great beer.  suckers.
Not as bad as some would have you believe. If you are at a club and it is this or AB take this.

Very skunky aroma, I could smell it two feet from the bottle. Has a nice, clear golden color, but the head rapidly dissipates. Really hard to detect any hops, but it does have a very slight maltiness. Dry finish with hardly any real flavor to speak of. Boring and a waste of time.
Watery, drinkable, bland, flavorless, overrated in public.  Not the worst beer out there, though - definitely beats all the big U.S. water-beers.
Pretty smooth beer with little or no aftertaste. Should not be considered a premium beer, but definitely more drinkable than your run of the mill American Lagers.
Bottle. Straw gold low head and condition. Low head and condition. Low aromas of malt and hop, forgetable body and slight, dry aftertaste.

I''ve had too much fun with this beer in my hand to rate it low.  Believe it or not, it''s been years since I''ve had a skunked sample.  Nice light malt sweetness with surprisingly firm body.  Decent hop character.  Would rather have a helles, but this is great at parties when nothing else is available.  When I was in Holland, people would carry a six pack in their briefcases.
Cool green bottle comes with "beer" inside.  Could have fooled me.

Perplexing. I find this very hard on my innards. Why does this cost so much and why do people pretend to like it? One of the foulest stenches I have ever encountered from a beer. Skunky sewer smell blows you away as soon as you open it. Nasty aftertaste much like copper pipes. This is really a crappy brew. Not worth the extra money. For idiot yuppies who know zero about beer. A mind bender and a stomach churner.
Of all beers that be to this Australian known, this here plonk taste the most as water.

Rerate Revisiting after 11 years. Light golden, initial white bubbly head.  Grainy aroma, not skunky, Flavor is slightly bland, some grassy notes, a bit of toasted bread. Mouthfeel is crisp. Original 2.9 I know I am supposed to not like this beer because it is one of the world’s best sellers, blah, blah, blah - but it isn’t that bad. A little skunky pour - but it is a clean even-tempered skunk. Goes down smooth. Not bad for a lager.  Weak snow white head though.
This is one of, if not the worst, beer i have ever had.  I think I might consider drinking my own PEE if anyone dares offer me this beer again!  BBBLLLLAAAAH!
Can''t understand why people consider this premium beer.  Its no Labbatt....
Skunky aroma and no head.  Beats most American bears easily though... minus the higher price tag.
A light yellow beer wiht no head. It has a faint aroma of malt. And a watery flavor that end in a slight bitterness. I much rather have a Tuborg - if it must be a lager.
Sweet, grassy aroma, pale yellow, small white head. Grassy flavour, slight bitterness. Sweet, light and fluffy, ordinary.

This piece of crap comes from holland, the most beer exporting country in the world...
Why doesn't the world know better?
In holland, if you go to the toilet you say I'm gonna make heineken...

I'm a little ashamed to say that I like this beer.  It isn't my favorite by a longshot, but a lot of places there isn't much variety and this is generally my favorite in such situations.  It is easily drinkable en masse, and the taste is certainly decent.  Usually overpriced, but much better than US megas if those are the only options.  It does get skunky a lot in those damned green bottles, but I had it on tap recently and it was much better, so I tried the "keg" cans and it was in between: not as good as the draught but better than bottled, mainly because it wasn't skunky.  Still, if you can get a micro you'll generally be better off.
Export brand - keg (5%). Paler than the cold filtered variety. Average keg product.
Where I come from, we call this "runemiege". I will not give the literal translation, but it has something to do with a horse and water leaving your body.
This stuff is skunky.  I don't know while people think it is SUPPOSED to taste that way.

Ah yes.  Heineken.  I drink this beer frequently because it serves well with it's nice Dutch Lager flavor and aroma.  It is a refreshing alternative to American big brewery beers.  Tastes all right.  Try Becks too.
It look good in this green bottle but that the only good thing about it. Flavor is too chimical.
average.  very average. I would never pin this one down in a blind taste test.
A good beer.  Available most places.........................................
This is a good lager. Not as heavy as most lagers and you can tell by the light color.

Good lager. Sort of "McDonalds among beers" (nothing wrong about that) - you can have it about anywhere around the world with a certain quality guaranteed and also have it quite often without risk of getting sick of it. Keep in mind it's not a vintage cherry to sip - it is a mass beer for mass drinking and it's good at it.
As ALWAYS - best served cold on tap (eg. in a pub in Amsterdam), never call it skunk after you had just one old bad-treated bottle - no beer is made to survive anything, you know. Also, don't call it overpriced - the prices of beer differ around the world - once I payed $12 for Budvar in London while in Czechia a pint of Budvar, Pilsner Urquell or any other beer costs less than $1 - now should I call such beer generally overpriced?

Lt gold color, large head. Light tasting lager, slightly citrus taste, slightly hoppy, not very malty. A little skunky. Mouthfeel is a little thin, kind of watery. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is neutral. A mass-market beer, nothing special or different. Also, not very fond of the “green bottle beer” taste.
I did not enjoy this beer at all.  Why should beer cost so much money.......

this beer is richly over priced and not very delicious. personally i dont like lagers to me it isnt like your classic beers that u see your grandpa and fathers drink like pabst or genny or milwakees. not that those r great beers. overall i give this 2 thumbs down.
i agree with most reviewers, that it is a bit chemical tasting. still, it smells very nice n' fruity, and it's very crisp and good with food. my, a person could do soooo much worse.
I'd qualify it as on the same par as Rolling Rock: it's better than the other mass swill, but nothing else.
This beer has a gold/yellow body - hue apperance and a coarse white scum collar. I have drunk the beer from the bottle and it had a medium carbonic acid. The initial flavor taste is bitter.
Has a yellow color and a skunky smell.  Taste is nothing special.  Same mass produced skunkiness from Europe.  Similar to St. Pauli Girl...
Cooked sweet metallic skuny brew. Over-carbonated. Very low IBUs. ..........
Drinking this out of a keg can.  If it were not in such a cool can, and if it were not alcoholic, I'd throw it away.

i cant believe ive never got around to rating this. not that all of you need my advice on this beer. even for a massmarket dutchie its horrifying. sweet yellow cheesy and sweaty with nasty chemical aftertaste.
I use to think it was a fancy beer.  Now it's just fancy skunk must crap.  Still more drinkable than some other lagers.
THe last time I had it, I was actually surprised.  It was decently smooth, and not too skunky.
This beer always has a skunky finish. It looks all right and the fruity smell is refreshing, but there isn't much ther in the way of taste.
this beer really sucks! it almost always has a skunky smell and gives me a stomach ache after 3 of them. must be the liver-eating substance that they brew it with. not good at all.
eh, its ok. not as good as its advertised to be, but still not bad..........

not a bad beer at all.

little high in price but when i do decide to drink it, it really does hit the spot.

smooth going down.
nice whit head which fades down to little laces going up and down on the glass.
the appearance is a golden color.

the taste is lacking alittle.
Please.....why do they call this beer.  Cost too much to get drunk on.......
Not bad. I like the bitterness of it. Costs too much for what you get though.
I guess this was the first beer i ever had. I grew up with it. For me it's just a decent pilsener.
Not good beer. I'll drink it over Bud or Coors any day, but sadly Corona is much better.

Overall, nice and smooth.  However, not particularly striking in any way shape or form. 
In short, it doesn't suck.
plain boring pils. only excuse for drinking is the availibility all around the globe.
Light color similar to Becks.  Nothing sticks out.  ........................
Quite smelly.  Very light color.  Flavor is watery, yet too hoppy and with the wrong kind of hops.  Not a good balance.
Light golden color with a moderate fluffy head. Aroma hops just do not travel well. Aromas of stale paper. Flavors of pilsner malt with a sharp hops finish.
Slight hoppy aroma. Salty, but skunky taste with cabbage(!). This is the first time in about seven years I tasted Heineken pils. I think the next will also have to wait.

This is one of the world’s most famous disasters.

 Rerate 31/12/2013 Recently drunk about a liter of Heineken during a concert in Paradiso, Amsterdam. For what it is, it is actually pretty good. It has a pleasant flowery nose. It is simply not that bland (at least the stuff from the dutch factory). Guess this is my favourite dutch macro brew. Consider this stuff is made to sell at minimum prices to the most of people possible. Then there is actually quite some taste & even distinctive taste in it. At least more than other Dutch alternatives.
very hard brew to like..poor flavour very overpowering..leaves ne dry next day..nasty
Had it at the brewery in Amsterdam (fresh) and it was one of the best beer drinking days that I have ever had.  It can get ’skunky’ in the US however.
Who knows what this beer may be like in a different color bottle.  The Skunk Factor definitely defines this beer.

You know, i know guys that tell me that this is the best beer made!  I look at them and sneer.  It seems that almost every bottle I've had has that notorius Skunk smell going.  For gods sake put on a silly freshness date.
This beer sucks donkey nuts.  The aftertaste is horrible and it doesn't go down smooth. Settle for a domestic like Michelob.

This is anaverage beer at the most, as for imports. To me it taste like a lighter more bitter version of becks/st pauli girl  when its real bad it has a slight pond water taste to it. For the price u can do alot better , alot of people i know who dont drink alot think this stuff is the shit... shows u wahtkind of preppy beer this is.
Sometimes this is a nice alternative, when all you have to choose from is Bud and Lite.  Don't expect much from it, and you might be surprised.  Fairly hoppy, slight "skunk" nose.
I really don't like this beer. overrated in every way, very similar to carlsberg. the green bottle sure doesn't help much... fairly skunky and unremarkable. pass
I usually do not drink lagers, but this one has a nice dry bite to it.  I enjoyed this lager.

My opinion on Heineken varies based on what mood I am in and how it is being served. Heineken in a can is aweful.  Warm Heineken will make you never taste it again.  On the other hand a cold Heineken out of the tap is excellent.  I like the appearance in a glass and hate the green bottle.  A lot of uncertainty with me on this beer, more than any other.

A great beer yet definetly a desired taste I can see why some would like it. "Skunky"
This is the beer that started me to inquire a taste for different beers.
The aftertaste stops me from drinking too many..............................

Aroma relatively light combination of hops and sweet malt--but nothing remarkable...Appearance fairly standard pale-gold--head light but acceptable.
