Flavor reveals both decent hop bitterness and some underlying malt, which shows up in the body more than, say, Beck's. Finish is pretty much a a continuation of the main body--no hidden mysteries here...This is perfectly OK stuff--but falls about in the middle of the field of macro-import lagers...
Is there any other beer that tastes so average yet costs so much?...........

decent, i dont like the aftertaste.
I'd drink it, wont be my first choice.
when I was young I thought this was a great beer(any beer we could get our hands on being under age). But now after drinking a couple of Heineken the distinct after taste stops me from drinking more.
What's the big deal??? Reminds me of road kill on the transcanada highway. (OK a little to harsh on the beer perhaps but really what is the big deal)
Great taste, definitely worth the money.....................................
NOt that bad for a pilsner, but that's not saying much.  Better than fizzy yellow American beer.  Johnny Mac drinks it though, just a thought.  Drinkable.
Yeasty aroma with a wee striped varmint hiding in there.  Medium-light hopping, crackery, a distinctive lager yeast strain.   A somehow puffy palate -- light and mouthy.
Not too bad for a macro-import. Given the choice between this and BudMillCoors I would go for this every time. Great ads!

Better than American macrobrews, but not by much. I agree with other posters this is probably nothing more than a reliable "fall back" beer at your local convenience store, but skunkiness remains a persistent problem thanks to the green bottle.
It's not a bad beer, but i think it's overvalorated.........................

One of my favorite imports that is consistently good.  I have a feeling that Heineken's ratings suffer a bit due to its popularity among non-beer enthusiasts, but there's really nothing wrong with it.  Distinct, mildly-bitter flavor and pleasant aftertaste never let you down.  The only thing really bad about a Heineken is that it has a tendency to run you over twice the morning after.
Seems like the European trying to imitate the Americans for some reason.  Light, little texture, a little flavor, and way to expensive.  Still better then most of the Big American Crap

Why pay so much for a shitty beer that has preservatives and added chemicals.  I cant understand why this beer is so over-hyped (not on the site but by average beer drinkers in general.)  Nothing is good about this beer, but it is not the worst I've tried.  At least the commercials are funny.

This might quite possibly be the "best" beer of beer drinker wannabes.  It has all the ingredients of a good beer, but remains average at best.  More of a trendy thing than any.  Why bother with this stuff if you can have something else that's decent.
A bit metallic. Easy drinkable, but utterly uninteresting. .................
Gotta have this one ... better in the can...................................
RERATE: Managed to pick up an unskunked sixer. Sweet, with a somewhat bitter finish. Not quite so watery as your typical North American swill and its lack of adjunct off-flavors is a plus.

I am still struggling over the loss of Reptile, and I have only this beer to blame for my sorrow.  Never again will I drink a Heineken, there is just to much risk involved...revenge will someday be mine...

Welp, for a cheap "import" as it is deemed in certain places around here.  It's not the worst.  It's got a decent bitter flavor.  I'd take it over a Corona, or a regular domestic.  But I wouldn't take it over a delicious sandwich.  Thank you and goodnight.

I really don't like the metallic taste that comes from this beer (and no, I'm not taking just a sample from a can).  It's decent and very drinkable, but not my favorite.  A bit too thin and watery as well.  Flavor is kind of distinctive, saving its otherwise bad impression on me.

I lived in the virgin islands for a summer and you'd be amazed how many places I went where this was the best beer they offered.  How sad is that?  This stuff is an average lager at best, that benefits from a good marketing department.
I wonder if it was just my sample, but I didn't like this stuff at all.  I'll probably never buy it again.  Slightly sour, with a bitter aftertaste.

Let go my Heinie.  A pretty damn good import.  Not skunky, rather smooth and quite a buy.  But something does happen after more than one.  I'd only drink one, then switch to another beer.  Not too shabby though.
Over-rated, not entirely bad though.  Kind of a hoppy skunky thing going on.
Bottled: A little metalic and disgusting aroma. The flavour is matalic and sligthly chemical. Not my kind of beer.
Bland, bitter, slightly disgusting lager.  Better than most mass produced Americans but still never a first choice.  Overpriced.
Smells skunky, very pale and watery with no head. Taste is bitter with no follow through of any kind. I would rather drink the beast.

Smells a little bit like cheese:-), nice hoppy aroma, also flavor but not bitter. Short aftertaste. Not much to say. But: Do'nt go to the Heineken Brewery in Amsterdam. Terrible, they try to give you the so called "Heineken Experience". If you see the entrance of the brewery, run away, drink your beer somewhere else.

Cereal aroma - very light. Pale gold color. Head could be better. Light bitter hops with not much of a body. Clean palette and well balanced. Tastes better at the brewery, but be warned of hyper-marketing with the new Heineken Experience if you go. For all the money and energy spent on bells and whistles at the brewery the beer is still pretty mediocre.

A horrible example of what a Dutch Lager is supposed to be. The flavor was that of seltzer water and bitter hops. The head vanished almost imediatly leaving me with a feeling of flat soda in my mouth. This was a very poor beer.
This beer seems to get by merely on it's image.  It's not good, it's not high-class, it just is a better version of budweiser... and not much better at that.
I don't know why they sell some much of this beer in the world. No flavours, awful taste.
ray ketchum drinks this shit so it has to be a little gay...................

This is a beer that is totally different between tap and bottle. On tap and fresh, it's smooth and refreshing, with no bad aftertaste. In the bottle, it has a funky odor and a bad aftertaste. My rating is for the tap and my memories of taking the Heineken Brewery tour in Amsterdam and getting loaded at 10 a.m. with a bunch of wild Australians, while the golden-hair Flems kept pushing more fresh beer our way.

yuck, bitter aftertaste is superficial. this dosent taste of quality. watery on top of it and over carbonated.  wow, if stella was called a beer for posers, id hate to see what they call this one. this looks exactly like urine!! kinda funny

Either you love this beer or hate it. That's my observation. 
I love it. The bitter after taste is excellent. This is one of my favorite beers of ALL time. Unfortunately it is WAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY over priced, and sometimes it's skunky.

Typical European green bottle lager/pilsner... I actually like these better in cans... Malty and grassy... a little more bite from the hops than you might expect but nothing to get terribly excited about.  Refreshing and non-offensive.

looks great in the glass,and has a great hoppiness about it, but lacks the punch that the great beers have. The lack of bitterness does not do justice to the full-flavoured hops

*Re-rate* I decided to give this one another chance when my bud picked up cardboard enclosed 12 pack of these.  I felt my chance of obtaining a fresh sample would be much better (damn green bottles).  And so I did.  This brew pours a light sparkling straw yellow.  The large tight white rocky head is fully lasting with decent lacing.  The mild nose is toasted malt and resinous hops.  The fresh flavor is light and neutral with a fair balance.  Bready, slightly sweet, and bland though.  The thin body is watery and fizzy, and finishes crisp.  Much better when not light struck, but still average IMO.  *original rate 4/4/02 - 1,3,4,2; 7 (skunked!)*
drinkable but there is nothing to it it.  it's fairly smooth but suffers from a total lack of any distinguishing characteristics

never liked the taste of the stuff..........................................

I am not big on Pilseners, Heineken is a reasonable one. Good when one is thirsty.

There's nothing wrong with Heineken.  For a fizzy yellow mass-produced beer, it isn't half bad.  It's got more hops than most domestic lagers, and it's light enough that it won't kick your ass like a good APA.  I drink my share of Stone, Bells, etc., but I'm not afraid to have a Heineken every once in a while.  It's the yin that balances yang.  While the beer has no head, is fizzy and yellow, often is skunky, it's got a character all its own.  I'd take it over most American mass-produced beers any day.  There are better beers for less; say a good Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, but a sixer of Heineken is the best choice you are going to get when you visit the gas station and want to take home a sixer without a far drive.  That's the secret to Heineken's success.  Yuppy beer?  Maybe about ten years ago.  The crown yuppie beer of today is probably clear bottle swill like Corona.

Ice cold, my favorite memory of it is watching case after case being loaded onto a Dutch warship.  Bit on the bitter side and not my favorite, but prefer it to many American megabrews.  Bit of a skunky smell and taste, weak foam.

Had this here and in the Netherlands. Much better in Europe, this beer first introduced me to skunky.

Standard Eurolager.

This is nothing more or nothing less than a smooth, easy-drinking lager. It is much smoother than most Australian lagers which makes it my drink of choice when I’m going for a refreshing beer. It is reasonably priced here aswell, although still significantly more expensive than the local produce.
This stuff is no good, Ive never had a real Heineken, but Im sure it tastes better than the American version.  You need Pizza or wings to chase the stuff for god's sake!
Shitty Stuff.  Wow this is the bad beer to enda ll bad beers.  Worse than the Beast or Beast Light.

The bottle I drank last night had a bitter skunky taste.  Dennis Hopper was right, fuck this shit!! Pabst Blue Ribbon, man!  Strangely enough, one of my best beer experiences was Heineken on tap at a pizzera next to Piazza San Marco in Venice.  The fact that Heineken sells good beer in Europe and crap in the U.S. must be the result of some market research that shows Americans prefer shitty beer.
I like... Never at home, always at a bar or a burger joint..................
A nice looking beer, with a nice head on it.  This was my grandfathers favorite beer.  Incredibly well marketed, to an incredibly foolish marketplace.  It's very skunky.  It sucks
Heineken may be the Budweiser of Holland, but if so they are one up on us. Pleasant drinking.

TERRIBLE SKUNKED OUT BEER.  It almost made me puke half-way through my first beer.  Again, another shit beer that is overhyped and way overpriced(1/3/1/1/1/0.7).---ok, this was one of my first beers "rated".  It is definitely time to re-rate this.  I think the can version is much better than the bottle and that is what I am rating now.  There is a mildly minty grassiness in the nose with a bit of spiced hops present as well.  Transparent yellow-golden color with a pretty long-standing foamy white head.  More minty spiciness present to start with some sweet maltiness present.  A kiss of hoppiness to finish.  Smooth, and a hell of a lot better than that Busch Light I just had.
I don't really care for this beer, that said. I couldn't believe how happy I was to find it in the liquor store at a blues festival in Arkansas that was serving ony Bud and Bud light.

Good Clean Taste. can almost dind it anywhere.
Reliable....................
If you don't know much about this beer then get out from under that rock.  Of all the mass produced beers this is one of the better ones but it's still not great.

Not outstanding, but perfect for someone venturing outside the world of Budmilloors for a slightly more exotic, hoppy product. This is by no means an outstanding beer, but if it is indeed the Bud of Holland, it beats that standard by a country mile. If you like this, don't stop your exploring here, in other words. Interesting thickish, Scottish aftertaste
Bitter skunk piss.  Big name, bad taste.....................................
Wow! Easy on the hops there!  This one just fucks with you’re taste buds.  Way to bitter for my taste (and my sensitive taste buds).
It is ok taste is good one of my beers of choice............................
Average Lager, Beware of the 'cold filtered' variety sold here is UK it is bland rubbish aimed at the typical Brit lager lout
Out of the bottle: too bitter, out of can: Undrinkable, out of tap: water with a flavour.

Good stuff, lots of hops but it smell like a skunk.
.......................
An average lager at an above average price.  Seems highly carbonated and lacks a well-defined taste.

Rated from the pure draft quality sample from the Amsterdam Brewery....This beer is straight.  More popular than water in Holland because of it's richness and poundability.  Won't resort to the bottled taste of the imported Heineken's avaiable in the states anymore.  Not even the keg cans come close to the fresh full taste of the domestic version of Heineken.
what can i say? it's in a green bottle......................................

I find nothing special about this beer.  I wonder why it is priced like a premium beer (in America, at least).  Frequently skunky, due to the green bottles.  It would be nice if they used amber bottles like their Amstel beer, to cut down on the skunkiness.
One of the first European beer I ever had. It seemed better then............
Not impressed with this, it certainly would be a better choice over other mass-produced beers, clear golden color, not much head, thin & bland

It almost look likes I've to defend this classic beer.
I don't agree with most others. I think it's a very fine lager beer.
One of the Best chepa beers around..........................................
If you dont get a skunky batch, this is a pretty good lager. Much better than the American swill they pass for beer in this country. Put it in a dark bottle!!!

"What are you doing?"  You know you've got an image problem when Bud can poke fun at you.  An average but O.K. beer, as long as you keep it away from the light so that it doesn't develop that skunk factor that some people think is an inherent flavor characteristic of this beer.
"Red Star" is a rich, smooth lager.  Although you may experience a small bit at first, it gets very smooth-amost like a cream ale.  Cost is a little high for my liking, so I would rate a 2 for cost.

I used to like this stuff, because I thought it made you look cool to drink it.  Heineken is just a bitter, boring beer.  There are much better imports out there for the money.  However, it goes down easy, it is consistently the same taste every time drank, and is a favorite of many.
i love thos big 32 Oz heineken bottles.this is a beer you drink when you just want to drink beer for beer,not anything fancy.

The difference is night and day between the Heineken we get in the States, and the Heineken you get in Amsterdam.  My rating reflects the stuff there, which is quite good.  Here its always skunked and has lots of strange, out of place flavors.  I've heard they take an extremely long time to ship in unrefrigerated tanker ships.  I would still take it over an American macrobrew (Bud/Miller/Coors/etc), but its not that much better.

If any of you make it to Amsterdam, try it there and I promise you will be surprised!

I drink it over the major macrobrews when nothing else is available, but there's incredibly little going on in the bottle.  What they lack in flavor they make up for in market saturation, but it'd be nice if this beer actually tasted like, well, anything.
Probably the first 'world' beverage.You can get it in all but the worst Western establishments. I order it over Bud.

Had the version contract-brewed by Cerveceria Costa Rica multiple times. More bitter than other Costa Rican brews (except Bavaria Gold) and not as pleasant as Bavaria Gold. Skunky smell but I'd rather have this than Bud. I'm fortunate most parties around this area (central PA) serve Yuengling.
Skunky smell but good taste.  Smooth........................................
pretty bad, dont know what the hype is all about.  Its usually skunked or flat, so i just make another choice
This is a very good import, but from what i hear it tastes vastly better in germany. A solid and respectable beer.
My experience with Heineken has varied and it's true the European stuff is slightly better. I've found this beer to age horribly and is easily damaged by heat. So F*** this shi*! PABST BLUE RIBBON!!!
Way overrated - usually really skunky and flat.  Off flavors really set this stuff very low on my list.

Doesn't anyone here watch movies?  Frank said it best:  "Heineken?  HEINEKEN?  Fuck that shit!! Pabst Blue Ribbon, man!"

As someone else says in a rating of this swill, if you MUST drink a green-bottle beer, go with Rolling Rock, rarely skunky (though not a great beer, mind you).
I have to be around many people to drink this hog urine.....................
I like really really cold beer. So on this one im a little biased. Horrid taste under their reccomended temp. Tastes like warm bud at their reccomended temp. Like the commercials though.
it's an alright beer, not a big lager fan, i support heinee's cuz i'm dutch, but other thatn that i don't like lager beer

how to make heineken in several easy steps:
1. piss in barrel
2. put in dirty bottle
3. sell as a chic import to yuppies.
4. collect profits to buy better beer for your employees to keep them pissing in the barrels. 
5. repeat till wealthy.
"Water is alright in tay for fish and things that swim in rivers."..........
Classic Eurolager, strong and leathery palate, musty with a hint of axel grease from the hubs of a thousand Dutch windmills. Drink it by the clog full. Skunky as in Northern Lights? I don't think so.

One of those well known names that doesn't do much for me.  The flavor is humdrum...perhaps because I've grown accustom to it.  Not bad for drinking mass quantities, but definitely not a beer to savor.
Never had it when it wasn't skunky, looks great sitting in that bottle though.  As low as I'll go before I start drinking wine.
Another great beer.  One of my favorites....................................
(Amendded review)  I must be getting used to this stuff.  Due to the lack of choices available in PR Heineken is usually what I drink.  Better than the alternatives and not a bad Lager.
If you can find fresh Heinies consider yourself lucky. When or if you do, it is definately worthwhile. Otherwise, SKUNK CITY.
Skunky, funky. Marginally drinkable when very cold. They've done a great job of selling an image. Now they should get to work on the beer.
I have had the pleasure of drinking Heineken for years, and enjoy it. I think amateur drinkers confuse skunk for aroma. American domestic beers taste like water, which has no smell.

All this talk of skunk, surely it can't be happening to everyone who reviews. I've only drunk a few bottles but never noticed it. I've drunk many European pilsners from green bottles and can only recall one occasion when I got a bad one. I tatsed the draft for this review and while not quite enough hops was a decent lager.
How can this beer be accepted as a true good import?........................
I've experienced some bad things in my day, rolled over wanted to chew my arm off, but after this beer bring on the fatties.

I've never had a bottle that wasn't at least slightly skunked, so I can only comment on what's available.  Leaves a bad aftertaste. Almost pungent.  Beer isn't supposed to be pungent.  Very overrated unless you like the stylish bottle. Probably a favorite of people who've never had it before (meaning this beer has a very good reputation...undeservedly so). If you like green bottles, stick with Rolling Rock.

Well, it's always a little unsurprising when you drink your first Heineken of the day, but to me, it's the best allround-drinking beer... 

When I have little time, I pick another beer, some heavier Belgium stuff, but when I have all night, I keep drinkin' the Heinekens! As you can imagine, I live in Holland ;-)

Next to that, they have brilliant marketing, in the whole wide world, doesn't matter where you are, Heineken is there...

(BTW what is Palate?)

And yes, I do collect all sorts of Heinekens-goodies... ;) But I do like other beers also...
I hadn't had a Heineken in years so I tried one tonight. Man, this looks and tastes weak. Nothing to it.

If you thinks this is the best beer in the world, it's time for you to stop drinking
it has no good flavour at all.
Overrated beer in the USA.  It simply does not taste as good as advertising wants you to think.
This has to be one of my favorites just because of the combination of good price, good taste, and cool bottle.
Rating on draft, less on the bottle.........................................
Was my favor beer. . . . . Then I drank something else.  Decent, but not worth the money.  You buying??
One of my all time fav's, cool refeshing, smooth and great taste............

It's an OK beer, better than Bud fer shure, but I generally stay away from it for 2 reasons.
First, there are better choices, and second, it gives me an intense headache if it's my first of the day.
It's my neighbor's favorite though, and I try to have 2 or 3 good beers before I take one of his offerings.
Incidentally, since I mounted a bottle opener outside on my deck, I'm the most popular guy in the neighborhood on Saturday afternoons.
Worst beer in the world second only to Busch Light..........................
Is it good? No. Is it even really a Pilsner? No. Yet amazingly its often the best beer you can buy at a bar.
A much OverRated beer..much too dry bad aftertaste if your looking for a good lager then try Moosehead.
If it's the best a bar's got I might consider it............................
a very overrated beer. just because it's imported doesn't mean it can't suck.
Great beer after you already drank a few.  If you start off with one of these it tastes kinda skunked.
Man, I don't know why people drink this stuff.  El skunko.  I wish the Flavor category had a way to give a negative rating...
Not bad, but very overrated by the general public. A little too skunkalicious.
It looks good.  It smells okay too.  But, when I drink a beer I don't want pure hopps in a bottle.
Nothing to write home about, but not bad either.  Kind of boring............

Yet another European Lager in a green bottle - almost always skunked.  I think it is miles ahead of the US Big 3 when on draft, but not very impressive overall.  Almost no aroma, light taste and body.  No complexity at all.
This is a bitter lager best drunk very cold in a hot setting.  The prefered beer in most of the caribbean for precisely that reason.  Goes well with fish and chicken or on its own.
Bitter beer in a pretty green bottle........................................

Yet another good lager.  Very smooth, refreshing, easy to drink.  A bit pricey, but somewhat worth it.  Usually the only import available in most redneck bars.  You really can't go wrong in that situation.

This stuff looks good but tastes like shit.  The caps aren't even twist off so its hard to drink in the car.  Its highly overpriced and tastes like crap.  I wouldn't recommend this stuff but if you want to waste your money go ahead.  Oh and heres a tip... if your in the car and you dont have a bottle opener, use your seat belt clip, it works great.
It's the standard beer heer in holland, it's worth the price but nothing special. It's better then Amstel!
Skunky as hell, and just plain isnt that good all around....................
The "skunk" champ. I'd have to burn my adenoids out with a soldering pen to get this awful concoction near my face again.
It is good but really isn't anything special, it is not worth the price.....
For a change of taste, how about some German Panther Whiz...................
Not bad for a mass market international lager.  Better than Becks...........
The more I drink this the more I am starting to warm up to it...............

I had a fresh one once, clean taste, light on the palate, with that slightly bitter finish so prized by Europeans.

Very uneven quality, hard to get one unskunked.

A final update. I think I was too generous in my treatment of the non-skunked version of this. I recently had a chance to sample some really fresh draft, from one of this 5L minikegs they sell. It did have the nice creamy feel of good fresh draft, but the distint sulfuric aroma and flavor, coupled with a general wateriness, just forget about it. Any number of domestic pale lagers are preferable to this.
I hate this stuff almost as much as Miller Lite. Skunky, sour aroma; musty, stale taste; a bad beer in all aspects. Hard to finish one bottle unless you use a clothespin.

Probably the first time I’ve had it since they went back to being all-malt.  Well, maybe not because I had the Thai version and it seemed structured to local tastes.  Anyway, here’s what I’ve got:  medium gold colour, whispy head.  Grassy aroma with faint fusel alcohol.  More high alcohol notes, very light malts, equally light hops.  Off-dry finish.  I was actually expecting better, but the burn of the higher alcohols is a very Thai characteristic and really sucks.
another one of my favorites, serve it ice cold though.......................

In a word: yuck.
Each time I've had it, it tasted skunky.  I was told "That's how it's supposed to be."  Not anything I'll ever want to buy.
